text:
We went to Scarpetta to celebrate our 9 year anniversary. As requested, they gave us a table so we could see the Bellagio fountains.  Our reservation was at 9 PM and we were disappointed to find out that the chef was no longer offering the tasting menu that evening. Our waiter, however, said we could create our own tasting - excellent!  

We started with the polenta with mushrooms - delicious, but it maybe could have used a bit more salt. Next up was the infamous $24 spaghetti. Well worth it - this is the best pasta I ever ate. Since we were indulging, the next course was more pasta. The duck and foie gras ravioli. It was good, but very rich and not even close to as good as the beef cheek ravioli from Carnevino. I am not sure why people would compare the two. On carb overload we then had the lamb which was fantastic. For some reason they also sent out a duck entree which we had not ordered. Not a fan of the spices - cardamom and clove. Nor was I a fan of the waiter attempting to charge us for it. 
Dessert was the chocolate salted caramel cake. Good, but nothing to rave about. 

Wine prices are high but on par with everything else on the strip. 

Oh, I almost forgot the bread basket and dipping sauces. The Stromboli bread with salami and cheese is phenomenal. The marscapone butter could make even cheap white bread taste good. 

Definitely worth a visit to try the spaghetti. I will be going back for that!

Everything about this restaurant is AMAZING! We had an amazing view, the food was fantastic, and the staff, were all very helpful and friendly. The Chef, Chef Dave even came out to see how we enjoyed the food. I've never met such a great Chef!  I will make sure to come here again next time I make a trip to Vegas!

Scarpetta is renowned Italian Chef Scott Conant's masterpiece. There are five throughout the U.S. - New York, Miami, Las Vegas (in the Cosmopolitan), Toronto, and Beverly Hills. I first heard about Scarpetta from my boyfriend's sister, as we both like to watch Conant on Chopped on the Food Network. 

We started the night off with two cocktails - Scarselli and Dolce Limone. Good, as always. They gave us complimentary bread: sourdough, french, rosemary, and a stromboli. Along with the bread were marscapone butter, eggplant and tomato-herb spread, and a citrus-infused olive oil. The stromboli was definitely the best, but the eggplant/tomato-herb spread was really good. As our appetizer, we chose the Tuna 'Susci' ($16), which as you can see is raw tuna wrapped around vegetables. The tart-marinated vegetables complimented the fresh tuna very well.

After reading so many good things about the spaghetti, I had to find out if this is really the best pasta you will ever have. Usually, I am disappointed with certain dishes because people have hyped them up way too much. But for once, the spaghetti ($24) lived up to its hype. Wow, I honestly can't believe spaghetti could taste this good. The pasta is cooked to perfection - consistency, texture, taste - everything was on point. Then there's the sauce, ahhhhh. You can taste the fresh tomatos and the basil in every single bite. I am speechless, really.

Although the spaghetti was definitely the highlight of the night, the duck and foie gras ravioli ($25) comes pretty close. Once again, the ravioli was cooked perfectly (as expected). But what really made this dish stand out was the filling. Duck - check. Foie Gras - check. Can you ask for anything more? Two of some of my favorite things to eat are mixed together and stuffed into a ravioli. It is the right amount of duck and the right amount of foie gras - not overpowering at all. The marsala reduction adds a nice and clean finishing touch to this already, perfect dish.

As for dessert, we opted for the chocolate cake with toasted almond gelato and salted caramel sauce. The cake was just like every other molten chocolate cake, but the toasted almond gelato and the salted caramel sauce was goooooood. I wouldn't order it again, only because I would want to try their other desserts.

For two cocktails, a beer, an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert, our bill came out to be about $125. Not that bad considering all the food and drinks we got. The entrees may seem pricey (especially the spaghetti), but you actually get a good amount in one order. When I come back (hopefully soon), I would definitely get the spaghetti again. Everything else, I would switch out only so I can try other items on their menu. But if it is your first time going, I highly recommend the spaghetti and the ravioli. Then, you can also say you just had the best spaghetti in your entire life!

Really best Italian, I'll say above average. 
Really get fooled by yelp. 
Sorry I was really looking foward to good pasta.

Impressed - knew of Scott Conent from his appearances as a nit-picky (and not always very nice) judge on Chopped and we were intrigued enough to try this place for dinner.

Service was impeccable, and the ambiance was sophisticated and serene - quite a contrast to the less tasteful (and less dressed) crowd outside of the restaurant.

Highlights:
- roasted diver scallops - wonderful, beautifully seared and nicely complemented by the peas
- bread basket - quite the variety and served with an eggplant tapenade
- agnolotti - unctuous and decadent tasting little pillows 
- fennel dusted cod - elegant flavors and well cooked
- desserts - hazelnut cake with poached pears and a decadent chocolate almond cake

Could improve:
- artic char was overdone
- spaghetti was done well, al dente and with just the right amount of tomato basil...but way overpriced
- wine list was clearly very very marked up 
 
Overall, very enjoyable meal and a welcome reprieve from the LV scene.
If I could put 10 stars I would! Food is beyond amazing from appetizers to deserts. Service excellent. Thank you so much for great time and experience! Definitely coming back again! It's a must!!!!!!

What an awesome italian restaurant.  The entrance is super secluded, and as the hostess led us down an empty hallway it seemed like the place was abandoned, but the hallway opened up into a large dining room.  We were seated by the windows and could see the Bellagio fountains which was nice. 
    I got the Berry Smash to drink which was very average, a little too strong for my taste.  The bread basket they brought out was great, focacia, french bread and one more were average.  The best bread had salami and basil and maybe even cheese baked into it- SO GOOD.  There was a citrus olive oil to dip in, as well as butter, and an eggplant tomato spread.  Definitely helped to liven up the more basic bread.  
     The duck and foie gras ravioli were great.  First time having foie gras and we were not disappointed.  Rich and delicious.  The spaghetti was unreal good- I did not think spaghetti could be that great.  Finally, the veal chop looked great, and was very rich and tender.  The chocolate cake for dessert was probably the low point- it reminded us of an Applebee's dessert, although the presentation was slightly better than that.  
     The only other con was our server- he was very awkward and seemed to appear at all the wrong times to talk to us about the menu.  He rambled on about dishes just a little too much.  
     Would definitely have given a 5 with a different server and had we picked a different and hopefully better dessert.

This place is quite good.   I've only been twice, but the food has been good and the ambiance is great.  Try to get a table by the window and you can watch the Bellagio fountain show while you eat.  

I had the pasta and the rib cap. Both were good.  Service was excellent.

I highly recommend this place. I ate here last night with a group of three others, the entire experience was wonderful. The restauraunt is beautiful and has a great view overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. I started with the wine list. I had read one review on yelp from a reviewer complaining there were hardly any bottles of wine under 100.00, I thought the wine menu was really varied and there were many price points to choose from, types, regions. This is a fine dining restauraunt so what do you expect. I chose a Riesling from France that was perfect with our food. 

The bread, holy Jesus the bread. They have about four different kinds they bring out (and keep bringing). There is a roll with salami inside that is literally to die for. The bread is accompanied by mascarpone butter, citrus infused olive oil, and some sun dried tomatoe compote. All wonderful. We started with oysters that were fresh and perfect. 

I ordered the Black fettuccine with seafood (crab, shrimp, squid) and it was incredible. This is a dish with few ingredients for a reason, fresh seafood and house made pasta really don't need many other players. I forced my boyfriend to order the special, a lamb ragu over fettuccine after we argued for five minutes (I won). This was the best ragu I have ever eaten, hands down. Incredible, we inhaled it. The portions are really good, it looks small when they present your plate but there is a lot of pasta I could hardly finish mine. 

For desert, you have to try the strawberry soufle, it literally melts in your mouth. We also had these little light donuts filled with with banan creme and Nutella. Enough said. 

The waitstaff was wonderful, very warm and attentive. Our waiter was fantastic, everyone was. 

You have to make a reservation ahead for this place, we landed in Vegas on a Wednesday and the cosmopolitan concierge had to squeeze is in.

Scarpetta knows how to make a girl happy.  I went there this past Sunday for my very good friend's birthday dinner. She said she had the spaghetti a year ago in Miami and has been dreaming about it ever since.  Now I know why!
Before I get too far ahead of myself though, let me start at the beginning of my experience. My group was pretty large and scattered throughout the strip. A few of us were fashionably late but the hostess had no problem seating those of us who were there on time. That's uncommon for shi-shi- type places and I really appreciated it. The decor was a dark/ modern/ rustic all-at-the-same time- type of feel. Very sexy place :o) Plus it overlooks the Bellagio fountains and the Strip! Nothing like enjoying a killer meal with that type of view. 
The sommelier was a delight. He helped us pick out a wine that had the qualities we wanted without breaking the bank. We thought it was hilarious when he said "How about this vintage" while pointing right at the price. Very classy way to help price-concerned consumers w/o announcing to the entire room that we were trying to save money.
A bread basket is usually of no consequence BUT, here, it was SOOOOO good! One roll in particular had prosciutto or salami wrapped in and it was amazing! Fresh, warm, and perfect!
We shared a bunch of starters.  I got the yellowtail fully intending to share but that did not happen. It was so fresh and delicious with the shredded red onion on top that it somehow disappeared before I could send my plate around the table... OOPS!  I also managed to get a bite for my friend's creamy polenta. To. Die. For. says it all.
Next, our main course  - the spaghetti. Let me preface this by saying that 6 out the 7 people in our party ordered it because my friend hyped it up so much. We were not disappointed. I normally try to stay away from carbs and I seriously cannot remember the last time I went out and actually ordered spaghetti! It was just so good! It wasn't a heavy, flowery mess of wet spaghetti strands. It was light, tasty, cooked, and sauced to perfection. PS. it was great on its own - no meatballs or anything necessary to dress it up. That is a plate I would certainly order again. 
In sum, I had a great experience. I paid ~ $100 for bread, pasta, some sashimi, and 3 glasses of wine and I still can say that it was well worth the price.  I would go back and definitely recommend Scarpetta - Vegas to friends!  :o)

Had dinner here with friends on May 6.  I believe reservations were early, 6pm.  Got there early and had drink at the bar.  Great variety....no beers on tap but some interesting bottled beers.

Our group shared a few apps.  I sampled the oysters, which if I recall had a mignonette sauce which was excellent, very "bright" tasting.  Also had the lentils and squid.  The lentils were amazing and the squid perfectly cooked.  

For dinner I had the "Pici" (pasta) served with lobster, tarragon, almond & chili pesto.  It was perfectly portioned but still a little "heavy".  I paired that with a side order of broccoli rabe and a nice house Chianti.  No dessert for our group.   Others had the short-rib dish (which looked great but small).

Service was fine, the waiter seemed very knowledgeable.  Great views in this hip hotel.  Would recommend/go again.

Service- The service was nice when it was existent. It took 30/40 mins for a glass of water and wine and then another 40 for our food. Dinner took way to long. The server kinda made up for it towards the end after we pointed it out. 

Food- the dishes are very hit and miss. Some are good and others are very basic for their price point. Overall very unimpressed for the cost of this placed

Ambiance- beautiful very dim and romantic

I would rate this place a solid 4 stars for the decor, service and food. My fiancé had the duck and foie gras ravioli and I had the Pici (lobster pasta). Both entrees were good, but the dessert was definitely a delicious sweet ending. We ordered the Nutella & Vanilla Creme Bomboloni (mini filled donuts) and they were a little taste of heaven. Would definitely recommend this place.

A Vegas must, every time we go to Vegas we visit Scarpetta. One of my husbands favorites. We always sit at the bar, sometimes it's slow, though we still seem to have a great time and great food. When its busy the energy is definitely flowing in a positive Vegas way.

Just finished dinner here. Would have given this restaurant 4 stars if not for the terrible service from our waiter Roberto. 
He seemed to be completely preoccupied with the couple at the table next to us. After our entrees were cleared and we declined dessert, we waited over 15 minutes for our check before we waved down a passing busboy and asked him to send Roberto to our table. Rather than coming himself, he sent the busboy with the check even though Roberto visited the table right next to us about 5 times after our plates were cleared. We were not rude to him in any way, shape or form so I can't imagine why he chose to behave that way. He came by to say sorry as we were signing the check. Too bad because the food and atmosphere were nice and it would have been a pleasant experience if he had made the slightest effort.

My husband took me there on our anniversary day. He noted it on the reservation and we were seated next to the window! We had a strip view and were able to see the fountain of Bellagio. Good atmosphere and ambience.

Food wise, it was awesome! I don't hate Italian food but it is not something that I am a big fan of. But I loved the Italian food here at Scarpetta! I think I had the best pasta in my life here! I tried different Italian places in the past that made homemade fresh pasta, but they aren't as good as the homemade pasta here at Scarpetta! I am impressed! I had the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti, it tasted great!
 My husband's veal ragu fettuccine was awesome too. We loved them a lot. At the end, I had a strawberry souffle and my husband's had a dessert that I don't remember the exact name. From my memory, his dessert tasted good and had an interesting presentation. Anyway, my souffle was awesome, I think it was the best I had by far, better than what I had in other French restaurants in the past (e.g. Andres, Eiffel). Everything was awesome. We became a fan. Highly recommend this place to yelpers!
At the end, they also gave us some sweet treats for our anniversary. Those tasted good too!

We tried 500 tonight after hearing many good things, and we weren't disappointed. Had some great appetizers - the funghi tartufa and meatballs were very tasty, and the arancini were fantastic!  We all had pasta, which were universally enjoyed, but next time, we try the pizza - it looked amazing!  The service was great, and Gennaro, the chef, was extremely charming. We will definitely be back.

I admit... The food was pretty good.  However, the service was terrible.  We were 5 min late for our reservation and they made us wait 1 hour at the bar (seated after 9:30)  The hostess was incredibly rude and it took almost 30 min to get service at the bar.  When we were finally seated the service only got worse.  They didn't refill our waters or wine glasses once.  They served our first course to another table and never once explained what was laid in front of us.  They knew how terrible the service was (we have said nothing at this point) so they offered us free dessert.  But... The kicker was the $50 bottle if wine that ended up as $100 on the bill.  We were amazed so we asked the table next to us how their meal was.  Turns out they were getting a free meal due to the 5 reservation changes made by the restaurant.  Hope this place gets their act together.  Currently it's an embarassment to a hotel that's trying to be upscale.  Hype not quality.

This will be my VERY FIRST Yelp review and I couldn't be more excited to post it! I look to Yelp on a daily basis but have never felt as compelled to leave a review as I do about our experience at Scarpetta...spoiler alert: this could get lengthy! 

My boyfriend and I were taking a mini vacation to Vegas and did extensive research on restaurants, as we wanted to treat ourselves to one night of fine dining while we were there. We found Scarpetta's Yelp listing and looked through every single photo and read a ton of reviews (even the not so great ones :( )and decided this was going to be our place! 

Our reservation was for 10p.m. but we arrived at around 9 and were told we could be accommodated immediately. I asked if there was any possibility of getting a window table, and apologized for not requesting it when we made our res. The extremely nice hostess told us that wouldn't be a problem at all and after waiting, maybe 2 minutes tops, we were taken to our table. They weren't kidding about the view by the window! The view was gorgeous and we were looking right out at the Bellagio water show(s).  The lighting IS very dark, but for us that made it even more romantic, which was the exact experience we were hoping for. 

Our cocktails were EXCELLENT. I had a "basic" dirty martini with blue cheese olives and it was by far the best martini I've ever had.  Our server, Julian, even brought a tiny shot glass of extra olive juice just in case it was still too dry for my taste, but I didn't need it!  

For starters, we chose the Diver Scallops and the White Corn Soup. When they were brought to our table, the server mentioned they took it upon themselves to split the scallops for us so that "we could each get the best of what the dish had to offer."  Julian made the excellent suggestion of combining the crispy pancetta with the rest of the dish's ingredients, rather than taste it on its own, as that was how the chef intended for it to be eaten.  He was SO right! What an absolutely delicious combination and just the perfect portion size.  The soup was served in one bowl for us to share, and once again, we were blown away. Just enough king crab to give it a bit of body, but still a light enough soup that we were able to enjoy it and be ready for more (so, so much more!)

They gave us the complimentary basket of warm fresh breads and again we were surprised because of the variety they provided! Even most nice restaurants will give you one or two selections, but here? 5 choices and then 3 options for spreads/ dipping. 

We finished our amazing cocktails and decided to each get a glass of wine to compliment our meal.  As soon as the wine list was brought back to our table, a man came over and introduced himself as the sommelier and asked if he could suggest any wines to accompany our entrees.  I drink white and my boyfriend drinks red, and we got very different entrees, but the sommelier was extremely helpful and described the selections perfectly.  Naturally, we chose his suggestions! 

Now on to the entrees:  My boyfriend chose the duck ravioli and I went with the tagliatelle dish. Amazing, Amazing, Amazing! When I asked Julian to please give a bit more detail about the Tagliatelle entree, he described it as "definitely more of a comfort meal" and he couldn't have been more right.  The pasta was extremely fresh and even though the sauce itself was on the heavier side, it did not overwhelm the dish at all.  I'm not a fan of duck but my boyfriend could not say enough great things about his dish and the presentation was perfect! The sommelier stopped back after we sipped our wine for a bit and asked how the flavors were complimenting the dishes. He was just doing his job but made us feel important, none the less. 

Dinner was cleared and we were so full but they hadn't let us down yet so we chose the Amedei chocolate cake. Heaven! Just enough of everything on the plate for you to enjoy it without setting yourself over the edge. 

I do apologize for the length of this review, but I felt that sharing this absolutely amazing experience was important for anyone that might be on the fence about trying this place! The ambiance was romantic, relaxing, and quiet with beautiful views- perfect for a date night.  The service was excellent.  When we choose to "dine" we like to sit and relax and enjoy  and not feel rushed and we were not disappointed here.  We never felt rushed nor did we feel neglected either.  They seemed to understand that we were there to enjoy ourselves and never made us feel like we were hanging around too long/ late.  The presentation of every single plate was perfection.  The food was some of the best we've ever had. I can definitely appreciate that restaurants can't be a "10" every single night, and things do sometimes happen, but our experience was outstanding and will definitely be somewhere we come back to the next time we're in town!!

This restaurant was absolutely dreadful.  We ordered the famous spaghetti as a starter which was forgotten about by the server.  He informed us that the chef had already thrown out the pasta water (despite being 30 minutes before close).  Our entrees arrived and only 1 was PASSABLE.  Pasta was undercooked and rubbery.  Wine selection was mediocre, especially if you're looking at getting a bottle for under 150 dollars. Terrible service, terrible food.  You should be ashamed

This is a wonderful addition to the Las Vegas food scene. This is not your father's Olive Garden - this is a fine dining Italian food experience. Side note - it's not inexpensive. I'm happy to say that someone else picked up the tab for my visit and encouraged me to order whatever I wanted, so I did.

The service is what you'd expect from a restaurant like this - the entire staff is attentive, polite and knowledgeable.  I had some questions about a few of the dishes and my server didn't give me the old, "hang on, let me check" or the bald faced lie.  

I started with the creamy polenta mostly because I've never had creamy polenta before. It was good. Not what I expected, but it was quite tasty. An excellent starter.

Since I wasn't paying, I ordered the veal chop which comes with a side of spaghetti, squash, and mushrooms.  Cooked perfectly and it was delicious.

Although I was full my host had ordered a banana souffle and I hated to see it go to waste.  Wow - just Wow.

Excellent food and service in a beautifully appointed restaurant.  No, it wasn't cheap but it was well worth the price. Note - they also have a gluten free and vegetarian menus.

I was really excited for our dinner to Scarpetta with some friends. The service was good, but the food was very underwhelming. I just expected more from Scott Conant. The food wasn't bad, just average and at the prices you're paying to dine here the food better not be average.

For the price of this place I found it to be just OK. Heirloom tomato salad was good but not great. Duck ravioli was a bit disappointing. The menu does offer many creative dishes and things you wouldn't find at your typical Italian place.

Scarpetta is classy, modern restaurant. The main dining room gives you a great view of the Bellagio Fountain and is a great place to take a date. I have to mention that the music was perfect. It was swanky downtempo electronic music. Awesome. 

I love beef tartars...especially the korean/japanese yuk-hoe, so as an appetizer, I decided to order the Wagyu Beef Tartare and for dinner I ordered the famous Duck Foie Gras Ravioli.

The server brought out an assortments of bread to soothe my appetite. There was sourdough, french bread, rosemary bread, and stromboli. The bread came with a trio of butter, tomato-herb salad, and a lime-infused olive oil. The stromboli was the bomb.

The beef tartar came out next and I was extremely underwhelmed by it. The meat lacked flavor and the side salad was too salty. There is also a cured egg in it, which I did not taste at all. I did like the hazelnut garnish tho. All in all, 2/5 stars for this dish. 

Finally, the duck foie gras ravioli came out and it did not disappoint. They were small pockets of ravioli stuffed with a mixture of duck liver and duck confit, all topped with balsamic vineger and scallions. The pasta was fresh and incredibly delicate. It was one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. My only knock on it was that I was not full at all. 4.5/5 stars.

One of the top dining experiences of my life!  The food was fantastic; the strawberry rhubarb souffle may be the best dessert I've ever had.  The service was just about perfect; knowledgeable waiter; we were not rushed; beautiful presentation.  I did not think that it was overpriced given the quality of the experience.  I will definitely return when I am in Las Vegas.

Tremendous menu and top notch service. Our host, Noe, was one of the finest I've had the pleasure of meeting. He and his staff could not have done a better job of taking care of our table for 12. Thanks to him and @MannyKess from TonightImVIP.com we had an amazing meal and experience.

Scarpettas in the cosmopolitan was one of the best experiences we have ever had in Vegas. The food was delicious from apps to entrees. Caesar salad with the lemon zest was amazing and they split it for the two that were eating. I had the tuna avocado salad appetizer which was the most amazing app ever!  For entrees we had branzzino which was very flavorful with a kick. The orecchiette with homemade sausage and broccoli rabe in a clam sauce was fabulous!! . The final entree was pici a pasta with lobster with a chili kick.  We shared them all and eaxh of them were exceptional. We also has the best service with Julian as the most amazing server. He was a best server and also got our silly sense of humor and went along wth it.

I loved everything about Scarpetta, from the food to the great ambiance overlooking the Bellagio water show. 
Scott Conant puts his own unique twists on Italian classics, starting with the bread basket accompanied creamy butter, sun dried tomatoes and citrus infused olive oil, which is a very nice touch. Let's not gloss over the bread basket like you would at most of your standard restaurants, this bread basket is special. Maybe one of my favorite parts of the meal was the stromboli bread, dipped in some olive oil and topped with the sun dried tomatoes, I could eat that all day.  
Another highlight of this meal was the braised short rib risotto primi piatti, this was a flawless dish. My best description of this dish would be, homey and earthy. The risotto had perfect texture and the short ribs were melt in your mouth braised.
Next we had the spaghetti tomato basil and the duck & foie gras ravioli. Both amazing pasta dishes in their own right. 
The spaghetti tomato basil did not disappoint, the homemade pasta had just enough bite to it and the sauce was simple but deep in flavors. The tomato sauce had a buttery richness to it, with a hint of spice from the red pepper flakes, and some freshness from the basil. It's truly a perfect spaghetti.  
Duck & foie gras ravioli is very eloquent and rich. Very deep in flavors and a smooth velvety texture to the foie gras filling. The marsala reduction rich and buttery smooth in it's own right and when combined with the raviolli gives a Mike Tyson KO punch of flavor. 
I highly recommend Scarpetta. The prices are also reasonable when you consider the delicious free bread basket, which can be a meal in itself. A very delicious meal and romantic place take your significant other, what more could you ask for. Absolutely a 5 star restaurant.

As great as this meal was the one thing that stands out to me is the stromboli bread with the complimentary bread basket with olive oils and sun dried tomatoes.

even though it's located in the mall-ish portion of the cosmo, place is very elegant, with great views if you get a window seat.

food was very good, we had the scallop appetizer, duck breast and duck ravioli entrees, and goat cheese cheesecake for dessert. everything came out perfect, and service was excellent.

I really liked this place! My husband and I actually started off at D.O.C.G. and were sat in a booth up against the wall. We had no room and were too close to the next couple so I decided we should just go to Scarpetta instead. The décor is absolutely beautiful! We sat at a table by the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains and it was stunning. So far happy with my decision. 

We had the short ribs and the tuna susci appetizer. The short ribs were good but nothing about them stood out as amazing. The risotto that came with them was just ok. The tuna appetizer was out of this world. The marinated veggies that came with were just so delicious and they went so well with the thinly sliced tuna. 

For our entrees, my husband had the NY strip and I had the Orata. The steak was seasoned perfectly and it was very good. The Orata was somewhat different from what I expected. It is a very light dish so if you are watching your waistline, I would recommend it. The fish was cooked well and wasn't dry at all, just lacking some seasoning in my opinion. The tomato based broth was also a little bland but overall it was a good dish. We also ordered the glazed carrots to go along with our meal. OMG, I couldn't stop eating these even after I was full. They were so good!! 

Overall a great dining experience. I would like to go back and try some pasta next time. I also thought the service was excellent and the staff was very welcoming.

Scarpetta was one of the best dining experiences I have had.  The atmosphere is quiet and romantic and we had a view of the Bellagio fountains from our table.  The pasta was amazing - my husband had the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli and I had the Branzino.  Both were excellent dishes.

The service was absolutely sh*t. The food was fantastic. Waited for at least 5 minutes standing at the door before someone even noticed us. Then finally seated, thank goodness for a reservation. Live music. Nice ambiance, candles included. Highly recommend trying the prawns to start. Both my husband and I had pasta. I had a tagliatelle dish with mushrooms and he the lasagna. The tagliatelle tasted much better than the lasagna but still good. Service throughout the entire experience was beyond pathetic. It would even keep me from returning. The servers seemed very disorganized and flustered and did not compose themselves in a professional manner. It was entirely frustrating. I expected more from a place that had such great food and atmosphere.

400+ positive reviews says it all.  

Scarpetta was one of the best dining experiences that I've had in Las Vegas, and one of the best Italian restaurants that I have been to. Our group of 8 got a semi-private room facing the Bellagio fountains, and from the moment we stepped in, the service was just top notch. Our server was professional, attentive, and extremely knowledgeable about the menu and gave some great pasta recommendations...and it didn't hurt that the pastas, for once, were actually big enough for a person to have as an entree. I went with the sheep milk ricotta agnolotti with truffles and parmesan (TO DIE FOR!), but the real hit at our table was the lobster pici.

It's always the little touches that push a restaurant into 5-star territory for me, and at Scarpetta, it was our fantastic server bringing us a free tiramisu (also to die for...and I don't even like tiramisu!) for bringing one of our dishes out a tad late, and a plate of Italian cookies with a chocolate "Congratulations" message on the plate after finding out that one of us was getting married. If I can get a table, this is an absolute must-visit every time I go to Vegas!

I don't review often so when I do it's good! First time here and I came with my wife for our anniversary. The atmosphere and service was fantastic, chefs choice dinner was exceptional. You must give this place a try.

Amazing meal.  Went with my family after trying the food at Cochon 555 event.  The restaurant does have great views of the strip.  I like the clean design of the restaurant.  The service was great.  Every single person from hostess to maitre d to waiter to bus boys was incredibly attentive and friendly.  The food was fantastic.  We had the tasting menu.  It's a great deal for $85 per person.  So much food, you won't come out hungry. They've selected the dishes they are best known for as part of their tasting menu.  I love how the first couple courses are paired with another dish that is shared by the table.  It feels like you are having 10 dishes!  We also did the wine pairing.  Very generous pours.  My favorite dishes were the short rib agnoletti and home-made pasta.  Devine meal.  Definitely will come back and try some other dishes!  Scott Conant and his team have done a fabulous job.

Least favorite restaurant we have eaten at in Vegas.  I ordered the sea trout, husband got Kobe flat iron steak, friends shared a Caesar salad and Pici.  I liked the sea trout okay, not fantastic.  Husband liked his steak, but not the best for what it cost.  Friends couldn't finish the Caesar salad or Pici, & the portions are small.  They didn't like it & there was hardly any lobster in the Pici.  Expensive and food was not memorable.  The bread basket was good though.  Wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend to a friend.

We had the best gnocchi and pizza ever! Also had the meatballs and arancini that was from heaven. Delicious drinks and desserts. Beautiful interior, excellent service, and reasonable pricing. How is this place not ridiculously busy? Absolutely a hidden gem.

Made reservations and requested a window seat -- we didn't get right next to the window but we got 2nd row next to it so we were still able to look over to our table mates and see the water show. (All the tables that actually had front view of the Bellagio water show could've cared less about the water show!) The view really is amazing. The ambiance is nice and romantic, with Justin Timberlake singing in the background. The bread baskets were as delicious as everyone mentioned, and if you ask they do give another basket. Ordered the spaghetti because everyone mentioned how great it was -- it was yummy but not sure $24 yummy. Ordered a bottle of wine which was a task because they had so many options! Service was great and it was a nice fine dining experience.

After reading all the reviews here, I decided to try the fantastic Pasta place that Yelpers are craving about.  The restaurant is located on the third floor at Cosmopolitan Hotel and it is an easy find once you reach there.  It's a nice high end restaurant and you can pick the window seat so you get to overlook the Bellagio fountain.

We are a huge party so I get to try couple different appetizers and main dish.  I have to say, it is a total disappointment.  Not to bash on their food because the food actually  taste from ok to good, but the food does not taste like the level when you are spending 50 dollars a person.  It lacks that "wow" factor.  

To further breakdown the night, there are two things that wowed me.  First, is their salami bread, it is really tasty and you rarely see it from any other restaurant. Second, is their creamy polenta, you need to eat it while its hot and it is delicious.

However, all the other dishes are mediocre at best.  I ordered the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli, and it is SO SALTY.  I love salty food and always add extra pepper and salt on my french fries, and even I have a hard time taking on the saltiness of its Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli.  Also, their tomato & basil spaghetti is very plain.  Taste good if it is $15, but not at $24.  

One worst part is their restroom.  They have 1 female and 1 male restroom, and you can only use it one person at a time.  So, during the night, people kept waiting in line for restroom.  I understand the fact that you can exit the restaurant and there is another Cosmopolitan restroom outside, but isn't it a little absurd when you have only one bathroom stall in the restaurant.  

Overall, it is not my best Vegas restaurant experience, I would rate it somewhere between 2.5 stars to 3 stars.

Had a great dining experience at Scarpetta last night but almost missed it. Tried to make an 8pm reservation on Open Table but were shown closest time available was 9:30pm.  Called the restaurant directly to see what could be done and was told no problem come at 8pm.  Restaurant was barley half full at 8pm so call directly.  Meal and staff were incredible.  Option to add shaved white truffles a gem!

great ambiance, delicately prepared dishes.
love the "free" warm bread brought to table so quickly upon seated.

One of the best fine dinning experiences I've had. Everything from the dim lighting to the friendly staff and the incredible food came together for a once-in-a-lifetime meal. We sat next to the window, so we got a great view of the Bellagio fountain. I'm still dreaming of the Black Tagliolini. Order it! It's the perfect balance of salty sea, cream, and butter. It was well balanced, not overly sauced and the tobiko added a nice texture. They are famous for the Spaghetti and it didn't disappoint. The noodles were al dente and the sauce was complex. You could taste the time and care that was put into it. The Amedei Chocolate Cake was a surprise hit. There was a rich chocolate ganache inside and a coco powder dusting outside, which went perfectly with the almond gelato. It reminded me of a well-made truffle. The next time I'm in Vegas I will make sure to visit Scarpetta again.
This restaurant has fabulous food and fantastic service, worth every penny!  The Sommelier was great with his suggestions and he didn't try to gouge us.

Service here was fantastic. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and able to answer all of our questions. The food came out very quickly for our table of 5.

I ordered duck and foie gras ravioli and was unable to finish it as it was quite heavy and oily. This is probably a dish best for sharing since it's so creamy.

Delicious in every aspect!  We had the tasting menu,  and it was worth every single penny. Everything was delicious, but I will be dreaming of the polenta the rest of my life! We were so stuffed by the end of the meal,  but of course you have to have dessert.  We had a couple different things,  but by far the best was the coconut pana cotta with the mango soup.  To die for. Great service, great food,  and a great atmosphere.  I will totally recommend this restaurant to everyone.

File Under: A must if you are looking for AMAZING Italian in the center of the strip with a view
-spaghetti simple yet spectacular with hand made noodles
-polenta w truffles n mushrooms creamy and delicious order this!
-farmers market salad fresh crisp organic thinly sliced deliciousness 
-Fillet of beef was like butta!
-top notch drinks with cool corridor bar as you enter
-Friendly staff 
Do It!

The food was Ok, we got Pici and the portion was small and very fishy tasting. The bread was great and it comes with oil and a butter and a ciabatta which is excellent. I got the roasted organic chicken which was cruncy on the outside and moist on the inside. The wine list is extensive, the glass was pricy. We had a group of 4 guys next to us that had been drinking and they were loud and obnoxious, so it was not the best for me and the wife. It is in Vegas so that maybe expected. The pricing seemed a bit high.

Sommelier was too harsh with the wine pouring. 
We were still working on our appetizers when they tried to rush us to move to the pasta dishes. Big no-no!! 
Dishes were good but not worth the Vegas price.

Once we were shown our table, our server  was right behind with the wine list and menu. Awesome. My Manhattan was made perfectly and my bf's dirty martini was made just dirty enough. We knew that Scarpetta's known for their homemade pastas so that's what we focused on - we got the short-rib and bone marrow agnolotti, duck and foie gras ravioli, lamb ragu fettucine and the Brussels sprouts as main courses. The brussel sprouts were meh. The lamb ragu was good but the agnolotti and ravioli were amazing! Had the grilled Dover scallops for and appetizer and they were awesome and the bombalini with Nutella were phenomenal. We were seated by the windows where you could watch the Bellagio water show so that made the meal even more special.
We enjoyed the food, but the server ruined it for us.  His name was Jason and he was so arrogant and non-communicative that he simply didn't hear our needs.

We dined there last week. It was awful. The service...the food. The atmosphere is nice and a cool vibe, although we were seated by the beautiful fountain views and I looked up and the curtain was covered in dust balls. Ugh! 

I ordered a gluten free pasta so gave them some room on how bad the entree tasted and looked but even my husband who is not picky could not eat his short rib pasta dish. It was so greasy. The service was bad too, we waited a very long time for a waiter to come up to us. He made a rude face about another bus boy that bumped into him. It is not a high end dining experience at all. 

We were very disappointed.

I will open this review with a recommendation: come here for the pasta. The pasta was spectacular. If I come back it will be just to have a pasta course, maybe will even try 2 pastas. The primi and piatti are forgettable and not worth the money.

Here's the full review:

The room is pretty plain. I've done a lot of traveling for work and it reminded me of a standard upscale hotel restaurant. It actually reminded me a lot of the Keg in The Westin in Calgary, but without the fireplaces.

Primi: I had the Grilled Mediterranea Octopus, my date had the Tuna "Susci". The Tuna was nice and fresh, but plain and couldn't really taste the truffles. The octopus was cooked nice and tender, however it was evident that it was a bit old from a fishy smell that piles of capers attempted to disguise. The description said "crispy potatoes" but they were completely mushy. The entire dish was very soft and gave the impression that it may have been reheated. All in all both apps were just ok, definitely not worth the price tag.

Paste: This was by far the star of the show. I had the Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli, my date had the Agnolotti Dal Plin. Both were fresh, tasty and just fantastic. The pickled mustard seeds in the agnolotti gave an incredibly pleasing texture and flavour. The pasta was fresh, delicate and made with care. The ravioli was equally delicious and the beautifully displayed triangle shapes made me feel like I was eating special little pockets of delight. Both sauces were very light and complimented the stuffed pastas without competing with the flavour. If we had only ordered pastas this would be a 5 star review.

Piatti: I had the Balsamic Glazed Duck Breast, my date had the Pork Chop (not currently on their online menu). The chop was good, not great. It was a surprisingly huge portion after the other delicate dishes. The fatty end of the chop, we guessed, had been deep fried after cooking which my date thoroughly enjoyed and was a nice touch. The disappointment of this dish were the sour cherries (which were highlighted on the menu) had no flavor. The duck breast was a big let down. It was cooked well but was tough, not a good piece of duck and under-seasoned. I believe it was under-seasoned because the dish included large pieces of speck which when eaten with the duck gave it the saltiness it needed, but the flavour of the speck was way too strong for this dish. I started picking it out because it was all I could taste and when you order duck, you kinda want it to taste like duck.

The service was attentive and polite. Our server gave a good suggestion for wine but couldn't answer some questions we had about one of the dishes. Overall it was an enjoyable evening. I just find for these prices there are better restaurants in Toronto. However as I said, it would be worth it to go and try the pastas.

Atmosphere is great, and it builds your expectations. Prepare for disappointment, however. The "susci" while beautifully prepared is bland and falls flat. The short rib appetizer is much better, but disappointingly small serving. Got the seafood pasta of crab, lobster, and shrimp. The seafood portion is generous, but the flat pasta sticks together and congeals into a doughy mess. Finally, the hostess was rude and obnoxious. Come on, your job is to just seat people and answer basic questions. You can't be polite? Overall, Spago is much better bang for your buck in Las Vegas.
What a wonderful experience. The food and service were amazing. The menu is pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. Would go back in a heartbeat.

My partner and I came in with a $35 Groupon. We made our reservation for 7 PM and ended up coming in around 6 PM, but they were very accommodating. Our waiter was friendly, but was constantly trying to upsell, which got a bit grating after awhile. We ordered the fries to start. They were VERY cooked, but the taste made up for it. For mains, we ordered the Pollo and Formaggio pizzas. The toppings were very good, though the Formaggio was super strong. The Pollo was my favourite, though I wish the toppings had been more evenly distributed. The caramelized onions gave the Pollo a nice sweet taste and the mushrooms were delicious. In both cases, the crust wasn't great - it was super hard and tasted like it was really just flour and water. I also ordered a cappuccino, but it was far too bitter for my taste, even with two sugar cubes.

The food was pretty good, and I'd give it about 4 stars, but we were also nickel and dimed in addition to the constant attempts to upsell - though our Groupon was for $35, they deducted only $34.50. The waiter informed me that this was because they had taken off items that added up to $34.50 - this made me wonder what they would have done if I hadn't ordered the cappuccino, as nothing added together would have come close to $35. When I pay for a $35 Groupon, I kind of expect to have $35 deducted from my bill. I'm not going to make a fuss over $0.50, but I found it quite tacky.

We visited this restaurant on our last night in Vegas. The restaurant decor is beautiful. I ordered the octopus as an appetizer. It was good but not the best I've had. My entree was the crab pasta. This dish had little fish eggs in it. I enjoyed my dish. 

This is a very pricey restaurant $$$$. I could not find the prices online before going. Overall it was a good experience but for the money, I will try another restaurant on my next visit. Our check for 3 was about $212 which included 2 drinks and 2 glasses of wine. The was not a bottle of wine on the menu less than $100.

They had a special this week. 3 course menu for $45 with wine pairing add $25. I initially thought there would be 3 glass of wine, one for each dish makes sense no? But no. Just 2 glasses white and red can't remember their names. 

We ordered CREAMY POLENTA and YELLOWTAIL. i tasted the polenta and wish I had ordered that. It was delicious. Should have known as it was scarpettta scinserNothing I've ever tastes before.  the yellowtail was good too. Not smelly. Not bad for portions. 6pcs 

As for mains we ordered AGNOLOTTI DAL PLIN and I got SPICED DUCK BREAST Got quite a lot of pcs of duck meat like about 10 pcs.  I could not finish it all. I would have like his agnolotti dish better. 

For desert we ordered STRAWBERRY SFOGLIA and COCONUT PANNA COTTA  both very good. 

The best part of the meal were the warm bread served in the beginning. It was moist delicious and served with a Stromboli which I later found is a turnover w meat and cheese. So good. I want more now!

Scott conant really is a genius. Service was attentive and part of the overall amazing experience. Matthew was our server and was incredible. Tuna "suchi", fritto misto, spaghetti, duck and foie GRAS ravioli were all outstanding dishes. We will definitely be coming back.
Great place for a nice romantic dinner with a view of the Bellagio fountains! Staff is so nice and the food was amazing!
Everything was amazing. The beat salad, spaghetti and the sea bass! Noe put our meal together for us and made us all very happy!  Wonderful dining experience!

In the past few weeks I've eaten at Joel Robuchon in Las Vegas, John Besh's Domenica in New Orleans and Seryna in Tokyo among many others, so I was definitely in gourmet mode as I ate at Scarpetta in Toronto. 

Firstly, the restaurant is beautiful and everything you'd expect for fine dining.  The wait staff were pleasant and attentive.

I started with the Creamy Polenta with truffled mushrooms, which is noted as a must have - it is.  It's hard to get any better.  I then had the duck and foe grais ravioli drizzled with balsamic and spaghetti with tomato and basil.  The ravioli was good, though I was left wanting more foe grais flavor - the balsamic was a great touch.  The spaghetti was outstanding, especially considering it is the middle of winter and fresh tomatoes would not be coming from an outdoor local garden.  As with the polenta, it's simply very difficult to get much better than this spaghetti, which was simple, elegant and perfectly executed.

I went in fully expecting to get the chocolate cake dessert that has been reviewed so highly.  The waitress talked me into the coconut panna cotta with guava soup & caramelized pineapple and I'm glad she did - fantastic and nice and light after a good meal.

Scarpetta is an excellent restaurant.  In overhearing conversations at other tables, I did note that the Monday night clientele were young and often inexperienced in their comments.  Perhaps, they are responsible for  giving this fine restaurant the lower than deserved reviews in the past.

I would go back and I would recommend.

Dinner at Scarpetta was unforgettable!  Mike was our server and he was excellent!  He gave suggestions for menu items, had a great personality and added a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal.  My husband and I had the filet (med-rare) and the duck and foie ravioli.  The filet was cooked perfectly and the pasta was incredibly fresh.  Our friends loved their dishes too (lamb and a chicken pasta).  I highly recommend saving room for dessert.  We had cheesecake, a banana soufflé and a salted caramel pudding.  Overall an amazing experience, excellent service and delicious food.

There was a large selection of items, so it was a nice to see a variety of menu options selected. We're told that this restaurant makes their own pasta & sauces fresh, in-house, and in my humble opinion, you could certainly taste it! The best part is that 93% of the menu can be made Gluten Free.

There were some individuals who ordered appetizers such as salads and sautéed mushrooms, while others opted to save their tastebuds for their delicious entrees. For the olive lovers in the group, some friends ordered what I believe was the delicious 'Charcuterie Board' platter as their entree that included olives, prosciutto, cheese & bread - it not only appeared quite scrumptious, I'm sure it was filling too! There was also an order of seafood linguine; a few orders of gnocchi, one mushroom special & two primavera orders - overall, it appears everyone found their meal selection quite gastronomically pleasing & appeared to enjoy every bite!

All in all, it was a good experience. We give it a 5 out of 5 and we will for sure be dining there again.

I was very much looking forward to my first visit to Scarpetta, I had heard great things about it and couldn't wait. 

I was surprised that the menu was so limited.  The appetizers were very limited and if you don't like seafood, tartare, or mushrooms it will be a challenge to find anything you can eat.  I wasn't able to find anything which was a bummer.  I was also surprised that there wasn't an offering of dinner salads or anything like that before the meal.  

The highlight before the entrees arrived was actually the bread, there is a warm bread that has some cheese and a salami or beef in it.  It tastes like fresh pizza bread and it is amazing.  I might visit again for this bread alone.

For the entrée, I had the veal cooked medium.  It was good but the mustard sauce was a bit tangy and was not my favorite.  I tried to limit the amount that was on my veal as much as possible.  Otherwise, the veal was cooked perfectly and seasoned well.  It was not fatty and there was plenty of meat on the bone.

For dessert I enjoyed the Nutella & Vanilla Creme Bombolini.  I had no idea what to expect but it was like mini doughnut holes filled with either the crème or the nutella in the center.  The ice cream that came with it was banana and was quite good as well.  It was a great dessert to share and I would recommend this to anyone looking for an indulgent dessert.

Service here was great.  We were checked on frequently and the food was delivered promptly after ordering.
Fabulous,  extremely personable service.  Every course was excellent,  from the creative cocktails through the luscious desserts.

Sometimes one word is enough- Perfection!

While on another trip to the sin city;) my bf and I chose to celebrate our 3 years anniversary at this restaurant after many yelping, looking for the perfect spot for this occasion .
We set at the bar area and arrived just in time for happy hour, which means we could enjoy multiple dishes and cocktails at a very reasonable price.
We orders almost the entire happy hour appetizer menu, as well as another main course from the regular menu, and were taken by every single dish.
Started with burrata crostini, short rib agnolotti (which we later ordered again since it was so phenomenal), the sea food dish, creamy polenta and the Tagliatelle
fall vegetables, truffle zabagalione & guanciale.
We finished with the most amazing Nutella mini donuts- to die for!!!
Our bar tender was ok, not very verbal, but it didn't matter since we enjoyed each other's company and the food was amazing!
If you are in Vegas, and looking for a delicious meal, don't skip this place!

The past few times my husband and I have been to Vegas we've gone to Scarpetta for the Social Hour. The food/drinks were always yummy and I have a bit of a love affair going on with the potato chips they set out at the bar. So for this Vegas trip we decided to make a reservation to do the tasting menu. We made a reservation for 8pm on a Friday night (9/30/16). 

We arrived, were seated promptly, but were then left for quite awhile before the waiter came over to talk to us. I mentioned that we wanted to do the tasting menu and was informed that they don't typically do it on weekends (the website specifies that the tasting menu isn't served after 10 pm and that it must be enjoyed by the whole table, but nowhere does it say that it's not available on weekends). The waiter could see that we were disappointed so said he'd ask the kitchen. He came back a bit later and said that kitchen said it was fine, tasting menu a-go. Great! We also did the wine pairing. 

The food:
- Ok, I know you shouldn't fill up on a bread basket when you are about to do a tasting menu, but oh my god. The sourdough and the stromboli's were our favorite. 
- The first course was a duo of yellowtail and tuna that was their take on sushi. Two wonderful bites, perfect. 
- The second course was a sea scallop with corn and homemade pancetta. The sea scallop and corn were amazing. The piece of pancetta was essentially inedible because it was so incredibly overly salted (and I like salt!). It's the closest I've ever come to spitting food into my napkin. Instead, I just drank an entire glass of water. 
- It's not on the tasting menu, but they brought out an order of the polenta and mushrooms for us compliments of the chef. It was absolutely heavenly. We both kept saying we shouldn't eat all of it because we needed room for the whole meal, but it was just that good. 
- Next was the pasta course. The famous spaghetti and the short rib agnolotti. We'd had the agnolotti before during Social Hour and loved it. We were anxious to try to spaghetti after having heard so many great things about it. It was truly wonderful. Both are flawless dishes; pasta is clearly Scott Conant's specialty. When we finished this course we both looked at each other and said we'd be happy to end dinner with that. 
- Next was fennel dusted black cod. I wasn't a fan of this dish. It was too "fishy" for my taste, but it was my first time having black cod so I assumed I just wasn't a fan of the protein. My husband enjoyed his but ate about half as he was getting full. I should've tried his fish as he said he didn't find it overly fishy (whereas I described my piece as licking a rotting fish corpse); but, alas, I didn't. I will say, the vegetables on this plate were amazing.
- Next was duck breast. I was so excited because duck is one of my favorite things to eat. This duck was good, don't get me wrong, but it wasn't great. It was a tad overcooked and it didn't have the best sear on it. The flavors of the dish were great, the duck just could've been cooked better
-Finally, dessert. We were absolutely stuffed but dessert was just so good, an amazing chocolate cake and gelato. 

The wine:
- All I can say about the wine pairing was that each and every wine was perfect for the course and delicious. I would give the wine pairing 5 stars. 

Overall it was a great meal; but, it was just too much food. We've done a variety of tasting menus (including at e by Jose in cosmo) and this was the only one where we felt the amount of food was overwhelming. It probably has less to do with the total amount of food, as it does with there being 2 pasta courses and us having polenta. 

I would've rated our previous dining experiences at Scarpetta at the Social Hour as 5 star. I would have rated this meal as 4 star (simply because of technical flaws with the pancetta and duck breast, and slightly slow service). BUT....after we left the restaurant we started walking back to our room (in Cosmo) to change clothing before going back out. Walking down the 3rd floor hallway to the room elevators I all the sudden felt horrible. Luckily I didn't have to walk too far before finding a restroom, where I began suffering from extremely violent food poisoning. That lasted all night and into the next day. My husband was completely fine. I suspect the black cod (I'm fairly certain the issue came from Scarpetta since for breakfast/lunch we'd split dishes at other places). 

TLRD: 3 star review because while the food was amazing, the food poisoning was awful

I'm torn here between 4/5 stars because of the price is high for an Italian restaurant but I have to give it 5. 

First off the complimentary bread is served with Mascarpone butter (omg nice touch). Excellent tomato/basil spaghetti...the best I've ever had. Fresh oysters, tender duck, awesome view from our booth. The clincher was the service though. Our server took great care of us and gave us perfect wine pairings. 

Thumbs up Mr. Conant...

My wife and I had dinner at Scarpetta for our anniversary. It was the best meal we had in Vegas.  From the service to the food is five stars.  We shared the Tuna carpaccio appetizer as well as one if their special appetizers of a soft cheese,fennel and bread... I am not a cheese person and it was amazing.  For dinner I had the branzino and my wife had their famous spaghetti, both top-notch.  Be sure to ask for a table by the windows for a good view of the Bellagio fountain show!!!

The service, the food and the view of the Bellagio fountains was incredible! I was very excited to eat here as I am a Chopped fan and Scott Conant is a judge on the show.  The food exceeded my expectations, it was delicious. Can't wait to eat there again!!!

I used to go next door to DOCG but found out they closed, I decided to go next door  and found a plesant surprise, our favorite bartender Jessica was here! As usual Jessica made our night amazing! People like Jessica should be promoted...thank you Jess for everything you do to make our experience dining at Scarpetta amazing!

Amazing food and wonderful service from Scarpetta. Been going to this wonderful restaurant since 2013. We had our daughter's 21st birthday dinner there. Mike our server is amazing and very attentive. For starters we the divers scallops and the creamy polenta so perfectly seasoned and cooked, melts in your mouth. The duck foie gras ravioli is to die for! All the entrees from the Branzino, Filet mignon are so flavorful. Everything is made with shear perfection. The Soufflés are out of this world and worth the wait! 5 stars this restaurant should be rated!

I almost never write any reviews but felt like I have to with this one - I just went to Scarpetta for winterlicious. Prior to my dinner I've read quite a few mediocre to negative reviews about this place, however I still wanted to give it a try, and I'm so very glad I did!! The key to an amazing dinner at this restaurant is to stick with the signature dishes - i.e. the polenta and the tomato & basil spaghetti. I thought the spaghetti was the most outstanding dish of the night - tastes as good as the best pasta restaurant I went to when I was in Rome, and better than many mediocre restaurants in Italy! I've been to many Italian restos around the city, including Enoteca Sociale and Campagnolo, but trust me, this pasta is the BEST EVER! Originally I thought its silly that they charge $24 for a plate of plain pasta, but after tasting it, I was thinking that I'll definitely come eat this dish again and pay full price, so I can re-live the Rome dining experience without flying there! The polenta was also amazing, with a very strong truffle aroma and was extremely smooth, however I still thought the spaghetti was more outstanding since most food would taste really good if you put enough black truffles in it. For dessert I tried both the chocolate cake and the panna cotta. The chocolate cake was so extremely rich and the sweetness was just right. However, I enjoyed the panna cotta more that night since the two other dishes I had were pretty heavy and the panna cotta was a light refreshing dessert to balance out the meal. My companion had the branzino and the short ribs.. the short ribs were extremely tender but the meat itself was lacking some flavor. The branzino was very good, I especially loved the crispy skin, but the sides that came with it were a bit too heavily salted. To conclude, my biggest tip is to stick with the polenta and the spaghetti - I can't wait to eat those dishes again!

As others have said- AMAZING!

Have been numerous times and never had a bad meal or experience.  Service and food are top notch.  Scott Conant runs a tight ship- he's my favorite Chopped judge.

Highlights include the spaghetti (yes, it's pricey but worth it imho) and the agnolotti with truffles (doesn't seem to be on the menu at the moment).  On my last visit, I had a special tarragon pasta dish that was out of this world.  The stromboli bread from the bread basket is pretty fantastic too.  Have not been to the other outposts so can't compare consistency.

Scarpetta is at the newly opened Cosmopolitan Hotel in Las Vegas and we dropped by on a whim and are glad we did.  This turned out to be a sensational dining experience.  Every single morsel of food that passed our lips was a taste sensation.  We started out with the seared sea scallops, the chestnut soup and the beet salad.  Each was out of this world delicious!  Our entrees consisted of the black cod which was buttery and perfect, the Sicilian spiced duck breast which was tender and tasty and the duck and foie gras ravioli which was creamy and sensational.  We ended our dinner with two desserts and I would highly recommend the Coconut Panna Cotta Guava Soup with Carmelized Pineapple.  Double-yum!  Service was outstanding and although we did not have have a table with a view overlooking the Las Vegas Strip, we enjoyed our comfortable booth with room enough on the table for all the dishes we ordered. I would DEFINITELY want to return to this restaurant again and would highly recommend it to everyone.

My husband and I decided to come here for our last night in Vegas. We were very excited to try the man who is very particular about his Italian food and couldn't believe how delicious it was.

We started off with cocktails, which is a MUST.
I had the IL Dolce Limone and my husband had the Moscow Mule. Outstanding cocktails.

We were lucky enough to get a seat right by the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. If you're looking for a relaxed dinner with a semi - formal atmosphere, this is your place. I loved the formality yet relaxed environment, and appreciated how friendly the staff was! 

The short rib agnolotti is like nothing else I've tried. Light yet hearty with a bit of crunch and the portion was just right. It's one of those dishes that can get monotone after a while, but this portion is just right to where it doesn't allow that to happen. 

I had the Orecchiette which was also phenomenal. The homemade sausage brought it to another level, although a bit bitter from the broccoli rabe. 

We finished off with the chocolate cake and the strawberry soufflé. They were both very delicious, but I don't think it was anything that blew me out of the water when it came to dessert. Definitely worth trying though! I'm just particular about my desserts.

All in all, phenomenal dinner. We will be back!

My boyfriend and I came here for an early Valentine's dinner. The staff was very attentive and definitely knew their menu. I had the pici for dinner which I found delicious but a little rich and heavy. However, I do highly recommend the mushroom risotto. By far one of the best risotto's I've ever tasted!

I was very excited to try out this restaurant after reading all the positive reviews on yelp. I am also a big fan of the show chopped and enjoyed Scott Conant's snarky remarks. On the show he comes off as a cocky chef who is cocky because he can cook damn well.

Well, all the dishes I sampled were incredibly disappointing. The bread basket was stale. The garden salad that I ordered was soooo overdressed that it was unpalatable. I couldn't taste the sliced beets or even the spicy arugula. It was too vinegary. Maybe a better ratio of oil to vinegar would have improved the flavor. Or no dressing .. .the Caesar salad was similarly overdressed. 

For entrees, my Sig other ordered the marinara pasta with broccoli rabe, I ordered the mezzaluna with basil and ricotta salata. My sig's pasta was a bit too al dente, but it was tasty but not special. The broccoli rabe was absolutely disgusting: it was so over salted that we sent it back. We got another order which was only slightly improved. It also had an aggressive char flavor that was not pleasant. My ravioli was nothing to write home about. It tasted no better than what you could buy at trader Joe's. 

I usually love ordering dessert, but I didn't bother with this restaurant. Scott Conant needs a reality check--ironic that he harshly critiques the dishes of others while his need some serious work.

BTW, the restaurant was way too dark. I love mood lighting but this was ridiculous. Don't waste your money here. Go to beauty and Essex for the soup dumplings or Holsteins, if you are staying at the cosmopolitan.

We arrive five minutes prior to our reservation time and were were told to wait. The bar was full, but no one offered us cocktails or any particular space to wait. This was awkward and frustrating. 
Overall, we were rushed out in under an hour. Dinner was literally waiting for us on the side just as we were done with appetizers. For a restaurant with an extensive wine list, waiter didn't seem knowledgeable about wine and wine was not poured at our table. The Sommelier did not come to our table at any point. Overall, we were made to feel like an inconvenience. As young dinners, we sometimes get a sense of condescension from some staff - this was certainly the case here. We were not there at a busy time, but even if it had been busy we should not have been rushed out. Other tables were being rushed too. Waiter asked several times if were done with our food while I was clearly still eating. Food itself was OK, not great - octopus was very disappointing and lacked flavor. I have had much better elsewhere. 
One positive: the windows in the main dinning area provided a beautiful view of the strip and Bellagio fountains! 
Certainly, an unfortunate experience at this price point - would not return and would not recommend. Service is everything at this price point, and the iteration of Scarpettta misses the mark.

Was so excited to eat here. huge foodie and could not be more excited to eat here. dined at docg 2 times before and loved that restaurant, so was hoping would love scarpetta as well. 

food did not disappoint at all. foie gras and duck ravioli like every one before said was amazing! was completely skeptical about this polenta dish as an app, but I'm sorry for ever doubting this app. it was so creamy and the mushrooms added so much to the dish only the chef would have thought of this. short rib agnolotti with horseradish holy moly. i LOVE horse radish and this was so amazing. brussel sprouts with pork belly were to die for. ppl who cook brussel sprouts correctly are 5 stars in my eyes.  

the reason i gave 2 stars is the service. i almost gave 3 stars but the service really upset me. no spiel of the menu, server was an order taker and not a server. when greeted our table he said "welcome amigos" my girlfriend was at the table with my brother, are you kidding me? he had his hands on our 4th empty chair and that is so unprofessional. every server should have his or her own style however, "amigo" should not be in any style and laid back with leaning on a chair should not be either. never gave us suggestions, did not check back on courses, huge lack of service when check should have been presented, etc. he did not mark courses with proper silverware until after food was dropped. only positive note about service was the food runners. 2 thumbs up to the food runners, spieled the food, gave us smiles, friendly!!! 

check was dropped as if it was a step of service, not real thank you from server, i still tipped 20+ % but was NOT happy to do so. I'm not expecting to be treated like a king but when paying nearly top dollar and excited to dine in this restaurant i was really disappointed. will not be going back to this restaurant 100% due to lack of great hospitality. 

as stated before 2 thumbs up to the chefs and BOH staff and runners, but to my server, you should probably realize its just not just a paycheck you are collecting, if you want repeat guests you should probably try to provide good service. 

so disappointed, wish i was more happy...

Came to Scarpetta for an anniversary dinner in February with much excitement after having learned about Scott Conant and his signature dish that shook the culinary world at one point. 

Arrival: We arrived around 7pm and was quickly greeted by the bartender as the hostess was busy seating someone and she was able to smoothly check us in just as the hostess arrived (Both wished us a Happy Anniversary) to walk us to the table. The restaurant itself is dark while the interior modern yet, still upholding the flair of traditional Italian restaurants seen with the white cloths over the tables. We were disappointed that we weren't able to get a seat right by the window but was instead placed awkwardly in the middle. Luckily our server happily obliged to moving us next to a window seat just as a party of two was leaving and his team quickly whisked us and our waters over. 
cia
Service: Our server was friendly and attentive and had a great feel for what type of guest we were. He never pushed items and would passionately explain various items that we had questions on in detail and gave a brief history of certain items that were famous at Scarpetta. He also greeted us a Happy Anniversary and provided a great wine recommendation that my girlfriend loved and the best part is it wasn't the most expensive one but actually matched her description of what she wanted. He was there when we needed him but he also knew when to give us our space so we could enjoy our time with each other. Overall great service all around from our server and his whole team. Also convinced he had a part in convincing the pastry chef for some extra Bomboloni for our anniversary which is an added bonus. 

Food: The best way to enjoy Scarpetta in my opinion is to keep it simple. We found that the dishes we enjoyed more were the simple ones. We started with the complimentary bread which was a variety and came with three different types of sauces which provided a different flair then the typical olive oil and Vinegar (Which is great). 

Starter: Creamy Polenta, we chose this dish based off the recommendation of our server and his explanation that this was one of Conant's more famous dishes. The polenta was rich and provided a feeling of comfort with every spoonful and even more when we dipped our bread in it. 

Entree: Lobster Pici x Spaghetti. My girlfriend got the pici while I went with Conant's most famous dish and crown jewel his simple spaghetti with Tomato and Basil. The magic in the dish is in the noodles itself. I'm a fan of thick noodles and the spaghetti is the perfect amount where it's not too hard but not extremely soft. You can taste the difference in the handmade noodle compared to many other places. Sometimes it's hard for me to go back to eating regular spaghetti after Scarpetta. The tomato and basil sauce is light and not heavy complementing but putting the texture and flavor of the spaghetti in the forefront. Such a simple dish yet just right. My only wish was for the portions to be more but it would take away from the experience. The lobster pici was also delicious but was a stark contrast to the spaghetti as the sauce was more powerful and the addition of lobster helped make the dish more intricate and intense. The touch of almonds gave the dish an interesting crunch as well. We switched dishes a couple times and in the end we both agreed the Spaghetti was our favorite. 

Dessert: Crema Bruciatti x Nutella and Vanilla Bomboloni. The Crema Bruciatti although good wasn't anything impressive and easily forgettable. The Bomboloni on the other hand is the ultimate guilty pleasure (Insane sugar rush as well). The warm nutella inside the sugary exterior coupled with rich vanilla ice cream inside of each Bomboloni is happiness in every bite and regret later on when stepping on the scale. Definitely worth it and the standard amount of pieces is more than enough. 

Thoughts: Our whole experience at Scarpetta could be described as less is more. The simple dishes is what won us over. Our service was attentive when needed but gone to leave us in our own world when it was time. Although we didn't try alot of other dishes on the menu which I'm sure is good we came for the pasta which should be the main focus when coming to a place like this. The dark modern atmosphere provided a great date night as we talked and watched the Bellagio fountains going on in the distance with the entire strip glowing beneath our feet. This is definitely somewhere where you can take someone special as the food is comforting and atmosphere intimate.

SAVE YOUR MONEY!

I just went here for the first time tonight, albeit for Winterlicious and I have to say I was less than impressed. In fact, I would say that the cuisine was bland and basic. If this was 1998 I may have been more impressed but in 2013 I'm expecting much more especially at $100 a person (and that's Winterlicious prices!). 

The beet salad was bland and predictable. In fact, I had a better one two weeks ago at the Crush wine bar for $12 and a show stopping one in Niagara with candied beets and quail egg for $15 that would knock this chef's socks off because it actually included effort in its preparation. The polenta was simply full of parmesan cheese, that's it, nothing more interesting. The accompanying mushrooms were bland. The striped bass was bland and predictable. The organic chicken was better and was the highlight of the meal but still rather bland. The chocolate cake was a joke, anyone with access to Youtube could make that and the accompany gelato tasted like frozen water with flavour i.e. not gelato. The "cheese" cake was another joke, it tasted like silken tofu with a few berries on the side. The term cheese was severely misused.

All in all a waste of time and money. Our wine choice was the best part of the meal and even that was botched in that it wasn't the bottle we ordered but the one underneath. As they hold your bottle for ransom they didn't even keep my glass filled.

You'd be better off going to Crush Wine Bar or pretty much any other reputable restaurant in the city for far less money than this place. The atmosphere is nice and it's posh but if you're looking for good food go elsewhere!

4th of July weekend in Vegas - we thought it would be nuts, but we were pleasantly surprised we were able to make a reservation for Scarpetta. 

We were thrilled when the hostess seated us right next to a window, and no sooner had we sat when the fireworks started over Caesar's Palace! Our waiter was smart enough to know we having a romantic moment watching them and let us be until the end. Shortly after, he arrived and took our drink orders. I believe he was a bit new - possibly a bit nervous, but he had very good instincts and was very nice. Our water glasses did not go empty once and empty plates/glasses were removed immediately. Again, our waiter was not in a rush, but he was not ignoring us either....he really set a nice pace for us for the meal. It was nice to take our time and enjoy the ambiance, which is really a highlight of this restaurant. 

The meal: We're pretty avid fans of the Food Network, and while you'd think the celebrity chefs might be overrated on the Strip especially, I have never had a bad experience with these types of restaurants. This was no exception. The bread basket is to die for....if we knew we weren't going to pay a mint for the meal itself, we might have stuffed ourselves with that alone. Our waiter recommended the spaghetti, which the chef is particularly known for.
