We decided to split it (they're not snobby about that at this place which is great!) as an appetizer - and it was very good. My boyfriend said he likes my spaghetti better, but I loved it. We had the veal chop for the entree, which we also split - that was very good as well. 

Overall, I don't think our meal was crazy expensive - it was very much in line with the price you'd pay at any other of the strip restaurants. The portions were small, yes, but we also respect not gorging ourselves to death...that's what the buffets are for. 

I can't say what would make me give this restaurant a 5 star rating as opposed to a 4 star...but, I'm definitely willing to go back to find out. Enjoy the Cosmopolitan - it's stunning inside, enjoy this restaurant - the views and food are great, and enjoy each other if you're in a romantic mood - this is the place!

I'm a big time blogger and I love to give my input on what's hot and what's not. I'm always on the road and I'm never in one place for so long because of my job so a mini vacay was way overdue! My first stop was the cosmopolitan, I've been here a couple of times and I love the vibe coming from the casino, it has marquee which is one of the hot spots in Las Vegas to date, a good amount of shopping stores and let's not forget the restaurants. To name a few you have Blue Ribbon Sushi, China Poblano, Comme Ca, Milos, STK, Holsteins and Scarpetta/DOCG. I've been to some of these restaurants before and Scarpetta "WAS" my favorite, the food is still on the top of my list but this time around the customer service was beyond horrible, the worst I've had in my entire life! I came to Scarpetta last year in mid-January 2011, this time they have new employees/managers. I walk to the host stand to check in and no one was there so I waited, then when this young lady arrived she checked me in but had a hard time working her own computer, finally when she gave me the OK can you wait at the bar it'll take just 5 to 10 minutes for your table, I said that's fine even though it wasn't busy. 10 minutes have passed and still no call for my name, finally I reminded the hostess and she goes "oh yes your table was ready 5 minutes ago". Instead of checking on the guest this airhead young school girl flirts with the bar back showing off her big breast, while the female manager just stands there letting her go on with her actions. I then tried to speak to the female manager and she turns away like she didn't even hear me. I finally sat on my chair to calm down, I then order my favorite the "SPAGHETTI w/tomato & basil", now I have explained to you guys before how this dish is. Scott Conant really put his all into this dish, his ingredients, the flavors, the texture of the pasta everything just works and I can't get enough of it! At the end of the night I did get up off my chair a happy person and the server was awesome but I did NOT leave the restaurant a happy guest, as I walked out to say thank you for the food the female manager again disappoints me. No words, no gratitude she looks at me like my money wasn't good enough, like I wasn't good enough for that place. I was told there's only one female manager so you'll know who I'm talking about when you get there. I swear this lady should get an award for being so stuck up and the worst manager ever! What happened to the old managers? Scott do yourself a favor and fire this woman, she's making your business look bad and as for the female manager, sweetheart you should relax and smile more! I definitely won't be coming back to this location or recommend this to anyone, if you really like the food just have it to go or else you'll feel like an unwelcome guest.
Incredible restaurant! Staff is very friendly and attentive. Sexy, rustic atmosphere feels elegant, yet not stuffy. The best pasta I have ever had!!!

Had friends in town and decided to check out this place. The atmoshpere is just great from the bar area to the dining area.
Food was great three of us had the pasta and one the lamb. Great bread basket.
Service in the bar was awesome. Dinner service a little slow and server seemed distracted with other tables.
Overall great place especailly for a special night out.

I really enjoyed the service and the atmosphere with the nice view. The waiter that we had was excellent with great customer service skills. But the food was ok. I order some white fish and it was ok, I couldn't taste a lot of flavors. I highly recommend for the atmosphere, elegant, nice music with amazing view but the food was decent.
Amazing food, great service, beautiful decor, awesome wine list, views of the Bellagio fountains. What more could you possibly ask for in Vegas!?

Last Friday we came in at 9.30. The place was packed and the girls at the reception told us that we could eat at the bar or at the small tables on the opposite side of the bar. We choose to wait at the bar for a table in the restaurant, where it seemed to be more quiet. They told us the wait could be up to an hour, but we didn't really care.

We allready had a few cocktails before we came in, so I started to drink lots of water. We had to share our snack basket (patato chips, nice!) with the people sitting next to us. They shove it to their side of the bar, we didn't steal it back, so far the enjoyment of snacks. 

After about 30 minutes it seemed like more and more people came in without reservation, but they were all given a table in the restaurant. We were still enjoying the bottled water, but after an hour waiting, my boyfriend walked up to the reception and they made our table ready, thanking us for the long wait. When we were seated, we noticed that the restaurant wasn't that full anymore. We were seated at a table apart from the other guest, in the corner of an almost empty room, where it wasn't that warm. They gave us some really nice bread and I didn't want to be snobby, but I did ask for another table. They were very nice and gave us a table by the window, overlooking the B fountains. Not that we especially wanted that, but we did like to sit closer to other people. Experiencing a restaurant isn't just about the food, it's also he temperature, the views, looking at other guest and the over all service.

Anyway, after this, everything was great. My boyfriend and I shared 4 courses, which were all perfectly made: the tartare, the foie gras ravioli, the organic chicken and the goat cheese cake. I was really stuffed (I also had 3 bottles of water) and happy. Service was great, although we were asked a little to much if everything was okay. In Holland we are not used to all that attentiveness.

6 stars for the food, 4 for the somewhat weird start = 5 stars.

My boyfriend and I just ate here tonight after reading the reviews on Yelp. We requested a window table based on other reviews and glad we did as the view of the Bellagio water show was nice to see at night. The atmosphere is good, nothing amazing. The pasta and sauce dish was very good but beware, portions are VERY small. We didn't have great service either. Our waiter never came over to us once our meals arrived and never came over to us during our meal to check to see how we were doing and still didn't come over until 15 minutes after we were done. Cocktails were ok nothing great. This was our last night in Vegas and wish we tried one of the Italian restaurants over at the Venetian instead.

Beware unscrupulous waiter or manager! Never lose sight of your credit card at Scarpetta.
 
I gave my credit card to Scarpetta'swaiter on 12/31/12 around 11:15pm to pay our New Year Eve dinner bill. 2 preset menus, A la carte filet for my daughter, champagne and generous gratuity. Slightly over $1000.00. So far nothing wrong.
We left the restaurant and went back home. Around  0:05am on 01/01/13. someone at Scarpetta ran my credit card again. This time for $864,--
I noticed the issue a couple of days later. I did call Scarpetta and explained the situation to the hostess. She assured me that the manager would return my call and would certainly correct this mistake. The manager never called me back.
I filed a claim with my credit card company the next day as I did not want to waste my time calling Scarpetta again or drive there to try resolving this error. My credit card company credited back my account right away. However, Scarpetta did resubmit the charge along with apparently supporting documentation. My guess is that the so called supporting documentation is copy of card credit card receipt with some sort of a forged signature). Unfortunately, my credit card company had to re-bill the charge to my account and now I must provide my credit card company with additional information/documentation to support my claim.
Since I must now waste my time supporting my claim, I will also file a police report. I am probably not an isolated case.  BRAVO SCARPETTA

One of the best meals of my life, with a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountain show. We started out with cocktails & enjoyed the variety of complimentary bread served with citrus olive oil, eggplant caponata & mascarpone butter. We chose the lardo wrapped prawns as our appetizer which were served with rosemary lentils & it was very flavorful. I had the black tagliolini pasta for my entree which was lightly dressed with a cream sauce & topped with dungeness crab, uni & tobiko. I told the server's assistant who removed my empty dish that, had I been alone, I would have licked the plate...it was that good. I lived in Italy for several months & had some great pasta, but never anything that spectacular. My date had the lamb trio which was filet, sausage & chop over ceci beans & baby carrots topped with hazelnut. He requested the chop cooked medium rare but it was served rare. The server quickly took it back for a re-fire & it was perfectly cooked upon its return. We enjoyed the nutella & vanilla bomboloni for dessert which was served with chocolate shortbread crumble & banana gelato. The only issue I had was that our server was a little aloof & cold, but it was late & I believe we were his last table so I understand. It really did nothing to detract from my fantastic experience at Scarpetta & his assistant, guy with a beard & long hair (cute!), made up for it with his kind conversation. Can't wait to return for another meal here!

We were visiting family in Henderson and my husband and I snuck away for a date night. Friends recommended Scarpetta to us, and oh my gosh. I mean from the service to the delectable food, we were really wowed.  We had a 6pm reservation (which is really early for Vegas) but arrived early and  said we will seat you at 6, but please enjoy a drink at the bar. It was very fancy! We were seated at 6 with an amazing view of the bellagio and fountains. Our server knew his stuff, and recommended the vegetarian pasta with a truffle cream sauce for me, and the New York steak for my husband. We also had the creamy polenta for an appetizer. Everything was amazing!! Oh and the complimentary bread was too!!! Thank you for showing this mom and dad of a toddler a good time Scarpetta!

Scarpetta is the best Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas. Period. It is high priced but what restaurant isn't on the strip.

Here is the secret: Make a reservation during the early part of the week and order the sampler menu. The sampler is not available during the busy times (Fri-Sun). A word of caution: don't gorge on the bread or you will not be able to finish the meal. Sampler: $90 Wine compliment:$50. I don't remember the exact amounts. 
 
If you drink wine, add the wine for each sampler. You will be very happy with their wine selection for EACH of the sampler. 

Their signature spaghetti is the best I have ever had. There was one dish they cooked up specially for my wife from her previous visit with her BFFs. 

This will be the first place we revisit when we head back to LV.

Had the most amazing experience, thank you so much to all the staff! I made reservations only days before our first wedding anniversary. They gave us the best table in the house, with an incredible view. The entire staff took great care of us and treated us like royalty. It made the entire night one to remember for the rest of our lives. Thank you Scarpetta!!

For the money, it was the best meal we had in Vegas.  I went with 3 friends for my birthday (sidenote: Las Vegas Restaurants don't really do anything special for your birthday, no free dessert, maybe a candle on the dessert you order).  We split an appetizer, ordered a bottle of wine, and all ordered one pasta.  The bread accompaniments are fantastic!  The Marscapone "butter",  citrus infused olive oil, and tomato tapenade are delicious.  Each pasta we had was spectacular.  Then we each ordered a dessert (the coconut panna cotta was the best, light and refreshing, and I'm usually a chocolate person when it comes to dessert).  We had an issue with the check (they presented us with a check, then when we gave our credit card to pay the amount changed, turns out they gave us the wrong check the 2nd time around, but they went back and corrected this promptly) but other than that service was flawless.  We each paid about $60 for a shared appetizer, wine, pasta, and dessert and it was the perfect amount of food (full but not stuffed).  I went to Vegas for a food extravaganza (including going to Sage, CarneVino and Joel Robuchon's) and I would go back to Scarpetta every night if I could do it again.  The food is wonderful and the atmosphere is modern and well-done.

This review is based on a dinner visit.

Atmosphere - 4.5:  From the entrance it's a little difficult to get a sense of the restaurant because you can only see the long bar which you must walk through to get to the main seating area of the restaurant.  I initially thought it was an extension of the DOCG Enoteca, which is next door.  Once you reach the main seating area you will find a nicely decorated dining room that features views of the Bellagio fountains in one direction, and their extensive wine cellar in the opposite direction.

Menu - 4.5:  Great menu with very creative options.  The portions are small and the staff is really good about helping ensure you get the right amount of food.  Of course, as with many fine dining experiences you will pay for it if you are a big eater.

Service - 3:  The service was mixed.  The sommelier was fantastic; he really knew the vast wine collection and helped us find something that paired well with our group's diverse menu choices.  Our waiter, while very friendly, was just way too slow.  It took too long for everything from taking our order to getting our food.   Food delivery timing was off as one member of our group ended up watching everyone else eat while he waited.  I will say that it didn't appear that the other people in the restaurant were having the same experience.  I really think that our experience was out of the norm for some reason.  While I can't in good conscience rate the service experience any higher than 3, I would note that in my experience an establishment with a reputation for good service will usually do things to make amends when they don't deliver.  The restaurant recognized that things had not gone well for our table and took a few items off of our bill to compensate.

Food - 5:  The food was fantastic.  Especially liked the creamy truffle polenta.   

Wine List - 5:  The 3,000+ bottle cellar offered plenty of choices.  The sommelier was very knowledgeable, friendly, and didn't make me feel like an idiot.  

Overall - 4

Another gem in the heart of Inglewood.  Great service, lots of patio seating.  Not a huge wine selection but decent enough.  Consistently well prepared dishes.  

Had the captures salad to start.  Lots of tomatoes and very flavourful.  Perfect for sharing between 2 or 3.  Next was the seafood linguini.  Nice and light, this was a simple clear tomato broth with lots of clans, mussels and shrimp.  Ordered some fresh bread for the broth. Just perfect.

Modern decor, lots of metal and concrete so not much to absorb sound.  Not ideal for intimate dinners, great for groups.

Did I mention the service?  Great service!

Pro tip: When making a reservation, request a table by the Bellagio fountains and you won't be disappointed. 

Pro tip 2: Not your traditional Italian restaurant (see menu).  Might be better off with Carbone if that's what you had in mind. 

After our most recent Vegas trip, I've come to realize that a lot of what you pay for the many $$$ restaurants along the strip is the ambiance and the convenience of being on the strip.  The food itself is okay but not mind blowing, or at least not enough to justify the cost.  For that, I feel like you would have to go to one of the many famous $$$$ restaurants.  But who cares! It's Vegas. Scarpetta is really nice because of the view, but the food wasn't necessarily mind blowing.  The break-down:

Fritto misto: My girlfriend and I weren't really a fan of this. Seemed like a bunch of fried shoestrings served on a plate for $18 and not impressive. 
Duck breast: This dish was tasty, but nothing too special that struck out. 
Pici: Yes! My favorite dish of the night.  Very flavorful pasta with an olive oil base and chunks of lobster on top. Would recommend this to anyone who enjoys a pasta that feels light and bouncy.

Apart from the food itself, we also really enjoyed the bread selection.  

Overall, despite some shortcomings from some of the food I enjoyed this meal overall.  While I personally don't see myself coming back here, would recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy a medium-high quality dinner who doesn't mind spending a little extra cash for the view and ambiance.

Seeing Scott on tv, I naturally thought he was full of it. Boy was I in for a surprise, the food at Scarpetta was amazing from start to finish. Most restaurants on the strip with with a celebrity chef name are just that - an overpriced restaurant with subpar food living off their name. To start I had the polenta which is to die for! They bring wild mushrooms in a sauce table side and pour it over your dish. As a second course we shared the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti, also highly recommend this dish. Main dish consisted of the prime beef once again delicious. 

For once a high profile chef and restaurant lives up to the hype. Hail to the pasta king!

Last night my boyfriend and I went for the first time with another one of my friends for dinner, we couldn't have been more pleased! We had Chef Dave come out and talk to us and he offered to just send a whole Bunch of his favorite things out for all of us to try! The breads are amazing, the spaghetti is outta this world, and Chef Dave's  signature dish which is the pink snapper is just to die for ! I wish I could go back again tonight! The food was so perfectly prepared that I couldn't stop eating even though I had no room left to
Continue to eat, I just forced myself to! The wine pairings went perfectly with each dish ! We had such an awesome experience, and at the end chef Dave even brought us back into the kitchen to see where our awesome dinner was created! The kitchen was spotless! Can't wait to go again! Thanks so
Much chef Dave !!:)

This is one of those restaurants that just inspires you. You know, like how it inspired me to open a Yelp account just so I could tell everyone what a terrible experience I had. I've skimmed over a lot of positive reviews on here, so I'm kind of shocked by how crappy our experience was.

It earns one star for the solid cocktails (I had a Moscow Mule) and the delicious bread basket. 

The service started out mediocre. We (me and two of my girlfriends) had an 8:30 p.m. reservation and arrived on time, but were still told to wait in the bar for 15 minutes despite seeing open tables. No biggie, we order drinks and hang out. 

We're seated at 8:45 p.m., the waiter greets us, he's surly and disinterested. Who cares, the bread basket has just arrived and is delicious. The bus boy seems friendly and smiles. Everything is cool. Waiter asks if we want sparkling or still water. I say still instead of saying tap, and we get the $8 bottle. Ok, so it was a little sneaky but it's my mistake for not knowing to say tap. But no big deal, still eating the bread.

8:55 - We order 12 oysters, wine, and our main dishes because we've already decided. One of the girls mispronounces her dish, and he gives her a look like she just asked which side Italy was on in WWII. He corrects her, she politely apologizes, and he tells her "it's OK," even though clearly it is not.

9:00 p.m. - The oysters arrive. There are 6 instead of 12 and a bus boy brings them out. We get no description and none was offered on the menu. We plan to inform the waiter about our missing oysters when he comes by again, but I guess he's done with us because he's vanished and does not reappear until we are well into the main course (which is really only 10 minutes later). No matter, we will not be needing any additional oysters as the first 6 were disgusting. Half are covered in red wine vinegar, it's unclear if there is actually an oyster in the shell as I can't taste it. The remaining three have three large chunks of ice carefully placed on top of each oyster, indicating the ice is part of the dish. The problem with having a huge chunk of ice in an oyster is that it makes you chew your oyster multiple times until you realize you are chewing an oyster.

9:05ish p.m. - The main dishes come out. I ordered the short rib agnolotti and my friend had the duck & foie gras ravioli. The descriptions sounded better than the food tasted. The ravioli was overcooked. I can't remember what my other friend ordered as I didn't try it when she said it was also mediocre.

9:15 p.m. - Our waiter materializes temporarily to clear our dishes and to fail to comment on the fact that we've left a substantial portion of our food uneaten. I receive the glass of wine I ordered with the appetizers.

9:20 p.m. - Waiter asks if we want dessert, no thanks, and he drops off the bill immediately. Now he's all smiles.

9:25 p.m. - They take a chair from our table to put together a table for an incoming party of 10, even though there are many empty tables with chairs surrounding us. We take that as our cue, throw back our wine and leave.

The result - we ended up paying over $200 for 45 minutes of so-so food and bad service. I've had worse service before, but never at a place that had the audacity to charge me this much. We also stayed in the Cosmo during our stay and the service at the hotel was pretty lackluster.

Good house made Pasta. Also had the chicken breast, probably most tender and juicy breast i've ever had.

Meal was super expensive though. Really nice place, with a great view of the bellagio fountains, but I don't think i'll be back.

The wife and I were in Vegas on vacation and her younger cousin and his GF were in town the same week so we wanted to take them out to a nice dinner.  I didn't have a chance to check out Scarpetta when I was last here in November, so this seemed like a perfect time.  

The room is absolutely beautiful, and we were lucky enough to get seated near a window, so we could also watch the Bellagio Fountain show at the same time.  I was thinking, this night is going to be perfect right......maybe not.  So the server comes to take our drink order.  I'm a simple guy, so I just ordered a Miller Lite.......he kind of looks at me and is like " Bud ".  I'm like ok, nevermind.  Can I get a Stella instead?  He's like Yup.  I'm like.... ok.  Then he leaves and the busser brings over the bread basket full of win~!  The bread was a salami roll, as well as some Focaccia, and what looked like some french baguette.  The busser really explained the different condiments they had for the bread well.  He had a thick accent, so it was a little difficult to understand, but he did a nice job explaining it.  He left and our server came back with the beer....a Bud.  I'm like...seriously, I just told you  Stella?  Then my wife's cousin asks him a bit about the condiments (mascarpone, some eggplant tapenade, and some olive oil) and if there is a certain one that is recommended for the different breads.   He's like I don't know, they're all good.  I'm like....seriously?  Then we get around to ordering our Apps and entrees.  We started with the braised shortribs and the fritto misto.....both were great.  The shortribs were very tender and flavorful.  The fritto misto,was crunchy and not oily either.  We then ordered our entrees. My wife and her cousin ordered the Short rib agnolotti, the cousins GF ordered the Lamb loin.  Haha, we could already tell how our waiter was, so for fun, she asked him how the Lamb was.  You would think at a nicer upscale restaurant like this, he would boast about the preparation, or the sauce, or how tender the meat was......nope.  When she asked how it was, he said "good."  Really?  I thought restaurants made money by putting crap on the menu?  Anyways, back to lucky old me.  I asked the waiter about the Spaghetti with Basil (which is what lots of people rave about) or the Stracci.  He was like it's ok, but it's kind of plain.  Not sure if he was trying to upsell me, but I don't know if Scott Conant would appreciate one of his servers calling his food plain.  Anyways, I took his advice and order the Stracci.  Or did I?  Because even if I ordered the Stracci, that's not what was placed in front of me when the rest of the order came around.  I looked at the guy and was like "didn't I tell you Stracci?"  Oh, I'm not sure, let me check.  Seriously?  What the hell, can this really be happening.  Anyways, I waited patiently like a fool, while everybody else ate.  To Scarpetta's defense, all the entrees were really good and flavorful, just the guy serving us needed a clue.  We moved on to dessert and ordered the chocolate cake (a bit too heavy for me), the coconut panna cotta (awesome!), and the cheesecake (light, airy, completely delicious).  The waiter comped us an order of Zeppole's for his lack of service, and it too was great.  

Overall, I was just disappointed that the service was so poor.  I was REALLY looking forward to having a wonderful night with family and friends, but it ended up just being ok.  Too bad

I have to say I indulged in almost every meal in my 4 day stay in Vegas, but this was by far the best. The most decadent, delicious, and just memorable. 

At the tables in Cosmo friday afternoon we were pondering where to have a late dinner before hitting the clubs. The player to my left said Scarpetta had an amazing, but simple spaghetti dish that was to die for. Keeping our fingers crossed, we wandered upstairs around 6:30 and were able to secure a 9:30 reservation and requested a tiny 2 person table in the corner with a great window view. Even though we were running about 15 minutes late, they were gracious enough to hold the table for us. 

Upon arrival, we didn't even have to give our name and check in, the host immediately remembered us from 3 hours earlier and sat us promptly at the requested table. The view of the Bellagio and the water show was fantastic! The only issue I had was that we were not given a menu or even a wine list for at least 10-15 minutes after we were seated. Normally this wouldn't be a problem I presume, but it was 9:30 and we were pretty much starving at this point. 

After we were presented with menus though, the bread basket pretty much had our full attention for a good while. The selection of bread and spreads was DELICIOUS. We literally ate almost all of it...the focaccia was incredible. I ordered a gin and tonic, and my friend a glass of moscato. They were both delicious with our meals. 

We shared the beef carpaccio appetizer, and it was absolutely delicious--just the perfect amount for 2 people to share since we weren't looking to eat a heavy meal, but wanted to try a starter. We shared 2 pasta dishes--the spaghetti everyone raves about and the duck and foie gras ravioli. Personally I absolutely savored the ravioli--i love foie gras and duck, so it was perfect. The Spaghetti my friend liked more--it was simple, but good. 

Definitely coming back here on my next trip to Vegas in May!
Cold food, didn't deliver entrees at the same time, indifferent attitude. Quality of food was good, but lack of service to match makes this a nonstarter compared to other choices in town.
3.5 out of 5!  Great option for summerlicious! I had the braised beef and the trout as a main. Good portion size. Check out the rooftop afterwards ;)

Had a wonderful dinner here last night. Our server was very knowledgable and attentive. We were celebrating a birthday and were given a table with a nice view of the strip and a free birthday dessert. Food was great and tasty, what more can you ask for?!?

A business dinner. Server couldn't describe how the frito misto was prepared. The paparadelle was a starchy ball. Asked for a side of pasta, to which the server said she'd have to check with the chef! She came back shortly and advised "the chef says no." From there we rarely saw our server; suspect she was embarrassed. Bottom line: contemporary design; average (though friendly) service; average food.
Had the tasting menu, the ravioli and the spaghetti were very good, black cod was mushy no flavor and duck breast had a game taste. They should just stick with the pasta.

good, pricey but apparently everything in Vegas is headed that way, or so they try to have some class but the truckloads of white trash appear with their bud light. 


I guess its Italian food, which is great but you end up paying a lot for it, and actually what's really out of range is the wine prices , its like 15-20$ a glass. its like jesus !!! It doesn't match the price or class or their food.

The mediocre: Although good, the $24 spaghetti is not really justified by the price. Stay away from that chocolate cake. It's the heaviest, tiniest, piece of chocolate cake I have ever had. It's good, but WAY heavy.

The better: The short rib with farro risotto. Oh so yum! How can you screw up short ribs?

The OUT OF THIS WORLD: The panna cotta with guava soup and coconut ice cream. Very few desserts I eat are memorable. This one is VERY memorable. For a panna cotta, this dessert was extremely light and had just a hint of sweetness (I thought the guava was going to make it super sweet, but it didn't). I would come back and eat here just for this dessert. No joke!

Our service was great. Request a table near one of the windows so you can see the fountain show at Bellagio.

Went on a Thursday night. We had the mussels which were fabulous! Each of us also had Tagliatelle - one with chicken and black olives in a red sauce (pollo), and one with chicken and spinach in a white wine cream sauce (alla Panna). It was fantastic, the chianti was lovely and the service was perfect! I'll go back every chance I get :)

OMG GOOD! GREAT date night/anniversary spot. This is a very classy place, I absolutely loved every bite! The staff were extremely professional. I had the Duck Ravioli, delicious! My wife had the Lamb, which i tried and nearly died, SO GOOD. We even had some desert, you have to get the cheesecake, it is topped with mango gilato which does not sound appealing but was phenomenal! We spent $100 before gratuity, did not drink any alcohol. OH, and we had a table watching the Bellagio fountains! I live in Las Vegas, only two other restaraunts rival this one and they are more expensive - YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!
Great views of the Bellagio fountains/strip, nice comfortable seating, and good ambiance. All the dishes we had were very good, but none were great.

New favorite place in Vegas. Definitely a must.

Here's the scoop: Ask for the booth - #46 (i think). It's right across the magnificent window to watch the fountain show at the Bellagio.

$35 corkage fee. Not bad considering our party brought in a beautiful bottle of cab from Napa. Their adorable great grand master somm Noeh is the sweetest, nicest guy ever. He let us see his most prized bottle. He recommended a beautiful Amarone. Best value for a bottle of wine that's less than $200. Tell him the flavor profiles that you like and he will never steer you wrong.

Titus and the gang (all the crew who helped us) are amazing. Don't like your drink? Tell them what you want. I can't stress that enough. If you know what you want, they'll give it to you. No clue as to what you want? Well don't blame them if you got something that's not good enough for you.

Take your time and enjoy the experience that is Scarpetta. The staff is very courteous and genuine. Food? It's an italian place, so don't complain if the Hamachi isn't like Nobu's. Their agnolotti is divine. It's rich - and a little bit goes a long way.

Think of quality vs quantity. Four appetizers, an entree each and 2 desserts should be an amazing dinner for a party of 5. The food is rich. You will get gustatory fatigue if you try and finish a bowl of pasta with bone marrow and octopus all by yourself. The trio of lamb is tender and well seasoned. Have little bites from everyone's plate. That's when you know that you came here with the right group of family/friends and you're ready to have a great dining experience.

In a rush? Skip this. This is not a fast food joint. Want a big slab of foie? You obviously won't find it in a ravioli.

I was excited to try Scott Conants restaurant since his such a A-hole on Chopped.
He's a particular S.O.B so I thought ; well his restaurant should be perfect.
Well Scott its not. I am  a retired restauranteur and your restaurant had many faults to make our experience a unpleasant one.
The biggest is : we had a reservation at 6 30 pm. We were so rushed for our dinner it felt like they had the table booked for 7pm. We had taken one sip of our Martini and our appetizers were there. We weren't even done with our appetizers and our pasta was there. Then the weirdest thing happened; we had taken 2 bites of pasta and our entrees were ready, they had to bring them back to the kitchen.
2 good things ; wine pairings excellent, and the veal chop prepared perfectly. It had sweetbreads with it but we opted to not have them and it didn't need them.
The worst was the heirloom tomato salad, we had to send it back because the tomatoes had no taste whatsoever. (the night before we ate a American Fish had gazpacho and a tomato app there that our first bite was OMG heavenly)
We didn't have dessert because of our experience with dinner.
Scott you should spend more time at your restaurant training your staff on the floor and in the Kitchen. i will not be going back to Scarpetta. It was not memorable.

this is one of those places that doesn't know how to use expensive ingredients.  Food preparation was on tier with a TGIFridays.  The wait staff was a self proclaimed dbag who "hung out at XS pool party and hit on fat chicks."

the only reason to eat at this place is b/c of the view of the bellagio fountains.  it's a tourist trap, not a culinary experience by any means.  I'd stay away! they're pretty douchy in here.  Manager, wouldn't move us to a table by the bellagio fountains b/c we weren't dressed right, eventhough there were plenty of tables clearing out during the hour long wait for my first meal to be replaced.  No comp, no free drinks, worst $120 spent in vegas.

After reading rave reviews- a bit disappointed. Nice decor - waitstaff was polite but a bit inexperienced. The food runners completely described the food incorrectly  - with confidence though.... Bread was wonderful. We ordered more! Spaghetti with tomato sauce and basil quite delicious and unexpected. I had pasta with lobster - Menza-menza .... Too salty and lobster was soggy and tasteless. The side of asparagus was tasty with an eggy hollandaise-like topping. Other diner had black cod  said it was ok - not great- ordered a green salad- not on the menu - great croutons - dessert was a strawberry soufflé - underwhelming and under baked.. I was not paying the bill but I am so annoyed with restaurants that charge an enormous amount of money for food that is not so consistent or great. 
Hence 2 stars...
Amazing dining experience! Was here with a group of girls for my friends birthday and we had SO much fun. The service was amazing. Our waiter was extremely attentive The food was out of this world.

Went recently for a friend's birthday.  I had steak tartare and their signature spaghetti.  The quality of the beef was great for the tartare but lacked seasoning.  I've had their spaghetti several times before and it has been getting worse with each visit.  The pasta was over cooked and was mushy.  Shameful!  Al dente is the way to go.  The noodle was also finer in texture than it usually is.  I am not going back.  Especially after they cancelled my reservation once due to a larger event they wanted to book.   There are so many great restaurants in Toronto, if you don't need my business, I will gladly take it elsewhere.  Good luck!

Excellent, friendly wait staff. I'm a bit of a dork when it comes to these fine dining restaurants and they just laughed it off.

The food is incredible. I thought it might be a bit rich for me but it was delicious and even better than I could have expected (and I went in with very high end expectations). 

I'm not a mushroom lover and I was scraping the bowl for every last drop of polenta. The agnolotti was something I could eat for every meal happily. 

The best part was the bill. We ordered a lot. Everyone had an appetizer and an entree and there were several mixed drinks and it was way cheaper than I expected. Yes it is pricey compared to your average meal but for a view of the Bellagio fountains, delicious food, and friendly staff, I would've gladly paid much much more.

I've been here three times since they opened in the early bits of 2013. The menu has grown and the place has evolved a tiny smidgeon. The guys (Rocco and Gennaro) always have a warm welcome for me and they are both intent on creating the best food possible.
To be honest I've only had the Tagliatelle with Mushroom ragu. I order it every time because I love it so. And the calamari fritti.
I love the vibe of this place and if I ever stayed out late I would probably end up here.

So I wanted to try this place just because I have heard about Scott Conant so much and I figured I has to try this tomato basil pasta that is so famous and costs so much. My mom and I got the tasting menu. The famous, signature pasta wasn't the best and there were two dishes that we absolutely both refused to finish because they weren't good. For the price and the hype, I was pretty disappointed.

Went there based on the rave reviews, and our table of 6 was frankly disappointed with the food.

I had the duck & foie gras ravioli, and it just tasted off. Very bland, but also the meat stuffing was just not tasting right.

Also tried the spaghetti and it was just meh. I know what Al Dente should be and this was definitely under cooked.

At least the bread basket was good.  Service was just okay.

The place looks great though. That's about it.

Chef Conant is truly a culinary star. The polenta shows that he means business. So often polenta and risotto are served with poor preparation because the average person can't tell the difference. At Scarpetta, they are perfect, as is the homemade pasta.

The food is great and very tasty. The vegetarian Palenta is awesome. One drawback about this place is the service is very slow and food takes forever to come out, so leave your self enough time if you have other plans

*EYE ROLL* Hostess had us come back in 15 mins or get a drink at the bar "to be ontime." WELL, it was 1/3 empty when walked in on a Fri night.

My fish was awesome! But, my fellow diner/payer was disappointed. Nothing was terrible, just idk, maybe we got the "wrong things"? Nothing extraordinary in comparison with other Vegas/NYC estbalishments.

PS View was pleasant - but why is the window sill right on the eye level of the Bellagio fountain?

Hands down AMAZING!  

Had the 7 course tasting menu ($110 per person) everything was outstanding except the fish was. . Way to fishy, but they immediately substituted it with an additional pasta and glass of wine..

Be ready to relax,  enjoy and be treated like you are an appreciated customer! 

We wanted to just sit back and enjoy our evening and that is exactly what we did!   never once did we feel rushed, the staff checked on us and asked us when we wanted the next course unlike some places that just being it out before you are ready. 

I cant say enough about this place and tell everyone that is looking for an awesome meal to go to scarpettas. .. 

(I should be getting a referral fee!  Lol)

I'll admit I was a little nervous heading to Scarpetta after a lot of mixed reviews I have read since its' opening this past summer and the Yelp rating wasn't entirely supportive of this restaurant as well. But I am here to help bring up its' rating as I believe this place is a solid 4 stars.

I made a reservation a week in advance for a Wed night (if you don't have reservations for a weeknight, I noticed a lot of empty tables late in the night around 930/10ish). My date and I knew we had to try some of Conant's signature dishes ie the Creamy Polenta and Hand Made Spaghetti. We also tried the Raw Waygu Beef and the Veal Tenderloin. 

So here's the run down:

Creamy Polenta: Comes with a truffled mushroom sauce and this is by far the best Polenta I have ever had, it is just melt in your mouth goodness.

Raw Waygu Beef: This was the only dish of the night where we thought it was just "meh" as the true taste of waygu beef isn't brought out very well raw and the nuts and seasoning over power this flavorful meat.

Spaghetti: Magnificent and dense mountain of handmade pasta with the right hint of tomato and basil marinara sauce

Veal Tenderloin: Extremely tender pieces of meat and a dish that all guys (even gals) would truly enjoy.

Coconut Panna Cotta: This came recommended by our waiter and all I got to say is WOW. I'm usually not a huge dessert fan but this is one dish you can't pass up. 

I'm definitely a fan of the food and would disagree with a lot of the harsh critics out there. The service was impeccable and the tables are arranged with a lot of room in between so it's a very happening yet relaxed environment. My only complaints are its' lighting as it's pretty dark inside the restaurant, the hostesses in the front are sort of useless, and the seating is just ok as I started to get a bit uncomfortable near the end of dinner. If you had doubts before just go and try for yourself, I did and I'm certainly not disappointed.
This was the worst Italian meal I have had in a while.  The place has a chain restaurant feel to it, including the menu and food quality. Definitely one of the worst restaurants in Inglewood.

We decided to try a new restaurant in Las Vegas and I'm glad I did. This place has it all..the food, service, View and add a good bottle of wine with great company now that's the way to live. 

I ordered the west coast oysters which are fresh and so delicious and the black cod which is done to perfection. My friend had the spaghetti in which I tried and it was amazing. I'm not a spaghetti fan so that tells you a lot. I also noticed that they have gluten free options on the menu that is rare in las Vegas restaurants. I will definitely go back if the budget allows it.

Hidden on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan, Scarpetta is the place to visit to learn what really good pasta can be like.

As a pasta fiend, I am very picky when it comes to pasta.  Scarpetta has shown me another dimension to pasta that I must learn.  The minimalist approach where pasta is the star, and the sauce or other items are addendums.

Allow me to expound:

Signature Spaghetti: Normally a staple of the American diet, lifted from Italy, it is most commonly served with tomato, carbonara, or meat sauce. Since I make spaghetti at home, I always believed in what I thought I liked.  This dish showed me that a very simple, light sauce can accompany the pasta and "show it off" in a way that the pasta shines above the sauce.  A large portion is not required as the fresh pasta is rich and heavy.  The sauce is light, and delicately flavorful, allowing the pasta flavor to come out instead of being more of a "texture" experience.  When presented with this dish, one might think "Where is the sauce?", but when finished the response will be: "I didn't miss it"

Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli:  Again, simple in presentation and execution, the difference is in the details.  I normally don't like duck, and find foie gras to be overly rich and intense when served alone.  The blended filling, in just the right proportion to pasta was a grand pleasure and I will be looking or ANY excuse to have this dish again.  Again, the sauce is minimal at best and the dish relies on the pasta and filling almost entirely to achieve its goal.

Lesson Learned: Extravagant sauces are used to cover up mediocre pasta offerings

Appetizer Bonus: Creamy Polenta with Fricassee of Mushroom: This dish, served in a moderately small portion was a flavor and texture experience that reinforces the axiom that quality is small amounts is the most flavorful, and healthy for you experience.  Having watched its manufacture on the Food Channel, the secret is in the long prep.  Like tamahagane, it must be nurtured for hours (3) to achieve the complete assimilation of the polenta kernel into the dish, resulting in a creaminess of exceptional quality.

All in all, I learned the perception of the Minimalist, the discipline of the Stalwart, and the reminder that food is art in the presentation.

My most basic position:  I will look for ANY excuse to visit Scarpetta in the future.

Sundries:  As with any restaurant of this caliber, service was impeccable.  Even though I dined alone on several occasions, several people inquired as to my satisfaction each visit.  I cannot say enough.  As a lone diner, I felt as attended to as any other party and normally I can't stand eating alone as one tends to get treated like a pariah.  Not the case here!

Ahhh Scarpetta. I was really expecting the food to be so good, it jumped off the plate, but this was not the case for me. 

The restaurant is beautiful, good lighting, great view of the Bellagio fountains, but not as good as the Eiffel Tower restaurant at the Paris hotel. 

Atmosphere: 
I went with 3 girlfriends and I think the atmosphere was a little bit more subdued than we were hoping. It was a Thursday night, the restaurant was 1/2 empty and was very quiet/tame. We are used to the NYC dining scene, where top restaurants are packed and noisy and give an atmosphere of fun, which is more what we were expecting. 

Food:
-Bread was absolutely delicious! we ate two baskets :) 
-duck Foi gras ravioli: very good, but was a bit too al dente for my taste 
-steak: understanding this is not a steak restaurant, the steak was not flavorful at all. I would at least expect the steak to have some pizazz. 
-wine list: very extensive and reasonable range of prices to accommodate. 

Service: 
- it was good. nothing exceptional. the best service I have ever received is from a Tom Colicchio restaurant - I wish all high end places would follow suit!  

I would probably come back here to give it a second chance, but I am in no rush.

We came here our last night in Vegas celebrating our anniversary. We requested a table with a view of the fountains and we got a great, intimate table. The bread basket was out of this world. We started with the scallop dish as an appetizer, followed by the spaghetti with tomato sauce and duck and foie gras ravioli. The dishes were all amazing, and it was a great way to end our trip. It was one of the best meals I've ever had, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting who wants a special meal.

Yeah, so I can't really comment on other people's trouble with the service, but our experience at Scarpetta was excellent - we were seated right away, and enjoyed very attentive (if not too attentive) service the whole night
But the reason Scarpetta gets a 5 star rating from me is the food - it's incredible
The fact that various media outlets are giving it a 2.5 or even 3 star and suggesting it's not as good as Terroni is a total joke. It's without question in another league. The preparations are way more complex, and the flavours way more interesting
Toronto really doesn't have a restaurant in the same league at this point, perhaps Buca, but otherwise it'll take a trip down to NYC to visit one of Batali's amazing places to beat this one
Hopefully Mr. Conant finds some happier servers to deliver his amazing food to those lucky enough to get in (given all the complaining about how snooty the wait staff is - again, not my experience) because we should be happy we have a place of this calibre in this city, and hopefully more chefs will bring this type of inventive food to our great city!

This place is simply fantastic, from the customer service to the food. Reserved a table for the Saturday night of memorial day weekend. We had a group of 7 guys and they put us in a private room that had a glass wall separating us from the kitchen, so we got to watch the chefs the entire night. We also had a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountain. The waiter was attentive, but not over-bearing and the sommelier's recommendation were very on spot. 

The food was fantastic. I highly recommend the wagyu tar-tar as an appetizer. Pasta and meats were all cooked perfectly. And for Vegas, the prices are very reasonable. A great experience all around. I highly recommend it.

Came here for happy hour 5:30-7pm at the bar. The restaurant is located right next to D.O.C.G. with a large copper door, but minimal signage so it might be confusing to new guests. I came a little before 5pm when Scarpetta was still closed, and saw a couple of folks wander in to D.O.C.G. by mistake. Service was great, food was excellent. All the happy hour menu items are $7 (albeit small plates)! I had the duck & fois gras ravioli, short rib/bone marrow angnolotti, and pork belly all super great, rich and delicious! Washed it down with a glass of red. As typical with many restaurants here, some food items don't come out until 6pm due to kitchen prep time. Would definitely return.

Disappointed...that's the best way to describe my experience at the much hyped Scarpetta, at the beautiful Cosmopolitan Hotel.  Our group of four shared several appetizers, entrees and deserts, but none were memorable.  Portion sizes were very small, and way over priced.  Of the starters, the thimble of steak tartare was tasty, but was only served with three slivers of garlic toast, so one of us got short changed.  The oysters and polenta were mediocre at best.  Our entrees included the signature tomato and basil spaghetti, a short rib filled pasta, and a carbonara style squid ink pasta that was very bland.  None of the main dishes were served very hot, and cooled quickly as we transferred them to our plates.  The deserts were undoubtedly the best part of the meal. The lava style chocolate cake, and the sugar coated donuts were a hit.  The cheesecake had a sour aftertaste.  Service was excellent at Scarpetta, as we were attended to by a flurry of servers.  Unfortunately, good service is not enough to bring me back next time.  If you are in Vegas and want to try a new restaurant, go somewhere else, but stop by the Cosmopolitan to check out the hotel and enjoy a drink in one of the many beautiful lounges.

3.5 stars.

I had:
Polenta with mushrooms
Spaghetti with basil
Braised lentils
Gingerbread pear crisp and choc cake

Polenta with mushrooms --- MUST get . 5 stars. Truly outstanding.

Spaghetti with basil --- lots of hype. Yes, it is good. $24 good? Not sure. Pasta is fresh and flavorful, but this is still not a WOW dish for me as other Yelpers seem to classify this.

Braised lentils --- boring dish, nothing special or unique here, made me annoyed with myself that I ordered this given my gut told me it wouldn't be that great. 

Gingerbread pear crisp and choc cake --- both good, but nothing special, creative, or unique here. Standard dessert fare for a nicer restaurant.

Did not live up to the hype. Look it's good. But $75 a person for 3 courses good? Nope.

I own a restaurant so five stars are not easy for me to give!  Great views of the strip and the water show but how 'bout the food?

After doing the math, we decided to go with the wine and food pairing dinner fat $85. for the food and $45. for the wine (about six courses).  If you order off the menu and consider appitizer, entree, dessert and wine, this is at least a push if not a better deal.

Waiter seconded our decision as a good deal and the night began!  Each course of food was presented with a different wine with a short explanation of each.  The flavors were described both before trying the wine with the food and what we should expect after trying it with the food.

The entire meal lasted about two hours and each dish was unique in both presentation and flavor.  If anything, we'd suggest maybe some sorbet between one or two courses for cleansing and maybe take just a little bit more time.  Five or six (we can't remember because even with about a 3 oz serving of wine, that's a lot of grape to consume!) is courses is a bunch of food and even at two hours, it was a lttile bit rushed.

Waiter was very nice, buss service great.  Lot's of corporate types having dinner, I would like to have seen management pay more attention to the guests and the somm never said hello although he was paying tons of attention to an apparient high roller next to us.

All-in-all I would recommend this place to anyone who will listen and also our stay at the Cosmopolitan was fantastic!  Very cool place, great bars, wonderful pools.  Do yourself a favor and rent a cabana, #5 is the best one to get.

Enjoy!

I am extremely weary of eating in italian restaurants because so many places dont do it well. There is nothing more disappointing than getting a pasta dish done poorly. This place is my favorite restaurant in Vegas.  Spaghetti is worth it.  Polenta is so good although overpriced. Duck ravioli is good. Almost everything on the menu is good. Service is good and its a very nice setting.  Would come back....many times!
One of the most authentic Italian restaurants in the states.  Not a fan of the Cosmopolitan Hotel, but Scarpetta e veramente delizioso.

Went there for business dinner last night and the seafood (Halibut) and view were fantastic. Jenny, our server was fantastic and we never needed to ask for refills. Only reason this review is getting 4 out of 5 stars is the noise level. You had to lean into the conversation and the lights were flickering sometime despite normal weather. 
Overall I will recommend the food and service!

Meh!  I have several criteria for good Italian cuisine.  Firstly, it has to taste good.  That being said, everyone has a different take on what "good" means.  That is the basis for this discussion.  Although the flavors were savory, there was a lack of complexity.  Expectations for me were also HIGH since this place is expensive.  When you start with high expectations, you are bound to be disappointed.  The signature spaghetti was flavorful, but not out of this world, but again a personal opinion.  The veal was good.  Was it worth the cost? Not in my opinion.  If you take all of the dishes and drop the price by 50%, then it becomes a good Italian restaurant.

Went here this week for a Summerlicious menu and really enjoyed ourselves.

The ambience was very nice - just the appropriate fancy and an easy place to LOL and have a great time with a bunch of girlfriends.

Much to our surprise the portions were generous and filling. The food overall was delicious and the service was qucik and friendly. 

We tried almost everything on the summerlicious menu.
For starters:
Tried the creamy polenta - it was divine.
The braised ribs of beef was nice and tender over a great bed of seasonal risotto - delic!

For mains:
The trout with veggies - it was very tender and beautifully cooked.
The ogranic chicken was unbelievably delicous - i almost wish i had ordered that over the chicken

For dessert:
we tried all the desserts - the chocolate was the best and the lemony dessert was not that great at all

overall, great summerlicious experience!

From start to finish, the best meal that my wife and I have ever had in our lives! Highly recommend that you do The Tasting Menu with The Italian Wine Pairings!  In particular, The Spaghetti was amazing!  Our Waiter Sato was outstanding!  Scott Conant is a genious; saw him at the bar as we came at 6:30pm on 6/30/15 but he was busy. My wife Dawn and I just want to tell him that it was the best experience that we ever had dining in our lives; thanks!

I have been to Cinquecento a number of times.  From the pasta dishes to the meat and seafood plates, the food was always excellent.  Service is consistently friendly and prompt.  The decor is a harmonious blend of modern chic and old world rustic charm.  As an added special treat, on the weekend, enjoy romantic classical guitar performers or dj music.  

Cinquecento is definitely a place for not just tasty food, but for a great experience!

It's-a nice-a! Spiceh meat-a ball-a! *De Niro face*

Now that I've got THAT out of the way, let's talk business here. I'm lingering somewhere betwixt a 3 and a 4 on this one -  but the weird thing is, I've got all positive things to say. But at the end of it all, I just didn't feel an overall enthusiasm towards the place. It's like in the dating world - a person can look good on paper, but sometimes you just don't feel that THING. Well I'm sorry to say, Scarpetta... it's not you, it's me.

The service was splendid; despite having a fafillion hosts/servers/sommeliers/kitchen dudes lingering about at all times, it was never invasive. I'm not used to dealing with sommeliers, so it was hilarious to me that as soon as Tara A started eyeing the wine list, he was creeping up from behind to offer suggestions. And then once he poured the wine, he took it away. Is that a fancy sommelier thing?! "NO. ONLY I MUST POUR THE WINE." I'm sorry, I'm only accustomed to eating at brunch spots. This is all new to me. Not that I minded it - I liked having him be the master of all wine. 

Our servers were deee-lightful and very accommodating. Speaking of accommodating, they have a separate Vegetarian menu! POINTS!! I ordered the Bibb lettuce and Braised Lentils with Rosemary. The salad was meh - I mean, not a cost-effective selection. The lentils were KILLER! Such flavour! Such sassiness! Topped with kale and sun-dried tomato, mama mia!! I tried a bite of my friend's house-made spaghetti with a FACE SLAP of basil - SO. GOOD. I'm telling you: when that plate comes, you're like, "come on. I could eat twice that amount." But nobody at our table finished their spaghetti, cause it was crazy filling.  

I asked for my lentil-y leftovers to go (about 1/3 of a cup) and the lady brought them back in a giant, Whole Foods-sized paper bag. So comical!! 

When the next reservation was waiting for our table, the hostess moved us out to the lounge and brought free glasses of Prosecco (I just typed 'prosexxo'.) Nice touch, and delicious. The lounge is a fab place to sit if you like feeling fancy, free candied almonds, watching dolled-up ladies mack on rich men and some chairs that serve fashion over function. I wouldn't mind hitting up the Thompson every once in awhile - it's very chic, and I think a terrific idea to include 3 eating establishments.

I was very excited to dine here and left feeling like I'd had a really good, not necessarily memorable meal. The best part was the gluten-free menu; that is always easier than "I don't know, let me check with the kitchen.". 

We were seated next to the bus station in spite of having a reservation, and there was a table by the window open the entire time we were there. 

The service was excellent, attentive, not obtrusive.

Wines by the glass were good, but as another reviewer mentioned, overpriced.

The food was very good. I had the spaghetti with tomatoes and basil, which many reviews mentioned as "amazing". I have a very similar recipe at home that I enjoy equally. The creamy polenta with mushrooms was a great starter. Everyone else enjoyed their meals.

My husband ordered a flourless chocolate cake, which he practically inhaled. There were closed eyes and moans of pleasure with each bite.

Came here based on Yelp reviews.  The food was delicious. The service, not so much. Homemade pasta melts in your mouth.  Thumbs up on the short rib pasta.  Unfortunately, Roberto, our server, was not very attentive to us once the food came.  Had to flag down a bus boy to get our check.  Decided not to give him any more business.  Went across the street to Mon Ami Gabi for my favorite Bananas Foster. Ordered but never received my cappuccino. Guess it wasn't our night for good service.  That is a discussion unto itself.

If you want something more unique than DOCG then come here.

Helpful staff, clean environment.  I was surprised that there was only one stall for this place.  They have an extensive wine menu.

Their bread and their dipping sauces for it were delicious. 

Raw yellowtail was delicious!

Also ordered the
Tuna susci not bad but I would have ordered another raw yellow tail instead of this
Taglitelle 
spaghetti
Stracci 

If I could order one of those 3 pastas again I would pick the simple and very impressive spaghetti.  it's not just your ordinary tomato with basil spaghetti. 


The guava sobert type of dessert was amazingly delicious!  A great surprise for the end.

I have dined at the Thompson Hotel's Scarpetta on several occassions and have found both the food and the service to be fantastic upon every visit.  The staff is always very friendly from the moment you check in with the hostess, and they are extremely attentive throughout the whole dining experience.  In fact I don't think I've been to a restaurant in the city in which the staff has checked in so much with regards to additional needs, as well as asking about how the service is - and not in an annoying way, but more so in a genuine way which really makes you feel like a special guest.

Of all the items on the menu, my absolute favourite is the 'creamy polenta with fricasse of truffled mushrooms'.  The polenta has a very smooth and creamy texture and is absolutely delicious and melts in your mouth.  The presentation of the dish as well as the pampered feeling you get when the waiter spoons the truffled mushrooms into the polenta really makes for a great dining experience.  It's definitely a must, and the appetizer is of a size that it could be shared amongst two people - although I'm not sure if you will want to share after you take your first bite!

The restaurant also offers a variety of delectable pastas of which you can tell from the first morsel that they are all made fresh in the kitchen.  I especially enjoy the 'agnolotti dal plin', which is similar to a ravioli with short rib, bone marrow, horseradish and brown butter inside, as well as the 'duck and foie gras ravioli'.  Although I'm not usually one to order spaghetti in a restaurant, Scarpetta's spaghetti with tomato and basil is like no other - don't be fooled by the size of the dish as it is extremely rich with deep flavour, and is overall quite filling.

There is also a vast selection of meat dishes, including chicken, venison, pork and duck, as well as halibut and black cod.  I have tried the roasted organic chicken, which comes with cauliflower, cippoline and noodles, and found it to be savoury and well-prepared.  

Overall, it is no secret that Scarpetta really takes pride in what it does by paying attention to each and every detail from the presentation of its eye-catching dishes to the rich flavours of its food, not to mention its top notch service.  The bright dining room with floor to ceiling windows also helps create an inviting ambiance which makes you feel at home and want to hang around for hours.  Job well done Scarpetta - until next time!

We ate there last night with our friends, and we loved everything.  Without getting into specifics, some highlights were the Short rib Angolotti and the Raviolini. The tomato basil pasta is not to be missed. Service was excellent as was the ambiance. This place is not to be missed.
Probably one of the best italian restaurant in Vegas. We are a fan of the black linguinis and the strawberry souffle. Service is excellent and you cannot beat the view.

After making a reservation to dine here with a group of 10 co-workers during the NAB show, we got a call that the restaurant had been bought out and we would not be able to eat at Scarpetta. We were very disappointed, to say the least.

After some back and forth, the restaurant offered to have us to dine at DOCG (their casual restaurant next door) but order from the Scarpetta menu. Not only that, but since it was their error, they said they would comp the food and we would just pay for our wine and other drinks. We were skeptical about the level of food they would offer, but frankly the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.

They cheerfully brought us generous samplings from their appetizer and pasta menus and then we each chose an entree. Then they brought several selections from the dessert menu to finish. Dishes were uniformly delicious, and the wine service from Noe and the staff was first rate with a number of fantastic suggestions. 

Our entire team went home happy and the restaurant honored their offer to make us whole. 

We will definitely return the next time a trade show brings us to Vegas and I will seek out the Beverly Hills location, too. Great job, Scarpetta.

We had a party of 11 that stopped in Las Vegas for a short stop and chose the restaurant based on reviews and hype on Yelp.  As you can tell from the number of stars we were less than enthralled  with the food but especially the service.  To start, Two of the appetizers were served cold and on the main course one filet was overlooked and one meal for some reason didn't arrive until almost everyone was finished with their meals

At no time did anyone even come over to ask how the meal was.  Given the owners background and supposed attention to detail it was a total disappointment.   In a town with so many choices Scott conant and Scarpetta have been "chopped " from my list of places to go.

Phenomenal.

I was concerned that the famed $24 Spaghetti would be over-hyped, but it was amazing.

I dined at B&B the night before, and was disappointed that they pointed me towards the veggie sides to make my 'entree'.

Scarpetta has a whole menu dedicated to vegetarians - a touch especially appreciated on the Strip.

I booked on OpenTable, specifying that I was veg and that we had a 7pm show to get to (the restaurant opens at 5:30pm).

They had us in and out at lightening speed, and the food was fantastic. Do not miss the mushroom polenta - truffles, vegetable stock, creamy polenta.. the dish is fantastic.

The sommelier made excellent recommendations based off of our meal choices. 

My meat-eating Dad LOVED the salami bread. I was even more enamored by the fact they brought out a separate (meat-free) basket for me to indulge on.

Best meal in Vegas, with fabulous service to boot. It doesn't hurt that you have a great view of the Bellagio water fountains, either.

I know this is an Italian restaurant and we really came here for the spaghetti BUT what blew me away was the bread basket. Yes, something as simple as a bread basket was quite possibly the highlight of our meals. 

I went with 2 girlfriends and decided on one duck and foie gras ravioli, one spaghetti, and one tagliatelle for our meals and a polenta with mushroom fricasee to share. So we're waiting for our food and they bring out the bread basket and some butter, olive oil, and eggplant tapenade. Ok, pretty standard. But once we opened up that napkin, we were pleasantly surprised with stromboli, rosemary bread, and biscuits piping hot from the oven! The stromboli was a perfect blend of crispy outside and soft buttery inside, with the salami and cheese adding the perfect amount of salt. If that wasn't good enough, the rosemary bread. WOW. I absolutely love rosemary though so I may be biased. Anyway, we asked for another basket of bread and polished that one off long before our appetizer even touched down on the table. 

To start, we ordered the polenta with mushrooms and our server told us it was just a small bite meant for one person, but the 3 of us were able to share it without wanting more. At this point we were already getting full! Finally our entrees came and everything was on point. The rich duck/foie gras ravioli, the clean but complicated flavors of the spaghetti, and the fresh, crisp spring veggie tagliatelle. Amazing. You really can't beat fresh pasta. I paired my meal with their pinot noir which was a great complement but I barely even remembered to drink it because I was so enamored with the food. Next time, I may try not to eat as much bread...oh who am I kidding. It's too good!

The restaurant is located at the beautiful spot. The ambience matches the awesome location. Be sure to ask for a window seat overlooking the Bellagio foundations for a breathtaking view while dining. 

Their food is delicious. The complimentary bread basket comes with a variety of bread, is fresh, warm, also comes with accompaniments. The tomato basil spaghetti was well made. Service was quick and the pasta was cooked to perfection, the spaghetti was sturdy, sauce was creamy with a hint of Basil. The presentation was impeccable. 

I topped it off with the chocolate cake. This was a little disappointing and hence the 4 stars. It was tough and cumbly.
Had the filet. Great service. Nice atmosphere. Great view. Affordable for an upscale restaurant on the strip. Highly recommend for a nice restaurant without having to spend a fortune.

Love Scarpetta!  Snake river rib cap is a must... not to mention you can go up the the chandelier bar and get some great cocktails pre and post.  We brought a baby and it was totally cool. Can't wait to go back...

Came here on Sunday night for my husband's birthday and it was phenomenal!  The service was outstanding, the food was amazing, and the wine was delicious!  I also want to compliment the lighting and overall ambiance in this place.  I know that's a weird thing to make note of, but it drives me crazy when there is a fab restaurant with crap lighting.  This place killed it in that department -- it was warm, cozy, and romantic (but it's also a great group spot -- there were tons of groups dining while we were there).

The sommelier helped us choose the perfect wine that was within our budget.  It was super earthy, full bodied, and reminded me of being in Italy!  

We had the duck and foie ravioli, the black seafood pasta, and the veal and all were outstanding!  I would absolutely eat here again in the future.
Food was Above average. Ambience was nice. Desert was great! Recommend it. Definitely a birthday dinner spot!

So had an excellent experience here over a year ago, so came back with my brother and his wife expecting the same thing.

Service: excellent, they were on it and very helpful

View: excellent

Food: so complete mixed bag... 

*got the lobster appetizer... it was adequate, but really not terribly good and REALLY not worth the price

*bread basket was great

*aged steak... complete waste of money.  It wasn't ruined, but ive gotten similar or better steaks at mom and pop shops for 1/5 the price... not terribly good and really overpriced... cooked fine

*spaghetti and basil - still a rock star dish, even though its pretty plain

I am less than impressed than anything beyond the most basic dish is pretty mediocre, probably wouldnt recommend unless I only suggested the spaghetti and basil

Bread was good, Caponata very salty. Lardon wrapped shrimp tasty, although lentils overcooked (or maybe they wanted mash, either way not great). Polenta was super creamy, and the food runner said  he was topping with truffles, while menu said mushroom fricassee. Either way it was soupy. We had asked about a greens type salad and the server said that a Caesar was an option. Dressing was great, but there was too much. Croutons were at least a week old, stale and gross. The pasta which we were most excited about was not al dente, as promised. The ragu was good, but the dish was just a bowl of noodle mush. Brussels sprouts cooked well, but were missing the promised sage pesto and the walnuts. Also I don't believe they seasoned them. We left them uneaten. Gelato-lemongrass was fine but bland, almond was icy as f. Seems like these acclaimed chefs can't control quality like they do at their flagship locations. Vegas is like the red headed step child. Scott Contant can give brutal critiques on chopped, but he may need to take some of his own advice.
What an incredible restaurant. Definitely come here when you come to Vegas. I sampled the entire menu and there was not a single dish that wasn't incredible. The staff is friendly and curious.

had romantic dinner with the wife. 
we felt over all the place was very good. dinner was nice. location is great. we had couple of drinks before at the bar just outside the restaurant at hotel lobby which were expensive but lots of fun (over $60+ for two drinks each!)

for wise, we had to start the firtto misto, the braised beef and the creamy palenta.
the last two were very good, super nicely presented and very tasty.

with the fritto misto we had huge issues. we take this dish often all over the place and this one must have been way way worse. to start it was 90% vegis that where all cut way too small and where way over cooked...hence they were all falling a part and very oily. we manage to find 2 pieces of squid and 5 or 6 little pieces of shrimp (i.e like 2 shrimps in total cut in 3 pieces each). proportion was way off...should be more like 30% squid, 30% shrimp and 30% veg.....the other 10% is usually some other fish of the day which is always nice to find as well
restaurant people - if you are reading this please please change and improve as it was very disappointing!

for main dish we went with the classic pasta the place was famous for and with bass fish. both were very good. fish was amazing. pasta was good. had to take the pasta cause it was feature on show best thing i ever ate. it was just good but not best pasta i ever had at all. advice would be to skip and try other awesome dish they surly had

we had 2 great desserts. cheese cake and chocolate cake with coffee ice cream both were great (chocolate cake and ice cream was exceptional!)

all in all with 2 drinks the total was some what expensive but we had a great evening.
all the food was very good to amazing! perhaps skip the simple pasta or try another more special sauce but every other dish was amazing with the exception of the fritto misto which was a total disaster!

the only other comment i can make which is not a real comment is that the portions where all a little on the small size. i actually know this is normal in fine dinning places and i have no real issue, however we are certain that if another chef would be serving this portions to the owner on "chopped" tv show - there is no doubt scott would say over and over as he usually does.....this is not an appetizer portion size....i wish i had more fish etc etc
we were only hoping he will put a little more of his profits where his mouth is - fyi scott :-)

but a defiantly 4 start and a huge thumps up for a special occasion places.

service and staff were real great!
Scarpetta was amazing.  We enjoyed the tasting menu, which was quite a culinary tour.  Seasonal vegetables were well integrated into the menu.  Service was impeccable.

Came here for dinner because of the hype. We had a great seat with the bellagio fountain view. (Make sure you ask for that when you make the reservations) thy bring you unlimited variety of breads which were delish. For appetizers the chef made a special dish with foie gras which wasn't part if their menu and it was really good. We also got the yellowtail which was not fishy, and fresh. However when it came to the main course. It wasn't too satisfying. We got the filet mignon which was ok but not enough taste to it and short ribs didnt meet my expectations. However the strawberry soufflé was OUT OF THIS WORLD. BEST SOUFFLÉ EVER!! That's why I have them four stars.

This is a 5 star restaurant by any standard, in any city. The reviewers will tell you to order the spaghetti. The waiters will tell you to order the spaghetti. I know what you're thinking - "spaghetti? Really?" Seriously. Order the spaghetti. You won't regret it!

I generally don't eat out at very many fancy places.  This is about as fancy as I get.  I came here with a bunch of colleagues from work, and one of the people in my dinner party was a well-to-do doctor who eats here often and knows everyone at the restaurant.  This is an awesome restaurant.  The view outside the panoramic window overlooks the fountains at Bellagio.  It's an amazing view!  I had multiple appetizers shared among my party, a pasta dish as an entree, and several desserts.  Everything was perfect.  I didn't get a chance to look at the bill, but I'm sure it was substantial.  Like several hundred dollars.  But it was worth the experience.

Look - I'm going to keep this as simple as I can. 

I'm astute in the world of culinary arts and have a high appreciation for an incredible meal and the impact that good service and ambiance can have on an evening out.  I also enjoy basic Italian comfort food at times and that's what I happened to be craving on this particular occasion. I found the best of both worlds at Scott Conant's Las Vegas masterpiece. With that being said... We had a slight misunderstanding when we arrived regarding the reservation and our seating preference. The manager was professional enough to minimize any anxieties and made sure we felt that it would be worked out immediately. She sat my wife and I at the bar and proceeded to make us two complimentary cocktails - herself! They were outstanding BTW.  We were seated at the window and enjoyed the Bellagio water show in the backdrop.  The food... it was absolutely the most incredible dinning experience I have had in the last 10 years. We had some of everything on the menu...  It was the equivalent to exquisite gourmet comfort food porn. The wine list is stellar and the service I received was impeccable and personable.  Our server was outstanding - DO NOT believe any negative hype about this restaurant. This is a must for anyone wanting to venture and try something new - Scarpetta will not disappoint.

The faro risotto was outstanding however the white truffle pasta was... Ok, I don't eat truffle very often but cook with it somewhat regularly and the flavor was underwhelming. Great service! The more a drank the water the fuller the glass was! And that never happens

We visited Scarpetta during Summerlicious this year.The polenta is incredible so creamy and delicious. I had the Heritage Pork Chop and it was so good. For dessert, I had Amedei Chocolate Cake. 

We blogged about our dinner:

http://tipsareincluded.blogspot.ca/2012/07/scarpetta-toronto.html

It was an unbelievable dinner. We even had a table side visit from Chef Hunter.

What a great place! We dined with another couple, who had been here before, and raved about it.  We couldn't agree with them more.
