Our table had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains -- request that if you can. The ambiance as a whole was quite wonderful -- contemporary and elegant, but still warm and inviting.  Our server was very knowledgeable and gave excellent suggestions when we asked for them. Food was outstanding; we ordered different dishes and shared. The polenta, ravioli, scallops and duck received high marks by all. We would not at all hesitate to recommend or return here.

I have been to Scarpetta twice now... and while the food is fine, for some reason this place is very lackluster to me. The first time I went I was unimpressed but then I wanted the give it a second chance and was still not very impressed. With all the amazing Italian restaurants in Vegas, you can do better. 

I love old school Italian food and all the pizzaz from the other Italian restaurants on the strip. Scarpetta is modern and minimal but the decor is nothing special. If you don't visit Vegas often and have not been to many Italian restaurants here this place seems great. I will say that on a positive note, yes the view is nice but you can get a better view at most of the other restaurants especially in the Bellagio. The pasta is also really great and fresh but overall the restaurant just lacks something.
Steak and pasta were flawless.  wine recommendation was spot on.  You will drop a few bills here, but the quality of the food delivers the value.

One of the best meals I've ever had in Vegas or in Italy. The creamy polenta and tomato and mozzarella salad were delightful starters and really set the tone for the meal.  The star was the Pici ..... Lobster with handmade tarragon infused pasta. It was a wonderful balance of richness with just a hint of spice to keep it interesting. This review would be remiss if I failed to mention the expert service. We had knowledgeable, pleasant and attentive servers. Thank you for a wonderful experience. We'll definitely be back.
Amazing food, ambiance, and service! Fantastic view of the fountain in front of the Bellagio as well!
View is amazing, service top notch, food is innovative and fresh. Pasta is to die for! Must try this location for a nice view of Bellagio and for spaghetti!

I came for my birthday dinner on the 16th of January with a large group and it was amazing!!!!!! I can stop talking about the cocktails, the entrees, the pasta, the duck, and the desserts. The service was OUTSTANDING. This has now become my go to restaurant in Las Vegas.
Very modern and chic italian restaurant. Nice ambiance, good lighting and fabulous view overlooking the Bellagio fountains so be sure to request a window seat! Food is delicious and fresh!

My absolute favorite Italian restaurant on the strip! They are known for their homemade spaghetti and it's absolutely the best dish on the menu. I usually don't go out for Italian since my family makes homemade pasta but Scarpetta always exceeds my expectations. Also there's a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains.
Pasta w basil was decent. Good panna cotta.

Had high expectation for this place since it's Scott Conant's place(watching him being so critical of others cooking), but dining experience with the waiter from hell and cold food leaves a bad taste all together.. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT..
Scarpetta was so amazing and the spaghetti was as good as everyone says.  Great service and atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Excellent Italian meal.  Food was fenaminal, from the pastas to the steak, desserts &  the Mikes Hot Honey tequila Margarita's to die for. Great ambiance. Highly recommend.  Thank you, will seen you again.

Food was YUMMY. We had the steak tartare and the sirloin special.

They must have killed the cow in the kitchen as soon as we ordered because it was FRESH. We ordered medium rare and it was succulent, juicy, and ORGASMIC.

But perhaps the best part of the dining experience (aside from my date) would be the staff. The staff truly makes the dining experience and we felt utterly pampered. Honestly, they would have fed us by hand had we asked. 

The dinner bread was FANTASTIC. I totally nom nom'd on a lot of carbs tonight.

Thank you Christian and the staff tonight for a wonderful dining experience. We will most certainly return :) :) :)

What an amazing view of the Bellagio hotel. This restaurant is so nice and very romantic with its dimmed lights and wonderful view of the fountain.

Our waiter was very nice and had tons of information to give us about every item we ordered. I enjoyed my meal here and the service was great. I will visit again.
Sincere attention not found in most Casino restaurants.... Food is a dramatic step upon gourmet chain.,,,wine list rivals all others.... View of Bellagio is fantastic

When it came time to celebrate my 32nd birthday, Scarpetta, it was. I made 5:30 reservations on Opentable.

We were the first diners of the evening, we were seated at a table for two overlooking the Bellagio fountains. However, when the fountain show actually began the we realized the view was quite obstructed from the tall trees surrounding the lake. It was no bother, we didn't come for the view, we were there for the food. 
 
We started with a delicious bread basket, it had a variety of Italian breads and the real treat was stromboli with prosciutto and smoked mozzarella. Citrus olive oil, butter with marscapone and eggplant & tomatoes accompanied the bread. I could've easily made a meal from this, but I ordered the creamy polenta to whet our appetite.

I've heard nothing but praises for this polenta. It was a beautiful dish. Luscious and full of truffle flavor, but it didn't leave me wanting more. 

Next, we opted to skip the entrees and order selections from the secondini portion of the meal. Frank went with the Signature spaghetti. It's been featured on "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" so it's hard to pass it up. I went with the duck and foie gras ravioli. It was the dish that made me lust over the restaurant for the past year. 

The ravioli did not disappoint. It was the second best ravioli I've had to date. Mama Egi's ravioli over at Circo takes the cake. But this was very, very good. Well balanced and the raviolis seemed to melt on your tongue. The spaghetti was good, but hardly a best thing I ever ate. I enjoyed the simplicity of it, the al dente noodle, but $26 spaghetti should knock my socks off, it did not. 

We weren't overly stuffed so we took a gander at the dessert menu and quickly chose zeppole for dessert.

Now, this was special! I'm not fond of dessert oozing with sweetness. This bordered on savory and I love it. These little pillowy bites were filled with nutella and topped with candied hazelnuts. There was a creme anglaise for dipping. It was a perfect end to the meal. 

Service was very good throughout. Our server, Luis, was helpful and he made certain we did not go thirsty. Fresh iced teas were plentiful. The meal set us back $92. Pretty good considering one could easily spend an arm and leg here.

Excellent. It was a great way to start our Vegas trip. Arrived for a late dinner, seated in lounge (still nice). Server very helpful with excellent recommendations. Primi piatti octopus was so good. Scallops very good as well. Artic char cooked perfectly. Husband had the stracci and was the most perfect pasta dish. Was pleasantly pleased with this find.

This is an awesome place. We always come to Vegas and this place is pure class. Phenomenal food and fantastic staff. Allie and Kyle took care of us. Absolutely flawless service and impeccable knowledge of the menu. Thanks for having us!

Food was excellent.

My wife and I spent a couple of days in Vegas recently and based on the other reviews, decided to try Scarpetta.  Despite showing up almost 45 minutes before our reservation time, the maître d' found a table for us quickly, fulfilling our request for a quiet table as we were celebrating a special occasion.  We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains.

Service was excellent as well.  Unlike our dinner at a different restaurant the next night, we weren't constantly interrupted by an over eager waiter.  Our needs were met at the appropriate time but we were allowed the time to enjoy our meals.  Our waiter's recommendation of the Spaghetti was spot on, the house made pasta was perfect, and my wife loved the tagliatelle.

Next time we're in Vegas we'll definitely be going back.

Place was solid but it would really like to five it 3.5 stars because of the cleanliness of the bathrooms. Doors were busted and place was a mess. Food was good although a little overpriced but hey it's vegas! Had the foie gras ravioli and polenta with mushrooms

I cant speak for others but the one time i went with a part of 7 we had immaculate service with the finest italian food i have experienced in Toronto.

Absolutely delicious, a little on the pricey side? yes.. but if thats not an issue then go go go..

Sexy restaurant nestled in the cosmopolitan hotel over looking the Bellagio fountains.  Sophisticated flavors and thoughtful presentation...loved the Pici, Classic Spaghetti, Short Ribs, and Heirloom Tomatoes...the bread basket and accoutrements are to die for...most of all...thank you Jonathan for your impeccable service!

Had an amazing dinner Monday night.  We did the tasting menu ($110 per person), and we were not disappointed!  My favorite was the duck. . Tender, juicy, perfectly seasoned. Oh and the short rib agnolotti AMAZING! There was a substitution on the fish with a fish sauce that neither of us ate (way to fishy), but they gave us a wine paring to off set,  and it didn't take away from the meal.. great service,  great atmosphere  (ask for a window table ) and sit back and enjoy. ..! Oh,  and our Somalia was outstanding. ..

We had a wine pairing dinner this evening.  We have had them in California and NY, Philly, and Miami.  I was looking forward to tonight's dinner but it pains me to say it was really not very good.  1/2 the time the waiters either barely mentioned either the food choice or the wine pairing.   When asked they were barely able to name the wine or the reason for the pairing.  Severely disappointed overall.  I will give credit to the waiter however.  After about the 3rd or 4th pairing he started sharing his choices for wines and they were better than the choices on the list by far.  I hate ever giving bad reviews, but this one was bad overall.  Sorry

The ambiance and view of the las vegas strip was amazing! I've tasted so many different spaghettis and the only spaghetti that I've ever liked is my moms and the one at scarpetta. The sauce was just a perfect taste. My sister had the duck foie gras ravioli and my other sister had the Short Rib and Bone Marrow Agnolotti which both dishes were amazing. The food came out in less than ten minutes. The waiters were very attentive.

The bread basket alone would bring me back! That stromboli is amazing! I love salami and bread, so put the two together.....FUGGETABOUTIT!

We had the tasting menu: 

- Duo of Yellowtail and Tuna "Susci": melt in your mouth delicious!

- Roasted Sea Scallops, Cauliflower, Bottarga, Chili and Caper Salmoriglio: Sea scallops can be rubbery and chewy if not cooked properly, but at Scarpetta, they were cooked to perfection. They had the consistency of flaky, firm fish and the roasted cauliflower was a perfect pairing.

- Spagetti Tomato Basil - simple and good, but not memorable.

- Black Cod, Caramelized Fennel & Concentrated Tomatoes - The fish was nice and flakey and the tomatoes added a nice acidity to the fish. I'm not a fan of fennel as they are too "licorice-y" in flavor for my taste.

- Spiced Duck Breast, Endive, Preserved Orange and Cippollini - DELICIOUS! I love duck, but I hate when its not cooked properly or tastes overly fatty. This was a perfect balance. The preserved orange cut through the richness of the duck. Yum!

- Amedei Chocolate Cake & Toasted Almond Gelato - Toasted almond gelato & salted caramel sauce. SELF EXPLANATORY....IT WAS HEAVEN!

What made this experience special was that the chef brought out a few mini appetizers with every dish served, so it was like having an "extended" tasting menu. He brought out:

- CRISPY FRITTO MISTO - seafood, vegetables, artichokes, herbs & lemon
- CREAMY POLENTA - fricassee of truffled mushrooms: By far my favorite dish at Scarpetta. Upon first glance, it looks like it would be too heavy and rich, but it was AMAZING!
- SHORT RIB AGNOLOTTI - brown butter horseradish & toasted breadcrumb.
- ZEPPOLE - nutella center, vanilla sauce and candied hazelnuts. Need I say more?

I loved the ambiance and service of this restaurant. We were seated by the window facing the fountains of Bellagio. A beautiful place to take someone on a date!

Wow. W-O-W. I live in LA and never been to Scarpetta here. My first experience was in Vegas. Wow. Oops I said it again but it deserves another wow. We were a group of 13 girls and every single one of us raved about the food, service & experience. We had a long big table in the back in a private section of the restaurant. Our waiter was so gracious and patient (again we were 13 girls...). He made sure to explain the different dishes and suggested what he said were the favorites. Before our food came, the bread arrived. I think I would have still given the place 5 stars based on the bread. The salami cheese bread. Holy moly. SOOOO delicious. We shared a bunch of starters. The creamy polenta-to die for. You must order it if you only order one starter. The scallops were also so tasty & yummy. I tried most of the pasta dishes. The short rib agniolotti (sp?) very good with these delicious little horseradish crispies on top. The duck foie gras ravioli were also so good (definitely on the rich side). The spaghetti was great too but not my favorite i've ever had. The seafood pasta also was great. Now onto the desserts. You must you must you must order the caramel creme brulee. Amaaaazing. And the nutella little donuts were great too. I am definitely headed soon to the Scarpetta here!

Pricey but worth every penny.

The simplest dish at this place is the best:  spaghetti with tomato and basil.  It's life-altering, perfection itself, delicious, amazing, spectacular, love it, want it, dream about it, miss it!!

Great good, great feel, great service.

Our evening at Scarpetta was a late one, with dinner reservations at 9:30, I was expecting a rushed and lackluster performance. However, my prediction was soon proven wrong.

We arrived and were seated immediately in a comfy booth facing the windows. Our server quickly came to our table with bottled water and began to introduce himself and the restaurant to us. His delivery was smooth and made us feel welcome.

He took our wine orders, brought out the vino and listed off the specialties of the house for the evening. Soon after departing, a waiter came to our table and delivered the first batch of goodies. A basket of treats with artisan baked focaccia, bread with salami and oozing cheese baked right in and a selection of dipping sauces. We quickly devoured one of each and were in carb heaven.

When our waiter returned we put in our main course order of their famous spaghetti and the Short Rib agnolotti. He refilled our wine shortly thereafter and let us enjoy some conversation and spectating.  This place was buzzing at 10pm with eye candy and low-lit cool vibes.

Finally, our main courses arrived. The spaghetti is unforgettable with thick noodles, creamy reduced marinara and a touch of fresh basic. The short rib agnolotti, the little perfectly packaged pockets of braise short rib and hint of horseradish bursted with slow cooked flavor.

Overall, the staff, food and ambiance was something I won't soon forget next time I am in town.

What a fantastic spot! I came here on a Sunday of a long weekend for a second date - it was a great spot that was the right mix of comfortable, stylish and romantic but not too romantic.

First off, the service was great. Attentive without being overbearing, knowledgeable with a few personal touches that made things seem a little more special. The food was delish too! We both started with the Arancini to start (yum) and I had the tagliatelle with chicken - really tasty. Decent sized portions too! There are a fair number of good vegetarian options (which made my guest happy) and the desserts were also yummy.

The only thing I'd change is that they were out of one of the desserts and didnt know until after we ordered - it was too bad because the server had done a great job or talking it up. The other small tiny thing I'd improve is that I could have gone for a second glass of wine - and the server never asked. I didnt really need it though.

Easy to find parking nearby too which was awesome. I'd go back and try out their pizzas next time because they sounded great!

Went here for my wife's birthday. We had a table where the view is overlooking Bellagio's water fountain. Very nice. The service was awesome and the food was pretty good. First ever restaurant that we encountered where they don't give anything for birthdays. And we have been to a lot of restaurants, go figure. Anything is better than nothing. Left with a sour taste...

This place is good. Definitely affordable fine dining and I would recommend friends to stop by. Is it amazing and must try? Yes and no. I'm sure there are other Vegas establishments more on the wow factor, but pricewise for food and the experience, yes. Please do visit.

I came here with a friend and were able to request and get a seat by the window that looks over to the Bellagio water fountains. Pretty cool I must say.

The bread. Oh my. They serve awesome bread here! There was a piece of sourdough bread on top of the basket covering two pieces of warm wheat type bread, two rosemary focaccia, and our favorite, cheese and salami wrapped bread!!! This last one was soooooo yummy!! The awesome bread basket came with salted butter, a tomato tapenade, and olive oil. Oh my, we finished most of the bread basket, except the rosemary focaccia and had to ask for a second round of bread to accompany our meal! Yes, that good. The salami cheese bread was probably my most favorite thing for dinner lol.

I ordered the Lobster Pici, which was good. There were large pieces of lobster meat in it! There better be if it costed $38! The pici was cooked perfectly. Nothing worng with this dish, but tasted like something I could have made at home. 

My friend ordered the Ricotta and Mushroom Agnolotti. This was really good. I had a few pieces and the wrapper on the agnolotti was super soft! It should be since they make their own spaghetti everyday.

My first choice for entree though was the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli. Un/lucky for me, my other friend went to dinner before me and had some leftovers, which I was able to try. These little suckers were really good heated up so I can only imagine what they would have tasted like if I ordered at dinner and the plate set in front of me. Drools... So, I would recommend this dish definitely!!

All in all, a really good dinner! The staff was all super professional, accommodating, and attentive. Good job staff!

An amazing meal! My husband and I decided on Scarpetta for dinner pretty much at the last minute. We were able to make a reservation on-line two hours prior to the reservation. We arrived about 15 minutes early and were sat right away. We were given a table by the window which allowed us to enjoy the Bellagio fountain show (about three times during our meal!). The wait staff was attentive and very nice. They offered advice about portion size and house favorites. Bread is served as you are seated, and it was delicious and fresh. The bread basket even includes Stromboli! Yum! We ordered a bottle of wine - a very good selection to chose from. My husband ordered the duck, and I got the short rib agnolotti with a side of broccoli rabe to share. Both meals were amazing! The atmosphere was modern yet casual. It felt sophisticated but comfortable. We will definitely be recommending to family and friends!

We have eaten here several times.They have a nice patio which catches the evening sun. Inside the decor is cool and light with artwork by Calgary artist Danielle Bartlette.   
Our first visits here were good - enthusiastic service and well prepared food. We often order a selection of appetizers - calamari, meatballs, caprese salad; they are all tasty and well presented.
Main courses are pleasant but not  exceptional; the usual pastas and pizzas one would expect at an Italian restaurant.  
Our latest visit was not a success as clearly the restaurant was understaffed. Only one person on duty to serve the whole restaurant, and after waiting too long to be seated and too long again to order a drink we decided to try somewhere else. 
I hope this restaurant can better manage their staffing very soon and I would welcome a new menu.

I loved it here. The atmosphere was relaxed, the view of the strip was gorgeous, and the service was excellent.

I had the casonsei which I highly recommend, especially if you're a vegetarian, and my boyfriend had the organic chicken. He said it was very juicy and full of flavor.

For dessert, we had the zeppole. It was filled with nutella. That's all I have to say for you to know that you should get it.

Oh Scott!! When is the last time you did quality control??? I'm a huge fan of yours as I love the Food Network.  I've been itching to try out Scarpetta for a while and made it a priority during my Vegas trip!!

OMG!  Everything was bad.  I mean bad!!! The service was bad and lacking and the food didn't save the day either.  Let's just say I'd expected much more from you and maybe a meal at Olive Garden would've been a better choice. There was absolutely no seasoning in all of the dishes and the focaccia bread was drowned in oil.  The saving grace is probably your specialty bread.  

We ordered the short rib agnolotti and fritto misto as appetizers and both were mediocre at best.  For entrees I ordered the duck and fois gras ravioli and omg, I couldn't eat more than 4 pieces of it and I'm known to polish my plates.  My hubby had the octopus and it was ok but lacked seasoning again.  My daughter had your world famous tomato sauce pasta and the pasta was tough and needed salt!  Is it a bad day or is it normally like this?

Hands down the worst meal in Vegas.  HUGE disappointment!!!

We decided to do dinner here with a couple of friends after Yelping the place . The reviews were amazing and the pictures of the food looked very Yummy . I have to admit the  food was really good, but I am extremely disappointed with the service I received. Once we got the first round of drinks we NEVER got asked again if you wanted another round. Until I asked the waiter if he can get us another round . We waited for 40 minutes for our food . What really made me upset was a party of 4 sat literally across from us , and the customer service they received was the total opposite .

Your typical nice restaurant with nice restaurant prices.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't outstanding in any way. The best thing about it was the view of the Bellagio fountains. Unfortunately, that didn't balance out the overpriced, mediocre food in my opinion.
Great view of the Bellagio fountains. Nice dark, romantic atmosphere. Started with a really great rye manhattan and had delicious pasta entrees. Minus one star for un-exciting yellowtail appetizer.

La pasta perfetto!

Sometimes the simplest things can be magical when executed perfectly.  This is the case with Scarpetta, Scott Conant's debut into the Las Vegas restaurant scene.  

The decor is understated and classy, in shades of black, white and gray.  A knowledgable and unpretentious waitstaff makes the experience all that much better, as they walk you through the menu.  A few tables along the wall rest next to big windows which overlook the neon shimmer of the strip below.  If you're coming here with a small group, definitley request one of these tables.  

Adesso, il Cibo  (Now, the food)

Yellowtail Carpaccio -  Four paper-thin slices of yellowtail treated with fine olive oil and a bit of garlic.  High quality fish and a gentle hand made this appetizer balanced and elegant.

Waygu Beef Tartare - Diced  Waygu beef treated in a similar fashion to the yellowtail, but with a more pronounced garlic note at the end.  Very straightforward and satisfying.

Spaghetti Marinara - As many have said, this is the best spaghetti you will ever eat.  The housemade Al Dente spaghetti is toothsome and tender.  Somehow, the chefs here are able to pull the purest essence of tomato and basil out in this dish.  The simultaneous subtley and complexity of the flavor profile here is truly incredible.  I've spent a lot of time in Italy, and honestly cannot think of a spaghetti that holds a candle to this masterpiece.  A must order!

Black Mac n' Lobster - I believe the black color of the noodles comes from squid ink, but I could be mistaken.  Very nice flavors of lobster and the sea.  The texture was quite similar to the spaghetti, which I found to be redundant, but that was an error in my ordering, and nothing to do with the execution of the dish.  

Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli w/ Marsala Reduction - The food that kings eat!  The ravioli was immaculate, formed with care and the love you'd expect from a homemade Italian meal.  I found the combination of duck, foie gras, and the marsala reduction to be a bit too heavy.  I could see people raving about this dish, but for me it was just too much of a good thing.

Branzino - Gentle white fish with a lightly crisped skin and honest flavors.  One of the best cooked fish plates I can remember having.

Dry Aged Filet - The pink/gray color of this steak is visually contradictory to what you might find at a fine steak house, but that is due to the dry aging process.  It was tender, flavorful, and neat.


Yes the bread is incredible as well, but let's not fill up on bread.  Scarpetta is a great date spot if you're looking to splurge.  Do not leave without ordering the spaghetti, its the type of dish you'll tell your grandkids about.

Wow! I was not expecting to love Scarpetta as much as I did. After a rather disappointing dining experience at Mastro's steakhouse the night before, I needed some Italian comfort food! From the moment we walked in I was in love. I love the lighting and the cozy booths next to the bar looked very inviting and I was hoping we would be sat at one. Thank god we weren't! Instead we were lead into the main dining room which has a perfect view of the Bellagio and Bellagio fountains! We not only had an amazing dinner but also enjoyed the fountain show every 1/2 hour. 

Now on to the actual meal. First of all, the bread selection in the basket are delicious! There was a prosciutto and mozzarella roll that was just to die for! For an appetizer we went with the heirloom tomato salad. Yummy! Next up we shared one of the pasta dishes that was on special. I can't remember what it was called, which is unfortunate because it was outstanding. Next we shared the roasted chicken, also very good! We shared a side of the carrots which were great. The combination of honey and the crunch of the nuts made the cooked carrots really stand out. 

Besides the meal itself, the service was outstanding. Since we shared each plate our server made sure that the items were split onto two plates so that we didn't have to reach across the table to get bites of food. Our water glasses never went below half full and our server was very attentive. 

I will definitely visit Scarpetta on my future visits to Vegas.

Unfortunately it has gone downhill - two stars for service and food - whereas it used to be one of my faves. We had a large party and the chef refused to give us the tasting menu as a few vegetarians weren't interested - Chef said via our server that it would "ruin the dining experience" because not everyone would do it. With our dining experience thus ruined by not being able to get the tasting menu, our party almost left, but I convinced everyone to stay because the food had been so stellar before. Which was a mistake. Service was painfully slow. My burrata was good but tagliatelle was just meh. Same mixed experience for the rest of the group. Bread was yummy but even with knowing we had vegetarians at the table, they served the meat filled bread in the same basket as the other bread - just lazy. Only bright spot worth the extra star was the sommelier who made our night with some great wines. We won't return.

last stop on the "cosmo food crawl " 

Starting to feel the effects of the crawl but we gotta make a final stop for the restaurant that allegedly makes some of the best pasta in the U.S. 

Again, sat in the lounge area of the restaurant. While waiting for the table, i tried a few of the chips that are complementary at the bar - very good ! had fried basil blended in with some bite to them - not sure if it was red pepper or not. 

While we were virtually ignored at Comme Ca, Scarpetta was the other end of the spectrum ( an not in a good way ) - our server was nice but man, way to pushy on trying to up sell, especially the drinks. 

Went with lighter wine this time - name escapes me but it was a $10 glass - nice. We also opted for some sparkling water - $9. 

Ordered the spaghetti ( $24 ) , the creamy polenta with fricasse mushrooms ( $16 ) and the branzino ( sis wanted the cod but the server almost insisted that the branzino was the way to go - she relented - $26 ) 

The spaghetti was a joy - might be tad bit too strong in basil , but it worked for me. What surprised us was a little heat to the sauce - the server was also a little surprised to hear this ... to the point i don't think she believed us. 

The polenta was extremely rich but dang good. the fricasse was better here than the mushrooms we had at comme ca and helped cut through some of the richness of the polenta. 

The branzino was perfectly cooked, simple seasoning but great taste. nice. 

We went with the amedei Chocolate cake ( basically a molton lava cake $11) with a toasted almond gelato and a salted caramel sauce ( the reason why we got it - $3) and then a separate scoop of tangerine sorbet. 

I tell ya, that tangerine was a heck of finish to our food fest - so frickin refreshing - I will go back for that every time i'm in the building !!

The best meal I've ever had in Vegas! The server was extremely attentive and the food was amazing. I had the pasta with tomato basil sauce and it was honestly the best spaghetti I've ever had. The servings aren't too big either so we were able to split a dessert, got the strawberry mouse. It was a bit too sweet for me, but still delicious, and the coffee I had with it helped tone down the sweet. Will definitely be coming back!

Came here for a romantic Anniversary dinner after seeing great reviews by other Yelpers and we were definitely steered in the right direction. 
We had made reservation a week in advance and were hoping to get a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains, though they told us they can't promise and that we will have to try our luck when we arrive. We made it to our reservation on time, yet we still had to wait 20 minutes, which was alittle annoying considering we had made reservations. Though we didn't get a fountain view, we were too hungry at that point to care. 
Our server immediately bought out a bread basket with a trio of olive oil, eggplant and honey butter. THE BREAD WAS INCREDIBLE!!! My favorite was the salami and cheese filled one (I still dream about it). For appettizer we got the MEDITERRAEN OCTOPUS, which was cooked just perfectly! For our entrees we got PRIME FILET OF BEEF and RAVIOLI FOIE GRAS AND DUCK. Though the ravioli was underwhelming, there was lot of ravioli squares which really was great. The filet of beef, on the other hand, was absolutely amazing. It was perfectly cooked and the softest beef I've ever had in my life. This really was the greatest dish I've ever eaten in my life and I was beyond impressed. 
For dessert, we had mentioned that it was our anniversary and were given a chocolate cake with HAPPY ANNIVERSARY writing, which was a lovely surprise. Sadly,. the cake was very dry but the ice-cream helped. 
In all I would highly recommend Scarpetta and would love to come back here for our next Vegas trip!!

Had high expectations after reading some reviews and friend ref. Food was good but nothing exceptional either. Ordered Brussels sprouts but never got them. Cocktails were extra tasty though and hence that's why 2 stars. 

Our server decided to ruin it for us. Within 5 minutes, decided to tell us that " I am going to hand over to someone Mr X, and you can tell him your price range". What made him decide on my price range? Because I looked through wine list and found no cocktails? Or I even hate to say this but I was neither a corporate client nor a rich patron? Give me another good reason to hand me over to a lower staff? After that it was just downhill for me. Give this place a shot if you fulfill their criteria of a good ticket! We were wanting to celebrate a special occasion. Thank you for completely ruining it. I have read similar condescending behavior reviews about this place but didn't want to believe those. Not anymore.

I was in town for a luxury travel conference and after dining at Scarpetta I know that I will send more clients here in the future . The service was amazing , we had a great seat with a beautiful view of the bellagio fountains . 
We had the braised short rib to start and it was melt in your mouth amazing . 
I then had the famous spaghetti and I am a huge pasta lover and this was just fabulous cooked exactly how I love it . 
My husband had the duck and foie gras ravioli . It was very rich but still delicious.
We tried three different desserts and every single one was good . 
I loved this restaurant and I would recommend it to everyone .

Husband and I are major food show junkies, so we planned to celebrate big for our 5th anniversary. We were seated by a window with an incredible view of the bellagio fountains. The wooden floors, leather chairs, and leather placemats gave an instant upscale but hip vibe. We ordered an appetizer, two pastas, a meat dish, a side, and a dessert. All handmade pastas, the chef was so kind and split all our dishes (even when we said it wasn't a big deal for us to eat family style), and the spaghetti was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. The spaghetti with tomato and basil was so good we got an extra order to eat later. Luis, our server, was incredibly accommodating and made sure our dining experience was unforgettable. He joked with us, told us each item we were about to eat, and sent us home happy customers.

Adequate food, but sketchy impersonal service... We went last weekend to celebrate a birthday with a party of six... No waiter greeted us or identified himself as our sever... Nice bottle of white wine poured during cocktails to get warm... Plates were placed at the wrong guest... One of the orders was wrong and had to be redone leaving the other plates to get cold... Watch out though for the double check... Check was brought to me... I gave my credit card... When the receipt came back to sign it had been run through at $100 more without explanation.... I called the manager the next day... He expressed concern, but did nothing to correct the problem... At the end of the day, seems to be just another case of cynical strip restaurant management... Too bad, we had wanted to check out this restaurant for awhile... Probably should have gone with Milos that night...

As soon as I had my flight and hotel booked for Vegas I also made my dinner reservation at Scarpetta. Even though we had made our reservation made for 8 on a Saturday night we still waited about 15 minutes or so for our table. Upon getting seated in the dining room I was incredibly impressed. The room was dimly lit, beautifully decorated and facing the fountains of the Bellagio. 

Our waiter quickly approached with our wine and cocktail lists and allowed us to look over them for a while. When he approached again we were still indecisive. We told him what we were thinking about ordering and he made a great suggestion. Now that drinks were ordered, it was time to dig into the bread basket. We loved the stromboli as well as the sourdough and focaccia bread. The eggplant caponata was also delicious. If I wasn't to embarrassed to order another bread basket I would have done so.

After we had ordered we were anxious to receive our food. We started with the shortribs over farro pasta. The shortribs fell apart and were incredibly rich. The farro was the perfect companion to this well made dish. Our polenta was next. It was creamy and topped with mushrooms. Wow. We finished with the home made tagilatelle with vegetables and fava beans as well as guanciale. Being the pasta snob Scott Conant is on "Chopped" I knew this had to be good. I was right. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the sauce was light and flavorful. Seeing as we weren't completely full we ordered dessert.

And what a dessert it was. The bombolini were basically dougnut holes filled with nutella and a vanilla custard. They were accompanied by a nutella powder and bruleed bananas. It was the perfect combination of textures: The soft doughnuts, the creamy nutella and vanilla custard, the crunchy bruleed bananas and the light nutella powder were out of control good.

Scarpetta is a must for Italian food lovers in Vegas. It's the perfect place for a date night.

Modern decor in dark earthy tones is beautiful. As for the food: Compliments to chef Scott Conant for his NYC location but not this one.  However, with more attentive service and a little less repetitive flavours, Scarpetta, italian for little shoe or small piece of bread used to dip in a sauce could be a good addition to the Thompson hotel.  though still a work in progress. Mushroom fricassee is excellent along with their silky hot molten rich chocolate cake which is a perfect fit in the warm chic monochromatic brown decor.  However the acoustic design needs to be revised: room sounds are loud and brittle.

I have been here a few times, and I cannot say anything more then flawless! THis place is amazing.  All the food is purely fresh, and the pasta is homemade which makes it even better.  The decor is beautiful, and their food is just amazing.  Sometimes you have to wait if you want to sit in the main room, with the views of las vegas blvd, but if you sit near the bar its a faster wait for a table.  Their pasta and food is just amazing.  I would go back again and again! It is a little pricey, but so is all of Vegas.

Simply fenomenal! 

It was my second time in Scarpetta, the first one was in Los Angeles, a few years ago!

The pici was fantastic, the service too!

My wife asked for the ravioli, and she loved it!

The dessert was superb! I really recommend it!
Prices are on the low end, food is excellent. Try the pasta, any pizza special. I've recommended this restaurant to more people than I can count. Great atmosphere. Really reasonable price.

Delicious!! Date night with bf - got a table next for he window with the view of Bellagio water show. The atmosphere was very romantic and calming. 
We ordered the following....
Entrees:
1) Pici, which is with homemade pasta with lobster and chili oil (so there is a kick to it!) $39
2) Special: wagyu Beef was cooked to perfection! The sear and crust on the outside of the beef was seasoned just right with a nice crunch which goes very well with the soft and tender wagyu beef. It was definitely one of the best wagyu beef I've tasted. $70
Dessert: 
We shared the Nutella Bomboloni with homemade banana Gelato (so soft with a slight chewy to the fried bomboloni) $12

It's a must try! Love the homemade authentic Italian flavors.

Wish we could of had a table with a view since we made the reservations months ago for Valentine's Day Dinner with our friends (table for 12)... but besides the less romantic view and unable to split checks for us, which we had to do ourselves at the end of dinner, The FOOD was amazing! ALL MY STARS GO TO THE FOOD one less star for the reservations and bill splitting.

This was for dinner on June 29th @ 8pm.

This could've been a 5-Star review because the food was amazing! Had the Agnolotti with the Short Rib, breadcrumbs, & brown butter, and my wife had the spaghettini their signature dish with the meatballs, fantastic. The bread basket was awesome, but there was one piece that stood out, the bread that was stuffed with Mozzarella and Salami, oh my gosh just amazing.

Unfortunately, the management and our server were so wrapped up with a couple of inebriated gentlemen who I guess deserved all the attention, they catered to there every need.

It's a real shame when this happens because it takes away from a great dinning experience and a memory in which you would've liked to have remembered for your anniversary. Just a note the restaurant wasn't that busy either, so not sure why the low grade service.

Big thanks to the hostesses, as they were so nice to greet us with "Happy Anniversary" when we arrived, however our server was nice and attentive, but got so wrapped up with the two gentlemen, must have forgotten it was our anniversary, and just brought our check, and went back to visiting. This accounts for the one less STAR, to bad, the managers that night and or server dropped the ball, I'm sure everyone noticed that was having dinner as well.

I dined at Scarpetta for the first time this evening with high hopes.  I am from New York and have heard good things about the reputation the NYC Scarpetta has from friends.  Being that Vegas is expected to bring the best of the best and be over priced I was nervous taking my parents there when my dad was meeting my boyfriend for the first time.  I am Italian and we take eating meals together very seriously.  I must say that I was not disappointed one bit.  Their decor and ambience alone was impressive.  It was elegant and slightly rustic but not tacky like you see often in Vegas.  From the very well dressed GM Kelli who seated us to the extremely polite food runners the entire experience was definitely a plus.  Having worked in the food and beverage industry on the east coast and west coast I can be a tough critic but I would recommend this establishment to anyone who isn't afraid to spend some money on a good meal.  The appetizers were fairly small portioned but paired with the entree and dessert this place is perfect to have a 3 course meal and be more than satisfied.  I hardly give 5 stars and did not take a look at the wine menu so I can not speak on that.  I will have to return in order to add another star.  Thanks Scarpetta!

I've been to this restaurant several times with my husband and we always sit at the bar. Neither food or service has ever been a disappointment. Tonight was no different. Bread basket with Stromboli (1 w/ prosciutto & 1 w/broccoli rabe) was fantastic as usual. Spaghetti perfect. Pici fabulous!

Love Scarpetta, but the one in Vegas isn't up to Miami or NYC standards. The decor is nice, the service is good. Don't forget to order the famous pasta with tomato and basil, it's amazing always. The polenta is very good as well. Lots of great choices, small portions, and great wine.

i cannot wait to go back!! every bite of the duck ravioli was delectable, i cant describe how good it was. i also tried the berry cocktail which quenched my thirst and gave me the buzz i needed. and let me warn you about the chocolate cake...it's dangerous!! (in a good way).

Scarpetta is one of my favorite restaurant in the Vegas and NYC area.   Not only is the food deliciously great and consistently delivers quality, the service is five stars rating itself !   My work company had their yearly convention in Vegas this past week and it fell on a Valentine's day. So I thought it would be nice to set something special for my co-workers and I.  I had called to book for their private dinning room about four months in advance. The manager signed me up ASAP. Three days before the dinner I called and asked if they can help me decorate the table and they said yes and so I dropped off a few items to them before hand. Another manager by the name of "Cheyenne" took care of the decorations and the results was beautifully done!! I couldn't have done it any better or ask for more.  See for yourself.  And our waiter Steve was hilariously funny as he joined in our jokes.  We had an awesome Valentine's night & dinner!   Thank you Scarpetta staff!

I have been to the Beverly HIlls location prior to the Las Vegas location and both were spot on. We made reservations and got there 45 minutes early to be promptly seated at the best table in the house! We had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. Our waiter was very helpful and had great suggestions. The bread basket is always a favorite of mine. I especially like the marscarpone cheese spread. YUMMY!! We shared the apple endive salad with beets also good. I had the spaghetti this time and prior i had the short rib agnolotti (super good). The ambience was top notch as was the service. I'll be visiting again.

I wanted to love Scarpetta, I really did. I was still mesmerized by the striking view I got to take in during the grand opening and determined to prove all of the reviews about the mediocre service wrong, but our waiter left me no choice but to report otherwise.

I want to point out the highlights before I rip Scarpetta to shreds. I came in for Restaurant Week so got the pre-fixe menu and chose the yellowtail, short rib agnolotti, and coconut panna cotta. I thought the yellowtail had great flavor and was presented beautifully. My only complaint was that it seemed to be served a little on the warm side to me which is a concern when it comes to raw fish.

The coconut panna cotta/guava soup was not only delicious but beautiful too. The almost tart soup was a nice contrast to the creamy panna cotta-probably the best panna cotta I've ever had! Not too rich or too sweet, and again, perfectly balanced with the cold fruit soup. I usually don't go for dessert soups, but I'd probably come back just for that.

The view is killer-great front row seats to the Bellagio water show!

Now for the bad.

Strike one: Maybe this is just me being very nitpicky, but the presentation of the short rib agnolotti was just gross. The pasta was served in a wide, shallow bowl and the appearance of pasta in one thin layer with hardly any garnish (save the breadcrumbs which had a nice flavor) was just unappetizing. Also, the pasta was incredibly greasy. I've had pasta in brown butter sauce before that didn't look like that. The filling was good, very rich and flavorful, but the sauce was just off-putting. 

Strike two: for the duration of our dinner, a toddler continuously screamed at the top of his lungs, banged on the table, stood on the booth in which his family was sitting and annoyed the crap out of the surrounding diners. As a fine dining restaurant, it's your responsibility to make sure that the experience is just that, fine dining. Which means if you need to tell this family who cannot control their spoiled infant to beat it, in the interest of preserving the experience for surrounding diners, then do it. After an hour of embarrassing behavior and ugly stares from other tables, the dad who was elegantly dressed in board shorts, shower shoes and a baseball cap removed the child from the fine dining situation. I feel like the management should've handled this earlier, but God forbid they offend one person who is offending the entire restaurant. 

Strike three: our waiter was a dud. I get it, everyone has their off days, but I think this waiter's life was a series of off days. I'm hoping that his service standards weren't lowered because we were getting what was essentially a discounted menu, but I can't help that think this was the case. Discounted menu=less tip? Not always. But if your behavior warrants a tip to match the discounted bill then that's what you'll get. It took about 15 minutes for bread to come out and for the waiter to bring water. Then another 15 minutes for him to take our order for wine. And about another 20 minutes to take our food order. I shouldn't have to flag you down and tell you we're ready to order. That's not my job as a patron of the restaurant. I wasn't in any rush, but those lapses in time mean either this dude was just straight up inattentive or suffering the early stages of dementia. Everything about the dinner just dragged on unnecessarily. He was inattentive and seemed disinterested in our table-there were only two of us and we're definitely not high maintenance so I'm not sure what the issue was.

Our waiter was in no way personable and just rubbed me the wrong way. Maybe we caught him on a bad night. Maybe he didn't feel like we deserved the attention that someone who was ordering off of the regular menu did. Regardless, in these economically unbalanced times, when so many people are opting to eat cheaper or stay home and cook, I feel like the restaurant industry should feel the pressure to give diners the experience they pay for. Even if we were getting your dishes for a reduced price-we are still dining in your restaurant and your standard of service should be equal across the board. You are a fine dining restaurant and I hold you to a higher standard than, say a Denny's. But if you perform like a Denny's waiter, I will tip you like a Denny's waiter. 


I'm not sure I would come back because I was truly annoyed with the service. Maybe I'd come back for the guava soup...and have it at the bar.

Let me first say that I went to Scarpetta just to try their dessert.  My friend and I had eaten dinner at a nearby restaurant in Cosmopolitan and wanted to try another place for dessert.  We first checked out the menu posted right outside the door of the restaurant and figured that the desserts sounded tasty so we should give it a shot.  When we first went in, they asked for our reservation.  We did not have any, so we elected to sit in one of the booths near the bar.  For dessert, I ordered the Peach Crostata since I really like peaches.  The dessert was described as moscato peaches, almonds, cinnamon and cardemom gelato.  It came in a clear glass.  I was expecting the dessert to be very sweet and savory, but it wasn't really any of those.  It wasn't anything extraordinary.  It just tasted like a regular dessert.  I understand that most customers do not come here just for dessert, but I figured with the great reviews and pricing that it would be something worth trying.  I guess I was wrong.  Maybe their food is better than their desserts, but there wasn't anything special on this end.

If the Cosmopolitan Hotel wasn't amazing enough...  This restaurant was great.

The Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli was amazing. The service was excellent and the view of the Bellagio water fountain was grand.

phenomenal - best meal of my entire life.

I consider myself an "entry level" foodie - i love food, but have not had the opportunities to try an extensive amount of high end dining. That being said, I've eaten at some top notch restaurants in  the US and Europe and this is the best overall meal I've ever had.

Should also add we were fortunate to get the corner table overlooking the belagio, which was really nice. Ask for it if possible. 

 We ordered:

Appetizers: Scallops, beef tartar
Pasta: Spaghetti, Duck Foi Gras Ravioli
Entree: Duck, Veal chop
Dessert: Bombelloni

The all stars of the evening was the beef, raviolio, and bombolloni. I rate each of these a 10/10. beef may be the most flavorful and delicate dish I've ever eaten (easily trumps what i ate in France). The ravioli was absolutely amazing with the perfectly cooked pasta and a smooth liver flavor on the inside.

We actually ordered the mousse for dessert, but our very attentive and friendly waiter suggested we go with the bombelloni instead. We trusted him, and glad we did. Hard to imagine eating donuts from DD ever again.

The other dishes were all perfectly cooked, but flavor wise they all earned an 8/10. 

Staff was excellent, atmosphere romantic, and food top notch. Highly recommended - thank you Scott Conant!
The food was amazing, wine was outstanding and the service was even better! Do yourself a favor and splurge on dessert, the cheescake was incredible!

I always order the same thing when I bring someone new here. My go to menu options never fail. Start off with the mushroom polenta (sex in your mouth), share the duck foie gras ravioli (it's pretty rich but amazing) and believe it or not the spaghetti! I've never ordered spaghetti at a restaurant until now and I'm hooked! I even got the recipe and make it at home now! I also like the short rib risotto and the short rib ravioli :)

I'm not one to typically go to the strip to have dinner. IMO a lot of places on the strip under deliver and overcharge. Don't get me wrong there are several good places that the meal fits the price. Scarpetta is one of those places!
I came here 2 years ago. I was on a date w/ my gf and I wasn't feeling well. So much that I didn't eat very much on that visit. Last month we did that date night all over again. She has always been a fan of Scarpetta. 
Scarpetta is looked by where the Bellagio fountains are. So if you can manage to make a reservation, request a table by the window to get a dinner and a show. However if you don't, the amazing food will certainly make up for it. 

Pici - lobster, preserved tangerine & bottarga (OMG! OMG! SO GOOD!)
Spaghetti - tomato & basil

She said she always gets the spaghetti. It's basic, but it's oh so good. She's right, it's SO GOOD! She mentioned that she hasn't ever had a bad experience at Scarpetta.

The dimly lit dining room is perfect to get lost in. The staff is 5 stars, they are certainly knowledgeable. Very good vibes.

Can't wait to go back!

We came here to celebrate husbands birthday and made reservation for three. There does not appear that a reservation is needed given the many open tables when we arrived. I was bummed that we can't get a window table to view the bellagio fountains because those are all two tops. 

Anyhoo the food was not spectacular and didn't blow me away. In light of all the raving reviews and food pics I had high expectations but it was somewhat of a let down in reality. Husband ordered the spaghetti and it was good but not like omg. I ordered the fried squid and it was also decent but the portion was very small. We shared a salad and shared our main entrees with our 7 year old since they don't offer kiddo menu. She wouldn't have been able to finish a meal by herself we thought so we shared but in light of the small portions she would've been just fine. It came to about 100 benjamins and we left feeling like we can still eat so we got dessert from the milk bar. All in all I would say this was an okay experience but I wouldn't be itching to eat here again.

Ok, so my husband and I went t Scarpetta last night for dinner to celebrate our anniversary.  I would give the restaurant 4.5 stars if I could, it was a very good experience.  However two of the dishes we ordered were less than stellar, so that's why my rating went to a four.

I give the staff 5 stars, they were prompt and courteous and seated us at a fantastic table right next to the window so we could watch the Bellagio fountain.

We ordered four dishes and split them all.  They helpfully divided the food onto 2 plates for every course - much appreciated.  We started with the seared scallop, which was excellent.  Then we had the tagliatelle with vegetables.  The pasta was great but the veggie sauce was extremely salty, and I couldn't eat it.  Then we had the pork chop - an amazing dish, a real winner.  But we ordered the mixed mushrooms to go with that.  And though they were fresh and nicely cooked, they were flavorless.  It didn't seem like there was any seasoning on them at all, very disappointing.  We split the orange soufflé for dessert, and that too was fantastic. So all in all it still was a great meal, and dining experience, and we would return to try again.  The good dishes were outstanding, it's too bad the other two weren't up to par.

Was staying at the Wynn and the concierge recommended this place.  We were a party of 12.  The food took forever to come out and the service was terrible.  The food was excellent though.  Was it worth the wait?  NO.  The Hotel "scene" itself was awesome.

We ate here for Valentine's Day last year and loved it. Part of the dining room has a view of the Bellagio fountains and made the evening a little more special. 

No problems with any staff and the whole restaurant seemed to operate very smoothly even though the restaurant was packed for the holiday. 

Everything we ordered was fabulous and we really enjoyed ourselves. This was a fun and intimate dinner and I'd definitely go back here another time.

Dark, sexy, and intimate.  Delicious Italian fare with excellent service and a view.

I've dined here multiple times and Scarpetta never seems to disappoint.  My dining experiences have ranged from a two-seated table with the view of the Bellagio fountains to the private chef's table with the view of the kitchen.  I've had the typical a la carte menu to the seven-course tasting menu.  If I had to choose my favorite experience between them all, my personal preference is the two-seated table with the a la carte menu.

The service here is very prompt and attentive.  From the Managers to the wait staff, service is priority here.  Shout out to Kelly, the General Manager, as she personally knows how to take care of her customers.

To start off the meal, you are presented with a one of my most favorite bread baskets ever.  The three accompanying spreads are vey unique and delicious. Their stromboli bread is sinfully good.

My personal favorite dishes:
-  Roasted Sea Scallops:  Simple and well executed.  My only complaint is the size of the portion.
-  Spaghetti:  Simple, clean, and classic.  FYI, the pasta is al dente.
-  Risotto:  Slightly al dente, yet creamy at the same time.
-  Tagliatelle:  Comforting dish that is full of flavor.  My personal favorite.
-  Fennel Spiced Black Cod:  Flaky yet bold in taste.

If you are looking for a restaurant with a sexy ambiance, delicious food, and excellent service, come to Scarpetta.  It's my personal "go to" spot for dinner dates.

Great atmosphere fitting for group night out, intimate enough for dates and business dinners alike. Beautiful view looking out to The Bellagio. 

We ordered:
Primi...
Yellowtail sashimi +++++ (more please!)
Tomatoe mozzarella salad ++++
scallops +++++

Pasta...
Spaghetti ++++ (pasta is made daily in house)

Secondi...
Spiced duck breast +++ (a bit chewy and star anise overpowered the duck just enough to make it not as enjoyable)

Finished the meal with Napoleon creme brûlée, and it was just divine.

I had a light Bordeaux(?) which was absolutely divine with the duck. It was one our waiter recommended so other waiters may know as it may be chef recommended.

I will absolutely come back. In fact, I feel like checking out the one in NYC now!
This is the best food that I've eaten all year. I couldn't get enough of the  foie gras ravioli and scallops. The cocktails were perfect. I have nothing but great things to say about this place.

Really was looking forward to this dinner. We had an excellent table and the service was amazing. Great wine list!!  Unfortunately the food was very mixed.  The ravioli got rave reviews, but the spaghetti (which was highly recommended by the waiter) was bland and tasteless. Will give this another shot....but wouldn't be my first choice.

I have been curious about Scarpetta.  The Thompson Hotel has been a gathering grounds for the hip and beautiful for the past while.

It so happens, I ended up buying a Travelzoo voucher for a 5 course tasting.  I wasn't sure what to expect.  I don't often buy Groupon/specials for restaurants but this one turned out to be a great buy! 

I made a reservation on a Wednesday night.  When you enter the hotel, the lobby is upbeat, modern, and lively with a bar by the couch area.  We were able to check our coats and enter the dining room.  We were the first ones seated since they just opened at 6 pm.

They seated us by the window which is nice for looking outside, but there are also these insanely annoyingly bright pot lights.  Lucky for me I had a giant purse and blocked the spot light.  I didn't want to feel like I was performing while I was eating.

The service was very attentive and pleasant.  We were offered water right away and provided with the wine menus and bread.

The bread basket included four types of warm fresh bread.  The salami bread was like mini salami sandwiches, which were really yummy but filling.

The amuse bouche was a cheese taster... literally you can have a small taste of Parmesan and another nondescript cheese. 

The five courses was chef's selection, so we didn't know what we would get.

Our first course was the popular creamy polenta with truffles.  
It was definitely standout.  The polenta was so smooth and wonderful.
Along with the polenta, we were also served the shortribs which were tender and fall apart soft.

The pasta course was huge.  The Spaghetti was simple with tomato sauce and basil and perfectly cooked.  I ate some but I wanted to eat more ravioli and left half of my spaghetti.

I loved the duck and foie ravioli!  We didn't leave any of it behind and it was a large plateful.  Savoury, sweet, and fatty, one of the richest raviolis I've ever tasted.

The fish course was sea bass.  It was lightly seared with crispy skin.  A bit salty and served with earthy vegetables.  

The leg of lamb was perfectly cooked and nice and pink without runny juices.  I was so full at this point I'm sure if I was paying as much attention to the food.  However, the lamb was well prepared.  It wasn't transformed into anything creative, but I thought it was well executed.

As for dessert, they served us the cheese cake and caramel budino.
The cheesecake was deconstructed with two types of crumble to add flavour.
The budino was a bitter caramel with peanut butter and chocolate brittle
I preferred the cheesecake.

At this point, I thought I was going to burst at the seams.  We left completely full and satisfied with our meal.

We had a fantastic meal and it was definitely a pleasant surprise considering I had purchased the tasting menu with a voucher (they add 18% gratuity automatically and wine is expensive, so it's still not a cheap meal but worth it).

I'm sure I will be back.  Also, I'll have to visit the bar or the rooftop patio!

My favorite Italian restaurant to go to when I come to Vegas. I usually get the tasting menu, because you get a little bit of everything. I love any Italian restaurant that uses handmade pasta. Love the ambiance here as well. I've gone here two nights in a row before to host business meetings because I favor this spot. Delightful that it's right inside one of my favorite hotel casinos, Cosmo.

I made reservations for 6 people at 10:30PM through the yelp app. It went smoothly!

We ordered:
PICI: it was lobster and pesto pasta (all pasta is made at the restaurant)
RIBS: SO GOODDDD. Full of fat! :)
HALIBUT W/ ARUGALA: Delicious, perfectly made. Beware, there was only ONE peice of arugala as an embellishment.
And two other orders that I can't remember. But everything was delicious!

PROS: The restaurant provides a view of the Bellagio water show.
Huge wine selection. Delicious food. 

CONS: Can't find one..

I love Scarpetta!  Especially their Branzeno with a fish broth and crispy skin!  It's a shame they changed the way this dish is prepared.   Their ambiance and decor is beautiful. Service is always great as well.  Their polenta and mushrooms is a must try dish.  I will be back soon!

The service was horrendous. The hostess didn't smile, wasn't polite, and was visibly overwhelmed. The food made up for it. Everything we ordered was amazing; cheese plate, ravioli, lamb ragu fettuccine, strawberry shortcake... AMAZING! My advice to you, patience! My advice to the manager, hire more servers and a better hostess!

I came yesterday to celebrate my birthday with my boyfriend I made reservation 2 weeks before that to make sure we will get a table next to the view...and the lady on the phone said "she is not promising nothing and I told her it is very important to me if she can do that. Of course we came yesterday the table wasnt next to the window but when I look at the tables next to the window you can see people come inside the restaurant ask for a bable next to the window and get it....nevermind about it. The host is American but all the waiters are Mexicans,  I do not have problem with that but you Hardly can Understand what they say or when they talking between them you don't understand Because they Speak Spanish,  I Find it rude and not respect the place. When we seated a waiter come to us and ask if we want a bottle of wine,  we says "no" and he brought 2 glass with water and that's pretty much ends our relationship with the waiters. after that come waiter brought brad and started to explain about the brad and left. We couldnt understand a word he say. After 15 mins come finally our waiter and ask what he want to eat I told him what I want and told him the only reason I choose this restaurant because I saw you have here vegetarian menu because my bf is Vegan, so the waiter brought him this menu and left we needed to wait more 15- 20 mins until he came back to the table, and then when my bf told him what he want to order the waiter say that all the pasta made with eggs in the vegetarian menu so he can't order any pasta !!!!! After we waited 20 min !!! And after he choose something to eat! You don't want to know what he ends with! After a while when the food  came the waiter comes to me few time to ask if I finish to eat and 3 times I said no. After he took the plate he didn't offer us dessert menu he just left to different tables and ignor us for good!!! After another 15 min I needed to call him for bring the check he didn't say nothing he brought it and gone!  Very disgusting treatment , the food is actually good! But the treatment so bad! I swear I never come to this restaurant again.

Short rib marrow stuffed tiny ravioli's = ridiculously good.
Spaghetti with marinara and basil = amazing; perfectly al dente.

Strawberry soufflé maybe one of the best deserts I've ever had.

The boyfriend has been pining for this restaurant after hearing about their amazing spaghetti. Also, after finding out that the man behind the restaurant is a judge from The Food Network's Chopped, I was sold.

The food did not disappoint. We had the yellow tail as an appetizer, then the famed spaghetti and the sirloin. We decided we were going to share everything and the kitchen was actually nice enough to split each dish so that it was presented on two separate plates to us. Each plate looked exactly as it would if it were the full portion. To top that off, they didn't even charge a splitting fee like so many restaurants usually would! That is what I call spectacular service. 

I'm a sucker for bread and their bread basket had me half full before we even ordered! The bread filled with salami and cheese was the favorite. It came with 3 dipping sauces, a marscapone cheese, tomato with eggplant, and a citrus oil. I thought the best combination was the citrus oil with the tomato and eggplant. 

The yellow tail was fresh and had a nice chili kick to it. There were small chunks of rock salt that added a little crunch. It came with 4 slices of yellow tail, which was actually more than we expected.

The spaghetti lives up to its reputation. It was beautifully presented, swirled up into a pile and they uncover the plate right in front of you. The sauce is perfectly seasoned and the tomatoes still have a slight acidity. The pasta itself is cooked al dente and they're beautifully thick spaghetti noodles. I had to eat this one noodle at a time so I could make it last as long as possible. 

The sirloin was cooked to our liking, but it was a bit chewy. We both loved the vegetables that came underneath it. There were carrots, mushrooms, potatoes, and probably some others and they were all so good!

At the last minute, we decided to get the amedei chocolate cake with the almond gelato and salted caramel sauce. The gelato was my favorite part of the plate, although it looked partly melted by the time it got to the table. The chocolate cake was like a lava cake, where the middle is still fudge like. It could have been warmer. I thought the plate could use more of the gelato and almond gelato to balance out how rich the chocolate is. Also, the bf ordered a coffee and it came with refills! 

One complaint is that we were seated along the wine fridge and someone would come by every once in a while and just open it up behind us. Having the chilled refrigerator air interrupt a nice meal isn't the most fun. But if you are seated by the window, there is an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains.

For the price, it was actually a good amount of food and it is quality food. I really cannot wait for the spaghetti again. When I eat my jarred Preggo tomato sauce, I'll be fantasizing about the spaghetti here.

The food here is amazing. Excellent well-thought out Italian fare. 

However, when dining at high-end restaurants, I expect a similar level of service. Tonight our server was mediocre at best. Barely checked on us at all. Never asked us if we would like anything to drink besides water. The kicker was serving half our party their desserts while the other half didn't even get to order dessert. Then, they proceeded to clear all the plates and served the other party their course afterwards. 

I also found it interesting that the server only addressed the man at the table and never the woman. Too bad for him, it's the woman who paid the check tonight and decided on the tip! It's the 21st century. Our party clearly wasn't out on a romantic date where it might have been chivalrous to only address the man. I suppose misogyny is alive and well at this establishment. 

Sadly, the service here used to be excellent but has clearly gone down the tubes. I wonder if Scott Conant realizes his restaurant is not keeping up the same standards as in previous years.

Warning, this beautiful restaurant is in the Cosmopolitan which is a pretentious somewhat tacky casino/hotel. Except for the hostess, who seemed a little  "too cool" for the guests, the staff gets an A+ for service. Titus was our main waiter but there were two other gentlemen who were on the spot and very kind.  We had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains as well. The warm bread basket with a variety of breads (foccacia, stromboli, etc) was served with a 3 different types of dips (an eggplant thing, olive oil, and butter) and they were all so delicious. We started our meals with a shared Beet salad and polenta. To say the polenta was AMAZING would not give it enough credit. It was creamy and consistent, topped with truffled mushrooms, garlic, and sauce. The serving was large enough to share. I could have had another serving of the polenta and been quite happy and full. The beet salad was crisp and came with a generous serving of gooey cheese (stracciatella), pumpkin seeds and balsamic dressing.  It was fresh and tasty.  My friend and I shared the Duck and foie Gras Ravioli and Short Rib Agnolotti. My friend loved the Ravioli and loved the marsala reduction. I felt the duck and foie gras had a weird texture and I didn't care much for it. But that could have been a mental thing since I have opinions about foie gras practices. The sauce was delicious however and perfect for dipping some bread into. I wasn't sure what to expect with the Short Rib. It was small rib pieces in noodle wrapping covered with breadcrumbs (?), brown butter and horseradish. Whoa the horseradish was strong but so delicious! If I hadn't filled up with polenta and bread, I could have finished my plate. It was so delicious. But if you find horseradish to be strong or can only tolerate a little, skip this meal! There wasn't any room for the dessert. But the options looked tempting. Oh I forgot we had Moscato de' Asti that complimented the meal throughout. The price seemed fair for the quality and service. One of the most delicious meals I have ever had.

What can I say about this place that hasn't been said? The food was amazing, the service was phenomenal, and the atmosphere was absolutely gorgeous.

I booked my reservation through Open Table. We showed up to our reservation roughly 15 minutes early. I gave the hostess my name and thus the amazing dining experience began.

I started off asking my waiter what he would recommend for a cocktail that I couldn't get anywhere else. He immediately recommended a drink that had bourbon in it. I'm not a bourbon fan, but I decided that I should give it a try. I cent remember the name of the drink, but it was the first one on the list of specialty cocktails. What I experienced next can only be described as an orgasm in my mouth. It was absolutely amazing. 

My dinner date and I shared two appetizers. We had the octopus, which was good but a bit flavorless, and the scallops. The scallops were unreal. Absolutely awesome. Also, he bread that they bring you with the baked cheese inside of it is great as well. For our second plate we shared a lobster spaghetti plate. Once again, phenomenal.

My dinner date had lamb and it was great. The meat absolutely melted in my mouth. I had some sea bass that was also very good.

Overall, for two appetizers, 3 drinks, a pasta plate, and two main courses, the meal was less than $200. We've been to Barelotta at the Wynn, and while this might not be the same caliber of food, the price comparison makes this place phenomenal.

This is Scott Conant's restaurant at Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas. The pasta, as one would expect from his restaurant, is great but so is the entire menu. That's why we usually have the tasting menu to see all the variety. Get it with the wine parings and experience the full range of cuisine.
The food was great, small portions and for non-organic food it was way overpriced. Our bus boy provided great service in contrast to our waiter. I tipped the bus boy. The desert was the best part.

My addiction started when my friend introduced me to their New York location 3 years ago. Since then, I am absolutely adamant about visiting every time I'm either in la, nyc or Vegas. I even planned a work event at the Vegas location because I love it so much!! 

I typically stay with the pastas on my visits because while the proteins are all solid, the pasta is something hard to get anywhere else. My absolute favorites are the spaghetti, short rib agnolotti, and polenta. I've had their prime  rib carpaccio and that is divine but I think was a unique special of the night. 

Until next time Scarpetta, I'll see you on my Yelp pages late at night during my next random craving. 

Love you Scott Conant.

Scarpetta is located in the Cosmopolitan in Vegas. My wife and I went to see Celine Dion (amazing btw) and headed here for dinner. As per usual in Vegas we were late after the show ( over 30 min) however they accommodated us very quickly on the Windows over looking the The fountains at Bellagio. The food was good, Italian, small plates. The desert was good and they had a good wine list. Pricy however it's Vegas. I would recommend this place next time you are in Vegas, great staff and great service.

This place is amazing.

Location isn't a huge factor to me.  As a local in Las Vegas, I avoid the strip when at all possible.  That being said, being sat at a window overlooking the Bellagio fountain show is a nice view to see (no matter how many times you have seen it.)

The server (Joe) was nice, funny, and informative.  He knew how to sell without selling.

First off, bread.  With a place called Scarpetta, you should expect great bread... which they have.  One of them has salami in it, and I was happy just eating that.  The bread came with olive oil, a tomato chutney-like sauce, and a pesto.  All were great, but the olive oil blew me away.  I enjoyed it so much, I bought a bottle.

Appetizers, I got the "creamy polenta" which turned out to be the creamiest polenta I have ever had.  It was served with mushrooms and was amazing.  My date had the roasted sea scallops.  The service size was a tad on the small size, but she seemed to enjoy it nonetheless.

Onto the Entrees.  I'm a Food Network addict, and saw Scarpetta while ago on "Best thing I ever ate" where they talked about the Spagetti with Tomatoes and Basil.  I had it, and it was good.  It wasn't the best pasta dish I have ever had, but a solid 8/10.  The pasta is fresh, and had a great texture to it.  The sauce was heavy on the basil (a good thing,) and there wasn't a ton of it weighing down the dish.  Next time I go, I'll try something different.

My date had the Duck and Foie Gras Ravoli.  She seemed to be very much enjoying it, and let me have a bite.  I then understood why Scott Conant is looked at as this great master of Italian cooking.  This dish was outstanding.  I might just get this next time I go.

Lastly came dessert.  I was informed there was no Tiramisu on the menu (my favorite Italian desert,) so we looked at the menu.  Our server recommended the Coconut Panna Cotta.  My date got that, and I got the Crispy Sweet Risotto Crepes.

The only downside to the meal, I would have to say is the Risotto Crepes.  It isn't that they were bad, it is just that they were more like Taquitos than crepes.  They were little rolled and fried pieces of batter with a sweet risotto in the middle of them.  For the amazing meal we had up to that point, it was a letdown.

My date's Panna Cotta, however, was fantastic.  It had that light and fresh taste that you want after eating a lot of pasta.

I will definitely be going back, I'll just get the Ravioli and Panna Cotta instead.

Was looking for a nice restaurant to eat at that was near to Vdara, good but not super pricey. This place fit the bill nicely. We had a 9:30pm reservation and was seated on time. The place was about 50% full. The service at the start was incredible but tapered off towards the end of the evening when they swapped out waiters on us. Wait staff however all very knowledgeable about the wine and the food. I started with Octopus which was delicious followed by the lobster pici. The pici was very nice indeed, tasty and pretty rich. The pasta itself was very dense and cooked al dente which took a little more effort to eat than perhaps it should have. It was a good size portion. I had a cheesecake for desert but at that point was too full to really appreciate it's intricate flavors. My wife started with the lobster salad which was also excellent followed by the Branzino, again delicious. Modern décor with a chilled yet sophisticated ambience. I wore a jacket but pretty sure you could dine here in a t-shirt if you wanted to. We dropped just over $300 for the evening including a modestly priced bottle of white wine. If this wasn't Vegas I would say it was not worth that kind of outlay. Seemed a little overpriced. But who knows.

I have been dying to try this restaurant for a while, hearing all About their special  spaghetti really had me hyped. Of course as soon as I got a reason for a celebration I choose Scarpetta. It was honestly underwhelming. I was expecting the food to be out of this world but unfortunately it was lacking in flavors.
