I got their butternut squash soup with lobster to start with and found the flavors to be very odd paired together. They were not complimentary to each other. We also got a steak which was good. Short rib pasta was great as well. Although very greasy. The service was great as expected from a 5 star rated restaurant. I liked the atmosphere. It was modern and seductive. Sadly, with so many Italian restaurants in town Scarpetta will not be the first on my list to visit.

First 5 star review of the year means it was that good, folks.
We had the filet mignon,veal chop (cooked medium plus), cauliflower and mushrooms. The flavors were incredible and well balanced.
Not to mention the portions were great for the price.
The views are amazing (ask to sit by window).
Ambience is romantic and sexy.
I would recommend you come here. It did not disappoint.

I was slightly disappointed with the food here.  From all the reviews I read, I thought that the pasta here was going to be exceptional. First off, let me state that the waiter I had was absolutely great and the view of the Bellagio and the fountains was fantastic as well.

Since none of the appetizers sounded appealing to me, I decided to order two pasta dishes.  I first ordered the spaghetti.  On the menu, it simply states "Spaghettti-tomato and basil."  As I started eating it, I realized that it was actually spicy and felt my lips burning.  Given that this is their signature dish, I expected to be blown away and I was not.  I feel that if the food is going to be spicy, they should let you know-this spaghetti certainly had more to it than simply tomato and basil.

The next dish I had was the Stracci-which was their seafood pasta dish that on the night I was there included crab, shrimp, and lobster.  The seafood was laid out on top of thin ribbons of black and yellow pasta.  While the seafood was tasty, I thought the dish was somewhat unimaginative.

Between these two pasta dishes and the bread that came out, which was fantastic, I was full and had to skip dessert.

Would I go back to Scarpetta?  Probably not, especially when considering there are so many fine restaurants in Las Vegas and the fact that with tax and tip, I spent close to $90 just for one person.  At the end of the day, I thought that the food was good but I just expected a bit more.

Superb service, great food. 
There are so many choices in Las Vegas it can be overwhelming. We wanted to try Scott Conant's Scarpetta because we had heard it was very good. We made reservations and arrived on time. They were just opening and we sat at the bar and had a drink. The bar is gorgeous and the bartender was very friendly. 
After we were seated and ordered drinks they brought us a really nice bread tray. I recommend the salami and cheese bread as the best of the bunch but everything in there was superb. The marscapone butter was a nice touch. 
I ordered the creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms for an app. Super dish, and creamy really does describe it. I could make a meal out of it. 
For my main course I had the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti which are like mini ravioli's. It was very rich and savory. The bread crumb crust on top was crispy and added some texture. Don't let the term bone marrow scare you it merely adds a depth of flavor. 
For dessert my wife had the flourless chocolate cake with homemade gelato. There was nothing wrong with my coconut panna cotta, a custard like dessert but after tasting her cake i wish I has ordered that as well. 
All in all a great meal at a reasonable price. I would definitely go there again on our next rip to LV.

Food was amazing as expected!  Coconut Panna Cotta with Guava was Devine.  Wine list was way overpriced, but it's Vegas right?  Still gets 5 stars because overpriced drinks in the newer Vegas spots at just the way it is!

I have dreamt about eating the spaghetti here for years. For years. And when that spaghetti and I finally met and dined together, it did not disappoint. The spaghetti noodles are cooked to an al dente. Rather than the spaghetti sauce poured on top, the noodles are simmered and cooked with simple sauce. The starch from the noodles holds onto the flavors bringing together the noodles and sauce. The spaghetti here is divine.

In addition to the spaghetti, our table also shared the creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms, the braised short ribs of beef, and the raw yellowtail. All of which were equally as good.

The service was subpar. Our table had to constantly flag our waiter down. For a fine dining establishment, I felt like we were jipped. On top of the inattentiveness, my friend encountered a shard of plastic/glass in her salad. Lemme tell you, whatever she bit into was hard. HARD. Everyone at the table felt it and indeed, the shard was tough and hard. We sent the dish back to the kitchen and the chef simply said that we were mistaken and that shard was actually just a piece of hard sea salt....uh. Okay. Clearly that piece of salt sea did not melt in my friend's mouth and it was HARD. Sea salt my ass.

The food is good, but go to the one in Beverly Hills. This place sucks. And maybe they cater toward out of towners who don't know any better, but for the vast majority- we know what fine dining should look and feel like and this certainly is not it.

Had dinner here by myself yesterday.  It's very elegant, I had a table with a view of the Bellagio.  I had the spaghetti, they were delicious. The wine selection is top-notch and the dessert (Strawberry souffle) was great. Service was also very good.

Duck foie gras ravioli.

Really, the review could start and end with just those four little words. I mean, really, what else do you need to know? You're going to sit down, you're going to order that, you're going to enjoy it because, believe it or not, it's better than it sounds. And you're going to leave a very happy person.

OK - I guess a little bit more is in order.

I've been here three times now, and not once have I been disappointed. But the absolute highlight has to be the dinner for my 40th birthday.

(Yes, I know - cliché to visit Vegas for one's 40th. Don't judge. It was a blast!)

In any event, we made a reservation for 10 of us. That managed to land us in one of their private rooms (which I didn't request, mind you) overlooking the Bellagio fountains. That right there was enough to make us all feel like rock stars. And, as an added bonus, we got to control the lighting and music volume in the room (I really don't like the music they play there, but it's easy enough to tune out.)

The service we received was absolutely impeccable. The waiter came along and explained the entire menu to us, calling out the highlights. We did an appetizer course of our own mix and match - just ordering a bunch of stuff off the menu, including the above mentioned duck foie gras ravioli so everyone could have a taste. For my entrée I wound up going with the lamb, which was out of this world spectacular - probably one of the top lamb dishes I've ever had.

The couple of little gripes I have - the wine menu is very expensive. I don't think there's much in the way of a bottle for under $80. The music (which I mentioned above).

Next time you're in Vegas and wanting a great dinner, this is an absolute must visit. It's a must visit for me every time I'm in Vegas.

Everyone raves about the views of the Bellagio fountains, but I didn't think that they were that great.  We got a great window table since my friend is in the Vegas business, but the view is more of a side-view.  Nothing spectacular.

And the food was just ok too.  I guess their specialty is the Stromboli that is included in the bread basket.  Meh.

And the rest of the dinner was pretty forgettable also.  The place has a nice vibe, but overall, I would say that I wouldn't go back.  They do stuff the tables and chairs in, so it's kind of cramped.

First off, I would have to say Scarpetta's service is impeccable.  If we could just rate our waiter alone, we would give him a 5 star rating!  He was knowledgeable, friendly, and humble.  I have seen far too many waiters in Vegas who don't care, or are extremely snooty because my husband and I look young even though we're not.  

As for the food, we order the scallops as the appetizer, and the duck and foie gras ravioli and the spaghetti as our entree.  For the scallops-I feel that it was good-but I have had better.  The duck and foie gras ravioli is their stand out dish!!  The wine reduction and marsala sauce on top of the ravioli made it so delicious.  The actual ravioli themselves are shaped like triangles.  I can tell there that is this delicacy to the outside when they were making it.  The duck and foie gras inside is very unique, and not like anything my husband and I have tasted before.  This dish deserves a 5 star.  Finally, for the spaghetti.  I was extremely excited to try this dish because I read all these reviews on yelp explaining that it was amazing.  However, we were a little disappointed maybe because we were expecting so much.  Don't get me wrong-the pasta is still good.  However, it's not the amazing that it was made out to be.

Overall, if I could give Scarpetta a 4 1/2 stars, I would.  My husband and I will definitely be back if when we go back to Vegas.

The final meal of our Vegas escapade was well spent at Scarpetta. It wasn't completely perfect but most of the night made up for the little missteps (we'll get to that later) so for the most part, I had nothing but a good time. Attentive service, rich indulgent food, all housed within an intimate space with gorgeous views of the Ballagio fountains, we closed our trip in pure hedonistic style.

We started with some of their signature cocktails as we browsed the menu. Upon the recommendation from our fantastic server, and the joys of libation, we decided on the tasting menu ($99) and accompanying wine pairing ($49) since several of the dishes that we wanted to try were on it anyway and boy did we pick right. That was the beginning of six courses of pure pleasure.

We started with a sashimi plate (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=YvhgCFf5CQSIopYC83uWwA) which consisted of yellowtail with a drizzle of ginger oil and red onions. The other half of the plate sat the tuna susci - tuna wrapped marinated vegetables. The fish was so fresh and the flavors were delicately balanced. The bread basket came shortly after and there was a nice selection including yummy foccacia and stromboli. As part of the tasting menu, the chef also threw in a couple of surprises and we were treated to a delightful seafood fritto misto for this course. Perfectly crispy fried but not oily, every bite was yummy and the rock shrimp just melted in my mouth.  

The next course was a perfectly roasted sea scallop. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=06QYvnXBie8HfTnYKN4OBw) It was a joy to eat and the velvety salmoriglio sauce was a nice accompaniment to the sweet and juicy scallop. The chef's extra this course was a polenta with a truffle mushroom stew. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=gtRWGpR4xggHmw0rVryaNw) For the record I hate cornmeal and thus hate grits, tamales, and polenta. Yet, I could not stop eating this polenta. The flavors of the mushroom stew combine with the impeccably smooth polenta. (I suspect there's a whole lot more butter in it than what Chef Scott Conant lets on) It was a nice double headliner with the scallop. 

Next up was the pasta course and Chef Conant's signature tomato & basil spaghetti. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=JQRLJQ4G8BgIzxS0bC8Bow) Fresh made pasta in a simple tomato basil (+ quarter stick of butter) sauce but just perfectly executed. While I thoroughly enjoyed it, the chef's extra this course, the short rib agnolotti with brown butter horseradish & toasted breadcrumb (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=wzfcOlEkTVylois628h_Ag), totally blew my mind. Wow who would have thought that the combination of short ribs, horseradish, and toasted breadcrumbs could be so sublime? I miss it already as I speak. 

The next course was the black cod. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=2TmOcEavT5T4aeu8J6ItRA) Again perfectly seared but wonderfully moist in the middle. The fatty fish absolutely stands out against the sauce and caramelized fennel. Delicious. The next entree course was a the duck breast. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=BR1FRH72URaVJtrhiq6w-A) While this was my least favorite dish of the night, it was still absolutely delicious which tells you the quality of the food all night. The orange and spices (I kept picking up 5 spice) worked well with gamy duck. All in all, a successful combination. 

Final course and dessert was a chocolate cake with toasted almond gelato and caramel. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0NmTwqYEQiKErDv4a55obg?select=uDi5aPZQgQwUQcGjVUkoSg) This is where I really had to throw in the towel after all that eating. The chocolate cake was really rich and decadent and I could only finish half of it but I just couldn't let the toasted almond gelato go to waste. It was just delicious. You can totally taste the toasted flavor. 

Now on to the kink of the night. Since we were seated by the wine cellar, the sommelier came by several times to retrieve bottles of wine. Each single time, he let the door hit me as I was eating without even acknowledging it, much less apologize. Not that it was a deal breaker but you expect a little more basic courtesy especially when you're dropping good money on dinner. 

Still for a wonderfully decadent meal paired with friendly and attentive service, we had a good time and I strongly recommend Scarpetta if you want to treat yourself to a fine meal on the strip.

Our party of 4 came to celebrate a friend's bday based on a recommendation. All reviewers who had previously mentioned about the great view of the Bellagio fountain is correct. Though, you'd get a much better view if you were a party of 2 seated right by the window, of course! 

Service was great! Our server gave great recommendations and the other wait staff were fantastic! They kept bringing basket after delicious basket of bread with that citrus-infused olive oil and refilled our drinks constantly!

We ordered the creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms to share, duck and foie gras ravioli, pan-seared escolar with sun chokes, American Wagyu rib cap and a lobster pasta  that was the daily special. The polenta was AMAZING!! We shared it but I was ready to order another for myself. The polenta itself was so fine that it added to its creaminess and then topped with the truffled mushroom sauce added to its heavenliness! All our entrees were delicious (as evidenced by the fact that nothing was left behind), except the  lobster pasta. While I enjoyed the fresh and sweet lobster and LOVE the freshly made chewiness of the pasta (think udon in terms of thickness), the combination together with the sauce was not incredibly tasty. It almost resembled a lobster bisque type sauce and I think it made the dish too "seafood-y." Hands down our table's favorite was the American Wagyu rib cap - WOW!!! The meat itself was incredibly tender and so divine that it just melted in your mouth. Even without the sauce reduction that accompanied it, the beef was naturally flavorful and worth its price tag. You don't get much but, you definitely get a phenomenal piece of meat! As for the ravioli, like others have mentioned, it was a bit on the salty side and even before our order, I mentioned it to our server and he gladly told us that the dish can be altered to fit our tastes. The escolar, not on the menu, was perfectly cooked and just as juicy and flaky as fish should be - delicious! 

Overall, the order came out to be a bit over $200 with 2 iced teas, 1 appetizer and 4 entrees. It was well worth the deliciousness that filled our bellies, the unique experience of being in such a gorgeous atmosphere and great service! I would visit again in a heart beat and save my $$$ for the next special occasion.
Very Impress with the wine sommelier he went out of his way to show us how fresh the Colorado Lamb was. Great place at a great price. If you like Pizza, Pasta and Lamb this place is worth the visit.

Excellent restaurant.  Rounding my 4.5 stars up to 5.

Sexy ambiance.  Lovely, low lighting and a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip.  

Absolutely beautiful service.  Our server and every runner and busser were friendly and classy.  Attentive but completely unobtrusive.  Perfect.

The delicious meal started with their bread basket.  All of the breads and accompaniments (mascarpone butter, citrus olive oil and caponata) were great, especially the Stromboli.  That was certainly a nice surprise!

We started with the Yellowtail which was well-seasoned.  I loved the little crystals of flavored salt.    My guy had the Stracci, a wide, flat pasta served with seafood.  Very delicious and simple.  I had the foie and duck ravioli which was pretty amazing.  Both dishes were very light on sauce, which I enjoyed.

The desserts were very good as well.  Man-friend had the chocolate cake with almond gelato.  Very tasty.  My mocha cheesecake was absolutely delicious.

Great restaurant for a sexy date.

Great ambience and food! The only thing holding me back from a 5-star review was our aloof server who never seemed to be present when we needed him, and when he was present, wasn't very interested in our dining experience. We started with the risotto balls and meatballs - fantastic!! Pizzas were tasty, as well as the pasta dishes. Prices were very reasonable and I'll definitely be back to try out the other dishes.

We went here for one of our dinners in Vegas this weekend. We were able to get a good reservation on a short notice, and were seated near the window overlooking the Bellagio fountain so that was a nice touch.

Server was extremely knowlegable and even shared some additional knowledge he had about the Sommelier. Turns out he is one of four master sommelier's in Las Vegas, and has his own vineyard. Nice guy to chat with.

Now the food... We started with the Yellowtail, moved on to the Black Farfalle, and ended with the Aged Sirloin. Yellowtail was awesome, though could have been sliced a little thicker. If you have never had Black Farfalle, I suggest getting it here. The server mentioned it would have a shelfish taste, but I didn't find it to be overwhelming, instead a nice balance. The Aged Sirloin came with perfectly prepared Gnocchi, which is a hard task seemingly for many chefs to pull off. But they did tonight! The Barolo Ragu was a perfect addition to bring the dish altogether.

The only thing I would say is the wine list was a tad overpriced in comparison to what I would expect from retail / dining out. So that is what made the 4th star come out. 

Definitely a great dining experience.

Romantic and Intimate, Scarpetta is definitely a date night spot... Not for a company dinner for twelve.

Since there were twelve of us, we were seated in a private room with a spectacular view of the Bellagio's fountain attraction.  As the sun went down, the room got really dark to a point where everyone was falling asleep...

The best way to describe the food here was "comforting".  The chef here definitely turns complicated Italian dishes to something very down-to-earth. My favorite dish of the night was the appetizer Scallops with Mushrooms.  The combination between the two was harmonious from taste to its texture.  My second favorite dish was Pancetta-wrapped veal loin.  I love veal, but I ordered this mainly for the side of sweetbread, peas and carrots.  I am HUGE on sweetbread since I have fallen in love with it at Animal in West LA.  Every since then, I have tried sweetbread whenever I see them on the menu, but this one was by far the WORST sweetbread side ever :(  The cripy frito misto appetizer was too salty and mushy.  Probably need higher heat to fry them...

I would definitely come back here again and try other dishes.  I have been here before and tried the duck and foie gras ravioli and black cod and they were both amazing!  The Aged sirloin beef here is very dry.

This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to. Delicious from start to finish.

Yummy cocktails, pea soup with rock shrimp, and beet salad. Then Kobe rib cap, short rib agnolotti, ox tail gemelli, and spaghetti pomodoro. All were amazing. That simple house made spaghetti was really fantastic. My son inhaled it! Great service too.

We would definitely return.
I have to say the food was amazing and the chef came to our table and took the time to talk to us. I would rate the service and food a 10/10 and would bring client or friends anytime..

Dined at Scarpetta for the 1st time.  Really enjoyable place.  It's dark and intimate so it's good for dates.  Had a view of the Bellagio Fountains bc we were seated at the window.  Very sophisticated decor.

Service (Luis) was very good. He seemed very passionate about food choices and pairings.   Very knowledgeable and personable.  

Their bread is served with  a nice trio of sauces.  We started with  beef carpaccio app.  Really good.  The combination they add on top really make it.  For entrees I had the octopus and shrimp risotto.  A bit of a kick to it so you won't have to add salt or pepper.  Great dish.   Wife had the cod.  Really creative presentation and she left her plate clean.

I do wish they had more wine selections by the glass.  Also, most of the meat dishes were really pricey.  

Nice night at Scarpetta..  Would definitely recommend.
Food is yummy! Free assorted bread is yum. Venue is dark and sexy. Perfect view of bellagio fountains. Service could be better though
Wasn't super impressed with this place at all. Food was just ok. Obi-ounce was insanely loud. I felt like I had to yell at my dinner companion. Not some where I'd come back. Great view thou!!!

Had an interesting experience at scarpettas last night. After doing a lot of research on the Internet, we made reservations there for our 21st anniversary. When we arrived we were told their kitchen was closed due to a "mishap" but we could order from an alternate menu. We were a little confused but decided to go ahead since we were all dressed up and ready to eat. Once we were seated and looking at the menu, we realized that they were serving food from their sister restaurant next door. We were very disappointed since we've read so many good things about their food on yelp.     Then they brought out a complimentary appetizer which was very good. Had the meal and then they brought us 2 delicious desserts, one had "happy anniversary" written in chocolate on the plate. Very nice. Then the big surprise came when the waiter informed us that the meal was on the house!!!  Totally unexpected! maybe the waiter sensed our dissappointment earlier in the evening, but we hadn't complained at all. 

So... I can't give an honest review of their food. However, the fact that they gave us our meal free says A LOT about how they feel about their customers. Very classy.  They made things right in a big way. 

As for ambience... Very classy, dark, contemporary and cool. They sat us by the window with a nice view of the bellagio fountains. 

Again, can't tell u about scarpettas food, but how can I not give them 5 stars when they treated my wife and I so well.

Where to begin...  I went here 2 weeks ago and let's just say from the start it was sub-par.  First, the restaurant is practically hidden on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan.  Trendy, loud hipsters abound, bad sign.  There is a tiny sign that you have to walk down a half corridor to see if this is indeed Scarpetta.

The hostest, why are they all idiots, sat us in a half circle booth behind a party of 8.  So much for the view of the Strip.  Then it got worse, every waiter, bus-boy, customer as they passed behind us used the back the booth as a rail.  Pat, pat, pat 6 inches behind my head.  Awesome!  The interior of the place is the cause of this bad layout.  Giant columns everywhere, wrapped in god-awful brown padding.

I got the waiter and told him we needed to move.  He scurried away to get the manager?!?  She came over and did move us, hence the extra 1/2 star.  She moved us to the window, so I got to see the Strip with a large drape in the way, that hadnt been dusted in forever.  

On to the food, achoo!  Yes I sneezed my way through the dust cloud from pushing drape out of the way.  The salads were good, we split a garden salad and an heirloom tomato salad.  Then I ordered duck & foie gras ravioli & my dining companion ordered the halibut wrapped in pancetta.  Oh Scott Conant, yea of pretty hair and arrogance, you can't cook pastas right!  It was over cooked.  Here is a hint, if all the raviolis stick together its over cooked.  If they are gummy and mushy its over cooked.  The halibut was dry, really dry, I mean damn I need a lot of water to eat this dish dry.  For dessert we split the donuts stuffed with vanilla cream or nutella, they were pretty good.  

The waiter was ok, he got his wine varietals mixed up and he had a Richie-Rich hair do, not kidding, that was humorous.  The bread guy is priceless, an old italian guy with good bread who should have been running the place.  He probably forgot more about pastas than Scotty-boy knows.

All in all a forgettable experience, unless you like overpriced, mediocre food.  The rest of these 4 star reviews I got to wonder about, I mean their fav thing was the bread so 4 stars?

Great dining experience. 
What I loved: duck, short rib appetizer, bread
What I liked: spaghetti, lobster salad, strip steak
What I meh'd: fois gras duck ravioli (super rich)

This, like so many other places in Toronto, is on the cusp of a 5 Star delight, but is knocked down a touch for price. So listen up folks, if you can afford it, this is where you ought to be. You'll be cheering from the rooftops (here, a gorgeous and city-best rooftop patio) about your meal.

We went with a group of 7. My GF and I showed up early and grabbed a drink at the bar. A delicious pinto grigio will set you back $17 which seems steep, but they don't serve glasses of wine here; rather carafes. Maybe a glass and a half worth of wine, so at $17 it was actually a fine price for a delicious drink. When our group all arrived we were quickly whisked to a beautiful round table. Floor to ceiling windows let light in from one side while the glow of a bajillion-bottle wine collection illuminated from the other. The noise level was great, with big groups at big tables all suitably spread out so that conversations did not overlap. The decor was great and apart from the fact that the bar looked more like a hotel lobby with a liquor license than an actual bar (it is, to be fair, a hotel lobby after all) it felt like a very swish and yet very warm joint. 

A wonderful selection of bread and dips came as we ordered and, courtesy of the house, we received unbelievable Creamy Polenta with Fricasse of Truffled Mushrooms which made my mind melt and my soul sing. For apps I had a great meat dish with cheese and oil, which I am not doing justice. For dinner Laura (the ol' GF there) ordered fois gras and duck ravioli which she immediately declared the best she had ever had (food-wise, I'm sure...) while I had the steak. The steak was well presented as two think slices stood on their ends, so you sliced down the grains as opposed to against them as you would regularly. I forget what else was on my plate to be honest, the steak really was the focal point, but it was overall a great dish and the steak was cooked just right.

We enjoyed a great cheese plate afterwards and settled up the bill to have a nightcap on the roof. Sadly there was some Mario Andretti party going on that night (you win again Andretti) so we couldn't head up, but the staff was very kind and apologetic and even without the beautiful view it was still a great night.

It's not a place to eat much more than once or twice a year (unless you're really rolling in it) but those one or two visits will stay with you for quite some time. Great, exciting, luxurious place that's sure to make the belly big, even if it makes the wallet skinny.

My girlfriends and I came here for a bachelorette party and we had such a great dinner here.  The service was phenomenal and the decor was so classy and glam.  I thoroughly loved my duck foir grois ravioli and the desserts were so gorgeously presented and delicious to boot.  I will be back!

While in Calgary on business last week, we met my customer for lunch at 500 Cucina...what a find!  I always drive through Inglewood and want to stop, but am usually in a taxi and on my way elsewhere.  Very modern place, lots of seating and a huge outdoor patio, and surprisingly pretty empty for lunch on a Tuesday.  I had the insalata misto salad, and took the waitress' suggestion to add prawns...probably some of the best shrimp I've ever had, perfectly cooked and super fresh, they were heaven on top of my light salad, that was dressed in a sweet balsamic vinaigrette.  And who doesn't love mozzarella cheese that tastes like it was made moments ago?  My customer had the caprese salad with prawns, and also enjoyed.  The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because the paninis came highly recommended, but the other two persons in my party just thought they were "good".  Regardless, I'm stopping in Inglewood every time I'm in Calgary from now on!  Oh, and my customer highly recommends all their pizza too!

What a GEM! I am in L O V E. 

I'm gonna give you the play by play... but really all you need to know is to JUST GO.

Appetizer:
Heirloom tomato and burrata salad. Sounds typical, and honestly not terrifically unique, but it was done well. Perfectly ripe tomatoes with the creamiest burrata. Microgreens on top added just the right balance of herby bite.

Pastas:
SPAGHETTI. HOLY MOLY. Who knew that some plain spaghetti could have such nuanced and delicious flavors. I looked up the recipe online as soon as I got back to my hotel because you know this is making an appearance ASAP at home.

Pici with pesto and lobster. Very solid. I don't think this is an attempt-at-home pasta. It was excellent though.

Short rib agnolotti. Solid choice. Very flavorful.

For all the pastas, they were cooked PERFECTLY. Spaghetti really stole the show though.

Entree:
I had the fennel dusted cod. Honestly I was already getting pretty full by then... so I don't think I enjoyed it as much as I would have without the pasta binge. However, it was cooked perfectly and the first few bites were delectable. I actually couldn't finish because after our shared app and pastas, I was already getting full. The accompanying veg were also expertly cooked and paired well with the fatty fish.

Everyone else opted for the duck, veal, and filet. Meat eaters I guess.

Desserts:
PANNA COTTA. This was the second recipe I researched as soon as I got home. I am SO EXCITED to make this. Hawaii is my favorite place on earth and this is just hawaii in your mouth. Silky, smooth, and perfect.  Coconut, guava... so so tasty.

Chocolate souffle. I'm not the biggest souffle fan, but even I can appreciate the technical skill and mastery that went into the baking of our souffle. It came with a spiced choco sauce and cookie dough bites and fancy buncha crunch. It was delicious, just not my favorite.

I also had a perfectly crafted cappuccino. 

In short.... can't wait to try the bev hills location.

I came here with a group of vendors for dinner and we were not disappointed.  We started out with some of their signature cocktails which were good, I didn't have any of them, I'm a vodka soda kind of girl so I can't comment on the quality or taste of their drinks.  We also had an amazing bottle of italian red wine that complimented our meal perfectly.  The bread was fantastic...not only did we have different dips (marscapone butter, olive oil and eggplant tapaenade) but they also included meat and cheese stromboli!  Delicious!  

For dinner I coudln't decide so my friend and I shared the proscuitto wrapped veal loin and duck and foie gras ravioli.  The veal was good and the sauce was delicious.  The ravioli was the winner for me though, great combo of duck and fatty foie gras and the sauce of balsamic complimented it well.  For dessert I tried a bite of the blue cheese with dried fruit preserves and that was excellent as well.  

All in all and enjoyable meal and I would go back again.

Pleasantly surprised to dine at strip Italian restaurant that serves some REALLY GOOD Italian food. Even better when you get to see bellagio fountains as you devour awesome food.
We were started off with their signature bread basket with an assortment of 4 types of bread. The focaccia and ciabatta were my fav and my husband loved the broccoli mozzarella bread. Served with butter, olive oil and eggplant tapenade. 
They don't have a kids menu but have 2 pastas on the menu spaghetti in red sauce and another pasta in white sauce that kids can enjoy. Priced around $27-$30 pretty pricy for kids and portions are enough for a 9 year old. We ordered filet of beef which was by far one the best in town. My husband had the black cod which was delish and I had the raviolini served with Parmesan broth and truffle ricotta, so AWESOME and perfect temperature. Never had anything quite like this! So yummy!! 
It was a busy Sunday night and I only saw 2 servers and a lady who took care of water and dishes, stefania who was so sweet,  and a bread server. 
They do have a sommelier on site and he is very helpful with wine selections. Wine by the bottle is pricy, mostly all over $100 and very few in the $60s range. We decided to do wine by glass and they are all priced at $15 and up. I had a glass of prosecco $16, husband started with Pinot Noir $19 and then Chianti $15. 
Corkage fee is $35 as long as you don't bring a wine on their wine list. I would highly recommend bring your own bottle and pay the $35 coz their sparkling and white wine selection is pretty limited. 
For dessert we ordered tiramisu  $11, which was too good! Served with dark chocolate Scarpetta cookies, so yummy. Pic attached.
This is a pricy place, you are looking at $75 plus Per person but well worth the food and ambiance.

Very happy we came here. Nice seat facing Bellagio fountains. Started with the crispy fritto like - a fried julienned mix of zucchini and squid. For those opposed to squid or seafood this may be a nice introduction. Hubby ordered the veal chop. It was stellar- the grill flavor, tender all the way through and that can be iffy with veal. I had the spaghetti- what a simple dish, right? But the fresh ingredients with the perfect al dente of the pasta, highly recommended. Finished with , embarrassing forgot the name ! I would say nutella filled donuts. Given our seat I understand and appreciate the low light in that the Bellagio fountains are the star here. Yet it was a tad dark to my personal taste- or maybe I was just in a mood that night.
Super....great food....Super service...will def.be returning for a super meal...and they pour a great drink...don't miss it

Very good restaurant, but slow service and bland taste keeps from being great. Group of 10, had 2-3 waiters sho had trouble remembering to come back and take care of us. We ordered a variety of steaks, pork chops, and duck, and the food was good and prepared to order, but the flavor was noticeably lacking. The most flavorful item we had was the side dish of homemade pasta. That is a sad statement considering that is a side dish on a fairly robust menu. I personally had the duck and while it was cooked properly it was just a very tough piece of meat. I truly wanted to like this place, but being raised Italian I would call it Italian only by name. The bread was like Cracker Barrel biscuits and the olive oil was thin and unflavorful.  I'm not sure we would go back, perhaps only in a pinch.

I wanted so badly to try this place after I watched Scott Conant make his famous spaghetti on Food Network. We made reservations and were seated next to a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The service was great and my husband's fettuccine with veal ragu was outstanding. I got the famous spaghetti with tomato-basil sauce and the noodles lived up to the hype - the most amazing pasta texture I've ever experienced. The sauce, however, was disappointing. Watching it being made I expected a fresh tasting tomato-basil sauce. What I received was an overly salted tomato sauce with no visible signs of basil that sadly reminded me of the sauce you get with spaghetti-o's (albeit not as sweet).

Terrific dining experience on the strip! Service and food were excellent. They sat us at a table with a breathtaking view of the Bellagio's fountains next door and the northside of the strip - what a great way to get us to stay longer and spend more $$$ 

My wife and I ordered split plates (which they were happy to do - as elegantly as if you had ordered individual plates) which allowed us to try several dishes and still have room for desert. Their selection of freshly baked breads was delicious and included focaccia and other assorted Italian breads. Since this was our first time dining here, we played it pretty safe with our selections. We shared the roasted beat salad, burrata, duck & foie gras ravioli, and sirloin. For dessert: we shared an italian version of a beignet the name of which I can't remember. It was served a la mode and it was delish. 

All in all, I can't wait to return to try some of the more intriguing items on the menu.
One of the most amazing meals I've ever had. The bread basket alone was fantastic but we also ordered the spaghetti and pici. It's a good thing I live in Atlanta or I might frequent Scarpetta weekly.

Hate to do this but here goes:

Fave chef, perfection in Manhattan, many missteps in Vegas, who would have guessed. 

Severe drop off In service, and cook execution. Way overly salty, server promised to die for for pasta and steak specials total $140 that were complete salt and meat uncutable by knife.

Meal comped, let me say if you have been to the Manhattan restaurant don't bother here. 

Scott is The best but obviously cannot reign his tight control over his new ever growing empire. I thought he was better than this but everyone has their price.....

Great restaurant.  Beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains and they hold back the seats nearest the windows for couples, making for a romantic setting.  The staff was professional and helpful, especially the manager.  Decent wine selection for individual glasses.  I had the Pici, a pasta with perfectly cooked lobster that was tasty.  Apps were good; I had the scallops and my wife had an asparagus soup that was light and creamy.
The highlight of the evening was the Ricotta and Truffle Agnolitta! The most perfect, light and tasty pasta ever made.  If you eat nothing else in Vegas... try that.

My boyfriend and I came to Scarpetta for my birthday and it was a wonderful experience. If you're cheap don't bother with this place because you won't appreciate all of the ingredients and love put into the dishes.  We had a view of the Bellagio fountains and it was amazing! I had a pasta dish with fresh veggies and this sauce that was delicious. The pasta was homemade, so It had a smooth buttery taste to it. Overall great food and a great dining experience.

Creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms is to DIE for!!! In fact, if it were (one of) the last thing(s) I ate, I could die happy. Exquisite flavor and display. Just love how every dish comes out with a dome cover and when ready to serve, the food is unveiled. Gets me giddy with joy every time!

Leftovers for lunch yesterday, basically pasta all mashed together in a tupperware bowl, nuked into a hot mess. Didn't have a fork, but ended up using 2 plastic knives as chopsticks to eat at my desk in front of my computer while I worked. First bite I had,  first thought was, "OMG!!! This is the worse pasta I have ever eaten in my life!  I can't believe I'm eating this!"  Then I proceeded to eat half of it, constantly thinking, "WHY AM I EATING THIS!!?!?!" before I finally throw the rest of the contents away in disgust.  Why write about this experience?  Because throughout that experience, I kept thinking of the best pasta I had ever eaten which was the spaghetti at Scarpetta.  The texture, consistency, taste, and bite of the pasta was AMAZING!  The sauce was awesome, had a little bit of a kick to it.  I have to admit I have had better sauce, just barely, but that's because I really like a lot of garlic in my sauce, but the combination of the sauce and the spaghetti was incredible.  The rest of the meal was very good, the tomatoes & burrata dish, short ribs, polenta with truffles and assorted mushrooms, black cod with roasted tomatoes and fennel, coconut pannacotta, and crème brule were all excellent, but that pasta kicked this restaurant up another notch.  If you make reservations, ask for a window seat since we had an amazing view of the water show at the Venetian.

There was a lot of pomp and circumstance regarding Scott Conant's Scarpetta restaurant in Toronto before it opened. First there was the new Thompson Hotel and then of course there had to be a signature restaurant befitting such a hotel. So, I was very excited to try Scarpetta upon an invite for a girlfriend's birthday event. 

Intro. Never having been to the Thompson hotel before, I was expecting modern, edgy, chique boutique very much like the Delano or Tides of South Beach. 

Friday night. Where was the entrance to the hotel? Where were the valet people? I didn't notice so no problem. I was late anyways and in a rush. I found the entrance to the hotel and there was no one to open the doors for me...is this a first class hotel? The lobby is filled with side-cap boys and baggy jeans. This is Thompson Hotel right? There were two ladies behind desks which I assumed was the check-in area so I asked them where Scarpetta was. One responded "to the left, walk a little bit and its at the end." I passed through what appeared to be the lounge/drinks area, and voila, I entered Scarpetta. 

Food. Isn't it funny that the one thing I remember the most was the tuna tar-tare with olive oil, salt, and greens. It was very yummy. The rest of the meal was entirely forgettable. To be fair, my girl friends and I did not try the pasta dishes which apparently is what Scarpetta is known for. I had the trout (yummy, but I can have trout anywhere) and my other two girl friends had meat. I asked them how it was and they responded good, but nothing spectacular. 

Ambiance. At first, the restaurant was quite quiet, but as it got later, the noise level increased. As we exited the restaurant, we entered the lounge/drinks area and it was packed. There were people standing and drinking and it almost looked like a club! I could not fathom how proper conversations could ensue in such noice, but meh, who cares about words...bring on the Veuve right? 

My girlfriends and I decided to explore the hotel a bit, and the lobby was full of younger looking girls dressed in clothes that showed too much. I felt like I was in high school again. 

Scarpetta is a restaurant where you would go to if you happened to be in the area. Food is good, but its nothing special. I would not go out of my way to eat at Scarpetta's. Next please.

Had a lovely dinner on our last night in Vegas.  We would have given this place 5 stars but our main course and dessert weren't as good as our salad and pasta courses.

My husband and I were happy that we could share each course so that we could try a few things without feeling stuffed. I highly recommend the polenta and short rib angiolotti as appetizer and pasta courses. The polenta was smooth and creamy and the angiolotti was heavenly! The trio of lamb was so-so and might have been better if just the lamb chop was served. 

Our server was very attentive and we would definitely recommend coming for good food, service and a beautiful view of the bellagio fountains!

First Impressions: Classy, classy, classy! Scarpetta is located on the 3rd floor in the Cosmo and everything about this restaurant screams class. 

My reservation for Scarpetta was for 1/1/2014 at 7:30 pm. The actual reservation was made about a week prior and I had put in a request to be seated with a view of the Bellagio fountain show. Upon arrival, the hostess said they had tried their best to accommodate my request but that we would be seated one row away from the window view of the fountains. Nevertheless, I appreciate the honesty and their earnest efforts. 

The service was impeccable and up to the standards of a Scott Conant restaurant. My bf and I were seated and presented with the menus immediately. Our waters were filled and a wine menu was brought to the table. My bf decided to order the duck and foie gras ravioli with marsala reduction ($27) and I ordered the endive and apple salad with heirloom beets, gorgonzola cheese and candied walnuts ($17). 

Once our orders were placed, the breadbasket was brought out. I truly appreciated the attention placed into informing the patrons on the different types of breads and dips. It was helpful because now I knew exactly what types of gourmet breads we would be feasting on! From what I can recall, I remember a small ciabatta, a piece of foccacia, and two breads with mozzarella and salami baked in. The breads were warm, and enclosed in a cloth napkin with another piece of traditional Italian bread placed atop it. The bread basket was divine and each piece of bread paired nicely with the soft, spreadable butter, salty eggplant spread and the citrus-infused olive oil dip. As a matter of fact, the bread was so good that I asked the server for another basket and that was brought out--only to be devoured again! 

As for the entrees, the presentation was extremely beautiful for both dishes. The foie gras was plated on the plate with the marsala reduction drizzled beautifully over the top. The ravioli was plentiful and this surprised my bf since he was only expecting a handful of ravioli. My endive and beet salad was truly one of the most beautiful salads I've ever seen. The endives were sliced thinly and the bitter after taste of the endives paired quite nicely with the sweetness of the beets, apples and candied walnuts while the salty gorgonzola cheese bits added the necessary salty punch to the sweet and bitter. 

The ambience was romantic, dim and quiet. My bf and I really enjoyed dinner that night. The overall price may not be cheap but for the quality of the food, it was well justified.
 
Bottom line: I would return for that breadbasket alone!

We got last minute reservations and were surprised to get a table for 2 at 7:30.  We were even more surprised being seated at a table that overlooked the Bellagio fountains.  Terrific view.

The bread basket was great, but the stromboli bread full of meat and cheese was amazing.  Worth it just for that.  Wife started with the creamy polenta - 5 hour cooked polenta with mushroom and truffle sauce, each served in their own pot, whilst the sauce is meant to be spooned over the polenta.  Very good, not as truffly as we both expected.  I got a very pretty beet salad with homemade mozzarella.

Agnolotti and spaghetti for our Primi courses.  As good as the other reviews say.  Extremely rich.  Black Cod for Secondi that was not quite as memorable as the pasta or bread.  Could have skipped this.

Highly recommend.  Best service, best ambiance of our stay.

Came to Vegas for the weekend to celebrate my birthday. Came here with a group of friends who lives in Vegas. We got the private room that overlooks the Bellagio water fountain. I was impress with the view, decor and service. I got the foie gras ravioli and it was amazing! Ravioli was perfectly cooked, foie gras filling was not too overwhelming, sauce was well balanced and complimented the dish very well.  Sommelier Kyle was very helpful in helping us decide on a nice bottle of wine to go with our dish. Staff was very patient and attentive with us especially because a few friends were running late.  I didn't feel rushed to put in an order. It was a nice relaxing evening catching up with some old friends.

I chose this restaurant because I was looking for a place where 5 large business men (my bro-in-law is here for a conference), my sister and I could all eat and be happy. I was a little worried because I'm vegan and they are very big meat eaters and they are super fancy with a lot of money. 

This restaurant could not have been NICER! we ended up doing the tasting menu for the table and they did a whole separate tasting for me (without making a big deal out of it which I REALLY appreciated). My food was so incredible and I didn't feel like an outcast. I can't tell you how grateful I am and was. 

This place has an incredible view of the Bellagio fountain and all the food is outstanding. The service was wonderful, super accommodating and had a really mellow, positive and professional energy. I loved it and I will 100% come back and recommend to anyone.

We have been here before and typically enjoyed our dinner, however this time was certainly different. Garvin tried to be attentive, however it was clear that if we weren't going to spend a certain amount we were not ok from his perspective regardless of who ordered what. We also had to ask for more bread twice. Despite my husband and I ordering a fair amount and asking for our friend's name to be spelled correctly on her dessert for her birthday party (showing Garvin how it was spelled) it was incorrect and disappointing. On top of that, the waiter hit me in the head with the plate as he served the table behind us. Really?? Conant we had more stringent expectations of your staff.....

Our 10th Anniversary/Valentine's Day celebration dinner was perfect, thanks to our wonderful meal at Scarpetta Tuesday night.  I made a reservation at Scarpetta for Valentine's Day based on great reviews, a great Chef running the place, and the fact it wasn't overly pricey.  I am so glad I choose this gem!  The restaurant decor is so lovely and romantic.  We were sat next to the window overlooking the Belagio fountains... how perfect!  My Husband's view was somewhat blocked, but we really enjoyed the atmosphere.

The food is great.  We absolutely LOVED the bread basket with dipping sauces.  Each was great in their own way, but the butter and eggplant was awesome.  The stromboli (included in the bread basket) was literally to die for.  We shared the short rib appetizer, which was small, but tasty.  This was our least favorite thing we ate, but it was still really good.  For our entree we shared the duck and foie gras ravioli.... it took my breath away!  It was so rich and delicious- I will be thinking about this one for awhile.  For dessert we had the zeppolis, which were a great way to end a fabulous meal.

We loved this restaurant and love the vibe in the cosmopolitan.  We'll be back for sure!

This is a review for their social hour, which is 5;30-7 M-Thurs. It is a perfect place for a drink and good quality quick bites before a show--everything on the menu, including cocktails, is $7, which was a spectacular deal, especially for the location. We ordered the truffled polenta, which was rich and full of umami flavor. 
-fritto misto was tasty, has shrimp and squid in it as well as veggies and lemon
-arancini were crisp and flavorful
-short rib agnolotti had good amounts of beef in there so you could really taste it, but they were a bit oily

A big treat was complimentary house-made potato chips that were still warm. You get a big bowl of them! 

It's a nice way to be able to sample several dishes from the regular dinner menu, and service was excellent.

We arrived at our reservation on time and were seated promptly. The restaurant has nice views of the Bellagio fountains. 

The meal started with their freshly baked bread and spreads which were divine. We started with the beef tartare and the polenta. Tartare, very fresh. The polenta, honestly, some of the best I've had. So cheesy!! I would come back for this dish alone! For my entree, I got the pasta with lobster. The dish, when brought out I thought was on the small side, but once I took a bite, I understood why. Extremely rich. A little too rich for my tastebuds. I actually couldn't finish it, which doesn't happen often. Delicious, but just too rich. Dessert, we ordered the bombolini that were filled with either vanilla or chocolate filling. Highly recommend these. Also ordered the chocolate cake, good, but I'm not the biggest chocolate cake fan. My brother-in-law who loves chocolate loved the cake. 

Good service and food with gorgeous views.

A lot of ups and downs for us on our stop here!

As per yelp, we requested a view of the Bellagio fountains.  Absolutely gorgeous!  However, there is a horizontal opaque support bar right at eye level if you're 6'0, so you have to duck or stand up a little bit to actually look out the window.

Service was great as you would expect at any nice Vegas restaurant.

Appetizers were delicious!  We had the scallops and the polenta per our waiter's recommendations.  Among the best you can ever find among appetizers.

Our entrees were a different story.  I don't feel the spaghetti was that special.  A former reviewer referenced "Asian hand-pulled noodles" and was dead on.  Any quality housemade noodle will taste like this, and it is very basically seasoned.  Not quite a great entree in itself, especially a meatless dish for a carnivore like myself.

The lady got foie gras ravioli, as she is a foie gras FIEND.  However, even this dish came out a little salty with only a hint of foie gras detected.  The pasta was still good.

Maybe our expectations were too high after the appetizers.

We also didn't get any wine, though I heard the wine list is fabulous.

The price is very reasonable too.  We'd probably come back.  Well, there are a lot of places to try in Vegas, so maybe not.

Really didn't expect to order a steak here.  Yet had one of the best bone in ribeyes I've ever had anywhere (was a special).  Was 24 oz of amazingness.  Ate at SW steakhouse the night before ... And this blew it away (also had their bone in).  

Went with my girlfriend and also wanted to sit by the window for a great view.  They accommodated.  Service was solid and they tossed in a free dessert (not sure why...said "congrats" on it....but we never told them we were celebrating anything).  

All in all, a great experience and meal.

We had the most amazing time here! While in Vegas, for my bachelorette party, we called the day of for reservations and they were able to accommodate. They even sat us in a private room in the back of the restaurant with views of the Bellagio fountains. Our waiter was fantastic! He recommended the best wine and had great suggestions for food. Everything came out timely and he made sure our glasses were full. After dinner, they brought out a desert plate that had "congratulations" written on it. Above and beyond! Going to Mora Italian in Phoenix next week, also owned by Scott Conant, and I cannot wait! Thanks for such an unforgettable dinner!

A fantastic dining experience. The staff was attentive an knowledgeable. The view was wonderful and included the Vegas skyline, plenty of greenery and the periodic excitement of the Bellagio fountain show. The food was memorable from the bread basket to dessert and everything in between. The spaghetti is as good as you've heard and the creme brulee napoleon was stunning.  More accessible and less intimidating menu than some of the other top tier restaurants in Las Vegas, but the food and service is every bit as good. Can't miss with Scarpetta, I will go back for seconds.

Scarpetta has amazing food and is in a great location with nice views. 

The yellowtail and polenta appetizers were both delicious with the yellowtail being slightly better.

The short rib agnolloti and the duck and foie gras ravioli were two amazing pastas that are very unique to the restaurant.

The entrees did not live up to the first two courses but the baby goat was satisfying. I wouldn't recommend the halibut.

The head chef Scott Conant was in the restaurant which is very rare for Vegas. When you head to this restaurant stick mostly with the pastas and appetizers and you will have a unique and enjoyable dining experience.
Squid ink pasta with seafood and tobiko was so decadent and good for the soul . Branzino was also cooked perfectly. Chocolate soufflé was good but not great

We had a wedding reception at the end of May 2018. Therefore, my review is based on private dining. We had the Vino Room booked. There is a maximum seating capacity of 30 I believe and a minimum spend that must be met in food and beverage. There was 24 of us and two long tables were set up. We weren't crowded and had the right amount of room for us. Our menu was one we chose ahead of time and served family style except for our main which we chose there but served individually. We had a dedicated server by the name of Luis and he was amazing. Very attentive and always making sure dishes were cleared, water was filled, and drinks were topped up. Our starters were scallops, burrata salad and a wild mushroom truffled polenta. The scallops were cooked to perfection and fresh tasting, burrata salad was refreshing and the polenta was creamy and light tasting.  The pasta selection we had was tomatoe basil spaghetti, foie grois ravioli, and short rib angliotti. The tomatoe spaghetti was one of our favourite, the foie grois ravioli and the angliotti were also very good. I chose as a main black cod. It was so moist, flaky and cooked perfectly. I tried the tenderloin beef. So flavourful and tender. I wish I could've had more. The deserts were all good.

Service: Top notch
Food: Great
Ambiance: Great

Sat myself at the bar area. Very small awkward area with the little tables next to the bar, would be pissed if someone sat me there. A very nice dude named Nikolai welcomed me with a smile and gave me a menu. Immediately decided between the Spiced Duck Breast and the Short Rib Agnolotti. Nikolai the bartender/server suggested the..

SHORT RIB AGNOLOTTI
brown butter horseradish & toasted breadcrumb $25

If the restaurant wasn't a fancy one, I would have licked my plate. My only complaint is there was not a large helping and I would have liked a little more food (when dont I want more food?).

Drank two San Remo's (fruity.. yum!) and a Billionaire (too citrus-y.. eh and I really like citrus-y things).

Service was good, my drink was always full and the bread was good. I'd recommend reservations highly, the dining room area seats about 100 people. Some of the tables even have a view of the Bellagio water fountains.. cooooool. Will definately have to be back for a full dinner one night (and not when I'm just trying to get something in my stomach before I drink alot of booze at the Blvd Pool).

After 3 drinks and my entree bill was $73 before tip.

My favorite thing at Scarpetta is the meat bread and it's not even something you order! I came here with a big group of girls as part of a bachelorette weekend. The ambiance is very classy and the service is impeccable. I ordered the pici pasta -- amazing! Since then, I've heard that the dish they're known for is the spaghetti, so I'll have to try it sometime when I get the chance.

-L.

Amazing experience!! Started with a couple cocktails at the very hip/swanky bar. Was led to our table by a stunning hostess. We overlooked the Bellagio fountains, by far one of the best veiws in Vegas. 

We took our seats and were greeted by a very friendly server who offered great suggestions and answered all of our food questions. 

 We looked thru the wine list and decided to ask for a somm to guide us. A smartly dressed younger gentleman came to our table and convinced us to try something new and interesting. It was a little more then I usually spend but decided to trust him. I have to say he really nailed it! Amazing wine, we wound up buying another bottle half way thru our meal!

Speaking of the meal....spectacular!! Perfectly cooked pasta, my duck was incredible. The service through out was impressive to say the least. The best I've had in Vegas in quite a long time. We will be back again for sure!

I love Scarpetta :)

The spaghetti there is delicious. I ran into Scott Conant at the South Beach Food & Wine Festival and he insisted I try out his restaurant. I'm glad I did. When I lived in Miami I frequented the Scarpetta in the Fontainebleau. The bars in the Miami Scarpetta v the Vegas Scarpetta are very similar. I like the layout of the Vegas Scarpetta better but the views of the two restaurants are the same. Miami overlooks the Fontainebleau pool area and water and Vegas overlooks the Bellagio fountains. The most recent visit to the Vegas Scarpetta was my favorite. One of the specials that night was a black truffle pasta. AMAZING. It was so delicious and filling, total comfort food. Granted it was a $60 (small, probably nutrionally not good for my figure) bowl of pasta but worth every penny (and bite).

Of course service was spot on and the house Riesling was great.

I was planning on giving it 2 stars but decided to give it 3 since the manager was so apologetic and assured me that my concerns would be taken care of. 

SERVICE: 1 star
FOOD: 4 Stars
Drinks: 3 Stars
Dessert: 1 Star
Atmosphere: 4 Stars

OVERALL: 2.6 

SERVICE: 
Our server Micheal was very condescending...I don't speak Italian so don't get upset when your table asks you what an Italian word on the menu means. He forgot our second bread basket... I had to ask 3 times for it (they have amazing bread lol) and when we asked if they do anything for birthdays he gave us a look that was like "really?". Terrible service and if I'm going to pay $50-$60 for a meal, I should receive great service. At the end of our meal we ordered coffee. I worked at a coffee shop for 5 years and was hoping they knew how to make my drink. They didn't which was fine but the server was so disgusted by my order which I thought was kinda funny. It's a Cortado which is equal parts espresso & equal parts steamed milk. Not that complicated. It's similar to a macchiato but it's not a macchiato. So he brought out a macchiato... cool

FOOD: 
- Bread 5 STARS: So good we asked for TWO baskets! Their bread baskets had a variety of bread with Sourdough, Ciabatta, some kind of bread with salami (I think it was salami) and cheese, and one other kind that I didn't get to try. 

- Colorado Lamb 3.5 STARS : I had the lamb...this one was a little disappointing. I've had way better lamb from another high end restaurant and paid half as much. I ordered it medium well and they gave it to me with a lot of pink left. It was also VERY FATTY... not a fan of fatty meats. There was also a piece of foil left on my meat from how they cooked it. 

- Filet of Beef: 5 STARS- my friend ordered this bad boy. It was cooked to perfection!!! I wish I ordered that! I honestly can't say much about it since it wasn't my meal. I had a little taste though. My friend loved it and said it was some of the best steak he's ever had. 

- Raviolini 4 STARS - the vegetarian of the group ordered this. She loved it so much that she finished it before I could ask for a bite! She said 4 Stars because it was such a small quantity and she's had better before. Feel free to disregard this part since I didn't try it. 

DESSERT... 
This was a joke it was so disrespectful that I wish they never brought it out. I didn't even eat it I just left it. They said "oh yeah let me bring the bday boy a special treat." They might as well have slapped me in the face lol look at the pics and you'll see what I'm talking about. 

DRINKS: 
Way too strong and way too expensive. We ordered a gin and tonic along with a vodka cranberry. Both of them must have been at least 50% alcohol lol. I like to enjoy my drinks... we kinda had to just power through them lol. We also ordered some coffee which was whatever honestly. Their average bottle of wine cost anywhere from 120-200 a glass of their cheap Chianti cost 15. I expected expensive but not THAT expensive. Corking fee is $50 so bring your own bottle. 

Atmosphere:
Super cute and super romantic. We even had a view of the Bellagio fountains! The only drawback was how dark the lighting was. Waaaay to dark. We sat by the wall of wine which was really aesthetically pleasing but also annoying because we had employees grabbing bottles from the wall. In order to get a bottle they had to squeeze in between us and the wall. That happened about 5-6 times while we were there.
The fois gras ravioli are as good as they sound. The ambience is a bit strange, but the food more than makes up for it and the service is very attentive.

5 star restaurant!! Just left this place and cant stop talking about how good it was. Starting with the service which was beyond excellent to the gourmet food and the delicious desserts. Enjoyed every minute of it!! If you are staying at the cosmo or happen to be in the area make sure you visit this amazing restaurant.

So let's begin....Jason was our server at table 65 on May 21, 2017 for a 945 reservation. I had to ask him if there were any specials(which there was 1) and never stopped once to asked us how our food was. I ordered a cappuccino that never came. How can I remind him if he never came by?!!!!  It's not about the food, it's about customer service. We had appetizers and food in less than an hour.

Phenomenal restaurant. I've had the pleasure to dine at some pretty great places around the country and this was in the top 5. 

Let's start with the food. Delicious. Basically perfect. One down side - they were not offering the tasting menu the evening I was there. As a fan of tasting menus (especially with wine pairings!) this was disappointing. Anyway, as others have mentioned, the bread is great. We also started with the short rib risotto appetizer as well as the fritto misto. Both were delightful. As far as the entrees - myself and my 3 dining partners all got pasta. The spaghetti (again, as many other reviewers have commented on) was wonderful. I don't think I've EVER ordered spaghetti at a restaurant and probably wouldn't had I not read the rave reviews on yelp (though the waiter did highly recommend it). It was simple yet extremely tasty. The only gripe I have is it seemed a little overpriced given the minimalistic dish (~$24) but was fair given the prices of other dishes on the menu. We also tried the duck and foie gras ravioli which was rich and delicious. The beef short rib pasta was also very good, though a little too horseradishy for my taste. 

The food would've earned the restaurant 5 stars in my book regardless, but the service made the experience one of a kind. Maybe the waiter has the same "routine" for everyone, but who cares? He was attentive, friendly, professional but not at all annoying. 

The only bad part about the night is I didn't get to try dessert (too full)!

My husband and I just went to Scarpetta the other night.  The food, overall, was delicious.  The service was ok.  The bread didn't come out until the appetizers which is a huge pet peeve, but whatever.  The big problem was the portion size.  My tiny little turbot cost $38.  My husband's chicken was half a breast at best.  $250 later, we ended up going to Secret Pizza at the Cosmo for a slice after our dinner at Scarpetta.  Secret Pizza, on the other hand, I highly recommend.

I mangia'd molto bene at Scarpetta during my most recent trip to the Strip.  The ambiance at this sophistocated Cosmopolitan restaurant is very sexy, and we were fortunate enough to be seated by the huge picture window with views of the Bellagio fountains spraying in the background.  To enjoy your meal at Scarpetta as I did, follow these instructions and thank me later:

1) Start of with a glass of Gosset.  There aren't many wines by the glass to choose from on the menu, but a glass of Gosset (even if it'll set you back $20 for a singular champagne flute of this nectar from the gods) is worth it.

2) Sample the fritto misto and Wagyu beef tartare to start.  Sure, these are old Italiano standbys, but they do it up here, adding cured egg, parmigiano, toasted hazelnuts, and sea salt to the tartare.  SO GOOD.

3) Devour the black farfalle (with Maine lobster) and the spiced duck breast (with endive, preserved orange, and delicious cippollini onion).  I split these dishes with my friend and it was the perfect portion size, not to mention SCRUMPTIOUS.  Jersey was a good choice to wear during this meal.

4) Polish it all off with the Zeppole for dessert, if you're a fan of Nutella.

Grazie mille, Scarpetta, for a wonderful experience!  I will definitely be back to try your famous spaghetti.

So I won this 5-team parlay and decided to treat my parents to a nice dinner and we were all in the mood for pasta.

This was my first time being introduced to a Scott Conant restaurant and was certainly not disappointed. I can't even tell you how many dishes we ordered but we had to go big! Black tagliolini, prime filet, veal chop, duck and foie Gras ravioli, mushrooms, broccolini, polenta and of course the spaghetti. 

To be completely honest with you the dishes were all solid. Nothing wrong with any of them. HOWEVER, the humble spaghetti, boring as it may look and sound, stole the show entirely. It was so good it made me regret ordering the tagliolini and all the apps when I could've gotten two of the spaghettis! 

If you come on a date night I highly recommend each of you ordering another main and then ordering the spaghetti to share so you can get a good variety of dishes while also being able to enjoy Scarpetta's best dish.

It is a clean trendy restaurant with good food, but it is a little pricey and I expected a little more after reading all of the reviews.  I would recommend going in with lower expectations and you will be happy.

Food
The food was very good, but it was not the best pasta I have eaten.  That honor goes to Babbo in New York.  I would give Scarpetta an 8/10.  It was rather pricey so not a good bang for the buck restaurant.  Dinner for 2 was $150 with 1 glass of wine each.  So it was good, but not great.
Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli.  This was the best dish of the night.  There were about 10 small raviolis and they were cooked just right.  They were tender and full of flavor.  9/10
Tomato & Basil Spaghetti.  It is a simple dish and the pasta is cooked al dente.  I would have preferred a little more tomato or basil flavors with the spaghetti, but it was good.  It looked small at first, but there was a good amount of pasta with the dish.  8/10.
Colorado Lamb Loin.  The lamb was cooked medium rare and it was tender.  It was less gamey than other lambs and I think I wanted more flavor from the lamb itself.  6/10.  I expected more for $40.
I had both the Rosso and the Rubrato red wines.  Both were excellent and they had a very through wine list.  9/10  

Ambiance
It is quite a scene in the Comsopolitan.  There were a lot of women hitting the club on the level above the restaurant.  The restaurant itself had a view overlooking the strip.  Unfortunately, not all of the tables have that view and our table did not.  I would recommend making sure you get a table with a view.  You should for the price.  The restaurant looked clean and modern, similar to the hotel itself.  The chairs and tables were a little strange.  The chairs were hard to move and the table seemed to slide when you pushed away from it in your chair.  10/10

Service
The waiter was attentive and kept checking on us throughout dinner.  He knew the menu and was informed about the dishes.  9/10

Bread basket with Stromboli, focaccia and other more basic roll.  The bread basket came with butter, eggplant areas and citrus olive oil.  The citrus olive oil was amazing paired with the Stromboli!

Berry smash - this drink was very good

Yellowtail sashimi - 4 stars. rock salt used was unique and yellowtail was tender.  

Signature Spaghetti dish -  5 stars. This dish was really incredible.  Delicious in it's simplicity.   The noodles were cooked perfectly and the sauce light yet flavorful.  I have not had anything like it before and I will be trying to recreate it at home.

Short rib agnolotti -  5 stars. This was excellent!  It has a very strong horse radish taste so you have got to really like horse radish!  

Pici - 4 stars. This dish was very good.  The noodles are cooked al dente. A little too mu/ch so for my taste.  There was tons of lobster.  I enjoyed the lobster paired with the tarragon.  I do not normally like pesto but I really liked the chili pesto in this dish.  

The restaurant is very nice however we were a party of 5 and were seated right by the exit sign and bus area.  It seems this restaurant is more suited for parties of 4 our less. as there is not a lot of seating for a larger party.

So, I was in Vegas for a fab Race/Scavenger Hunt event, and met up with friends the night before the event at Scarpetta for what I hoped would be an excellent meal.  It did not disappoint.

There were some nice-sounding appetizers on the menu, but we bypassed those in favor of ordering the day's pasta special as our starter.  it was linguini with truffle, and it was perfect.  Possibly the best pasta I've ever eaten.  Seriously, I wish I'd ordered that again as my meal.  And then maybe again as dessert.

Table faves included the aged sirloin, the orata rossa, the scallops and the sunchokes.  The roasted baby carrots were also pretty great.  The spaghetti was fine, but, honestly, after that starter, it just couldn't compete.  The gingerbread-pear crisp was the fave dessert, though all were good.

The fave wine of the night was the super tuscan, though it was crazy with sediment (something I'm surprised they didn't notice before serving it).

This place is absolutely terrible. We tried the tasting menu with wine pairing and the first dish to arrive is sushi. If it had been good, no problem. However the yellowtail smelled and tasted funky and the tuna was ruined with truffle oil. The flavorless dishes kept rolling and the service was equally terrible. 

We walked away feeling completely ripped off by a restaurant with an identity crisis. When i spend upwards of 300 on a meal, i expect good attentive service and good food. If a full plate goes back, i expect someone to notice and speak to us but no one cared at all. 

For a guy like scott who is so critical on these cooking shows, you really should revisit your own house. There are just too many places in vegas for places like this to survive.

Returned to Scarpetta last night!
It is consistently one of the "Best" dinning experiences in the entire city of Las Vegas.
Mike the Wine Steward made it even more special, thank you.
Just trust me when I say this, from the time you enter the restaurant to the time you leave, everything from service, wine, food is exceptional.
The Staff is really really well trained and very very nice.
Make you feel like family.

The food and customer service at this place was beyond incredible, you can taste how the food is freshly made and every bite you take into your meal takes you a step further into paradise. I've been to many restaurants down the strip in Vegas and I could tell you this one really stood out to me & every time I'm back here I make sure to make a reservation in advance since this place is always booked (which trust me is a good sign)

A-OK is what Scarpetta was. I was very excited to finally taste the famous pasta from the man himself-Scott Conant. I have been watching Chopped for weeks and was curious what exactly does he think amazing pasta is. Well Scott maybe Pasta is the only thing you should stick to.

We have ordered the Hamachi, Tuna, Polenta, Foie Gras Ravioli, Black Cod and the Tasting Menu.

Let's start from the beginning. First of all I would like to say that the service was beyond reparable. We sat at the restaurant for almost 3 hours. It took the server to give us the menu for about half an hour and every time we looked for him he wasn't there. After hinting and hinting that we would like our food right away the longer it took to the point where we just left.

Here is the breakdown:

Hamachi: nothing special-Nobu beats this dish any day of the week.

Tuna Susci: If you think wrapping tuna over a bunch of carrots is creative-think again.

Polenta: I really enjoyed this dish. It came in a small pot with a mushroom sauce on the side. This was one of my favorite appetizers.

Black Cod: it was A-OK. I wish it had more flavor and was more moist. I guess beggars can't be choosers. 

Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli: The dough was chewy and hard. The sauce on top ruined the whole dish in my opinion. The inside was tender and rich. I think if the ravioli were smaller and more tender it would come together better.

Tasting Menu:

Fritto Misto: A-OK. I like anchovies but I don't think this dish brought anything special to the table.

Spaghetti with tomato and basil was the best dish of the night! It was tender, flavorful and tasty. I would have this again any day!

Dessert: the chocolate cake was dry and even with the gelato on the side it still left a bitter rough flavor in my mouth!

We tried a few other things which I don't even care to discuss on the Tasting Menu

The bread basket was also pretty amazing! It came with 3 sauces which we ordered a second round of!

Overall I am not impressed by this Italian Restaurant. This has nothing to do with price or the atmosphere. I think as a food critic what you look at is the freshness of the food and the service. I have seen a lot of bad service but ignoring your patrons will not bring you very far.

So Scott Conant I am giving you a C+. You have been chopped!

My GF and I ate there on Easter for dinner.  When we arrived at like 5:15pm the place was virtually empty and there was more waitstaff and other workers than diners.  We were promptly seated by the hostess but st ther for like 10 minutes plus without anyone waiting on us.  Finally I got so frustrated I got up to leave and I told the waiter that was servicing the table next to me that I had had it and was leaving and he promptly apologized and said there must be a mix-up but that he would take care of me which he did....I think he threw in a free beer.  Anyway, the food was good...salad and pizza and the decor is nice.  

I almost ever complain about service as I am very low maintenance but this lack of being initially waited on was very off-putting.

Great food, atmosphere and service. 

Competitive pricing and food very tasty!

My Wife and I had dinner here during our trip to Vegas. This is one of the restaurants located inside The Cosmopolitan Hotel. 

Bottom line up front, it was an "okay" restaurant. Not worthy of your time but if you insist, don't say I didn't forewarn yah.

Menu. Small and limited a with a few options in each of the sections you'd expect.

Drinks. Expensive as expected . Moscow was pretty strong, however it was tart and not sweet enough.. could have used a shot of simple syrup. 

Food. I ordered their Filet Minion, medium rare of course. The inside was cooked fine, however the outside was way to seared... it was basically charred. The meat, was pretty dry and the sauce they provide on the plate was for decoration and not enough to last your $48 piece of meat.
