The Wife ordered some ravioli in some lemon sauce which was okay, but I like my sauce thicker and richer. 

Ambiance. A scooch to dark, but it was the bar area since the restaurant was booked.

In conclusion, I recommend passing. To expensive for the mediocre food and drinks you get in return.

This review is actually 4.5 stars!!!  I visited their NY location last year and luckily was able to visit this one during our stay in Vegas this passed weekend.  Nothing was amiss in terms of service and cordiality.  Was very tempted to try the famous $24 spaghetti again but decided to expand my horizons and try something new.  (Yet we still had the creamy polenta.. orgasmic). Boyfriend had the Sheep cheese ricotta ravioli with truffle shavings and I had the Prime Filet of Beef - Med. Rare w/ potato puree... fricken delicious! I was naseous for most the day.. even at the beginning of our meal but I scarfed down the steak and finished off most of my plate.  Didn't care so much for the rainbow chard as I found it a bit salty.  Boyfriend agreed.  We completed our meal by sharing the Coconut Panna Cotta w/ Guava Soup - so good and regreshing!  Would come back just for that on a hot day if I could.

Our server was this tall guy w/ a beautiful Trinidad accent who had a very kind demeanor about him.  Forgot his name but make sure you get seated in his area. ^_^

Don't let anyone talk up pasta like it's going to change your life, it's just pasta...
With that being said, the pasta at Scarpetta is pretty damn delicious. If you're going to pay $25 to $35 for a pasta dish, Scarpetta is the best place to do it.

We visited Scarpetta at 8 PM on a Thursday and sat at the bar until our table was ready. The bartender, Nicole, was a delight. She opened a bottle of Sauv Blanc for me since they did not serve any by the glass, and that's what I was looking for. I can always appreciate someone who goes above and beyond to make sure that the paying customer gets what they're looking for. The "crack chips" at the bar are highly addictive, don't even start...

We were seated shortly after taking a few sips of our drinks at the bar, near the window where we could see the Bellagio water fountain show. I was expecting the view to be more romantic and clear - there are beams and walls that are kind of in the way. Regardless, it's a very nice view (I just feel that they advertise it a bit differently than it actually is). The service was great and so pleasant. We ordered a braised short rib appetizer that was delicious, along with the spaghetti dish, pichi dish and the side of mushrooms. Everything was damn near perfect. I prefer my pasta a bit more cooked, but I can appreciate that the Scarpetta way is how it should be done, with hand made pasta, in house. The sauces are so amazing, the flavors are just perfect...

We didn't have any room for dessert but next time, I swear I will get into those bombolini nutella things, they were on every table and looked so good.

The ambiance is quiet and calm and it felt so good to get away from the chaos that is Vegas. I've eaten at many vegas restaurants and I feel that Scarpetta is perfect for a date and low key evening to enjoy one another's company and some GREAT italian food!

Based on the excellent reviews we decided to try 500 Cucina last night. We took a cab both directions so we could enjoy a nice evening with good food and wine. The food was nothing special and the waiter seemed to not enjoy serving us. I would consider all four of us easy going and not demanding at all. He seemed annoyed if he had to give us another minute to decide on drinks, food , dessert, so then he would not come back for 10 minutes. The place is small and not bus,y so  not sure why? At the end of the night we wanted to order shots to celebrate one of our birthdays. The waiter actually questioned our friend on whether he indeed wanted to participate and then started to quote ALCB laws. It was very strange and awkward. Like really... I think he is capable of handling himself and you just put a downer mood on the whole thing. It did give us something to talk about  on the cab ride home, we talked about how we will not return.

OMG OMG OMG!

If you're in Vegas you have to, MUST GO! eat at Scarpetta Words can't describe the yumminess of it all. 

All their pastas were perfectly al dente. Foie raviolis were my favorite.

Yum, Yum, Yum! I really enjoyed this restaurant. The decor was very sleek and we were seated next to a window with a gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountains. We started off with the orgasmic Raw Yellowtail as an appetizer. As an entree i had Stracci which was pasta with lobster, crab, shrimp and basil breadcrumbs. It was very light yet flavorful. The ambiance was quiet and intimate, perfect for a romantic dinner and conversation. The service was not memorable not extremely attentive. It was just okay, but the view, ambiance, and food outweigh the lack of service.

Food was wonderful! The somm was a great guy, very personable and connected with all the tables. I highly recommend checking this place out. Amazing cauliflower rabbit soup. Awesome pasta. Well done, I will be back.

I was anticipating an extraordinary dinner and experience, but was let down. Our server seemed to pre-judge us and gave us terrible service. She seemed to be fake nice and barely did her job. She gave us the bread after she served our dinner, and never asked us how we like our food.  I hate going to a nice restaurant and getting crappy service. Our bill was $124 and we still have her $20 for bad service. If I had the guts to give her what she really deserved, I would have given her $5. 

I ordered the Spaghetti because I read other reviews of how good it was.
The pasta seemed like it was cooked way before they served it. I asked if they could make meatballs. They said yes. They served me tiny little meatballs, like from a Chef Boyardee can. 

All in all, the service was not up to par, the food was overpriced, and disappointing.

This was a solid 5 star meal for me and my two friends this past weekend. Firstly, our server was amazing. I'm a bit of a pain and he was patient and helpful and very professional. He had great advice, and was very understanding of my gluten allergy (and I was thrilled that they had a separate gluten free menu). Every dish ordered was an 'oh wow you gotta taste this" moment. My friends said the stromboli bread basket with the choice of marscapone butter, lemon olive oil and eggplant caponata kicked off the night. Other standouts included the short rib agnolotti, polenta with mushroom ragout and the chocolate cake with almond gelato and salted caramel. Even the music was great. I had been hating being in Vegas- the riff-raff, over-designed spaces,  overpriced fussy but mediocre food, but this restaurant redeemed the trip. Note to the management- if you already have a gluten free menu why not put it on the website with the other menus?? I wish we had known about this place earlier.

The view----gorgeous. The setting, intimate, modern, subdued. The service, perfect. The food, nothing too surprising- good enough a quality, on par with my expectations, but didn't exceed it. Again though, the restaurant itself was so peaceful and powerfully refined, and this was itself a good enough reason for us, because its hard to find peace in Vegas. Whats nice about the restaurants at Cosmopolitan is each has its own character. And so depending on your mood, you can dial in what you prefer. 

If you stay at the hotel, everything is a breeze too coz their reservation line is all connected into your tv. Fancy.  The Cosmo has it up there with selection of good restaurants. You do have to pay for it, of course. Thats Cosmo. Its $$$, but they do it well.

Everything I hoped and dreamed. Our group of 12 was severely hungover from day drinking at Encore and most of us were struggling to just eat anything. I personally had to power through each bite just to keep it down but it was so worth it. Short rib and risotto app was phenomenal. Perfectly cooked risotto and short rib that just melted. But the real star was the spaghetti. I have been dying to try this forever. Truly life changing. Amazing al dente noodles enveloped in a rich and creamy tomato sauce with fresh basil folded in. It was heaven. I could eat that every day. Due to our state of being at the time, dessert was not an option but next time I will be definitely be indulging. Can't wait to return!

Truly enjoyed dinner here with a few old friends I hadn't seen in a while! Our waiter Roberto was patient with us as we were so busy catching up we took a long time to look at the menu and order. Service was on point, professional, friendly, informative and unobtrusive. Every dish we tried was amazing! My favorites were the buratta salad and truffle sheep milk ravioli! My friends were speechless when they tried the short ribs with farro. The wine sommelier Paulo was very attentive and fun to talk to. Managers Mario and Kelly both stopped by the table to check on us and make sure every thing was perfect- which it was. Save room for dessert! The cheesecake was the best I have ever had! Highly recommend Scarpetto and can't wait to go back!

It was pretty much a perfect evening!

We celebrated our 11 year anniversary here & not sure why it look so long to get here as we've tried everything at The Cosmo except for this place! 

Walking in was a little awkward because you go down a very narrow space & pass the bar to get to the beautiful main dining room. It was the perfect combination of feminine & masculine which happens to be my favorite combo for any space! Lots of wood, very warm color palette yet there were sexy curves everywhere like the furniture, lighting & seating arrangements. Everything about the space was very beautiful. It felt like a man & woman got together to create it. 

The view of the Bellagio Fountains is always stunning as it never gets old for me and the service was on point. Thank you to our waiter for the complimentary champagne & dessert which was banana soufflé (AMAZING)!

Now for the carb overload ~ the classic spaghetti is popular as it should be because it was perfect. Fresh noodles, sweet sauce with a hint of basil & garlic. The famous polenta! WOW! Creamy heaven! The duck & foie gras ravioli was beyond decadent and then the short rib & bone marrow agnolotti (climax) I wanted to lick my plate! I was so full but I savored every single little bite as it's possibly one of the top dishes EVER! I still think about it...

Had a few cocktails as well & just sat back & enjoyed ourselves while watching the fountains. It was a beautiful evening & I cannot wait to go back! It's very rare to enjoy everything but I really did.
I've been here several times and it's been consistent. Serves different variety of breads along with tapenade and olive oil.   For large groups, they have a private dining room.

So disappointed! I have eaten here multiple times as a local. The Som, Kyle is GREAT, but for 3pp and  a $450 meal our service SUCKED! I walked in thinking of one specific pasta dish, that I absolutely adore! The server told me, "no" absolutely don't get that, pick something else without any reason.  I assumed it was because something was bad in the kitchen, chose something else, was completely unhappy but couldn't tell my server because he never came back to check on us. We were rushed to order because the kitchen was closing, then why did the restaurant allow a 10pm reservation???? We were rushed through our meal, and after appetizers our server didn't return until the table was clear to "push us" dessert. 

I haven't been this unhappy about a meal on the strip in a long time. They are getting 2 stars because of the Somm

I'm not a big fan of pasta because I usually try to avoid carbs. I see it as a waste of valuable tummy space that I should reserve for other food. BUT I have to give it to Scarpetta for changing my mind.

We came here in a group of six on a Sunday night. We made reservations like two hours prior, but we showed up about an hour early and were seated immediately. 

Right away, we were impressed by the variety of the bread basket and the dips. I can't remember exactly but there were about six different types of bread. What really got our attention though was the eggplant dipping sauce! It was so yummy that we kept shamelessly asking for more. I think we got at least three refills of it (but hey, we had six hungry girls!).

On to the real food... My friend and I shared the Lobster Pici and the Short Rib and bone marrow agnolotti. The pici is dressed with a chili pesto sauce, and since my friend can't eat spicy foods, they split the portion for us and served it on two separate plates. I got extra chili pesto on the side in case I wanted to add more. I loved that we didn't have to try and split our dish in half ourselves. So much more convenient and I can get straight down to eating! However, it turns out that the chili pesto sauce isn't even spicy at all. If anything, it's just salty, like REALLY salty. The pieces of lobster meat still tasted good and wasn't that salty, but the pasta sat directly in the pesto and it definitely could've used less sauce/salt.

Now on to the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti... it was the last entree to come out! All the food came out already and the agnolotti was nowhere to be seen. We got sidetracked by the lobster pici and kind of forgot about our 2nd entree to share. When we realized, we asked the server where it was and if the kitchen had forgotten about it, but he assured us it will be coming out shortly. By the time it came out, everyone was done with their food. I'd say it came out 10-15 mins later than the other entrees. It wasn't so bad considering we were sharing another entree, but had we not shared, one of us would've sat there without food. Considering this is a fine dining restaurant, that is unacceptable. 

But you know what, it was so delicious that I didn't care it was late. I think this has become my favorite pasta dish of all time. The flavor was very rich and smooth, with a little crunchy texture from the garlic chips. I personally liked it better than the duck and foie gras ravioli that I tried from my friend's plate. I would order this again and again. Luckily for me, there's also a Scarpetta in NY! Guess where I'll be going to dinner soon!
Food was good and a great view of the bellagio fountains.  Service was on point.   Good spot for a date.  Worth spending a little more and skipping docg.

If I come here again, I'll just take two of the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli.  The pasta is shaped like a duck's tongue. It has balsamic reduction on top. If you like foie gras, you'd enjoy this. Keep the sauce and dip it with the complimentary bread.  

We got a couple of other plates, but honestly, I don't remember!

One of the very few (if not the only one) restaurants on the strip where the Vegas location is a LOT better than the one in NYC. Scarpetta LV is light years ahead of its namesake in Manhattan's Meatpacking district. 
The service is, without a question, much better here than in NYC and so was the food. Scarpetta NYC, on the other hand, has a quirkier, much more interesting wine list featuring Italian wines exclusively. 
So, I guess you'd have to visit both locations and decide for yourself.

For the price I am not impressed with the service. I like to be honest in my reviews and I honestly feel that for the price we are paying for fine dining. We were seated and waited 15 minutes to get our menus. Food took forever to get :( 

Food finally came and was definitely a 4 out of 5 but I have to drop the rating due to the poor service.

It was my first time actually being treated out to such a fancy restaurant , and it was absolutely amazing ! We had our own private room with a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains which made our meal extra special. The ambiance was very romantic and dimly lit. I recall having more than one server , but Titus was very personable , he was great. I ordered their creamy polenta and spaghetti based on reviews and they did not disappoint ! Their short rib agnolotti was fantastic as well. We also ordered a variety of desserts , and the winter parfait was our favorite out of everything. I felt that the food portions were just right. The food was really expensive , but that is the price you pay for for the fine dining experience and being on the Strip/Cosmopolitan.

A hotel contact set me up for dinner here on a Friday night after a long day of touring venues for work.

Finally it was time to unwind!

The dining room is dimly lit and a great place for a special occasion/ or pre show dinner with your significant other.

Our server was quite nice, and attentive.

I was in the mood for some bivalves and got 1/2  a dozen. They were really small and disappointing and not really the best that I've had.

We also had the beef tartare which was also quite good, but not as good as the one at BIX in SF. 

For entrees the husband had a ban seared fish, what type of fish it evades me, but it was cooked perfectly; crispy on the outside, soft and moist inside.

I had the lobster pasta of some sort, very rich and al dente,  I could certainly taste the flavor of the fresh herbs used in the butter sauce. I shared this with the husband and he thoroughly enjoyed it.

The highlight was the fish entree and also the desserts.

We had the trio of bombolini-some kind of fried dough/beignets looking things. But when we bit into them, they had this glorious melted chocolate inside! Every fried bit of goodness had a different filling, one chocolate, the other custard, and I forget what the other ones, but they were fried bites of perfection!  It had nutella and vanilla creme inside. Yummy!

The other dessert was this fruit and creme concoction, sorry the name escapes my mind but it was definetely really good and really rich. 

The server made a mistake and gave us a third dessert- the chocolate molten cake. It was also super good but by that time we were desserted out. 

I don't know what the bill was as it was comped but I imagine maybe $150 for two with a glass of wine. Not bad for some really good bites and sinful dessert to go with it!


I would recommend if staying at the cosmos.

When you are in Las Vegas you have more choices for great food than anywhere else in the U.S. sorry New York but let's be honest some food there sucks.

This place is a for sure try.  The Caesar salad is fantastic.... The bread you get before your meal comes with 3 dipping sauces and is a nice touch.

A wide variety of gourmet dished with the chicken being my favorite.

Amazing!  Food at its finest. We had the tasting menu and wine pairing and I would have paid triple for this experience. The service was professional and flawless. The food can only be described as art!  Texture, taste, and creativity are in every bite.  Wow!  This is bucket list worthy!  Check my other reviews, I am generally not this kind.

What do you have to do to make a reservation for a group here?  I've called reservations they said I had to call group reservations which I have a few times. Nobody ever answers so left messages. It's been a week and no return call?  If you can't accommodate me then at least return my call and tell me.  Ate here last year and the food was great but service/management clearly lacking.

We were there on Sunday night and I was looking forward to eating there after seeing the place a few times. Went with a small group and the place was busy but not full. They were out of 2 main entree items and it took 1 hour to get our order. The server did not acknowledge the slow service nor was anything offered to us by the restaurant for the delayed meals.  Pizza was good but it did not outweigh the poor service.  I will not return nor will I recommend or encourage others to try it.

Scarpetta is a dark, intimate, upscale Italian restaurant with nice views of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains in the distance.  We had some really good dishes here and would definitely recommend, especially if you like seafood with pasta.  Service was friendly but timing a bit off with the fish coming out way before our pasta dish and them forgetting about our side dish.  Still, solid 4 stars!

Their free bread basket is one of the best - nice variety of plain and some with some nice, Mediterranean-inspired filling. You get a triple-dip tray of olive oil, a savory tapenade, and mascarpone! 

The Berry Smash cocktail is sweet with the mix of blueberries and white cranberry juice.  It goes down smoothy but a few minutes you will get the buzz!  

For apps, we shared the grilled octopus. It was tender, well-seasoned of course and what made this dish a winner is that their olives and potato condiments also had a nice balanced taste. Olives not too briny nor salty - just perfect.

I got the Branzino with saffron broth, a pretty good dish albeit on the lighter side.  It had some nice clams and shrimp pieces to go with the fish, which was cooked perfectly and seasoned enough for me.

My wife's black pasta dish with sea urchin and crabmeat however, was outstanding.  It looked super rich and tiny at first, but after mixing everything up it turned out to be very filling. Best of all, it wasn't super rich.  This has got to be one of their signature dishes - why need sauce when uni and crab meat are already perfect together.

For dessert we shared the mascarpone cheesecake and Greek Yogurt (sorbet?).  Excellent dish that easily feeds two.  We dislike dense cheesecake that tends to be too heavy and rich, but Scarpetta's version was light and smooth.  It almost had a panna cotta texture.  The Greek Yogurt was sweet and chilled and reminded us more like a side of ice cream. No reason you can't make a sorbet or have Greek Froyo I suppose. Wonderful dessert, and perfect end to a great dinner.

I ate dinner here alone last night at the bar.  When they first opened a former BF and I ate here in the dinning room.  Although the food was amazing the first time, I think the dinning room is not configured well for romance.  Tables are close, like cafeteria kind of close.  In addition the service was just a disconnect...  But let's discuss this visit.  
Amazing.  Sat at the bar and got phenomenal treatment from the bartender.  As all the parties paraded by or waited for the tables, the bar staff not only took care of those folks but some how made me feel i was not eating my dinner in a waiting area.  I started with the roasted Scallops YUMMMMMMM.  Then I had the most magnificent piece of red meat that has ever passed between these lips...  Kobe Rib Cap.  Oh glorious rib cap.  Never have I had entire plate of rib cap,  In fact I had to Google it to know what it was.  Worth the effort to research and read up on it.  LOVE LOVE LOVE.

So amazing service, great cocktails, nice wine selection and the best steak I have ever eaten.

My new favorite.

This low-lit place is very classy and romantic. The service was excellent. Our food came out pretty quickly after we ordered. And there are seats next to the window with a nice view of part of the strip.  

The food:
-Complimentary bread: A real breadwinner! There was an assortment of breads that were warm and delicious: focaccia with rosemary, one with mozarella baked into it, one with salami, one with a leafy green in it, and bite-sized one that were crunchy. The bread comes with softened butter (it was so soft), an eggplant tomato sauce, and an olive oil-based dip. 
-Duck and foie gras ravioli: It was delicious. It was plentiful and full of flavor.
-Endive salad with beets: My gf really enjoyed this. It was presented very well. It had a nice, slightly bitter taste that was well-complimented by the sweetness of the beets that were on the side.

Like almost any restaurant, Scarpetta has its pros and cons. Let's start with the positives.

Ambience: when you walk in you have to go through the bar to get to the dining room. The bar is long and narrow. It is quite inviting and incredibly attractive. They have small alcoves that seat two on the right hand side that would make a wonderful place to come to have a romantic drink before your evening starts. The main dining room is also beautifully decorated. If you were lucky enough to get a seat by the window, you have a terrific you of the Bellagio fountains as well as looking down the Las Vegas Boulevard Strip. The tables are very nicely spaced so that you can have quiet conversation with the friends with whom you are dining and not be bothered by conversations from other tables. 

Food: the meal starts with a small basket of breads placed on the center of the table. If it were possible to have a "bread orgasm",  then the four of us had that shared experience on eating the breads. Wow, it was that good! We decided we would share the Pici ( normally a main course) as an appetizer for the four of us. This dish was incredibly good. It consisted of a green pasta cooked al dante with a generous portion of lobster meat mixed in. The sauce was a bit spicy but it was delicious. I had the New York strip steak as my main course. The quality of the meat was really mediocre even though it was cooked appropriately. I expected it to be much better in a high end restaurant. It came with some vegetables that were delicious. In addition we ordered a side of mushrooms for the table. This too was incredibly delicious. We shared a chocolate cake for dessert. The chocolate cake was a rich dark chocolate with a small scoop of gelato on top. The cake made me feel as if I had died and gone to heaven.
Service: while our waiter did nothing wrong, he certainly did nothing to make us feel welcome. The service runners brought the food in a timely fashion although it was a little surprising that they did not know who was supposed to get which dish. The bus boy was it quite good. Our water glasses never got below half full.

Las Vegas is my least popular destination in the US, but business takes me here twice a year. I visited Scarpetta for a business dinner today and I'm effusive about the experience. The food and service were absolutely sublime.

The menu was a culinary tour of pleasures with a full palate of distinctive flavors. Everything I sampled was exquisite.

Simply put: Scarpetta is an extraordinary restaurant that I would recommend wholeheartedly.

Understand that it's a premium price for a premium product, but well worth the money.

The entire experience was wonderful. The waitstaff was charming and attentive and very well informed about their food. When I mentioned I was vegetarian, I was provided with a special vegetarian menu, with a couple of additional items not on the regular menu. (this is not exactly a positive. Put all your dishes on the menu. I mean, you aren't actually starting to cook your farro for the farro risotto when a random vegetarian offers it, right?)

I was drawn to the restaurant by the marketing copy. (it's impressive!) The burrata salad made me add it to my very short -must-try-while-in-Vegas list. And it did not disappoint. I have a running pet peeve about chintzy servings of burrata, and this is possibly the first place I've eaten that provided a balanced proportion of tomato and burrata. The variety of heirloom tomatoes, served roasted, and fresh, was a wonderful surprise. And there was enough burrata (lightly salted with shaved crystal salt) for every bite of the dish. Divine.

Two other stellar standouts (aside from the view of the Bellagio fountain show) were the olive oil served with the table bread-- some of the best I've ever had-- and the dessert. We split the Bomboloni, and it was divine. My description will not do it justice, but I'll try. Essentially, 5 small donuts covered in crystal sugar, and filled with Nutella, served with a heavenly banana gelato.

All that, and in a peaceful oasis of a casino hotel that barely forces you to cross the casino floor, and makes it easy to enter and leave the building. I'll be back, should I find myself in Vegas ever again.

After having a great experience at D.O.C.G., I will really excited to dine at Scarpetta.  However, I walked away a bit underwhelmed by the food.  BUT the view of the Bellagio fountains at sundown was fantastic and the service was the best I have had anywhere.  We had half a dozen oysters to start with, duck foie gras ravioli, and truffled pasta.  The first bite was very good but after that everything was very one-noted and boring.  Taste buds were not enthused by the end of dinner.  While the staff was VERY good the service can get slow.  We almost missed our 10:30pm show as we were at dinner for over 2 hours. My only regret is that I should have tried the Spaghetti!

My husband took me here and I fell in love with the food and atmosphere. Their pea soup is to die for. And they have a great sommelier. I love coming here and highly recommend it for any special night out or even just to try the food for all the foodies out there.

Loved their Pici entree --- green pasta in a pesto spicy sauce with lobster. And of course their spaghetti pasta is delicious.  I had their squid and octopus appetizer with fennel and was pleasantly surprised.  

Ordered a Manhattan on the rocks and they gave me a big serving .. more than what I expected which was awesome.  Definitely coming back here again when in town.  Prices are comparable or cheaper than other fine dining restaurants in the top swank hotels on the strip.

A fantastic restaurant. A very unique dining room with spectacular views of the Bellagio fountain. The design of the dining room is open and not your traditional tables lined up next to one another. The food is sensational. The portions are on the smaller side - but that was refreshing considering the ounces and ounces of steak i had during my Vegas trip. The pasts dishes are exquisite and the sashimi was perfect. The bar scene was non existent on the Saturday night i was there, but the dining room had a great pulse. I recommend a pre dinner drink at the many cool spots of the Cosmopolitan Hotel and then come enjoy a fantastic meal at Scarpetta.
Great food and good portions for a light eater. Service was great as well.

AMAZING! Thank you for having real Italian food in Vegas worth the price! It's in the Cosmopolitan. 

FOOD:
Complimentary bread: Good variety, soft, addicting. 

Truffle Polenta (5): OMG can I have you every day. I could have left after just eating this and been so happy. So creamy and flavorful. Truffle flavor came out so well, and the extra crunch you get from the mushrooms made it perfect. Gorgeous dish also. 

Special-Cheese ravioli with black truffles (5 stars): Had to get the special since I love black truffles. They shave on a good amount too. The ravioli was really good and the black truffles and foam made it amazing. Very filling. 

Chicken Entree (5 stars): So moist and flavorful. Seasoned almost like Mediterranean/Indian chicken. Really liked it.

VIEW/ATMOSPHERE (5 stars)
Sat right against the window and saw the beautiful Bellagio fountains go up every 15 minutes. Gorgeous. Definitely request the window seats if you can. The place itself is nice and quiet. Great for a date night. 

SERVICE (5 stars)
Girls who work at the front are both beautiful and nice! I was in heels and she warned me as I was walking that the back area was slippery, which it was! So if she didn't warn me I probably would have ate it. And the waiters were on top of everything and nice too.

One of the best meals of my life.

I will preface the review by saying that we got the supreme hook up.  I am an acquaintance of Chef Dan Rossi and he saw to it that we experienced Scarpetta to the fullest.  A huge thank you again to Chef Dan and his hospitality and talented team.

The atmosphere: Sleek, elegant, and sexy are the first words that come to mind.  The sound track puts you in the right mood but doesn't overwhelm.  One of the few hot spots in Vegas where you don't have to shout to your dinner companions- I greatly appreciated this.  It is warm and inviting with these great S shaped booths.  Yes, the waiters appear over your sholder when you're dining at the booths, but I didnt really mind that.

The food: I do not exagerate, one of the best meals of my life!
A break down-
Polenta with mushrooms- I could have drank that sauce and been satisfied, my bf who doesnt even like polenta went back for seconds and thirds!
Heirloom tomato salad- simple, clean, delicious
Yellowtail carpaccio- i dont know how they get fish this fresh in Vegas! Light citrusy sauce with some crunch from the salt on top. Perfection.
Short ribs- I dont usually eat meat but when i saw that these babies basically fall off the bone as soon as a fork comes near, i had to try.

Taglietelle with veggies and truffle cream- this is not a light dish! The homemade pasta is cooked to a perfect al dente and the sauce is everything that something with truffles should be.  My bf's fave of the night.
Short rib ravioli- a special that night.  Again, I'm vegetarian and this was my fave dish.  It its offered when you go, dont miss it.

Branzino with leeks and asparagus- light and refreshing after the heavier pastas.  Crispy skin on the fish. Leeks roasted till they carmelized.  I could eat this every night and be a happy girl.

Gingerbread and pear tarte with cinnamon gelato- ORDER IT!!!!

I'm not usually this long winded in reviews but I was just so happy with the entire evening.  In addition wines by the glass are generously poured and therefore worth the steep-ish price.  I'd recommend this as a place for couples, non-rowdy bday parties, and those looking for an elegant evening without a bass infused club sound track.

Thank you, thank you Chef Rossi.

This restaurant is awesome! Service was good. Booked through open table. One of the best 3 course meals I had in Vegas ! I came here with my sister for a nice dinner. Bread basket was so good I wanted more, it came with butter, eggplant spread and olive oil. Each of the bread was different. They put it in layers and it was warm. We ordered the yellow tail, short rib agnolotti and fennel black cod. We were able to sit near the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We ordered cocktails as well. I got the berry smash it was fruity but not too sweet just the right bite of alcohol. My sis got the scarpetta  Cosmo it was equally delightful. There was no room for dessert we were both full. I like also how they split our dishes because we were sharing. I want to go back for more and try other pastas as well.

Came here after our vow renewal.  We had a great view of the fountains, our server was very nice and had no problem getting a new salad for my friend who did not like the one she originally ordered.  Drinks were about average priced for any nice place in vegas, avg. $16 each. My friend got a cosmo and she said it was perfect.  They had a good bourbon selection for my picky husband.  I got the branzino and it was very good. My husband got the waygu cap steak that was on special and loved it! Still talking about it.  I think it was about $65, it filled him up. We did not get salad (extra, not inculded). My friend got a caesar and it was beautiful! Loved the presentation.  They both get the filet and they said it was perfect.  Tip, 2 entrees and I think 2 drinks was $156. Not the most we have spent on a meal.  FYI for weddings, they charge between $6- $13 per person to bring in your own cake.

Very romantic atmosphere, great food, excellent service! I had the polenta which I didn't want to stop eating. I also had the spaghetti and I don't know how some people gave it bad reviews. I would come again just for the spaghetti, it was perfect. My husband had the fois gras and said it was the best he's had, as well as the halibut. For dessert we finished with the Nutella bomboloni, yum! The view of the bellagio fountains was a nice addition.

Four of us had dinner here 2 weeks ago--much anticipation given the Chef behind the restaurant!

Host staff was very pleasant--we were seated immediately at our table which had a decent view of the water-show at neighboring Bellagio.  The adult beverages were VERY good, and wait staff was excellent and well-informed about the menu.  One of our party was newly enamored of a drink she had previously had at the Chandelier bar at this same hotel--they did not have this drink at Scarpetta--but our waiter discussed it with the bartender and they came up with an excellent version of the cocktail--which may have surpassed the original!

I agree with the prior comments about the bread basket--the bread with the salami was the best thing we ate all night.

We ordered many things off of the menu--from the basic spaghetti to the seafood pasta--all of it was served very quickly and at proper temperature, etc, and presentation was great.   The pasta portion of the seafood pasta was overdone, but the rest of the meals were very good (though nothing I would say we had to go back for, except that bread!).

Desert was basic and boring--nothing exciting.

Overall the ambience was great--excellent place for date night, drinks, and decent food.
Very disappointed with this scarpetta :( the view is beautiful but the service is bad and the food was cold!

Came here while on a business trip with a friend. The atmosphere is super romantic and definitely high class. I ordered the sea bass which was divine. I just wish there were more options that didn't include pasta. I know Italians are famous for their pasta but c'mon, pasta isn't the only food they are famous for... and what.... there are no low carb Italian dieters??? If that's the case their workout regimen must be intense AF. I will definitely come back.. but on a cheat day :)

I'm almost surprised that the complementary bread isn't a menu item in itself...it was that good.  But let's not forget the rest of the menu.  During our visit we enjoyed the Mediterranean Octopus, Short-Rib Agnolotti and the Pici.  Everything was awesome, but the standout was the Pici...I'd almost go all the way back to LV just for that alone!  OMG!

Came here with my bf on my recent vegas stay.

I ordered the duck & foie gras ravioli.......
the best morsel I have ever eaten.

Handsome and I are celebrating our annual Vegas trip this weekend and this review is a year overdue!! 

We stayed at The Cosmopolitan and we really wanted to eat at Scarpetta. We love Chopped and Scott Conant is one of our favorites. His restaurant is located on the third level of The Cosmo. 

We walked in and we had a reservation so we were seated promptly right by the window and we could see The Bellagio fountain. It was so romantic. 

We ordered wine (I don't remember which one) but it was amazing. For our starter we got The Yellowtail and The Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli. Both were spectacular. 

For dinner Handsome ordered The Veal Three ways and I ordered The Pan Roasted Halibut. Handsome loved his veal and my halibut melted in my mouth.

For dessert we orders the Rhubarb Soufflé and I think that was Handsome's favorite part. It was so light and fluffy with such a delicious flavor. 

Our whole experience at Scarpetta was amazing from start to finish. We will definitely be back.

I'd give it more stars if I could. I've been to both the LV and the BH locations and it's definitely one of my favorite restaurants on Earth. From the bread basket to the agnolotti to the famous spaghetti to the caramel budino to the gorgeous view -- it's all simply amazing. The service is wonderful which makes the experience even better. I make a stop every time I'm in Vegas and I hope to try his other locations too!

I thought Scarpetta was supposed to be a step up from DOCG, but unfortunately found it to be the opposite. Have had several great experiences at DOCG, but rather than topping it, Scarpetta didn't even compare.

STARTERS
BREAD BASKET: Five types of bread (the olive-studded one and the rolled spinach and cheese were favorites) and three dipping sauces (really liked the tomato tapenade, lemon olive oil was aromatic).
RAW YELLOWTAIL ($18): Four thin slices of yellowtail sashimi, accented with ginger oil and red onion, and what seemed to be sea salt? Liked it but not worth the price.
ENGLISH PEA SOUP ($19): Much better than the version at Giada's. I liked the mint accents and flavorful rock shrimp, though there could have been more of it. Note that this is a hot soup, not chilled.
MEDITERRANEAN OCTOPUS: Not the best version I've had but good, I liked that it was a pretty plate formed using one whole octopus tentacle rather than pieces as elsewhere. This is plated with ceci beans and what seemed to be hummus. 

PASTAS
SPAGHETTI: BF's pick, and his favorite for the night. Classic but well-made spaghetti with tomato and basil. I agree with another reviewer who said this dish tasted like the pasta version of a margherita pizza.
ORECCHIETTI: "Little ears" pasta with broccoli rabe and a house-made sausage. Neither of us really cared for this and wished we had opted to split one of the fish entrees instead. Note that this was on the night's menu in place of the gnocchetti sardi on the online menu.
AGNOLOTTI: Short rib, brown butter, and horseradish bread crumbs. Ordered this dish because it was one most recommended in reviews. It was rich and I enjoyed the actual pasta, but the combination of flavors didn't especially work for me. 

DESSERTS
CAPPUCCINO: Very well made, no bitterness or acidity or burned taste at all, just pure, strong coffee, and a ton of foam. 
STRAWBERRY SOUFFLE: Another dish that was significantly better than one I had at Giada's (hers was lemon flavored). This was like eating a cloud, it was so perfectly executed. The strawberry gelato was among the most flavorful versions I've had, and the fresh strawberry accents were so ripe that this dish didn't need the accompanying creme fraiche. 
AMEDEI CHOCOLATE CAKE: For the chocolate-lover. This was extremely rich and dense, more like a brownie than a cake. The almond gelato had almonds on top for texture, which we liked, but the flavor of the salted caramel sauce was minimal and the cake itself was a bit overcooked and hard.

The appetizers were okay, the pastas were okay, and the desserts were okay. As I left, I wished I'd just gone next door to get the incredible salted caramel bundino at DOCG, which blows both of the desserts we had here out of the water.

Service was attentive, and I appreciate that we were able to get a seat in the second row from the windows even with a last-minute reservation. Location is dark and romantic, making photos nearly impossible (and largely inappropriate). Overall quality of food was less than expected. I'll be returning to DOCG instead, even though it is more casual... they have a better wine list, too.

Let me preface this review by saying I am loving the Thompson hotel lounges and restaurants however, Scarpetta, for the price that comes with the food, isn't overly worth it. The Spaghetti which is comprised of sauce and oil is $24. A bit too much for the portion as well.

The atmosphere is that of a nice hotel restaurant and the servers are pleasant although a bit lacking in attention to detail. The woman across from us was using a napkin that the server had spilled wine on and it wasn't until someone at our table informed them that they went and got a new one. Also when it came time to paying, we all had separate forms of payment and my girlfriend was over charged and when they went to fix it, they recharged the same amount to her CC (3 times this carried on!)

I did enjoy the meal however and their bartender sure does know how to mix a cocktail. I would suggest going to the lobby bar and having a cocktail. I would also suggest getting the meat stuffed olives (they are lip smacking delish!)

Scarpetta's ambiance is so nice!  The decor is beautiful and romantic.  We had great drinks at the bar and when we were seated for dinner we had a view of the Bellagio fountain show.  I went with my husband and we are both vegetarian.  It was great to see that they had a separate veggie menu to choose from.  We ordered the artichoke soup, risotto, spaghetti, and donut dessert dish.  It was all so delicious.  Our server was superb and very attentive to our needs.

Delicious and varietal bread basket!
Butternut squash soup delicious
Chicken; juicy, moist, tender - a little salty.
Short rib pasta..  raviolis with short rib inside.  Kinda like a way better version of chef boy-r-dee ravoilis.
All food was a tad bit salty but overall pretty delicious.  I would go back.  We had an intimate booth for two in the lounge which was pretty romantic!

Simply put Scarpetta is my favorite Vegas restaurant. 
I've been a few times and each time I've left as satisfied as possible. 

For an appetizer, I've had the squash soup, the tuna susci, and braised short ribs. The squash soup is some of the best I've ever had. The tuna was good but I wouldn't get it again. The braised short ribs were perfect and while I have no idea what was in that sauce, it was heavenly. Probably will get the braised short ribs the next few times I go.

As for entrees, they are famous for their duck and foie gras ravioli and believe me, it lives up to the loftiest of expectations. It's such a unique dish and the duck and foie gras compliment each other perfectly. It doesn't feel too heavy, goes down sooooo smoothly and has this great sauce on top with just the perfect amount of cheese. Ive had it multiple times and plan on getting it again in the future. 
I've also had the short rib agnolottie which is almost as superb. The short rib is great and you get this really tasty hint of horseradish in the sauce. It's far from overwhelming, just a hint of it, but after a full plate of the agnolotti, you can certainly tell its there. But it doesn't take away from the dish, the short rib and pasta are both great.
While I've not tried the black cod or the steak, my companions have and they have reported being very happy with their choices.

Oddly enough, I've not had dessert at Scarpetta. Maybe in the future I will, I'm sure it will be tasty.

A few other things to note: the view is superb, definitely ask for a window seat and you'll get a side view of the bellagio fountains. It's just a matter of luck and if they have a table available, ask when you make the reservation. The portions are great. So often Vegas portions (especially at nice restaurants) are so small, but these are adequate and leaves you filling full but not overly full (as often dishes are so heavy with fat and cream and such). The price is very appropriate. Nothing is exorbitantly pricy, nothing is cheap, the price is correct.

Great views, delicious food, very nice waiter!!! My bf(now fiancé) took me to dinner here and proposed!! Everything was perfect. First off, I'm a bread lover and their bread basket is by far the best I have ever had!!!! We tried the short rib appetizer-very good! I had the spaghetti for my meal-it was amazing! My fiancé had the special of the day which was a seafood pasta with crab, a lemon sauce and breadcrumbs-he really enjoyed it!! They also gave us champagne and a cookie assortment as a congratulations!!! ALL DELISH!! Definitely a must try!!

After much research on where to dine for our five year wedding anniversary, my husband and I decided on Scarpetta. The menu looked delicious and the prices weren't outrageous. We called about three weeks in advance to make our reservation for seven people. I was surprised that they only had one time left but was very happy we were able to get in at 7:30pm. We were all super excited to dine there. I tweeted about it and they even tweeted back at me, which I thought was a nice touch. 

We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation and only had to wait about five minutes for a table. We were hoping for a table by the window but didn't get one. We were near the wine wall but could still see the Bellagio fountains. 

I'll break this review into two parts.

SERVICE:
I'd never been to a higher end restaurant like this before, so I was expecting exceptional service like I had never previously received. While the service was very good, it didn't live up to my expectations. Our waiter was a really nice guy, but I think he might have been newer because he seemed a little bit awkward and shy. Also, I asked him to take a picture of our whole group and he forgot. Then two people had to leave so when he finally did take the pic, not everyone was there. There was another man (Paul?) who was in charge of the wine and he was another story. He was so suave and charming. I wish he could have been our waiter! There was a major glitch in our evening considering the type of place we were at. We receieved our bill, and as we were looking over it we realized they put two $125 bottles of wine on it rather than just the one. I'm glad we noticed, because that's a fairly big mistake to make. Service in general was on the slower side. There were many gaps where nobody came to our table. We were there for about two hours. The guy refilling the water glasses was really nice, though.

FOOD:
Between the seven of us, we ordered:
-Crispy fritto misto (x2)
-Heirloom tomato salad
-Creamy polenta
-Tagliatelle (x2) (this is what I ordered)
-Duck and foie gras ravioli
-Spaghetti
-Pea tortelli
-I know I'm missing one, but I can't remember/obviously didn't try a bite.

I had bites of everything and it was all delicious. Of course, the bread starter was fantastic. The polenta was great and rich. The ravioli was so rich, I wouldn't have been able to eat it as my main dish. It was also incredibly salty. It might be nice in a smaller size as a starter. The vegetables in my tagliatelle were super fresh - such a difference fresh veggies make! The spaghetti was very good, fresh and delicious, but it didn't knock my socks off like it has for some other people. Of all of the pastas I tried, I would order the pea tortelli next time. The portion sizes are not large, but just a nice amount to leave you satisfied and not bursting. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant was nice. Not as intimate as I wanted, but I think we would have had to spend more somewhere else for that. I was sort of surprised that there were a lot of skimpily dressed stagettes and dudes in t-shirts and BASEBALL HATS! 

We had a very good experience here but it just fell a bit short of my expectations based on the many other reviews I read.

Atmosphere: 
So hip. Great lighting. 

Dishes: 
-Oysters (Appetizer): Classic. Good. Perfect start. 
-Braised Short Ribs of Beef (Appetizer): YUMBERS. The meat is so tender. Risotto was perfectly cooked and tasty, and I don't usually like risotto.
-Halibut (Entree): Cooked to perfection. Asparagus, mushrooms, and potatoes were salted well. YUM
-Nutella & Vanilla Bomboloni (Dessert): Basically nutella filled donut holes coated in sugar, with a side of banana gelato. So good, will try to recreate this at home.

Drinks:
-Billionaire: Absinthe, need I say more
-Berry Smash (or something like that): If you don't like acid-y drinks, this is for you. 

tldr: Every time I go back to Vegas, I'll always have a dinner here.

This place is really a gem.  The food is excellent (particularly the banana nutella dessert and the lamb) and the service is top notch.  Also, the restaurant has beautiful views of both the strip and the Bellagio fountains.  Overall, I highly recommend this place.

This meal was pretty average, so I'm not sure what the hype is about here. Everyone raves about the spaghetti, but it's nothing special. Neither is the service given how disinterested the waiters seemed. The best part of the meal was the drink and the view of the fountains (though you can get a better view from restaurants at the Bellagio or from a fountain-view terrace room). Probably will not return.

The Scarpetta brand is renowned for exceptional food and service. The NYC meatpacking location is one of my faves, so I was VERY excited to try the Vegas one. How silly of me to forget that EVERYTHING IS BETTER IN VEGAS. Here we go...


I had the MOST delicious pasta course I've ever had in my entire life. It was short rib ravioli with a balsamic reduction. I try, TRY! not eat bread except when I'm at a restaurant like Scarpetta. Then I will destroy the bread basket and order a refill. I'm gross but if I finally get carbs, I'm going hog wild. Oink.

Onto the entrees and wine. Pete had the Osso Buco and thought it was good. I had the branzino. I don't remember the sides, not to say they were forgettable, we were just so obsessed with the ravioli appetizer. The wine was great, as was the service. Expensive AF and make sure you make a reservation.

this place was so disappointing. i based my selection of this restaurant on the number of yelp reviews it received and what others commented about it. the quality of the food was not that great and we ordered a totally overpriced bottle of wine. this was a visit for a bachelorette dinner and everyone, including the bride, were unimpressed by the food. who has been posting these rave reviews...?
i would not return. 
the only pro that this restaurant has is the wonderful view from the dining room. other than that, service was as expected, but the food really did not shine. short ribs that were highly recommended by the server were just ok. meh.

Interesting menu items and unique tastes accompanied by a strong wine list makes this a definite 4 star.  The menu is a little limited and the a bit pricey especially for the beef/steaks.  I was very impressed with the wait staff's knowledge and recommendations.  He wasn't shy about recommendations and potential wine pairings.  Very knowledgeable.  

Something to consider - The six course meal with wine pairings looks great and the wine recommendations looked very good.

Is it just me or did I miss something? 

We had a late dinner, and since Raku was booked we opted to try here. It's romantic and intimate, but I left feeling disappointed. 

Braised Short Ribs of Beef - It was good, the short rib was braised well although a bit salty. I didn't really understand or like farro risotto. 

Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli - I like Foie, but I just wasn't a fan of this. The texture reminds me of cow brains. It is also very rich. 

Short Rib & Bone Marrow Agnolotti - This was OK, but nothing spectacular. It was also a bit rich, and the horseradish was a bit too much at times. 

Mediterranean Orata - The seared fish was good, but nothing too special. Fish was almost too slimy. 

After reading all these great reviews, I'm starting to feel like I missed something. I'm not sure if it's my palate or if the food is just overrated? Everything I tried was really rich in flavor, and I left both pastas half finished. Maybe I went in expecting too much? If anyone feels the same as, please let me know. I can't be the only person that feels this way right? 

Service was good, except the host looked like she wanted to go home badly.

THE HYPE IS REAL! 

TL;DR: must try: creamy polenta with truffles mushroom; spaghetti and the mascarpone cheesecake. 

We went during the restaurant week and everything was SO good! If I'm stranded on an island and can only eat one thing for the rest of my life, I'd pick that polenta. The cheesecake was made from mascarpone, so it's not heavy like the New York cheesecake but A LOT smoother and creamier. In fact, probably the smoothest and creamiest I've ever had. 

I also love the design of the restaurant. Intimate, not too loud, has a glass wall facing the Bellagio fountain show and seemingly much larger tables than other fine dining places (lol). I also noticed a couple semi-private rooms for larger groups and events.

Edits: almost forgot about the bread basket. They had like 6 different breads with all kinds of flavors and textures. Never thought that I would be craving for some broccoli bread.

There are some more favorable seats, definitely grab a booth or something by the window to view Bellagio's fountains, unfortunately due to the proportions of my body, I had to peep over or under the metal strip on the window.  

Great Italian wine variatels by the glass: Falaghina, Vermentino & Rosso Di Montalc.

Eats:
*Complimentary bread is a meal in itself, there is a selection with salami and cheese between excellent toasty bread.  The accompaniments were housemade, mascapone butter and marinated eggplants.
*Waygu Beef Tartare, cured egg, parmigiano, toasted hazelnuts & sea salt, the nuts were a unique touch, flavors were delicate & clean, the beef shined
*Duck Foie Gras Ravioli, lovely marsala reduction, the filling was so heavenly, but I thought the pasta was a little thick
*Black Farfalle, lobster, bread crumbs, perfectly al dente pasta, sweet generous pieces of the crustacean
*Branzino, leeks, white asparagus, pine nuts and gremolata, LOVED this dish, crisp skin and nicely cooked flesh.  
*Aged Sirloin Beef, gnocchi, wild mushrooms, parmigiano & ragu, rich, hearty and robust flavors, the cut of beef could have been better

Wish there was a green leafy salad, the only thing I spied was the heirloom mozzarella.  Doesn't cut it for me.

Seamless service and solid food, one of the better choices for Italian on the Strip, the ambiance is there, if you want to go purely for food, Batali or bust.

Amazing food particularly the burrata, scallops and steak with potato gnocchi very delicious. The amazing service was provided by Jason and Adriana tonight who took great care of my friend and I. I will come back again!

I am so disappointed. I come here lookong to have a great time and i am rushed thru the entire experience. First i was asked if i wanted an appetizer within minutes of getting the menu we orderd and within 5 minutes the food was on the table befor our drinks or even the bread was on the table. We then orderd dinner and that showed up within out last bites. We were only there for a total of 45 minutes.  If you like being rushed thru dinner this is the place to go.

We picked Scarpetta for our 25th wedding anniversary dinner based on the menu.  We are so glad we did!!!  Absolutely delicious!!  We chose the tasting menu with the wine pairing. They were 6 delicious courses, so glad we didn't eat lunch and that we were told not to eat the bread.  We would not have been able to finish if we had eaten the bread.  Jason and Elaina our wait staff, took very good care of us all night.  We did not want for anything during the meal.  It was a very very nice evening.

My favorite course was the short rib agnolotti, and my husband loved the scallop with foie gras and polenta.  The salted caramel sauce was so good I asked for a bowl to dip my cake in.  The dessert wine was a little weird for us but all of the other wine selections were perfect.  

We will be back for another big event, we enjoyed our evening that much.  Thank you Scarpetta for making this special evening so memorable.

I wasn't too impressed with the meal here. For me personally, if I wanted a great Italian meal, I would rather stick with Buca. The food was OK it wasn't exceptional. It wasn't bad either. I had the halibut which was REALLY weird. It was like goopy and I thought "how odd..." I inquired thinking maybe this is how it was meant to come but they realized that there was something wrong with the fish, promptly apologized, owned up to the mistake, and when I asked for a different dish, they really rushed it and I wasn't left waiting for too long. 

Honestly, the best way any food mistake by a restaurant I've seen handled (the owning up to the mistake and rushing to get the second dish ready was probably the best / most perfect response to a situation like this. They did not comp or discount my dish though. Obviously didn't charge for the fish but the second dish I asked for to replace the fish showed up at full price on the bill- which is fine but thought I should mention that the extent of rectification was great communication and nothing more). 

Bottom line for me is, that the food was just ok and I've had better at several different placed in and around the vicinity. I went with a group of 8 and got to try a bit of everyone's dish- everything was just "alright" (we had venison, steak, pea soup, agnolotti, spaghetti, halibut, another fish dish etc, and several desserts).

Had a bachelorette party here. Food was decent but the service sucks!! We had a large party so the gratitude was already included. However, I guess that was why they lost their motivation to make our visit comfortable.

In the mood for pasta. The whole family ordered it and the homemade variety did not disappoint . The duck fat ravioli was unique and a rare find in any Italian restaurant.  It was fantastic and didn't want the meal to end. Excellent service with real Italian waiters.

What a great night out.  There are several Italian choices in LV and I'm glad that we chose here.   The bread and especially Stromboli with eggplant was amazing, we asked for more.  The polenta with truffle was wow!   We had the short rib and spaghetti main courses and I would do it again. The broccoli was a little too bitter for me.  The wine menu is certainly one of the more inflated I have seen but we got a nice Groth for a little higher than going rate.  We couldn't get last minute reservations but could get a nice private booth in the lounge which was perfect and probably better than the main dining area. I would come back!

Love love love!!!  

The food was delicious!   Right away we were sat under our 6 pm reservation and they gave us a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. The waiter we had was very attentive and asked us if we had any allergies to any food! 

I ordered their cocktails while my husband had wine. They came pretty quickly and the water was even faster.  I ordered the 1/2 dozen oysters and scallops for our appetizers.  Excellent!  Wanted to order more.  For our entree, I ordered their short rib pasta and the husband had Filet Mignon.  My short ribs were probably a 6/10 but my husbands Filet Mignon I tried was really yummy.  

I really enjoyed the meal and the experience. The decor was amazing.  It also looked like they had what looked like romantic small tables near the front and if you had a larger group, there was a private room that could seat maybe 12-16 people  in the back of the restaurant or group seatings as well.

The food was absolutely amazing - my two friends and I all had various pasta dishes and could not stop eating off one another's plates. However our service was HORRIBLE. Just because your clients are young does not mean you pay them any less attention (we are 23 each) because you think we are going to tip you less possibly? Also one our friends had gotten pick pocketed the night before. She had asked the waiter respectfully about alternative forms of ID that were understandably declined by the manager who then went on claiming how strict they were about IDing individuals.....but then did not even ID him when it came time for our one male friend (we were both females) to order a drink. Not sure if he meant to come off as sexist but I can promise you that it did - and quite rude in his mannerisms. However we took the high road and didn't pull the manager aside to complain about his waiting staff and instead gave our waiter a 40% tip. Promise you I won't be back until I've aged at least 10+ years because they simply don't enjoy young individuals.

Wow this restaurant is amazing. Atmosphere is chill with great music playing. Our waitir was so sweet and told great stories. My wine was fantastic and OMG the food is out of this world! Try the farmers salad, corn soup and the carrots! Highly recommend!!!

I went with some friends to the 'Chef's Table' at Scarpetta last night. The food was outstanding -- we had the tuna carpaccio, special pastas, veal, steak....everything was superb. However, the sommelier was pretty much of a con artist. Because there is a dining minimum, he sold us a very expensive (think $450) bottle of a white Burgundy which had almost no flavor at all.  (When he asked, we said we were disappointed, and he gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne, to be fair.) But beware!!!!!  

We did have a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains and the kitchen.

Request a table by the windows for views of the Bellagio fountains.  We came here for a late dinner on a Thursday night.  We walked into a narrow room with no hostess to be found.  A little confused, we waited to see if we were in the right place. Along came a waiter to assist. He sat us by the windows. We got lucky.  We saw the amazing Bellagio fountain show every 15 minutes. It was pretty cool.  Dinner was good but pricey. I ordered 1/2 dozen of oysters to start and it was delis.  The homemade cocktail sauce was so perfect.  For my entree, I ordered the tagliatelle and it was okay. The first few bites were good but got heavy after a while, that and i'm not a fan of peas and carrots with my pasta.  My husband ordered the prime filet of beef with 
potato-lardo purée, rainbow chard & barolo sauce.  He loved it. The rainbow chard and barolo sauce was probably the best thing on the dish. We spent about $140 on dinner. i wasn't that impressed for the price but still good overall.   The view makes up for it. I'm a big fan of the Bellagio fountains and it never gets old.

One of the best dining experiences in Vegas to date.

To start off I must say that our waiter, Matt, was amazing.  He was so knowlegeable, friendly, and answered all of our questions.  He really knew the menu well and could give reccomendations with amazing detail.  I loved the staff here.

No joke, that bread basket with trio of citrus infused olive oil, eggplant spread and mascarpone butter...is to die for!  I could live off the stromboli filled with salami and smoked mozzarella.  So delicious.

As a starter, I tried the Raw Yellowtail.  The presentation was simple and clean with four thin slices of yellowtail topped with olio di zenzero, microgreens and sea salt.  It was so simple but you could taste the freshness.

For my next course, I ordered the Short Rib Agnolloti.  Perfection.  The brown butter and horseradish sauce was flavorful and had the right amount of kick to pull the dish together.  It was a very small portion but was perfect for a light dinner before going out.  My friends ordered the Spaghetti with Tomato and Basil, Black Tagliolini, and Orata Rossa.  They all enjoyed their meals and the experience at Scarpetta.

Our amazing waiter Matt, surprised our table with a birthday plate of an assortment of Italian cookies which were an amazing finish to a great meal.

Great ambiance, view of the Bellagio fountain, service, food...overall an amazing dinner!!

This place will never let you down. Came with a group of 6 and we got access to the private room with a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Our server Luis was a delight. At one point my husband dropped his steak knife and before he could even ask for a new one Luis had arrived with a new one. Seriously, amazing job.

I don't have to go on and on about the spaghetti again but seriously. Get it. You won't regret it.

My husband also got a filet that was one of the best cooked filets I've ever had. It was also served with this amazing swiss chard and onion that had this bright acidity that really balanced the steak well.

Crudos are tasty as well.

dessert we had the Bomboloni and the Budino. The budino was heaven in a jar. I highly recommend it!

Fabulous dinner with friends to celebrate a birthday!   We were treated like royalty.  We sat at a table just off the kitchen with an incredible view of all the talent in the kitchen and a great view of the Bellagio fountains.  Mario (the GM) was so gracious.  Noe (the sommelier) was hysterical and kept us laughing all night long.  Thank you to everyone at Scarpetta that helped create incredible memories for our group of five.

Scarpetta is delicious! Great food and good, friendly service. I ordered their ubiquitous spaghetti, but I also got to try their daily special, pasta cooked with peaches and lobster, and their duck ravioli with foie gras. All dishes were excellent, but my favorite was the spaghetti with basil--simple and just different enough to distinguish itself as the best spaghetti I've had. 

The pasta and lobster special was light but the duck ravioili tasted rich, probably better shared, IMO.

We came here for our Anniversary and was really looking forward to what looked like an amazing dinner. The best part about our experience was the bread basket and dessert. Everything inbetween was a disappointment unfortunately. 

*The bread basket was amazing 

*The tuna and avocado appetizer was so bland. The waiter told us guests had complained of too much citrus added to the dish so they took it away. WTF 
So now Im paying almost $20 for a piece of tuna with sinew running through all of our pieces and plain avocado. It was a slight joke. Im sure it was better with the citrus dressing they got rid of. 

*The spaghetti was good I ate all of it but I added the meatballs which were also a joke. They were so tiny and tasted like baby food. 

*The short Rib ravioli dish was good

*The mascarpone cheesecake was heaven. 

*The service was great, almost a little too attentive like they were trying to rush us through the meal for table turn over. 

*All in all it was ok. The view of the Bellagio fountains was a bonus. I felt like I was paying more for the view than the food. I love Scott Conant, I love Chopped, there are so many restaurants to choose from in Vegas and I was reaaally looking forward to going there but I was a bit let down. If we were to return to Scarpetta it would be for a cocktail and dessert.

The hours posted are very wrong. I made a reservation for 5:30 on a Thursday, apparently they don't open until 6. I asked the girl standing inside about why they weren't open when I arrived at 5:30 and she was extremely rude. The concierge at The Cosmopolitan had told us they open at 5:30, their website says 5:30, this yelp page says 5:30. The girl I interacted with was short in tone, condescending, slammed the door on us and in no way helpful or apologetic. Since we had a show to get to at 7, we didn't stay and wait for them to let us in at 6. She wasn't just rude to me, she was rude to an entire family waiting as well.

I was really looking forward to finally trying this place. I come to Vegas often and I can say I won't ever give this place a try again. Horrible customer service.

Honestly, I don't think you can go wrong with ANY restaurant in Cosmo. I've been to 3 so far and each one has been phenomenal. My friends and I decided to give Scarpetta a try since it's Restaurant Week! 

Scarpetta is an Italian restaurant that is located on the 3rd level of Cosmo. It overlooks the Bellagio fountains which makes it great date spot. It's also pretty dark and romantical in there too. If you're coming here for a date, definitely ask for window seats. 

Onto the food!

Appetizers:
     - Braised short rib with vegetable and farro risotto: this was delicious! The short rib is sliced (instead of the chunky ones I'm used to seeing) and the risotto was super creamy
     - Creamy polenta with truffle mushrooms: this was a amazing! I love anything with truffle and if I didn't know may better, I would've thought the polenta was mashed potatoes because it was so creamy!

Entrees: 
     - Prime filet of beef with Swiss chard and barolo: I got this medium well and I absolutely loved it. The steak was juicy and paired well with the swiss chard 
     - Spaghetti with tomato and basil: cooked al dente, sauce was perfect. However, this wouldn't be something I'd get again mainly because I need some sort of meat in my meals

Dessert:
     - Nutella bombolini: Fried dough rolled in sugar. Reminded me of Chinese fried donuts but with Nutella inside. This was good but wasn't my favorite. 
     - Amedei chocolate cake: definitely hits the chocolate spot. It's more of a dark chocolate cake which is my kind of jam!
     - Mascarpone cheesecake: my favorite! It was so smooth and not overly sweet. I ate the whole thing! 

Since it's Restaurant Week, this 3-course meal was $50 which is totally worth it in my opinion. Just go with someone so you can share multiple things on the menu :)

My girlfriend and I were staying at the cosmo over the Christmas break and we decided we wanted some good Italian food. And we got it
We got;
Side of wild mushrooms
Grilled octopus 
Wild boar spaghetti 
Basil and tomato spaghetti

Everything was perfect and excellent, their staff was very friendly and attentive. 

They will not seat you earlier than your dinner reservation, so don't go too early. Their lounge/bar area is comfortable to eat at.

We have eaten at Scarpetta several times and while we have enjoyed it each time, it's not the best value - the portions are small and kinda fussy. 

The view is great and the service is always good. But if you are near the window, either you are looking over someone or they are looking over you, it's not comfortable.

This place was recommended by a friend so we went with another couple that was with us in Vegas. We had so many dishes I can't even remember it all (or all the fancy names) but it was amazing! I had the pasta with clams & my husband had their spaghetti. Both excellent! I am SUPER picky about my pasta being over cooked but this place was on POINT! I had the raw tuna appetizer which was just heavenly! We also had the polenta with mushrooms which was delicious!!! I don't even like mushrooms but this was soooo good! 
Desserts were the highlight of this dinner! My good friend is a BIG DESSERTS girl so when our table was covered in desserts she about died. We had 5 different desserts the 4 of us shared and every single one was thoroughly enjoyed! Yum! My husband and my friend said the cheesecake and the souffle were by far the best they ever had! Personally I LOVED the homemade soda/fruit dessert that came out! It was so different and SO YUMMY!

Dinner reservations at 9:30pm on Sunday. Food was decent but nothing wow. Service was a little off and made the experience a little sour. Ordered Mediterranean octopus, duck and foie gras ravioli, black tagliolini, spaghetti, fennel dusted black cod, broccoli rabe, and strawberry soufflé. The stand outs were the octopus and ravioli. Everything else fell flat. Our spaghetti came out crunchy; well under done. Sent it back to get it cooked a little longer and it still came out not cooked through. I question if the pasta is made in house. The soufflé was undercooked as well. They sent a plate of bite sized desserts to make up for it but I was over it by that point. Took forever and a day to close the bill. A little weird when the restaurant was empty but, whatever. A plus was the view of the bellagio fountain and plate presentation.

My partner took me here for my 22nd birthday. It was one hell of a treat. 
He was able to get us a chair near the windows with a great view of the Bellagio Fountains. The lighting was dim, but not too dark and surprisingly quiet and romantic. 
He ended up purchasing (not sure what the hell it's called) this sort of sampling type thing...expensive, but we had about 8 courses of food or so. By the time we got to the dessert, I was stuffed. The food was amazing. The service was spectacular. The place looked nice, but expect to spend a little money for this amazing place.

Food was good, not great. Service severely lacking, at least at our table. Portions not comparable with the prices but could have been overlooked had our waiter been more professional and customer service oriented. 

Management really should choose their employees more carefully, and that would include front of the house.

As for the window seating....where to begin. It really needs to be stated that even though there is window seating with view of the strip, there is a very large horizontal beam (which happens to be at eye level when seated) that obstructs your view. Restaurant should have made design considerations with regard to seating and tables to accommodate for that beam. 

Better places -hands down- in Vegas to spend a little less of my hard earned money and receive a better meal and better service!

I visited Scarpetta quite a while ago, but the experience was a negative one and therefore I feel the need to share, for the sake of diners who are looking to spend some money on a nice dinner.  I'm giving Scarpetta one star for the bread. It was the only remarkable part of the meal. Service was alright... A bit on the snooty side despite the fact that we ordered the most expensive things in the menu and lots of wine.
The most disappointing moment if the evening was when I ordered the truffled egg noodles, which were supposed to be dressed with shaved truffle at the table. I don't know what our waiter grated on my pasta, but nothing about my meal tasted like truffle. It was nothing more than buttered noodles. The price for this pasta dish was an offensive $60. No matter how passable anything else was (the diver scallops were nothing special), I could never justify being robbed blind for such a sad and disappointing main course. 
Perhaps judging a place by one dish is unfair, but truffles and pasta are special to me. A place that charges this much for Italian food should be doing it above and beyond.

Came here for a girl's weekend out. What a great experience! 
Scarpetta is located on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel. It's quite swanky, so you will want to dress up so you don't stick out like a sore thumb. The ambience is classy /sophisticated. The lighting is a bit dark, but that's why this is a great set up for looking out the window at night to see the Bellagio water show. It's a great place to take a date or to just have a "let's get dressed up cuz we can" night out with the girls.
We had a reservation, so we were seated immediately. May I just mention that the service here is magnificent. There was just the three of us, but they still sat us in a huge booth that can easily sit 6 people. It's a circular booth, so I was a little apprehensive about scooting with my little black dress on. Without saying a word, our host slid the whole table out, so that we can walk to our seats instead of scooting. From then, they had already won me over =).
 Ok, let's get to the food shall we? We started with the "Braised short ribs of beef" which is placed over root vegetables and risotto. Delish. The short rib was soft and delicate and melt in your mouth deliciousness. Not over seasoned at all. There are four small pieces, but each bite is delightful. The other appetizer that we decided to share was the "Roasted Sea Scallops" which is served over cauliflower, bottarge, cili and caper sauce. Aaaaaaaaaa-mazing. If I wasn't so nice, I would've eaten both pieces instead of share it. ;-)
The complimentary bread came with three spreads - butter, eggplant, and olive oil. All three tasted great and the different types of bread were warm and soft and all kinds of good =P. And since I love bread... this just won me over even more.
So since this is an Italian restaurant and the chef became famous because of his spaghetti, we all decided to order pasta. We ordered "Duck and foie gras ravioli", "spaghetti," and "stracci"... all of which were heavenly. The ravioli was soft, but not mushy and filled with such great flavor that my friend, who was already really full midway, ate the whole entire dish. Spaghetti - you think it's just regular good ol' spaghetti... not at all. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the seasoning was on point. Not too salty, not too sweet. perfect. My dish was the Stracci - flat pieces of hand made noodles with lobster, crab, shrimp, and basil breadcrumbs.
