The final savory dish was a wagyu beef served atop a creamy mash with spinach. Now this dish speaks for itself. You simply can't go wrong with perfectly medium rare wagyu beef. It just melts in your mouth, literally! It's a symphony of delights from start to finish. Encore! 

From the amazing cuisine, exceptional service, sleek & cool environs and awesome view, I really couldn't ask for more out of a wonderfully unforgettable NYE dinner.

Bravo Scarpetta!!!
Very good. My NY Strip was excellent. Pasta also very good. Chicken was good. Nice setting. If you get a seat by the window you can watch the fountains at Bellagio.

Umm wow!!

Where do I start??

VIEWS, BREAD, POLENTA, PASTA!

Best views of the Bellagio fountain show while enjoying a top notch dinner! I had a window seat and it was just amazing to watch the water show every few minutes while overlooking the strip.

The bread was amazing! Eggplant dipping sauce yum!

The following was ordered:
Mushroom Polenta - give me a pot of this I will down it in one sitting. So flavorful. Such great texture. I know what you're thinking "why would I come here to order a mash potato dish" don't be fooled people- it's pure heaven.

The spaghetti - by far the best spaghetti I've ever had. The tomatoes and Basel sauce was to die for. The pasta was cooked just perfectly -al dente .  It's simple but great.

Short rib agnolotti - what can I saw - sweet yet savory. Filling yet not enough to cut your appetite to see what's next.  Remember gusher the fruit snack? This is like an adult version... No joke!

Pici - pesto lobster pasta with tarragon. Warning this can be a little spicy for some people, but if you like spicy this is your dish. The amount of lobster in the dish was perfect and so fresh. The dish in general is something that is so unorthodox - like a spicy pesto? Who does that- well Scarpetta did and they did it perfectly!

We didn't have enough room for dessert but at least I got to try 3 pastas that are now on my top 10 list!

Service was five star also!!

Enjoy!

What do you do when you're too cracked out to go clubbing in Vegas? You eat at a fancy restaurant of course. 

Despite the reservations we were not seated as promptly as I would like, but the wait was not too long. We did request to be seated where we could see the fountains, a wish that went unfulfilled.I understand Vegas was at its capacity that weekend so I suppose it is forgivable though disappointing. We had the braised short ribs, spaghetti, and the duck & foie gras ravioli. We ended the meal with an unmemorable custard. 

Our waiter was excruciatingly nice, checking up on us every few minutes, never daring to let the water drain completely from our cups. He even remembered my boyfriend from his last business trip there.

The eggplant spread, short ribs, the spaghetti were nothing short of magnificent especially the spaghetti which lived up to all of its hype. I could eat an entire barrel of that spaghetti in all its simplistic perfection. My only issue was that my ravioli was so salty I could barely eat it. It won't deter me from coming back again though.

It was a nice modern style restaurant. The menu noted that the pasta was imported from a place called Scarpetta. (I'll look it up one of these days) The ambience was nice but however it might have been too dark and dim mainly because my eyes started to hurt after awhile. (*I ate with a large group. We were given a private room which was a bonus.)

I ordered a Mediterranean Branzini (fish). It looked beautiful on the plate which is always nice. After taking one bite, I noticed that the skin was extremely crispy but unfortunately the fish came out a bit dry. The dish was really depended on the sauce for it to work for me. The dish was also served with thinly sliced leeks, two tiny shrimps, and two mussels. The shrimp and leeks were delicious but the mussel was a bit gritty. I'm not sure if that's really my thing but the flavor was good though. 

This dish was worth a shot but I preferred the dishes that others in my party enjoyed such as short rib Agnalotti, Kobe beef, and some kind of chicken dish. The chicken that I sample was completely moist. I was very surprised and at the time was very jealous that I didn't ordered that instead.

Anyways, there was a complimentary salami/cheese bread in the bread basket. I recommend it. Don't forget to try the creamy dessert of pana cotta and guava. It was very sweet, refreshing, and light.

Beautiful new restaurant at the Thompson Hotel on Wellington just shy of a month old.  With a grand open space concept, large mahogany booths that snake through the center of the room and   full height wine racks that require a ladder to reach the top shelves.  With your meal illuminated by soft blue spotlights, this place tastefully whispers "Yes, I want your beautiful, sophisticated money".

The Italian menu focuses, and highlights season ingredients while keeping the traditional items you'd expect to see at an Italian restaurant.

For starters we had the Raw Waygu Beef with mushrooms, hazelnuts and parmigiano.  Smooth and silky textures with a beautiful hint of dare I say.. Dorrito flavours.

We split their Tomato & Basil Spaghetti because that's what they're known for, and it didn't disappoint. Their pasta is handmade and cooked to perfection.  The sauce was flavourful, but not overbearing and stuck to the pasta very nicely.  It was an amazingly light and tasty mid course.

For mains we had the Ocean Trout and the Duck Breast, I liked the Trout far more than my Duck.  It had amazingly crispy skin, accompanying fatty tender meat. However, my duck wasn't hot when served and felt chewier than I would've liked.  They listed mustard seeds as one of the ingredients, and I could see it, just not taste it.

The service was impeccable and our waitress and sommelier were incredibly friendly.  The bus boys were attentive and professional, and kept our wine flowing and our table clean.

Dinner came to $210sh before tip, which included a bottle of wine, dessert and coffee.  I want to give it 4 stars, but my main was just disappointing enough that I can't.  I would go back and try their other dishes when they've been open for a bit longer and found their groove.

I have been the Scarpetta in New York City about 4 times. And each time I go, I have to get (at least for an app) the exact same thing. I cannot recommend the spaghetti marinara strongly enough. The rest of the food we ordered was great-- but this is just the perfect bowl of pasta.

Having said that-- the NYC restaurant had superior service. They were busy, but it seemed like our waiter, who had our table first, had about 5 other tables sit down at the exact same time after us-- so our service was quite slow. (although, still very friendly). I think that is way more the problem of management to sit 5 tables in one waiters section all at once. I felt like it took at least 20 minutes to flag down the waiter to get our check delivered to us.

Again-- food was great, service was slow because it was so crowded... they should do something to rectify that situation.

Service and food was spot on.  Even though we came earlier than our actual reservations, the hostess was still able to seat us immediately and we also got to sit close to the window to see the Bellagio water show.  Our server was friendly and very helpful.  We ladies weren't sure what wines to drink with our dinner so our server was nice enough to let us try a few of their wines so we can decide on our choice.  

My DH had the beet salad and the duck ravioli.  He was in heaven.  Every time he put a ravioli in his mouth, he was saying, "Oh my god, Oh my god this is so good."

We also had the creamy polenta for appetizer, that was also a big hit.  I had the spaghetti.  It sounds plain, but was the best I've ever eaten.  Seriously.   I wanted to hate this restaurant so much because Scott Connant is such a stickler for his pasta on "Chopped".  I was ready to pounce out a bad review because the pasta was not right, or the seasoning was off.  But I have to say I had nothing to complain about, it was utterly a fantastic experience and the pasta was awesome! Even the stromboli bread that they brought out left me speechless.  Ok, so not speechless where I couldn't ask for more, but you get the picture.  Scott, well done!!!

We had late reservations on a Sunday, but it was still extremely crowded and even with reservations we had to wait 20 minutes. I was a little annoyed by having to wait, especially that late, but we ended up with a table that overlooked the Bellagio fountain so that was nice.

As everyone else has said, the portions are smaller than what people are used to but I actually liked that as my friend and I were able to split an app, and then each order an entree and split an additional entree as a middle course. The middle course was the spaghetti as we had heard good things, however we didn't find it to be anything special and it came out luke warm. However, we also had the Creamy Polenta, Stracci, and Black Farfalle which were all amazing!

Thomas Keller needs to eat here.

Why?

When Keller was contemplating opening a restaurant in Vegas, he refused to consider putting up a branch of The French Laundry there because, in his opinion, Vegas was too informal and boisterous for an experience which intended to be intensely focused and all-encompassing.

Scarpetta, however, proves that this idea is outdated.

This is a restaurant, located right in the center of the action on the Las Vegas strip which, despite the non-ending commotion, offers an experience in which the diner is able to enjoy the entirety of a meal without nary a distraction.

Las Vegas, instead of detracting from the experience of a fine meal, is now enhancing it.

Waiter was unfriendly and not welcoming.    Waited overlong for him to come to table.   He came too take and only said, "do you have any questions".   We said , "lots, what do you recommend?"     He flipped open a menu, pointed at each section and said something like top 3, top 2' etc as he pointed at each section.   No other comments, such as why they are recommended, etc.....then said, "any other questions".  We said ,"guess not".  And he walked away.....no drink order request, nothing.....waited about 10 minutes and got up and left.   At least 4 employees watched us leave and never acknowledged us.     Will never return.   Fyi ate dinner at Giadas at the Cromwell the night before....it received 5 stars.   Go there instead.

Amazing. This place succeeds in every way, from the food, to the service, to the atmosphere. As it should when you're paying $$$$ for dinner. Another bonus is that if you're not impressed by all the meat and seafood dishes on the menu, they have a separate vegetarian menu for freaks like me. All you have to do is ask. I was beyond happy. Much to my surprise, elegant dining can be found on the strip.

Came here Friday night for dinner, to celebrate my friend's birthday. One of my friends had heard about the original NYC restaurant and it came recommended, so we were excited to try the LV outpost. The food did not disappoint. First, I'd like to give a shoutout to the service - our waiter was fantastic and actually remembered our food preferences, which is so nice of him. The service was speedy but they didn't hover - we never felt rushed, which was what every restaurant experience should feel like.  We started off the complimentary bread basket - this was the most amazing bread basket I've ever had. There are several varieties of bread - there is a non vegetarian bread too, so if you're vegetarian let the waiter know beforehand and they'll bring out the vegetarian versions only. For the table, we ordered the seafood antipasto appetizer. The kitchen did accommodate our request to have the seafood and the vegetables be separated to keep it vegetarian, which was class. My favorite of the vegetarian antipasto was the squash, which was perfectly complemented with the Calabrian tomato dipping sauce. Onto the main course - one of my friends and I shared our dished. We ordered the the spaghetti (no meatballs) and the parmesan ravioli. To finish off, we ordered the chocolate cake to share between the four of us. It was good, but the interior wasn't as molten as I would have preferred. One thing to note - they didn't add a candle for my friend's dessert, even though we mentioned it on our OpenTable reservation. Not sure if they don't do at all, or forgot to for us. Still, it was a great dinner and a restaurant I recommend dining at in Vegas, especially if you like pasta.

Came here for a special occasion after Nora's Wine Bar closed.  We needed something that would wow us.  The ambiance certainly did, the service was great, and the food certainly did at times.

We did the tasting menu.  And the bottom line is that we were very happy, but not as happy as we could possibly be.  The expectation was high, and so was the price...so at the price we really needed it to come through for a 5 star rating...it ended as a 4 or 4.5 star experience for us.

There were a few items that left us wanting.  The spaghetti was good, but not the best thing I ever ate good (pasta or tomato... either way it was just above average good.)    The spaghetti was simple and lacked anything to set it off as truly amazing--coming off above-average, but slightly flat.  Likewise we enjoyed the duck & foie gras ravioli, but not at the raved about level we hoped for. The raviolis were overly rich and lacking balance...we were vary happy to just have a small portion in the tasting menu.

Some of our favorites were black cod, branzino, yellowtail, and creamy polenta with fricassee of truffled mushrooms.

We were also happy with the bread basket...how can you not be though?...a bread basket that includes a stromboli of rolled with cheeses and salami...yes please!

We had an amazing seat overlooking the Bellagio Fountains.

Simply Amazing.


There is a very tough choice when dining at the Cosmo because they have amazing offerings.  Scarpetta is one of those choices that I believe is a must.

The ambiance is very nice, and if you get there at a good time, you can request a table by the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains for some dinner entertainment.

There were 7 of us in my party, so I got to try quite a few things.  Service was on par with any high end restaurant which is good.

Bread - They give you four variations of bread, all good.  The standout is the Stromboli.  The bread comes with three dips which are Eggplant, Olive Oil with Lime and Marscapone Butter.  The eggplant dip was amazing.

Steak Tartar - This dish was fabulous and is my main recommendation for appetizer.  It is perfectly seasoned and finished off with a tiny quail egg on top. The toast points are also seasoned, buttered and toasted to add that buttery nutty flavor to the bite.

Fried Lemon Grass and Char - This dish was unique.  It was little strands tempura-like fried bits of lemon grass and fish mixed together.  I said Char because I believe that is what it was, but I cannot be for certain.  It was very simple and very good but I could take it or leave it for the price.

Scallops - Careful with this dish as you only get two.  I understand they are a luxury type item but for 21$ or how much ever it was, two scallops did not go a long way.  They were your average good scallop.

Foie Gras & Duck Ravioli - The star of the night.  This dish was simply perfect.  From flavor balance, quantity of food, to execution...it was a hit.  If you come here and don't at least try it, you are missing out.

Filet - The filet was cook medium rare (which is the way I like it) and was very soft as it should be.  That being said, it was a filet.  A normal good filet that you can get from any great steakhouse.  The star of that dish was actually the accompanying potatoes.  Mashed with garlic, sauteed spinach, sun dried tomatoes and a cheese that I could not recognize.

Chicken - OK yes, someone ordered chicken.   The one dish everyone always passes over at restaurants because...well, its chicken.  That being said, I was given about a fourth of the chicken because they were full and I must admit.  It was tasty as hell.  The skin is cooked on it to make it very crispy with seasonings that go a long way.  The bird itself was moist so that you had to use hardly any effort for it to shred apart in your mouth.  If I ever ordered chicken in a restaurant, this would be the one.  Its also a HUGE portion in terms of high end restaurant portions.

I would go back here in a heart beat.

Fellow Food Network junkies don't even need to be told why I lobbied to get to this place. I only need say one name to explain anything: SCOTT CONANT.  His rep is for fine Italian dining, and after having been a fan of his for umpteen years, the time had finally come to see if there was substance behind the style.

The answer is YAAAASSS, baby, and in spades, deuces, clubs...however you want to put it!  The restaurant is appointed in blond and dark woods and beautiful, but the real selling point is the HUGE picture windows that open out to the Strip, but ESPECIALLY the Dancing Fountains across the street at the Bellagio.  When you make a reservation or walk-in, make sure you ask for THAT seating.  You won't regret it.

The menu's not WAR AND PEACE-sized, so it wasn't difficult to make choices.  We opened with the Creamy Polenta (an absolute bull's-eye for me) and the Diver Scallops and Foie Gras for Bear, (which he shared generously - not a seafood fan at all, but the foie gras was fatty, sumptuous and completely decadent.)

Now, if you follow him on the Food Network, everyone knows that he's the "pasta guy", so I expected it to be pretty much close to perfect, when I ordered the Short Rib Agnolotti and the Spaghetti.  And how were they? Let's just say I have no idea where the hell that Agnolotti has been all my life, but if I weren't married to Bear already, I might have had to look into the possibilities of pledging my undying love to a plate of pasta.  And the Spaghetti?  Fits RIGHT in with Scott's philosophy about what makes it perfect: not soggy and not toothsome, with the right 'mouth feel', as they say, and a terrific marinara to grace it with. Meanwhile, Bear kept on the seafood tip with the Branzino, and gushed that he hadn't had fish that delicate or deliciously prepared, since our experiences at our adopted "second home" in Baltimore's Little Italy, La Tavola.

Now, with Chef Conant's and this place's rep, and the food being FANTASTIC, you may ask why not a full five stars? Well, there is a reason, and it has to do with the service. 

We were gifted with a $200 Cosmopolitan gift card, which is what prompted me to urge Bear to give this place a shot. We'd already been to other Cosmo eateries, and the experiences were fine, but we were looking for EXCEPTIONAL, which this almost was...until the bill came due.  Turns out, the waiter explained when he came back the first time, that he didn't know how to process the card, since the number on the back wasn't working - something like that.  Bear, getting understandably perturbed, asked him to try it again.  And again, he came back, very sheepish and apologetic, and said again that the card wasn't "taking".

Not sure how this whole thing was ultimately resolved - I do believed the manager had to get involved at some point - but this hitch at the end was a SNAFU that dampened the whole experience for us.  We will probably be back...but it may not be for a while.

Couldn't be more happy with my experience here. The ambiance was beautiful and we were seated at the window with a fantastic view of the Bellagio. Then the staff was sublime. All of them were so friendly, knowledgable, and the service they provided was top notch. Our waiter Matt even gave us a plate of complimentary treats to congratulate me on my graduation from nursing school. 

Now for the food. The drinks were great and even the bread basket was next level. The Stromboli were amazing as well as the spreads for the bread. The special carpaccio was outstanding providing bursts of flavor and texture. Then my creamy polenta with fricaseed mushrooms was out of this world life changing. My mom's squid ink pasta with crab and uni was unbelievable! And my duck and foie ravioli was so luscious. Our coconut Panna cotta was a wonderful way to end a fantastic meal.
Love this place.... good vibe, romantic and good good food. I will definitely be back for the bone marrows pasta!!!

What a memorable night it was! First, I definitely would request a window view of the Bellagio water show if you can, because my boyfriend and I saw three shows while enjoying our dinner. Scarpetta's very romantic but is also just a great place for a one-of-a-kind Italian meal. 

We started out with sharing a glass of Pinot Noir, which was delicious and smooth. For an appetizer, I highly recommend the creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms...then you must dip the bread they give you into the mushroom mixture. Deliciouso! I ordered the simple, but unforgettable Tomato and Basil Spaghetti and my boyfriend ordered the Short Rib Agnolotti, which he devoured. All their pasta is made fresh at the restaurant and can't be compared to any other pasta I've had. You must try it for yourself!

Reservations can be made online, and I definitely recommend this to anyone who is visiting Las Vegas with their significant other or wants to make a good first impression :)

I visited Scarpetta Saturday, June 4th at about 8pm to 10pm. When you first look at the entrance to Scarpetta all it looks like is a long narrow hallway from a distance, but it is so much more. The restaurant opens up to an "L" and overlooks the Bellagio fountains. It really is a breathtaking spot and the atmosphere is to die for. Besides visiting the pools view of the strip, this restaurant has to have the best view of the fountains. When i arrived at the restaurant it was very busy so we sat at the bar. The bar is a great room of lights, atmosphere, and helpful people. While staying there we had many custom cocktails (Scarpetta creations) that the bartenders made that were delicious. We also enjoyed the bread, which they said came for D.O.C.G., which was fabulous. The bread was homemade and there were several different types, all of them great flavors. We ate their spaghetti and their ravioli, both were excelt. The cost of the meal and drinks was around $100. It was a little more than i usually spend, but when you buys drinks it can become alot more. I thought for the spot it was at, the food quality, and the atmosphere the price was right on. I would highly recommend this place, and if you already had a meal and just relax there with some of their drinks.

(1st review of 2013!)

My goodness, Scott Conant - you gave us THE best meal in Vegas, EVER!

Located in the new Cosmopolitan Hotel, Scarpetta's chic, dark, ambience welcomes you and your party (I observed some ranging from business meetings to bachelorette parties and everything in between, with different types of seating arrangements to  match) and the vibe was always cool and collected. The service felt disconnected - I would've removed 1 star because of that, but the food was so superb that I won't! We didn't have reservations because it was a last minute decision to dine there, but we were seated right away regardless.

We skipped appetizers and went straight for the entrees. My eyes went straight to the DUCK & FOIS GRAS RAVIOLI! My heart jumped for joy realizing that fois gras is completely legal to sell here! I ordered it and it was the right decision! The pasta was cooked perfectly and the savory filling had a creamy texture that was bursting with flavor. It was like the perfect marriage of poultry and red meat flavor. Definitely unforgettable! My husband enjoyed his TAGLIATELLE (with fall vegetables, truffle zabaglione & guanciale) - it was very comforting and hearty.

We were full, but were able to make room for dessert: NUTELLA AND VANILLA CREME BOMBOLONI which consisted of Nutella ganache, caramalized bananas & Nutella powder. WOW! The bomboloni (like donut holes) were lovely fluffy and crispy, filled with either chocolate or vanilla cream. The bananas were fantastic, as were the ganache and powder, adding decadent levels of texture.

So glad our impromptu evening of dining led us to Scarpetta. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

I was honestly really disappointed with this place. I had high hopes. It was myself and 6 other girls for a Bachelorette dinner. Felt like the server thought he was better than us. The dishes really failed to impress me. I ordered the Halibut and felt like all it really needed was a dash of salt and lemon to really pick up the taste. One of the girls ordered extra marinara or something for her calamari, so I put that on my fish and it gave it the flavor it NEEDED. The bachelorette had the Polenta as an appetizer, which she loved. But overall, we were not impressed with this place or the dishes. And come on, $24 for spaghetti!? Even if I made it from scratch, it'd cost less than $10. Just sayin'

Had the signature spaghetti and meatballs. This was an OK meal... meatballs were small and tasteless- a bit hard as if they had been cooked hours earlier. Sauce was nothing special. Nice homemade noodles. Not worth $ 32. Mixed greens salad with beets was a basic salad. Decent flavor but, again, not worth $ 16. All in, for spaghetti and meatballs, mixed green salad and glass of house wine, our bill for 2 people was $ 170. I live in LA so I'm used to paying a lot to eat out, but this meal wasn't worth it. Too many other great places to eat in Vegas. (Bread was delicious!).
The food was average- nothing more or less. Pretty good service. Exceptional breads. Expensive.

A lovely dining experience! Very attentive service and great ambiance (we had a window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountain). The best part of our meal were the appetizers- we had the butter poached lobster chestnut and parsnip soup and the creamy polenta. The flavours on both soup and polenta were amazing. The lobster was cooked perfectly and I love the toasted almonds in there. The polenta was so smooth and the truffle flavour was present but not overwhelming.  We also really enjoyed the complimentary breads and tapenade. One of the best tapenade I have ever had. Perfect with the bread. 
Entree is where they loose one star. My husband and I shared a veggie tagliatelli. The noodle was cooked perfect but the sauce was too salty. We also had 3 sides- mushroom medley, cauliflowers and butternut squash. The squash was too sweet and could have been roasted a bit more. The raisin and pine nuts in the cauliflower had a clash of flavours. The mushrooms were good but nothing too special. I was expecting something a little outside of the box than just sautéed mushrooms. Overall a great experience!

Do not go in with high expectations. If you do end up here, try to go with their more classic dishes, as they do feature a lot of non-traditional pastas like foie gras ravioli. The intention is good but ours was off on the spices and a little disappointing. One perk though, was their gourmet bread basket with tasty dipping sauces.

Wine & appetizers at bar. Very good wine list with knowledgable bartenders (because I dont know my Italian wines). Yummy apps. Can't wait to come back & dine in main room with its gorgeous strip views. Scott, I love u.
Pricy but good food. Had a great dinning experience here. Food was delicious. A good place for a fancy night.

The absolute best Italian food I have ever had! The flavors were unique and fresh. The bread was unbelievable. We ordered PICI and were astonished by the flavor. Fantastic atmosphere, attentive service, and extraordinary desserts. Panda ending

Great place will Definitely go back. Had the grilled octopus appetizer. Had to be the best octopus Ive had. For dinner ordered the salmon omg it was mouth watering and my other half ordered the lobster pasta. Off the hook. 5 stars

4 thumbs up!   What a great place to have a romantic dinner!    The wait staff was very knowledgeable regarding all the items on the menu.  Portions are a bit small, so I suggest ordering a few items for each course and sharing.  The octopus app is a good starter, all the pastas were made fresh in house and tasted amazing!

Had our tiny rehearsal dinner here in the private room with a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains. Everyone I interacted with prior to dining and throughout our actual dinner was extremely kind and accomodating. Our menu was selected in advance and consisted of 4 spectacular courses all served family style except for the entrees: small shared plates (scallops, shortribs, apple endive blue cheese salad), 3 pastas (short rib bone marrow agnolotti, and another raviloi I forgot about bc I was drooling over the agnolotti), entrees (organic chicken, black cod, or ny strip steak) and dessert was these nutella filled doughnut holes rolled in sugar w/ a side of banana gelato, chocolate cake and cheesecake. Everything was delicious but if I had to pick one of each it'd be the short rib appetizer, the short rib bone marrow agnolotti, the chicken and the nutella balls. Go here if you have the opportunity!!

Things that come to mind about Scarpetta Vegas- Flawless, immaculate, delicious and mind blowing.  Service was absolutely amazing- our waiter was extremely knowledgably about the food and wine selection and made the dining experience quite enjoyable.   Food was literally out of this world.  Fresh, beautifully cooked and flavorful pasta dishes, creative and inspirable appetizers and mouthwatering jaw dropping desserts.  I am not even going to go into details about which appetizers were the best and which entrees rocked my world because honestly no matter what you chose you will be happy you did.

want to make it clear that this review is based on two things.  the food; and what I feel is arguably just as important if not more; proper billing/customer service.

let me start off with saying that the food is great.  I had the duck/foie gras ravioli and my wife had the New York strip steak, absolutely no complaints and the service while IN the restaurant was solid.  Paid the bill with a card (lets say it was for $200.51) and went home to the kids.  This was on 2/27...

a couple of days later I viewed by bank transactions and I see that on 2/28 I was charged 2 additional times for equal amounts (let's say they were both for $140.51).  I liked the food but I didn't like it that much to go 3 times within one weekend.  we're a middle class family who doesn't have that kind of income to justify that kind of spending.

so naturally I called my bank to dispute the charges and I called the restaurant since apparently they have to be on the phone to corroborate my story and fix the problem.  Since the restaurant is closed in the daytime I elected to leave a vm.  A few hours later I did receive a return call from someone who seemed genuinely apologetic and she said that the night manager would have to be the one who can truly solve the issue.  she asked if I could be patient and wait a few hours until they can get back to me....this was on 2/29

Today is 3/9, it's now been a week and two days later and I'm still waiting for that night manager to call.  I left a second voicemail today on the same line and my family is short roughly $280 in our checking acct.  so I had to call my bank again and explain how I still haven't gotten a call back and they did tell me that once my monthly transactions clear I should be able to dispute the charges and possibly get my money back next month.

if you're looking to go out for a nice dinner with your spouse/significant other I would think twice before going to a restaurant whose service level goes down to 0 once they have your money

Since we were staying at the cosmopolitan my husband and I decided to go back to Scarpetta. This visit did not disappoint. We started with the lobster and grilled peach salad with burratta. It was just over-the-top delicious. I ordered their signature spaghetti which was absolute perfection.  My has been was still dreaming about the last time he ordered a fillet there so he ordered it again and it was absolutely amazing. Service was fantastic as well. The bread basket and the top and nod and butter that they bring with it are just as amazing. If you are nearby or staying at the cosmopolitan in Las Vegas you must try this beautiful restaurant. They also have a great bar where you enjoy a glass of wine and an appetizer. We can't wait to come back.

Graciously hosted by Gina(chef), Domenic(Somm), Mario, and Noe this was the best dining experience ever.  Evening started out with there combination meat and cheese......fresh Parmigiano reminiscent of my trip to Parma, salty, nutty, and firm.    Now, for those who know me, I take 'Sauce' seriously as I was raised by a full blooded Sicilian mother.  I'm excited to say they Sauce was bright with acid, rounded out with olive oil and basil and finished with a hit of butter.  The polpettino were delicate pillow of lamb, beef, and pork with a nice crust gently tossed into the sauce.   Wines were perfectly selected by Noe and Domenic.  Should you get a chance reserve the private room for an intimate view of vegas.

Thank you to Noe and team for the memorable experience.  See you all at CES in January.

I was part of a large group that had lunch here.  The place is very elegant.  Staff was professional and friendly. The view is terrific.

The food was excellent.  Appetizers, meal and dessert were exceptional. We were able to sample several of each and all were delicious.

Highly recommend eating here.

The first sign should have been that only two tables were occupied at prime dinner time. Even though nearly every table was empty, we got sat in the back, despite every window seat being available, we got sat nearly two tables back.

The food was mediocre at best. I had the goat cheese ravioli and was bland at best. Was covered in some foamy like topping that tasted like soap.

The bread was good but wasn't served into nearly 30 minutes in.

Considering how empty they were, you would have expected service to be better but definitely could have used improvement.

Overall, definitely not worth the cost. I don't mind paying for good service and a good meal but this was not that.

This was the best meal I had this visit to Las Vegas! I was just in town a month prior and did some research about where to get good Italian food this time. Based on yelp, I was all set to get the spaghetti. But, based on my waiter's suggestion, I went with the short rib agnolotti and my mother got the tagliatelle with lamb bolognese. Our meals were good (hers more than mine) but I just didn't feel satisfied. So we ordered a third meal to share of the spaghetti. And WOW!!!!! It was the most basic, flavorful, al dente pasta I've ever had.  The basil came through every bite and the sauce was so smooth yet complex. Sometimes simple really is best.  I think about this spaghetti at least once a day and will definitely make a point to get it (maybe even twice) the next time I am in Vegas.

My boyfriend and I celebrated our anniversary with a romantic date night here.   The food and the service were both fantastic; however, we both were plagued with food poisoning that evening.  My episode kicked in about 2 hours after dinner and he was up all night super sick.  

My disappointment doesn't lie in the fact that we were displeased with our meal or the service, but rather in the service I received the next morning when I called to let them know about our food poisoning.  The manager on the phone immediately became defensive instead of apologetic and told me that food poisoning does not kick in until 8 hours later and that it was probably something else we had eaten during the day.  Mind you... this was the only meal and time that my boyfriend had spent together all day.   I had also called only 30 minutes after they had opened for the evening and she told me that it couldn't have been the food because they didn't receive any other calls regarding any episodes of food poisoning and we ordered popular items on the menu.  (Braised short rib, chicken, and a pasta dish). I still can't believe that I had to justify our ill feelings with someone who showed no compassion and was challenging me on the authenticity of my statement.

She eventually transferred me to security to fill out a report.  Four days later im still waiting to hear back regarding some sort of follow up.  

Never going here again.

The best I've had in Vegas!! Everything was amazing, we had the tasting menu which for the value was one of the best in Vegas!  The flower and Tabasco cocktail was awesome and then thank god  the server guided us away from more cocktails and towards the amazing wine pairings!  It was from start to finish one of the best meals I've ever had
Great Italian food in an even better setting.  View of the strip while dining on indulgent pasta?  Yes, please.  The bread they serve before dinner is worth it alone haha. You just can't go wrong.

Had a wonderful meal here. The scallops appetizer was excellent thanks to the squash bed and accessory toppings. The Veal Loin was about as perfect as humanly possible. The Nutella Bombs were a nice sweet finish. All was helped by a polished professional waiter.
The restaurant is gorgeous with views of the fountains and a classy cool atmosphere. The food was impeccable, and the staff was top shelf. The menu can be pricey, but worth it.

My wife and I dined here and really enjoyed the experience.  While we weren't seated near the window, we could still see the fountain and a lot of the view of the strip. The staff was friendly and accommodating and the food was delicious.  I highly recommend the foie gras ravioli, and any of the house made pasta for that matter.  One recommendation would be to make reservations as early as possible as the restaurant appears to be very popular and is relatively small.
High end, classy dining. Good foods, great service. Expensive and small portions (as one would expect honestly). Great Italian wine selection

Amazing food, and ambience. The restaurant is very elegant, and was very quiet during our visit. The service was awesome. Highly recommend the duck breast. The mascarpone cheesecake might be the most delicious thing I have ever eaten. We're going to go back just for that.

Romantic, classy, with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. It's located in the new Cosmopolitan hotel. Service was impeccable and food was innovative and had very distinctive flavors. Their free bread basket is so good - had to resist the urge to ask for another basket before the meal. I wasn't the biggest fan of the short rib and bone marrow starter or the duck and foie gras ravioli (it was good but maybe I just don't have the taste for it), but their diver scallops and polenta with mushrooms were amazing! Overall they pasta main courses were fine, but didn't blow us away. The black cod entree was a small portion but delicious. The atmosphere and experience of a nice Vegas restaurant with relatively reasonably priced (by Vegas standards) with several chances to catch the fountain shows... That's what gets you!

Perfectly romantic restaurant overlooking the Bellagio fountains and strip if you're seated near the window as we were.

Menu had great variety which made choosing pretty difficult. Fortunately there was a fantastic bread basket with 3 types that kept us going.

Drinks we got the Gallardo and San Remo. Gallardo was a nice appletini-ish drink and the San Remo was delicious.

We shared 3 dishes: the tuna+avocado and yellowtail to start. The tuna dish was more or less as expected with great quality fish and a nice garnish, also plentiful. The yellowtail came with 4 or 5 paper thin slices, also as expected served with a very subtle ginger/salt sauce. I was a little dissapointed with this given the quantity and quality.

We shared the branzino as an entree, which was incredible and served in a killer shellfish broth with small pieces of lobster, mussels, and potato. 

Service was definitely a little slow for our table (others were being served quicker) but we weren't in a rush so it wasn't a big deal. 

Overall, 4/5 stars based on what we ordered for the price and the service, could easily be 5/5 based on other items so I'll return to try it out in the future.

12/29/15 dinner for 6 at 6:00pm. Solid 4 stars, would of been 5 but service was poor and I felt we were treated differently because we are young couples and not old rich people. 
3 couples, sat right away in a large circular booth that only fit 5. One member of our party had to sit in a chair. He missed the fountain show and blocked others. I guess the can't accommodate a party of 6. Service was poor, had to ask for water, ask about specials, had to ask about the menu and it just felt like we weren't good enough for the wait staff? Anyway, if someone from the restaurant ever reads this you should put more effort into training your staff to treat everyone the same and work on service recovery! 

Okay food: it was amazing! I tried all 6 meals and both apps. Everything was amazing! To bad the staff wasn't amazing.

Disappointing; Three of us for dinner with drinks. 

The Pinot Grigio house wine was very good. We started with the Misto salad.  It had a nice assortment of tender greens, a wee bit of buffalo mozzarella but the only dressing on it was olive oil.  It needed a little pizzaz like lemon or vinegar, herbs, garlic or mustard....anything more than olive oil. For $15 I expect some flavour. I ordered the Linguini Pescatore;  a very small portion that offered 3 types of seafood:  squid, shrimp and clams.  The squid was almost non existent, 3 tiny clams and two nice quality shrimp. It was swimming in too much sauce that was too acidic - like tomato paste.  I didn't like it. My husband had the lasagna, he said it was ok but felt the portion was too small. My cousin had the pizza which had good flavour but it was too thin with a sauce that was too thin.  This created a soggy mess - too bad as it's easy to correct.  Just quality control.  The water refills were only offered at the time of payment. We all agreed we wouldn't go back.

Really nice place for dinner. I was sad about not having the opportunity to dine at Scarpetta in LA before it closed so I decided to try out the one in Vegas. We were with a group of 8. Most of us got pasta and two people got steak. Everyone loved their food. I got the spaghetti and loved it. My friends got the Pici and loved that as well. I also liked the assortment of bread. The restaurant has a really nice vibe and offers pretty nice views. Four stars instead of five for the following reasons: 1) two of their drinks were not good at all and we had asked the waiter ahead of time if they were sweet, were reassured that they weren't 2) even though we sent one of the drinks back because it was just so gross we didn't get an apology, an offer to replace, or a comp. I expect better attention to detail when we're spending almost $700 on dinner. Other than that, everything was great. A nice addition to the great restaurants at Cosmopolitan.

3 - appetizers - Creamy Polenta (perfect flavor, slightly thin), Tomato and Mozzarella, Braised Beef (both small, but excellent).

2 - pastas - a beautiful mini-ravioli excellently sauced and thick noodle in tomato sauce that was less successful (too thick and chewy).

Entres were OK, but the staff confused who got what.  My filet of beef was undercooked and uneventful.

Desserts - flour-less chocolate was ok, otherwise, unmemorable.

Very nice dining room (some get beautiful views of the Bellagio Fountain).

Service was adequate.

I was planning my friend's bachelorette party in Vegas and she wanted to do one fancy shmancy dinner.  I had two restaurants in mind and when she told me she wanted Italian, Scarpetta was the way to go.  I requested a table by the window so we can see the Bellagio water show.  The hostess said it was not guaranteed, but they will try their best to accommodate.  When we arrived at the restaurant, we were led into a private room with the view we requested.  I really couldn't have been any happier.  SIKE!  The food was effing amazing.  I was afraid some of the girls wouldn't eat (picky eaters), but everyone enjoyed their meal.  I ordered the veal chop ($68).  No regrets there though because I practically licked my plate after.  It was so juicy.  Normally, I don't like any pieces of fat.  I will literally gag at the table and throw up right then and there, but it melted in my mouth.  It was like a clean fat.  I honestly don't know how to describe it.  Ohmygawd.  We ended our dinner with dessert.  I was not disappointed in any of our choices.  

Don't forget that bread basket at the beginning!  I think we asked for two refills.  Another great thing about this place is that they make their pasts in house.

I must admit, my expectations were somewhat low for Scarpetta, as I usually find the Las Vegas outposts of famous restaurants to be more about decor and overpriced menus, and less about food.  I was glad to be proven wrong.

Although Scarpetta definitely delivers in the "Las Vegas Hip" decor, with a gorgeous dining room that has a glass-enclosed wine cellar on one wall, and floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the Bellagio fountains on the other, it also delivers on the food front.

At the waiters recommendation, my group of three decided to share a Primi (app) and Pasta, and order our own entrees.  Before our first course came out, we were brought fresh bread basket which I can honestly say was the BEST bread I've ever had.  A mix of rosemary ciabatta, focaccia, and this to-die-for bread that had salami and mozzarella in it.  The accompaniments of Olive Oil, Eggplant spread, and Mascarpone Butter were equally satisfying.  Here is a by-dish review:

Heirloom tomato salad w/ stracciatella, salsa verde & marinated eggplant:  This dish was good, if not a bit common.  It seems so many restaurants have an heirloom tomtato & burrata dish, that if you've had one, you've had them all - although I was happy to learn that stracciatella is an equally awesome burrata-style cheese.

Creamy polenta w/ fricassee of truffled mushrooms: Hands down the best polenta anyone at our table had ever had.  It was so creamy and rich, and went great with the mushrooms which were served from a separate pot.

Duck & Foie Gras ravioli w/ marsala reduction:  This dish was very well received by the two people in my party who'd never had foie gras.  I am a huge fan of foie, and found the dish to be lacking the richness that usually comes when it's served on it's own - but overall a great dish.

Pancetta-wrapped Veal Loin w/ sweetbreads, peas & carrots: The veal loin was my favorite dish of the night.  I am used to having sweetbreads battered and fried, so it was interesting to have them in a more natural state - small chunks cooked and mixed in with the vegetables.

Zeppole w/ nutella center, vanilla sauce & candied hazelnuts: WOW - we were blown away by how good this dessert was.  Little chocolate donut holes filled with nutella - YUM.

I will say that their wine list leans towards the expensive side, with only a few bottles in the $60 - $70 range.  We ordered the Castello di Bossi Chianti Classcio Riserva Berardo, which was $105 (retails for $30) - a good wine, but a bit pricey.

Had the spaghetti, and it was delicious. Definitely better than spaghetti I've had elsewhere, but not the best (The best was at Marea in NY). Like another person said, the consistency of the noodles was exactly like Chinese hand-pulled noodles I had growing up. The sauce was incredible. Had a bit of fire, although most people would not notice unless they were looking.

Wow - an unsurpassed experience.  The food was amazing ; make sure you order the charcuterie board,  The Tagliatelle with 5 kinds of wild mushrooms, the rib eye to share and the chocolate mousse cake for dessert.  The 'If You See Kay' bottle of wine @ $60 / bottle is amazing. We had Roger as our waiter and I can't even begin to explain as to how awesome he was.  Also, band on Saturday eve was amazing; great choice (I bought CD!)

I was in here on Saturday night with friends.  The place was busier than  I expected and had a good vibe.   Unfortunately the service wasnt good and the food was quite average. 
Our server was friendly, but kept forgetting things, and had this "cool man"  kind of attitude like we were all best buddies. This would be fine if the service was good - but when the service is bad, it just gets frustrating and annoying. 
We ordered the olives to start which were pretty basic - mostly green olives with some sundried black ones on top - they were heated? and I could taste bits of fennel seed, which I liked. 
 My main was a basic pasta and tomato sauce - I asked for spaghetti and so did someone else in our group of 9.  When it arrived, there was a huge difference in the plating, I had a small portion and my friend had a big one -consistency would be great. 
Another person at the table ordered a different penne pasta and the portion was massive... what is the rhyme and reason of portion control and perceived value?
The gnocchi that arrived were perfectly uniform -and although my pasta tasted fresh, the uniform size of the gnocchi made people question if they were store bought.  All of our entrees arrived except one - a lasagna and we all sat with our food in front of us waiting for this last dish to arrive. About 8 minutes later it did.  No apology from the server. Someone else dropped it off, and again no apology. 
When the bills arrived - some people were overcharged, others undercharged( we corrected him) and it was all just a gong show. 
Did we have a good time? More or less, would I go back - never.

The chicken was super good. Complimentary bread. Portions are very small. Very nice restaurant.  I was very disappointed in the short rib w/ risotto though.  It was about $30 for 2 thin slices of beef & a scoop of rice.

We've been to Scarpetta's every year for the last 3 years. We've made sure to go every time we are in Vegas. We were just there for my birthday last week, and it's the same experience everytime. Stellar. The food is wonderful, the view is gorgeous, and the staff is courteous, and prompt. We look forward to dinner here every year.

One of the best meals I've had in a long time....appropriately priced and amazing quality. The ambiance is amazing and the staff there is impeccably trained. Even the bread (with the variety of spreads) will knock your socks off. Just make sure to save room for the actual entrees...

The duck and foie gras ravioli is their signature dish and reasonably so. It's amazing. Delicate and refined is probably the best way to describe it. 

Colorado Lamb was amazing. The lamb was not gamey at all and the different components of the dish worked in harmony. I will admit that I still like the Colorado Lamb from Stage restaurant in Honolulu...

I remember one of my friends having a really delicious pasta (mint infused?) but I can't remember all the details regarding it. I just remembered it was heavenly. 

Strawberry souffle was amazing. Light, aromatic, and slightly sweet. It blew my socks off and definitely put Maison Akira's souffle to shame. 

Zeppole are AHH-MAYYY-ZIING. Deep fried dough nuggets (so light and airy!) filled with a rich nutella center. Even if you're full, you need to get these...or you will regret it forever. 

Definitely a great place to hit up for a bite to eat when you're in Vegas. I definitely will be returning during my next trip!

We love love love this restaurant. It is one of our most favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. We loving dressing up to come here and the View Is out of control amazing!!! They are always extraordinarily helpful and cautious when it come to my food allergies and the fact that I am vegan. The whole staff is awesome here. I would defiantly recommend them, and I will defiantly return!!

I just love this place! I have to write another review and tell everybody how great it is!

We came here to celebrate two birthdays the other day and the service, like last time, was awesome. Everybody thoroughly enjoyed their food and had ZERO complaints! We had a party of 8 and there were a few picky eaters amongst us and seriously everybody LOVED their food! I ordered the scallop with foie gras for an appetizer, lamb for the main course, and this guava soup thing with pineapples for dessert. Scallops were AMAZING and probably my favorite part of the whole meal. The lamb was different than the last time I had it but still good. The guava soup (per our waiter's suggestion) was light and refreshing...so good.

I whole heartedly recommend this place to everybody who wants to have a great meal and a great dining experience

Visited here over Thanksgiving while staying at one of my fave hotels, The Cosmopolitan. Scott Conant's famous restaurant overlooks the Bellagio fountains if you get a window seat, and has a wonderfully romantic but classic vibe. Not too loud, not too trendy, just elegant. I started with my favorite, a burrata and heirloom tomato salad with roasted eggplant which was quite a large portion and was very fresh. It needed to be considering what I was following it up with...Duck & Foie Gras ravioli. I know. Whenever out of CA right? Homemade pasta stuffed with melt in your mouth pockets of foie gras drizzled with a barolo reduction. I'd never had anything like it and probably never will and it was truly amazing and truly rich. I started with a cocktail that I don't remember the name of, but it was a usual concoction of my favorites, gin, basil, apple juice, and something else delicious and fresh. I wish I could remember more what Tristan had...he started with a fresh soup of some kind, pureed italian pea poured over veggies and hazelnuts I believe that he went nuts for. He also had a pasta (all homemade needless to say) with a lamb ragu. I'd absolutely go if you have the opportunity.

Delicious food and great service! Our waiter David was so patient, he not only went through almost ever item on the menu but also provided great recommendations!  We had a fantastic dining experience and enjoyed every dish (we had pasta and soufflé). Definitely coming back :)

It was pretty dark inside but maybe you might like the extra dim lights. The spaghetti was our tables favorite. 

I ordered the chicken and asked the waiter twice if the sauce had liver in it because it says fagato on the menu and he said sometimes that sauce is made with liver but our is not. Turns out he was wrong as when the food came out I asked the guy who brought it who seemed to know the food better and he said it was made with liver. I don't like the taste of liver and the sauce was all over my plate. The servers should know their food better so that is why I'm giving it 3 stars.

The food was amazing. The pasta was served in a covered dish that was unveiled upon arrival at the table. It was fresh, hot, full of flavor. We started with the scallops and foie gras which was my favorite dish of the night! The foie gras just melted in my mouth!  I got the pico with lobster, tarragon, and chili pesto. It was light and a little spicy, but delicious. My friend got the tagliatelle with vegetables, truffle, and guanciale. Hers was rich and even yummier than my dish! I can't wait to try this restaurant in Beverly Hills!

Was here this past year for CES, and we had 2 events here.
One was our company dinner in the private room with a view of Bellagio Fountains and the other was a upper management meeting with a client over wine tasting in the private seating area which is in the kitchen.

For the wine tasting, it was pretty awesome, except the room is probably equipped to seat 8 people comfortably, maybe 10, we squeezed in 12.  We enjoyed some awesome wines and some desserts, which hey mistakenly sent to our table, so they ended up comping those and bringing more, it was very good.  

The cool thing about this private room, is that you have to walk through the kitchen to get to it and it is located next to the kitchen, with glass floor to ceiling so you can see into the kitchen as they work and cook and the background is a view of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip.  

The second occasion was for our company dinner a few nights later since they were able to accommodate our group of 16 in the private dining room that is in front of the restaurant and our big boss loves Italian food.  

Although you can order single entrees off the menu, we had our waiter set up our dinner family style with some of his recommendations and some of the things we wanted to try.  

Also, our big boss had a request for something off the menu and the chef obliged with no problems.  Keeping the boss happy is always key!

We had the following dishes.
Apps - Braised short rib of beef, Creamy polenta, Raw yellowtail and Tuna Susci
the short ribs and the polenta were my favorite, the Susci was just ok.

Entrees - Duck and Foie Gras ravioli, Short rib agnolotti, Sheep milk ricotta agnolotti.  All were awesome, but the duck and foie gras raviolli is very rich.

We had dessert, but I don't actually remember what I had.

Service was great and except the bar was slow, so they comped certain drinks that didn't show up in a time fashion.

The minus one star was for the Sommelier, who seemed to enjoy the sound of his own voice and didn't really consider the requests of the guests at the table.  I understand he is very knowledgeable and he is an expert, but he could dial back the ego and work with the guest.  

Other than that, great place, I recommend it and you will not be disappointed.

Great ambiance and views but the food was just ok and service also not that good. I really don't think its an Italian restaurant either. The octopus was great but nothing unique or special. Had the duck breast. That was good just not great. I think the service level is just not quite there. It felt a little unfocused and we had to wait a long time just to get our plates cleared and I found myself flagging someone down more than once. Service and food really don't match the price if you ask me. I think it's mostly about ambiance. If you want to take out of towners to an Italian restaurant that is both cheaper and frankly much more satisfying food, go to buddy v's up the road.

Pretty phenomenal place. Let me start with the drinks. Most were on the fruity side, but they were all delicious. The main room has a window view of the Bellagio fountains, which set the mood and were going off every 15-20 minutes or so. Food was pretty good for the most part. Lady had the prix fixe and I had a few a la carte choices. The tuna app was super fresh and perfect for the evening. The celeriac soup was silky and very good. The bread is awesome. I know it sounds weird to rate the free shit, but their "stromboli" bread with the marscapone butter could be a meal in itself. Pumpkin ravioli was great. The filet and short rib mash was on point. The only thing that I was disappointed in was the foie/duck ravioli. It just wasn't what I thought it would be . It was good, and a rather large portion, but I expected something else. Dessert was ho-hum as well. Regardless, I would come back as the service was great and the ambiance was great.

A real disappointment...we own a business in Inglewood and wanted to support a fellow business in the community.  So, we decided to have our staff Christmas Party at 500 Cucina.  We talked to the manager/owner Rocco and he said he needed a deposit ($1000) in order to save our reservation for the large group we were feeding. He said it was just to hold the reservation and that we would be reimbursed the $1000. We paid our bill for the night (which was a large bill) and as it turns out he also charged our credit card $1000 which he said was only a deposit. It is 15 months later and he still has NOT reimbursed us the "deposit" and claims it is the banks fault. Bottom line is he is dishonest and has taken advantage of good people who were willing to give him business and support a community member, only to be ripped off.

Mostly Exceptional Food, Mostly Forgettable Service. 

I've been wanting to come here ever since seeing this place featured on Food Network's 'Best Thing I Ever Ate.' We came as a party of 5 to include my parents, 2 year old son and wife.

We came in and the hostess was less than friendly. She asked my name then took us to our table without a word. 

We sat down and waited much too long for our waiter. This became a theme throughout the night. He finally came by and simply told us the daily special and asked what we wanted to drink. I've been to many upscale restaurants around the world, and this would be unacceptable at any of them. He didn't take any time to explain the menu, how people normally order, etc. 

The menu was divided into courses which led me to believe people ordered many courses. However, with the price of each dish this would get prohibitively expensive quite quickly. I asked the waiter and pointed out that people ordered at most 2 dishes and that they were not family style. I'd expect the opposite with authentic Italian.

The drinks took FOREVER to come out, nearly being outpaced by our appetizers! We didn't order anything outrageous: 2 bourbons neat, 2 martinis and some milk. The bourbon list was one of the most extensive I've seen in a restaurant, mind you I just returned from 3 years in Japan. 

Our appetizers came out and were presented well. I ordered the creamy polenta into which the waiter scooped in fricasseed mushrooms. It had wonderful texture and taste; my wife hates polenta but loved it, even more than her butternut squash soup. It was ok, but had a Chinese five spice taste to it we found off putting. The bread and spreads were good and my dad enjoyed his Endive salad, despite the waiter giving it to my mom at first. Again, at this price point, unacceptable!

For the main course three of us ordered the spaghetti with tomato and basil and one got the short rib / bone marrow agnolotti. Both were mind blowing: must haves. 

Two of us got chocolate soufflé for dessert; I got the bombolonis and my mom got the panna cotta. The chocolate soufflé had that nasty five spice flavor to it again. Gross! I was certainly not a fan. The bombolonis were a can't miss as they were filled with Nutella, although the banana gelato was an awkward pairing.  The panna cotta was wonderfully fruity and refreshing. My mom got the best dessert for sure. 

I would come back here for the spaghetti, panna cotta and bourbon list, and hopefully we'd get a better waiter.

Great experience here! My boyfriend and I only had one night in Vegas, and we wanted to go big for dinner. We chose Scarpetta, and were so glad we did! Our waiter was very knowledgable and helpful, and the service was great. The decor was gorgeous, and had great ambiance. I would say it was very romantic with the dim lighting and lots of dark hardwood. The view was also beautiful, and we could watch Bellagio water show while we ate. 

Now onto the food...

First off, we were very impressed with the complimentary bread. One of them had spinach and smoked mozzarella baked into it! We started with the crispy fritto misto as an appetizer, which was great. It was delicious on it's own...no aioli needed! I had the Pici for my entrée. Tasted really great, but there was quite a bit of spice to it. It had a chili pesto sauce, so I should have expected it. It had a good amount of lobster in it. My boyfriend had the Tagliatelle, and we both decided that was the winner. The creamy truffle zabaglione sauce was to die for! The fresh vegetables and pancetta mixed in made it not overly rich as well. The pastas are made fresh there, and we could definitely taste the quality! We each had a glass of a nice Pinot Noir to enjoy with our pastas. 

It was a little pricy, but the quality is just so great and overall experience made it so worth it! There are so many great restaurants to try in Vegas, but I know I will be back to Scarpetta. Definitely one of my top dining experiences!

Where to start? 
Service... almost impeccable! 
Wine selection, even by the glass, incredible!
The food? Maybe better than being in Italy! We started with the Soft Polenta & Truffle! No words can describe this creation. Then the Burrata salad came out, very nice, yet he watermelon cubes were not for us. For the main course we shared the Kobe Cap, OMG! The Pici Pasta, a true creation from God! And the traditional Spaghetti, a masterpiece in simplicity! Enjoy!

This place is fantastic!  Really superb.  I enjoyed a lovely glass of cabernet as I waited for my  short rib agnolotti.  I was staying at the Cosmo and wanted to dine on my balcony, so I ordered carry out.  This meal was absolutely amazing...delicate and flavorful pasta, served with a selection of delicious breads.  I cannot wait to visit again to enjoy this lovely meal.

Ate there in March for a birthday celebration and was NOT disappointed.  This place is great and highly recommended.

The ambience is great. You do walk through a rather long narrow bar area, but when you get to the main dining area, you will be impressed. Great views of the strip.  We were seated in a very private booth with floor to ceiling "booth" - it was intimate and allowed the 6 of us to really talk.  

The service - attentive.  Not overbearing, not pushing (i..e we weren't that hungry and didn't order apps).  The breadbasket - yummy!!!!! 

Several tried the black cod - delicous!! I had the duck - it was wonderful and cooked just right.  Portions are on the smaller side, so if you are hungry make certain you order an appetizer.  The entrees were mostly in the $30 range, though some a bit cheaper.

They brought a lovely molten chocolate lava cake thing for the birthday boy, which was really tasty.

The wine list is huge! Not cheap, but some good selections.

Overall - certainly a place I would return.

Hold up. WHY does Scarpetta only have 4 stars? This was easily the best meal I had in Vegas, and quite possibly the best Italian I've had outside of my study abroad experience in Florence, Italy. It's got the perfect dining ambiance (perfect for a date with a significant other, or if you're me... your mom) with a view to boot (we watched the Bellagio fountains go off all night)!

Our waiter was absolutely adorable and I don't know how they managed to crank out their food so fast, but we were in and out within an hour. I wasn't really in the mood for anything heavy, but I'm a sucker for carbs and a good pasta dish, so I went with the short rib agnolotti, and my mom had the tagliatelle. Hoooly mother of all that is savory and delicious! The portions seem small, but man that plate of pasta will fill you up just right, while saving JUST enough room for that nutella and vanilla bombolini dessert, which I HIGHLY recommend. In fact, I wasn't even quick enough to snap a pic of this delicacy for Yelping purposes prior to absolutely devouring it, so you KNOW it was good.

The night definitely wasn't our cheapest meal in Vegas by any means, but it was definitely worth the splurge.
Food and service - Perfect , delicious , but the bathrooms , not so much ! I will definitely go back as the menu is amazing and it wasn't too loud as some of these places can be.

I had a group dinner here last weekend. From the start to the end, the manager and staff at the restaurant were very accommodating and attentive. The manager, Kelli, was very helpful on setting up a family style dinner and was amazing to work with. The food was delicious and the portions were very generous for a family style meal. We had 3 of their staff attending to our table. They even accommodated one of the guests who had celiac disease at the last minute! We had an amazing time here and would definitely come back!

The hallmarks of an elite Las Vegas restaurant are outstanding food, personable service, and a great atmosphere. If a restaurant can hit on all three of these, and do so at a reasonable price, they deserve a fifth star. Scarpetta doesn't even belong in the same sentence as some of the amazing Vegas hotspots. Lets start with the good- Scarpetta has a nice location with a good view of the strip and prides itself on a swanky and sleek atmosphere. Its dark, the jazzy music is loud, and the table settings a slick. The other "views" are good too- as the younger crowd will probably afford you a few peaks at some match.com dates happening around you. Your jaw will even drop as soon as you see the cans on the hostess, but its all downhill after that at Scarpetta.

To start, the restaurant was a hot box, so bring a wet towel to cool off. The service was atrociously impersonal and inattentive. Great restaurants have teams of servers constantly working your table, making suggestions, and guiding you through the experience. We had no sommelier to talk about wines with. Our waiter was a smug and unsmiling grump who detracted even more from the average food. The pasta dishes we ordered were step above Barilla pasta with some canned Ragu sauce. The beef tar tar was tasteless. How could some many be so wrong about this place? OVER-RATED! Clap, clap. Clap, Clap, Clap. If you want overpriced, average food with a forgettable personal touch slathered all over your plate- hit Scarpetta. If you want to enjoy a meal- look elsewhere.

5 star! We were in Vegas celebrating a bachelorette party this past weekend and I made reservations for Scarpetta at Cosmo.  It is one of my favorite places in LA and I figured I couldn't go wrong at their Las Vegas location.  They exceeded expectations.  I made reservations for 7 on opentable and due to a very long taxi line at our hotel we were running a bit late, I called them and they were kind to let me know that they would seat us when we arrive and not to worry.  Dinner was remarkable per usual as was the excellent service.  They were aware of our celebration and the staff made sure to congratulate our bride personally and with a desert! The waiter and his crew were extremely friendly and before we knew it 2 hrs had passed us by and we left happy and very full. I cant wait to go back!

What we ordered:
Farmer's Market Salad
Crispy Fritto Misto 
Creamy Polenta - AMAZING
Roasted Diver Scallops
Braised Short Ribs of Beef
Spaghetti - 4 out of 7 of us ordered this dish and all of us finished the entire bowl
Fettuccine  - If youre going to order the pasta dont be foolish order SPAGHETTI
Prime Filet of Beef - amazing!

The drinks were also delicious! The lemon drop martini and shots especially.

I've been here twice already on my trips to Vegas and enjoyed my meal both times. We called the day of each time and were able to get a reservation for the same night! Scarpetta is located on the 3rd floor of cosmo and offers a great view of the water show on the strip! 

They have a changing menu and amazing bread basket that comes with each meal! The bread is so good, I actually found myself most excited for their assorted focaccia, ciabatta, and sourdoughs that are served with lemon olive oil, an eggplant dip, and marscarpone butter. 

We had the:
Risotto with summer truffles: 5/5 this dish was amazing!! We ordered this as an appetizer to share but after one bite I wished I had ordered one just for myself 
Duck and foie gras ravioli: overly salty and didn't have as much foie as I had hoped
Short rib agnolotti: 5/5 favorite pasta dish of the night!
Tagliatelle with lamb bolognese and truffle burrata: 5/5
Black calamarata: 4/5 didn't have as much uni as we hoped for but still good

Overall, the food was great and service was amazing and I'll definitely be dreaming of that truffle risotto until our next trip to Vegas!

Scott Conant's Scarpetta boasts lavish, dimly lit and woody decor, complete with a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains from the Cosmopolitan. Be sure to make a reservation and if there are only 2 of you dining, request to sit by the window. All of the staff are well-trained and highly professional, delivering an upscale dining experience from start to finish. 

My sister and I came for a quick dinner before the club and didn't want to get too full, so we only indulged in the starter bread and 1 entree each. The bread basket is exquisite and features 1 piece each of Sourdough, Ciabbata, a salami Stromboli, broccoli Stromboli, and another that I cannot remember. It is accompanied by a white wine olive oil, mascarpone butter, and some type of tapenade. 

I ordered the famous Spaghetti. As far as I know, this dish only contains 3 ingredients. Noodles, tomato sauce, basil. Yes, the noodles were a perfect al-dente with just a little bite to them. Yes the sauce was fresh and light, sticking to each noodle. Was this worth $24? No. For only $2 more (and more deserving of the price tag), my sister went with the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli. The ravioli was optimally thin and there was almost no sauce, making the meat the star. It was a rich dish and could easily be shared if you're also getting an appetizer.   

I'm happy to have had my Scarpetta experience and I enjoyed the food and the ambiance, but I don't see any need to come back here for the $24 spaghetti, which is why I settled on 4 stars.

For years, I've always felt that -- among the casinos -- the MGM Grand has the best restaurants.  This may be changing, and Scarpetta is *certainly* one of the biggest reasons why.  

Lynn and I followed up our "good" dinner Wednesday night at Comme Ça (also Yelped) with dinner at Scarpetta the next night (followed Friday night by LoS, but that's been written up way to many times).  

Being a Celebrity Chef is a double-edged sword . . . it certainly gets your name out there, but then you (typically) aren't there to defend it -- someone ELSE is in the kitchen is, but if it sucks, you get the blame.  A potentially dicey proposition at best.

Scott Conant need not worry; his Vegas outpost is in excellent hands.

The six of us began with a bottle of n.v. Champagne from Chartogne-Taillet (Cuvée Ste.-Anne), and ordered a round of appetizers "for the table."  (The table, too, apparently was hungry -- not just the six of us!)  

Finishing the Champagne just as the appetizers arrived, we moved into a 2008 Bruno Giacosa Arneis.  We enjoyed the yellowtail crudo, the creamy polenta with a fricassee of truffled mushrooms (the winner of this round, IMHO), and the roasted sea scallops with porcini and sunchokes . . . all were delightful!

VEGETARIAN ALERT:  this place is *very* cool, and vegetarian-friendly.  They have a totally separate vegetarian and vegan menu available for the asking (as one in our party did).

Moving into the pasta course, we had the spaghetti with tomato and basil (so simple to say, so profound to eat -- nothing can describe the layers of flavor that you get here; magnificent!), the duck & foie gras ravioli with marsala reduction (OK, this is to die for!), and the short rib agnolotti with with brown butter horseradish.  Of course, we also moved into a stunning Piedmontese red, the 1999 Barbaesco Riserva Vigneti in Ovello from the  Produttori del Barbaresco.  Just gorgeous!

Our entrées included black cod with caramelized fennel & concentrated tomato, sirloin with potato gnocchi, wild mushrooms, parmigiano & barolo ragu, a veal chop the size of Baltimore (and much more tasty), and the aforementioned spaghetti with tomato and basil (as an entrée portion).  

A little dessert, a little Porto and coffee, and the world is a perfect place!

P.S. In case you haven't figured it out yet, their wine list is not only incredible, but there are some true gems on this list that remain real bargains (if you know how/where to look).

On Saturday night we were invited to Scarpetta  for dinner by an old friend. We had dinner reservations at 8:30 pm and it was hard getting into the Cosmopolitan Hotel because of all the traffic. We got seated right next to the window overlooking the Bellagio Fountain. The menu is very simple. We had the following:

Softshell crabs             3/5 stars the crabs were extra large. Deep fried and kinda
                                                         greasy.
Polenta                           5/5 stars off the hook good. excellent must order!

Heirloom Tomato Salad 4/5  stars   good fresh and dressed well.

Yellowtail sashimi           4/5  stars   4 small thinly slices pieces. Normal sushi fare.

Duck Foie Gras Ravioli     4/5 stars OK not the gastronomic orgasm as other yelpers
                                                              mentioned
Spaghetti                           4/5 stars excellent al dente, 

Barzano Fish                     5/5 stars best entree' of the night well cooked.

Cheese cake                     4/5 stars OK small poker chip sized.

Strawberry Souffle'           5/5 stars AMAZING ! light great strawberry flavor with a
                                                              dollop of vanilla ice cream. 

If you can get a seat next to the window over looking the Bellagio Fountain and the Las Vegas Strip the meal is well worth the prices. Service was excellent.

simple elegant food. I would recommend this place to the most discerning of palates! The scallop was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The Spaghetti was simple but addicting! The short agnolotti was super flavorful and the Tagliatelle with root veggies was absolutely devine!

So so so good! We started out with the bread basket and Polenta. The bread was delicious- I almost filled up on just that! The polenta was different for me, but I am happy I tried it. For our main courses we tried the pork chop, veal chop, duck breast, and spaghetti. I can't stop talking about the pork chop! So much flavor! Definitely my favorite out of the four dishes. The spaghetti is such a simple dish- but a classic and they made it perfectly. The veal was very tender and my husband loved it. I think out of the four dishes, the duck was everyone's least favorite. We HAD to try dessert so we went with the cheesecake and chocolate cake- both amazing. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and friendly, the service was awesome. Highly recommend and we'll for sure be back! 


Update* went back to Scarpetta and the menu was totally different and our waiter was not as friendly or knowledgeable. The food was still good but this time around I was a bit disappointed and I don't think I'll rave about it AS much.

Came here for a nice dinner after watching O. I really liked both the food and ambience at scarpetta. Since it was after the show, we walked in without a reservation and were able to get seated by the window. 

We shared the duck & foie ravioli and the black tagliolini with a side of mushrooms. I liked all 3 dishes - Even though you can't really taste the foie in the ravioli. The waiter told me they normally have a seared foie in the fall, but this year it wasn't here yet in october =( sad times. The mushrooms were really good! and I liked the black taliolini a little more than the ravioli. Overall, a great experience at a fairly reasonable price for vegas standards.

Scarpetta is certainly not an inexpensive meal, but it is well worth the price. The dining experience was wonderful. We had excellent service, great ambience, and the food was unique and delicious. 

After ordering a nice bottle of wine we started the meal with appetizers. I ordered the Salumi platter (italian meats) and was thoroughly impressed (although I did not enjoy the Lardo) by the variety of meats served.
