The raw yellowtail consisted of four slices of fish topped with olio di zenzero, pickled red onions and microgreens. a couple slices were bland and under seasoned, while others were perfect. The other app ordered came on the recommendation of our waiter. And, I'm glad I listened to him. The creamy polenta came in a decent sized bowl along with a pot with truffled mushrooms fricassee, which the server promptly spooned into the polenta. The rich and savory dish was unlike any polenta I've had before. 

The aged sirloin beef entree came sliced, cooked medium rare as ordered and was accompanied by a few light and fluffy potato gnocchi, wild mushrooms, barolo ragu, and topped with paper thin slices of parmigiano. The sirloin was good, but not nearly as good as the other entree.

The short rib agnolotti didn't look like much when it was placed on the table -- a shallow bowl filled with a modest amount of small stuffed pasta. But, the flavor from each bite was amazing. Each piece was a thin, delicate piece of pasta stuffed with tender short rib, with an intensely rich sauce. I loved the added texture that the bread crumbs added. It was a great dish on every level.

Desserts were tasty, as well. Amadei chocolate cake with toasted almond gelato and salted caramel sauce was dense and moist. The coconut panna cotta with coconut sorbetto, guava soup and pineapple was surprisingly light, creamy, and not too filling. It was a beautiful presentation with the guava soup covering and contrasting the panna cotta below.

Our service was a perfect compliment to our meal. Luis timed everything perfectly and provided the kind of personalized, friendly service that every top-notch restaurant should have.

I've had plenty of underwhelming experiences over the years for restaurant week, but this was definitely one of the best. I'm already thinking about when I'll be able to come back and hopefully enjoy more great food and service.

Nice place. I ordered sea scallops with truffled white asparagus pink graitfruit and uni aoili. This was an appatizer but they only gave me two scallops. My friends were raving about the bread with ham in it and if I would have known I would only get two scallops I would have tried the bread but by the time the food came there was no more bread. The servers werent the nicest and took them about an hour to serve our food. Which none should have taken that long.

Another place I ventured into because of YYC pizza week that I've never been to before.  500 Cucina was defending thin crust champion (a title they reclaimed in 2015).   I don't eat pork so their entry was judged by my husband who was close to swearing off all other pizzas he loved their entry so much and I ate the fiat.  Generally I like pizza but vegetarian pizzas can be so incredibly boring without some funky toppings so I didn't have high hopes for the fiat from the list of ingredient and was pleasantly surprised.  All the vegetables on that pizza had flavor.  Perhaps they were cooked, marinated or seasoned by fairies but they were all given attention before combined on my pie that's for certain.  The resulting pizza was wonderfully complex and bursting with flavor.  I'm also pleased to report left overs were just as tasty (an important rating for all pizza).   

All the food I tried was very new world Italian,  I loved it,  but it's way more flashy than the simple elegance of traditional Italian food.  While we were there it was pretty busy,  I recommend a reservation.   They had live music come on half way through our dinner which was also nice.  Our server was great,  we sat at the bar watching the pizza oven (I imagine that's a punishment for some folks but I like watching kitchens work their magic).  

I'd need more than one visit to know for certain,  but I think they may be a new favorite place for a nice dinner out among a few other favorites.  Probably my favorite new world Italian in the city though.
Scott Conant, you are very good my friend. Hats off to you. The spaghetti was probably the best spaghetti we've ever had, period.

Man, I had high hopes for this place... but can we say overrated?!  I have a theory about Vegas restaurants: they're all very hyped and expensive but tend to fall short on meeting expectations.

I was in Vegas for a convention so went in for dinner.  I ordered the duck and foie gras ravioli and it was so salty I couldn't eat more than one.  It actually felt weird on my tongue because it was so salty.   I normally don't like to send things back but there was no way I could eat the dish.  They gladly took it back and apologized.  I ordered the spaghetti in its place and they brought it out quickly so that I wasn't left waiting for my food while everyone else was eating.  Everything that the others had were alright but definitely not memorable (I don't remember what they got).  The service was great and the food was ok but those two factors along with the ridiculous prices, I would probably never go back.
Nailed it again!  Great food.  Amazing service.  Great ambiance.  One of my favorite restaurants in the world.

Solid. Never knew how "gourmet" pasta could get, but YES it surely can to that level. Believe it. 

Entrees:
Short Rib Agnolotti: this dish was perfection. the little ravioli-like pieces were well stuffed with flavorful short rib and the toasted breadcrumbs were the perfect topper. totally recommended.
Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli: the richness of the filling makes it a dish to remember. c'mon it's foie gras! may be too fatty/heavy for one, but a delectable dish to share. 
Spaghetti: took a bite of my friend's. pretty damn good for a traditional spaghetti dish, but it's really not like your mama's spaghetti at all. them al dente noodles were on point. 
Chicken: chicken is just chicken, to me. wasn't particularly exciting.
Prime Filet of Beef: this was another item for our table. pieces of steak were cooked med-rare, which made the pieces juicy. good, but not "steak-house good."

The desserts were shared were the Grapefruit Panna Cotta and Bombolini. Both were so delicious! I'm typically hesitant about ordering fancy dessert, but these were worth it! 

In addition, we got the perfect view of the Bellagio water show from our table. And to top it all off, our server (a mid-aged Asian man) was incredible hospitable, genuine in his recommendations and considerate of our party's needs. The service really made it a great experience for our bachelorette's dinner. 

Scarpetta, thanks for making our Vegas trip a classy one.

Greeted by Mario (former GM @ SW).
Whisked away to a great table for 4 overlooking Bellagio fountains.
Showered with appetizers and other taste treats.
Incredible service from various characters that epitomized and demonstrated the highest level of food service professionalism.
From the various fresh and unique breads to the delightful complimentary taste treats the meal started with a bang.
Too many dishes to mentioned but all outstanding.
Mario and team hovering over the table at critical times to ensure great service and presentation.
The meal culiminated with 4 deserts which absolutedly sealed the deal - establishing this restaurant as a staple for outstanding LV italian cuisine.
Seek out Mario - Make friends - Enjoy some great food.
Do not doubt me on this call.
Cheers,
Brad

Very romantic!!! Food was very good.....love the assorted bread baskets....you could see the Bellagio water show!!!  Pasta was delicious!!!!  you must have those donut holes filled with nutella!!!! Omg that was heaven!!

The restaurant has a nice elevated view of the Bellagio fountains so try to get one of the tables that take advantage of this.   

The bread basket they bring to the table was very good - many varieties.  The Buratta Salad and Branzino were also very good.    The other 3 people at the table also enjoyed their appetizers and main courses.  I had tastes of the Pasta special (Boar) and the Short Rib Agnolotti which were both very good.      The table shared a variety of desserts which were all excellent.

Stumbled into this place between getting destroyed by craps and the gasping for smoke-free air. 

Really happy that we made time for Scarpetta on our laundry list of vegas pit stops, it was well worth it. 

Such an eye for detail and dedication to the craft of their food, I didn't see a plate saunter back to the kitchen that wasn't already licked clean. Would highly recommend the dessert section and pretty much any pasta dish.... you literally can't go wrong. 

If you're looking for authentic Italian on the strip, you better believe this is the place to go! 

My only gripes with the place:

The toilets are black... semi gloss... black.... in a candlelit dark room. Literally had no idea where the hell I was peeing. 

The servers have name tags... What is this CHILIS?! Drop the nametag you're a fine dining establishment.
OMG!  LOVE THIS PLACE  view of the fountains with food and drink,  best Italian food in VEGAS

They don't serve tasting menu on Saturday but I still inquired. The waitress was kind enough to check with the chef and he/she agreed to it. There was a lot of food. Not only they brought out the items per the menu but also some courtesy dishes to sample. Very nice view by overlooking the Bellagio water fountain.

Came here with a bunch of friends for a nice sit down fancy Italian style restaurant and had a great meal. There is a good wine selection and there is a fair selection for vegetarians. The service was very good

My favorite thing about Vegas is not the casinos, shows, or nightclubs (although the latter is a close second), but the abundance and quality of fine dining.  One of my girl friends requested that we dine at The Cosmopolitan on our Vegas getaway, so I picked Scarpetta because it was spendy but not quite a splurge like é by José Andrés or Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill.

As far as Italian food goes, Scarpetta was scrumptious, though overpriced like everything on the Strip.  My girl friends and I were seated at a big, chic horseshoe booth--and if it weren't for our next destination (dancing at Tryst and XS), I likely would've drank and ate more here. 

For my appetizer I had the spring pea soup ($16) with gulf shrimp, guanciale (Italian bacon), and reisling gelee.  It was the most delicious pea soup I've ever had in my life! Incredibly balanced, fresh, flavorful, and masterfully presented.  

For my main I had the duck & foie gras ravioli ($26) with marsala reduction.  I absolutely wanted to love this dish due to the presence of foie gras, but I could barely taste the foie gras, let alone the duck.  I did appreciate, however, that the pasta was homemade.  Crystal L.'s main course, the short rib agnolotti ($25), with brown butter horseradish and toasted breadcrumb was a much better choice for pasta--I was so happy when she literally gave me half!  I knew then and there that this was going to be a wonderful night!

If you like classic trattoria fare, I wouldn't go to Scarpetta.  But if you don't mind fancy, modern Italian, look no further.

Have to say quite disappointed for fine dining.  Service was good, just way to rush in sending out the courses.  Had a tasting menu with wine pairing.  Have to say price is not expensive, but food was not the best.  Especially signature dishes as spaghetti and duck breast.  The spaghetti is like random home made tv dinner.  Noodle was too thick.  Duck breast is way over cooked.  Expect a bit more from Cosmopolitan fine dining.  For usd 250 per person, the package should be a bit better.

Well, we had a nice dinner but after eating at STK the night before, Scarpetta let me down a little.
The bar is somewhat awkward, more like a long hallway with a slight "walk of shame" ambiance to it.  We were seated at our table - it is a beautiful room.
The bread is good but I'm not sure why some of it was cut up stromboli slices.  Hell, we are from Philly but it's very filling before dinner.
The oysters were absolutely delicious!!! The best dish we ordered without a doubt!  
Our waiter then expanded our table by lifting the sides on our square table making it a larger round table to make room for our entrees.  Unfortunately, on my side there was a huge glob of chewed gum that became visible when the waiter lifted my partition.  This was not my waiter's fault but it was still gross.  Of course, my waiter quickly worked on removing the gum but yuck! That's Vegas for you! 
My husband and I both ordered the spaghetti and meatballs.  Both dishes were warm not has hot has I like.  It was OK.  I'm kind of a pasta snob (Thanks Babbo)
Our friends felt the same about their pasta dishes, it was OK  Not mind blowing.
We ordered two bottles of Cline wine - can't go wrong there!
Dessert was good but still not out of the park.
Our bill for 4 people was about $800.  Now for 4 people in Vegas, this is the norm but this night, I don't think it was worth it.
I know a lot of people LOVE this place, maybe it was just an off night.

Maybe I'm easy to please (doubtful) or just as not as sophisticated as some, or maybe they have had some off nights. I've seen some not-so-great reviews of this establishment. Frankly, I don't know what it would take to please them. My new bride and I went there for our "fancy meal" during our honeymoon. I wanted it to be a nice and memorable experience for her as she has not eaten in as many fine dining places as I have. Scarpetta delivered. When making my reservations weeks ago I asked for a window table with a view of the fountains at Bellagio in a quiet area. We sat at what is probably the best table in the house. The wait staff was attentive and knowledgeable. Having read all of the posted reviews I knew I wanted to try the spaghetti but we didn't want it as our main dish so we went "off script" a bit and ordered it as an appetizer. They spit it for us perfectly. That dish alone could have ended the night on a high note. House made pasta cooked perfectly with a simple tomato and basil sauce. Heavenly. Oh, I forgot to mention the bread. The bread. Neither of us are big carb eaters but my God that bread was good! I ordered the pork chop and she ordered the fillet. Both were cooked and seasoned perfectly. We both had unforgettable desserts as well. I had the chocolate cake and she had the Bombolinis. Even the coffee was one of the best cups I ever had. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting a over the top meal at a great place. We will be back.
Nothing terrible and nothing good. An attractive place but with the numerous choices in Vegas I would not return. I honestly cannot remember what I ate- that tells the story

Overall, I enjoyed my meal here and thought it was affordable for a nice meal on the Strip with a large group of friends. I think this is probably one of the better restaurants on the Strip. I enjoyed the ambiance and the view was relatively nice. 

My fiancé and I ordered the truffle mushroom polenta, the filet mignon, and lobster pici. Everything I ate was pretty solid. The steak was tender and cooked well and reasonably priced. The pici was a bit pricey, but it tasted pretty good and I appreciated that is was more unique than other pastas I've had. The sauce was nice and spicy and the lobster was cooked well. The pasta is homemade here which is a plus. I didn't mind paying more for it. The truffle mushroom polenta was also yummy considering the mushy texture of polenta. It was flavored well. Some of my friends ordered the Sphagetti with basil marina sauce (no meat) here and I had a try. I wasn't too impressed and wouldn't spend the 20ish dollars on it for something so plain and simple and without any meat. They raved about the sauce, but honestly I can get something similar at Trader Joes from a bag and I actually think it tastes better. Eek. 

The service was okay. The only big negative is that they forgot my pasta, which was unfortunate. 

Overall, I'd definitely come here again for the food if I want a nice decently priced fancy dinner on the strip and I wouldn't hesitate taking friends here.

It's a super fancy restaurant with cool decoration and some seats with nice view. The tabling service is old and kinda impatient to guests with no reservation. We ended sit in the bar, and luckily waiters at the bar are nicer. 

The food is kinda pricey but the taste is decent. I usually don't order ravioli (thought it taste like fake dumplings) but I actually almost finish the entire plate of their duck ravioli. Really tasty and sauce is quite matching. All 3 cocktails that we orders tastes not bad. 

Regardless of the price, I will recommend the food and drink, and remember to reserve the window seat then.

Just had dinner here the other night and it was tremendous. The atmosphere is stunning with sweeping views and the Bellagio fountains right outside the window. The waitstaff was the most pleasant of any restaurant we dined in on our trip; sociable, charming and very attentive. 
I ordered the Grilled Spanish Octopus & Squid with ceci beans, caperberries & smoked paprika vinaigrette, the Short Rib Agnolotti with brown butter, horseradish & toasted breadcrumbs and the Mascarpone Cheesecake with harry's berries, rhubarb, pistachio cream & milkshake. The meal was one of the best I've ever eaten; truly exceptional. The dessert was DIVINE. I can't say enough about this place. I am still dreaming about my meal! Can't wait to go back!

Oh, that spaghetti. It's the most unassuming thing on the menu--nothing fancy, just house made noodles with tomato sauce and basil. Completely simple, and totally delicious. It's worth coming to Scarpetta just for this one dish ($24). If you're sharing it, they'll split into two perfect servings that are big enough to enjoy and small enough that you can still order other stuff. 

I'm getting ahead of myself, though. Before you get to the spaghetti, enjoy the dark, modern, understated ambience. If you're lucky enough to be seated by the window, you'll be able to catch the Bellagio fountain water shows. 

The bread basket they being is not your run-of-the-mill sort of deal. There's a serious assortment of delicious options (the rosemary focaccia is amazing!) served with mascarpone butter, eggplant caponata, and citrus-infused olive oil. 

They have a nice selection of wine, including maybe a dozen options by the glass. Didn't have much experience with their cocktails, but the old fashioned that my husband ordered was way too sweet. 

Besides the spaghetti, other menu highlights were the asparagus, which was cooked perfectly, with an egg yolk vinaigrette (hollandaise-esque, but not too heavy) and capers, and the creamy polenta with truffled mushroom fricasee--so flavorful and umami. The polenta was so loose it was a little difficult to eat without dripping all over, but the buttery mushroom goodness happening way more than made up for that shortcoming.

Wanted to go to a nice Italian dinner for my 21st and happened to stumble upon Scarpetta and I'm SO happy I did. Everyone in the restaurant was so attentive and helpful and our server Roberto went above and beyond. All of our dishes were amazing and the perfect portion. I recommend the spicy lobster pesto pasta! So good. Cannot wait to come back here for my next trip to Vegas.

What a fantastic experience on the strip of las vegas. I didn't expected the food to be so good. We went there for dinner in November and the first course and main plats were all outstanding!
I had the beet salad which was fantastic. Then, my entree bronzino was so flavorful as well. The service was impeccable and the only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because the receptionists who were off putting making us wait needlessly even though there were plenty of seats.

By far one of the best filet's I have ever had. Luis the server was very knowledgeable as well and they met my gluten free dietary needs. The atmosphere is very pleasant. If your in Vegas I highly recommend giving this place try.

A good spot with great food. Excellent customer service. I recommend it!

First restaurant we went to upon moving to Calgary. Been back numerous times with family, friends and colleagues. Never disappointed.

Regards

Scarpetta is the best kind of restaurants in my mind - elegant ambiance with a view, absolutely delicious and innovative food, coupled with perfect service! 

We had a quick meal here on our last night in Vegas before heading to the airport. We got the burrata special, which was easily the best burrata I'd ever had - it was so fresh and creamy, and the pairings were perfect! For mains, I ordered the uni black tagliatelle and my 2 girl friends ordered al cempo and foie gras ravioli. Mine was pretty good but the foie gras ravioli gave me straight up food orgasm - simply perfection!! Our server was also very nice and responsive.

I recommend dates or group dinners here, as the round tables are large but intimate. Try to get a view if you can because the restaurant sits right above the Bellagio fountain.

We loved it.. Small menu but very delicious. Loved the spaghetti .
We don't have reservations but we didn't have to wait too long . They sat us in the front bar area and it was good for people watching . Drinks were pricey - but good 
Would definitely go back

If you are looking for best pasta on strip, this is the place! If you want the best view of Bellagio fountain from dinning table at Scarpetta, table 84 is your answer. The ambiance was quiet and intimate. It's perfect for a romantic dinner and conversation. I came here few times and never had anything I didn't like. Scarpetta serves very tasty breads. Don't fill yourself up with those yummies before your real food arrives! All pasta noodles here are hand made fresh. Lobster Pici( thick, hand-rolled pasta) is my love on pasta menu. It comes with big chunks of lobster and very tasty spiced sauce. I also really enjoy Spiced Duck Breast, Mediterranean Branzino and Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli from entree menu. One more thing you have to remember! Save some space for deserts! COCONUT PANNA COTTA is a MUST ORDER. It's very light and refreshing. It's a perfect way to end your dinner. I totally fall in love with Scarpetta as soon as I discovered this gem on strip. I hope you will enjoy it as much as I do.

Had an amazing NYE dinner here. From start to finish it was nothing short of spectacular. Had a beautiful view of the fountains and some of the best drinks during our staycation at the Cosmopolitan. Starting with their delicious bread basket the Stromboli was fantastic. Warm cheesy meaty deliciousness. For appetizers we had the polenta and short ribs. Entrees were the Branzino and Aged Sirloin. Shared an order of their tomato basil spaghetti. The bombolini was our finisher. I would order everything again except for the Branzino, my shrimp were overcooked and it was very one dimensional. However everything else was so delicious it didn't linger very long. It was pricey but well worth the experience. I cannot wait to go back. I'm salivating just thinking about it...
yelpers, your reviews hype it up again. the service was good, but the food, in my opinion is eh, okay.

Modern, warm and romantic restaurant featuring amazing vegan dishes by Scott Conant. My recommendations are the focaccia, roasted garden vegetable soup, rosemary braised lentils with broccoli rabe and oven dried tomatoes and tagliatelle with vegetables.

Lobster Picci unlike anything I've had. Pesto/pasta fresh and so tasteful. Lobster topped on pasta was more than I expected. Cauliflower soup so good. Ambience of the place is very upscale, romantic. My cousins got the spagetti which is well known even amongst the locals.  Prices obviously high, but well worth the experience.

I give it 3 stars for the ambience. It is very romantic. We asked for a window seat but it was too loud so we asked to be moved to one of the intimate booths. The food was mediocre. They seem to be trying too hard. Too man flavors in each dish.

I'm a little sad to give this update... I love Scarpetta.  I returned here for dinner after about a year and a half and there was something that just wasn't the same about it. The restaurant itself is still outstanding. And the food is great, EXCEPT, one thing just didn't seem the same anymore.  The shortrib appetizer.  All of us at the table agreed that something changed and it really wasn't good.  In fact, it's definitely now something I wouldn't order again.  The meat was dry and the flavor just wasn't there. And as for service, our waiter was nice...but there was a server who continued to hover around our table.  Attentiveness is appreciated but hovering when we're trying to enjoy our dinner was a little annoying.  And my last gripe - I ordered the chocolate souffle for dessert. Normally, the servers set it up for you and show you how to pour the chocolate over, put the toppings, etc.  But nothing.  They just placed this gigantic beautiful souffle in front of me and I stared it at like how am I supposed to eat this.  It was great, but I just thought it was weird that they didn't offer any help.   I still love Scarpetta but ... this night they were a little off.
Everything about this place is perfect! Views, food and impeccable service! I wish there was 6 stars.

A fancy italian restaurant, with hand-made pasta and a gorgeous view. 

Tips: 
- make sure you reserve a seat by the window or at least facing the window to see the Bellagio fountains 
- order the farmer's market salad, short rib & bone marrow agnolotti ravioli

Ambiance ~5 stars 
Restaurant located on the third floor of the cosmopolitan hotel and the seats and placed to face the window that has a view of the bellagio fountains. 

Food ~5 stars
Various types of bread served with olive oil, egg plant tomato spread, and ricotta cheese. I couldn't get my hands off the eggplant tomato spread. 

Farmer's market salad: definitely one my favorite salads that has pine nuts, arugula, truffle...i didn't have to force myself to eat it because it was delicious

Diver's scallop: 2 scallops that were cooked to perfection, tender

Foie gras ravioli: rich and buttery in flavor but I prefer my foie gras to be complemented with tart ingredients, I could hardly notice that it was foie gras

Short rib & bone marrow agnolotti ravioli: the menu list horseradish as an ingredient and that is something that I do not like but I couldn't taste it one bit, I preferred this dish over the foie gras ravioli since there was more flavor

Picci: pasta was interesting with chili pesto sauce and large chunks of lobster

Chocolate souffle: i was not impressed with the texture of this souffle, it was not as fluffy as I would like 

Service ~3 stars
The restaurant was understaffed on a busy new years day. We were seated but did not receive the menu until 10 minutes later. The waiter was hardly present and we had to get service from other waiters.

Foie Gras Ravioli- rich as hell and amazing every bite
The tar tar was also wonderful and tasted like meat heaven in my mouth
Agnolotti had perfect texture, powerful taste and left me wanting more
Fettuccini- rich and crazy good. The lamb was done perfectly and everything meshed into a perfect bite.
We had a couple bottles of wine. Both good. both recommended and not very expensive. 

service was obviously good, we pretty much had a server assistant another waiter our waiter or the manager check on our table every 2 minutes. They didn't always say anything but I consistantly noticed them doing a glance over at us.

We ate at Scarpetta yesterday evening go celebrate our friends' engagement. He had booked a private room overlooking the Bellagio fountains which was so nice! Our experience here was pleasant and very memorable :)

Ambiance - dark, romantic, trendy, upscale. Great for a date or fancy dinner with friends/family 

Service- excellent. Waitstaff was super attentive. I never had an empty water glass! 

Food- delicious but a little on the heavy side. Definitely come hungry! We had gotten the pre fix meal with several modifications. They had also added a few complimentary items which was nice! We started off with a bread basket which came with marscapone butter and eggplant tapenade. Some of the bread rolls had ham and cheese! I had to stop myself from stuffing myself from the bread. I don't remember everything we ate but some of the highlights were: polenta... it was so creamy and smooth! I've never had polenta like that. And we had some steak which was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The lobster Pesto noodles were also delicious and came with several lobster chunks and al dente handmade (seemed like it at least?) noodles. The bone marrow pasta and duck and foie gras ravioli were so interesting and tasty. Portions were pretty big and we left sooo stuffed. I also loved the desserts- the strawberry pana cotta had an extremely dense yet smooth texture which paired well with the strawberry gelato on top. We also loved the bombolini which were basically sugar coated donut balls. 

Value- we spend around $200 a person after tax and tip which was not bad considering all the food we got! It was good to try but I might get a la carte next time :p
The foie gras ravioli and the truffle polenta nom nom nom!!!

This was my first time visiting Scarpetta's and it did not disappoint!  Not only is this restaurant located in the beautiful Cosmopolitan Hotel and from the restaurant you can see the water show at the Bellagio, but the staff are really friendly and the food is the best I have ever had in my entire life!  We tried a variety of dishes and even after I was full, I kept eating because the food was so good.  I'm still thinking about how delicious the food was and want to go back so I can eat here again!
Came in for the spaghetti - walked away full and completely satisfied. Totally worth it.

I had a pleasant meal at the bar.  I got their mushroom polenta which was absolutely delicious.  The polenta was really creamy and the mushrooms flavored perfectly.  It complemented my duck foie gras ravioli really well.  The ravioli was not as good at the polenta.  I thought the skin was too thin, and the filling not substantial enough.  It was a smooth, light filling but I was left hungry after finishing it.  I probably should have gotten the other ravioli dish.

For dessert, the panna cotta with guava sauce and pineapples was a refreshing way to end the meal.

Salty. Just salty, but I was so hungry I ate it anyway.

$17 malbec
$18 yellowtail appetizer - 4 small pieces, good for one person
$28 duck foie gras ravioli - SALTY, but good portion size

great service made up for mediocre food.  $80 for dinner and I left slightly drunk, so that might have made up for it, too 

This is Vegas, so everything is expensive. If it wasn't, I'd give it 3 stars

Came for social hour, which was a good way to try the place at a great price. Social hour is $7 for small bites and select drinks from 5:30-7:00pm on weekdays. Service was friendly and great. However, the bar does not get a view of the Bellagio fountains. 

Highly recommend the Il Limone cocktail and the Short Rib and Bone Marrow Agnolotti. We would go back there just for the agnolotti. 

The Duck and Foie ravioli, while well made, felt like a let down compared to the agnolotti. The foie, rather than adding buttery richness to the ravioli, accentuated the gamey-ness and tasted more like regular liver. 

We also got the Arancini and the Fritto Misto. The arancini was pretty standard. The fritto misto comes out as a pile of thinly sliced fried vegetables on some small bits of assorted fried seafood. There was a tiny subtle pleasant kick to the fritto misto that also added to the uniqueness of the dish.

Scarpetta is just one of those restaurants in Vegas that you must check out. The atmosphere is quite different than the usual Vegas type (loud and filled with buzz) restaurants. Its romantic, intimate and just has a classy atmosphere. It was relaxing to have wonderful, kind servers there to help you choose a cocktail or a good mix of entrees. 

We went to celebrate a friends birthday, and let me tell you we have never eaten better. We ordered a few appetizers, entrees and were too full for dessert. I remember the veal entree being my favorite dish of the evening. Everything was on point from the presentations to flavors. I would say that the wine list was excellent but some of their cocktails are an acquired taste. The server was gracious enough to replace one of the drinks when asked. 

I cant wait to eat here again. A favorite for sure.

I ate dinner here with seven other friends a few weeks ago and the atmosphere is lovely, the service was bad.  Everyone we talked to before coming here said the spaghetti was awesome! 2 friends got that and it was okay, noodles slightly too undercooked and I like it aldenti, and two people got a lobster tagalini and their stomachs were upset after,  I got the roasted chicken and when I cut into the wing part it was bloody and I discreetly let the server know and he left the breast half with me and took back only the wing, he was gone for about 15 min, nowhere to be found, when he returned I explained that I wasn't eating the breast part and he explained that is the way they cook it, with his hand in my face I had to back my chair up, that was rude and not true, my Aunt got the same dish and hers was cooked through... I would not return after this experience.

Celebrating in LV is unlike celebrating anywhere else.  Not only are you in the Cosmo which is beautiful to begin with, but at Scarpetta you're in heaven.  My group and I were so hungry that we headed straight for the entrees.  I had the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti.  It was so delicious.  The brown butter sauce was perfectly nutty.  The pasta cooked by a seasoned pro no doubt.  And that yumminess from the bone marrow - orgasmic.  I know it sounds brash to put it like that, but this is the experience you're likely to have!

I have been here twice and will come back again, willing to try the one in Beverly Hills as well. So I made reservations here this weekend knowing that my friends would enjoy the ambiance and food. Was a success, they kept thanking me for bringing them. 

This time I tried the Duck Foie Gras ravioli, it did not disappoint. I also recommend the mushroom polenta soup, very rich in flavor. The duck breast and veal chop which I had last time were amazing so I wanted to try other dishes. I shared food with some of my friends which is an excellent way to try multiple items, we don't mind, sharing is caring. The lamb my friend ordered medium was very good, although I would have ordered it medium rare it would of been better. 

As far as the service goes, they we're very attentive to filling our waters and replacing our drinks. When we paid, I gave the waiter a coupon which they emailed me for 15% off the entire meal, no problem. One of the waiters also helped me put on my jacket, very courteous. Every detail counts!
Great service, so so food. Their menus are ridiculous. They try too hard. Stick to good ingredients and execution. Like many things in Vegas, their restaurant is more showy than tasty.

Once again Scarpetta takes the gold. Every time we come to Las Vegas and your restaurants, we are never disappointed with the price, service and quality of food. The great experience starts with Noe who always takes care of us and makes us feel like family every time we dine here. We were seated next to the windows that had a view of the Bellagio fountains. The staff is very on point and really make you feel like you are at a Michellin Star restaurant.  

The basket of fresh baked bread was a mixture of to die for breads. They are such a great start to the meal you are about to endure. We had a five course meal and every one is posted on the review. The plating of each dish was tasty to the eyes. The Tuna and Yellow tail appetizer was the smallest bites but they were the bites to remember.  Fresh, packed with the right flavors and textures.  The beet salad was very pleasant. I never like to eat beets but I could eat this beet salad every day. The earthy ness of the flavor was amazing and the dressing was so good. The creamy polenta was to die for. I could not put my spoon down to stop eating this. Every bite had a mixture of great flavors and a bite of truffle mushrooms.  The plate of green spaghetti was sooo good. It was fresh  pasta that had an amazing kick to it. It had a small kick of spicy on every bite but the creamy sauce mellowed the spiciness.  The shrimp in the spaghetti was the perfect combination of flavors. 

The braised beef was perfectly crusted and tender in the center. The two sauces that accompanied the meat was so tasty. And finally the dessert was very very very yummy. We had he Nutella stuffed doughnut balls with banana ice cream and the coconut panna Cotta was sooo good.  A must have.  The prices were soo affordable and we will always visit Scarpetta every time we go to Las Vegas.

Beautiful ambiance and great food! The only reason I have to do 4 stars instead of 5 is really the service. Upon arriving at the time of our reservation we were told the table was getting prepared. So we decided to sit at the bar and have a drink while we waited. We ended up waiting for 15 mins and when they finally walked us back to our table the restaurant was not as packed as I had expected. Strange that it took that long to just get us seated. We started with the diver scallops YUM! And then both ended up getting pasta. We got the lamb bolognese and the Pici lobster pasta. Both were delicious! I preferred the bolognese, amazing burrata on top and plenty of meat and pasta. The lobster pasta was different but not bad at all! Our server barely checked on us and was much more interested in other tables (tables buying expensive wine, etc.) I understand giving maybe a little more attention, but at least come and check on us! I would come back because the good was that good, but maybe just sitting in the bar next time. They have nice intimate booths that would have been perfect!

The food was great, but for the sparce seating, the service was lacking a bit.  It seems the rest on their reputation, rather than catering to each guest's needs.  The music was WAY too loud for dinner conversation.

Wonderful dinner experience! Easily one of my favorite Italian restaurant in town.

Came here for dinner one night with a good friend of mine and we took advantage of the 3 course dinner offered for restaurant week. Our waiter was awesome! We got a seat not to far from the window and got a small view of the Bellagio fountains. We ordered 2 appetizers, 2 entrees to share, all were extremely tasty, but my favorite had to be the fish, crispy on the outside, tender and moist on the inside, seasoned well and definitely not overcooked. The desserts were amazing too. 

Our waiter provided the best service, super attentive, anticipated our needs, refilled our drinks constantly, catered to us which is exactly what makes or breaks a meal. Highly recommend!

Amazing view. Flawless service. 

Scarpetta is one of those restaurants that will sweep you off your feet. The view that you get while dining here is just breathtaking. 

I could begin by talking about how delicious their appetizers and main courses are but I would rather talk about their desserts. 

OMG. Their desserts are to die for. Their strawberry souffle is out of this world. It was light and fluffy as souffles should be but not too sweet. Melts in your mouth the second it touches your tongue. Light and slightly sweet...thinking about brings me joy. The vanilla ice cream adds to how amazing devouring this warm delicious souffle was. 

We also had the coconut panacotta with guava...silky smooth and just so so good !!
The Amaedi Chocolate Cake is what every chocolate lover craves when they think of dessert. Warm melted chocolate in every bite with ice cream on the side *-* 

Please prepare yourself and do not over eat during dinner. You do not want to skip dessert!!

My boyfriend and I came here for date night while we were in Vegas. We really enjoyed our experience. We got a table that overlooked the fountain at Bellagio, which was beautiful. Our waiter was the nicest gentleman. We had a great time chatting up with him. We had heard wonderful things about the spaghetti so we both got that and devoured it. Their drinks were delicious and so was the complimentary bread. They catered to us very well and we were delighted. We were so stuffed so we didn't have room for dessert but I'm sure they were just as good. Highly recommend this place!

Favorite restaurant on the strip! I come here with family for every major occasion. Noe makes everything so special every time we visit. He always treats us like family. Food here is to die for. Best classic spaghetti I have ever had. Beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. Lovely atmosphere.

3.97 stars.

After a long day traveling to Las Vegas via Los Angeles, we were hungry and ready to celebrate our rather short weekend in Sin City.  We were able to get a booth in the designated bar area that was a bit more casual than the beautiful main dinning room.  Oh "Little Shoe", how pretty you are.  Ambiance:  4 stars.  

We started with a few appetizers:  The Beet Salad (2.5 stars) that my friend said was just okay and average at best; The Chestnut Soup (4 stars) was actually quiet nice and sort of like a bisque with nice chunks of pickled brussel sprouts that I usually never have, but really enjoyed; and The Braised Beef (3.5 stars) with fall root vegetables and faro risotto.

One dinner entree was the Tagliatelle pasta (3.75 stars) with fall root vegetables, truffle zabaglione and guanciale (Italian bacon).  This was the lighter of our three dishes and came in 3rd place.  The runner up dish was the Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli in a marsala reduction (5 stars!)  Wonderfully rich and decadent, like buttah!!!  We thought the best dish was the Short Rib Agnolotti (5 stars!) of brown butter horseradish.  A stellar dish that had such an intriguing zing of fresh horseradish.  Giddy up little doggie, giddy up!!

Service was okay, a bit non existent initially and it took awhile to get two additional settings for our party of three; then ask for a missing bread dish.  Other than that, the waiter made his Italian wine recommendations that turned out to be not bad.  Service:  4 stars.

Tally:  
Ambiance:  4 stars  ("New Romantic" 80's music, a tad bit loud)
Beet Salad:  2.5 stars
Chestnut Soup:  4 stars
Braised Beef:  3.5 stars
Tagliatelle pasta:  3.75 stars
Duck & Foie Gras ravioli:  5 stars!
Short Rib Agnolotti:  5 stars!
Service:  4 stars
4+2.5+4+3.5+3.75+5+5+4= 31.75/8= 3.97 stars.

Damn this was such a good meal!  My friends and I dined here for Restaurant Week 2013 and all of us, but one, ordered off the Restaurant week menu.  It all began when I made reservations on Open Table, courtesy of the Yelp App on my iPhone.  I didnt have any preference of where we sat, but where the hostess sat us was remarkable!  We got a window seat facing the Bellagio, so not only did we enjoy a delicious meal, we also got to enjoy a fantastic view of the strip, the Bellagio, and also the Bellagio Fountain show all at once!  Now this was a meal to remember!  Service was top notch, there were no disappointments there; the waiter we had was very attentive and helpful in helping us make our selection from the menu.  

Course 1: Braised beef short rib - very tender pieces of sliced beef on top of what they called a risotto (not the traditional type of risotto) but it was still delicious!  The "Risotto" was basically diced pieces of vegetables which supported the 3-4 pieces of beef on top.  Very good combination of flavors and textures.  Very impressed.  

Before the second course came, we were all scarfing down their stromboli bread which is complimentary with our meal!  It came with other bread, which were not that memorable.  The bread was also served with three types of spreads, an eggplant marinara spread, olive oil, and something else I cannot remember. On a side note, one of my friends even asked the waiter to bring an entire basket filled with the bread, which he did!  That made her evening! haha.  

Course 2: Jidori Chicken - Now I didn't know what a Jidori chicken was, so I asked the waiter.  This whole time, I thought it was the way the chicken was cooked!  But instead, it is the type of chicken used to make the chicken, like using kurabuta pork.  I can definitely tell the difference with kurabuta pork and regular pork, but this jidori chicken was a bit more difficult to tell the difference from regular chicken, besides the fact that this chicken was MOIST throughout!  Maybe that's what makes Jidori chicken so good?  Well, next time I will know! =D  

Not only did I have the second course as my main meal, I HAD to try their handmade spaghetti everyone RAVES about!  So I ordered a dish for everyone to share!  In conclusion, it was pretty damn good.  What makes it good is the noodles!  The texture is not too over or undercooked, but just right!  I guess the handmade pasta really makes a difference in a pasta dish!  

Course 3: Chocolate cake with salted caramel ice cream - Now how can you end a meal without dessert!?  My stomach was SO distended PRIOR to the second course, but I had to taste everything!  By the time dessert came, I swear I have a second stomach!  I devoured not ONLY MY dessert, but my friends dessert too!  She ordered the stuffed donuts with nutella....what?! NUTELLA in fried dough?  Yes!  Nuff said. ;-)  

I'd definitely come back to Scarpetta again!  Quite pricey for a student like myself, so probably come again with my family, during restaurant week, or when I start making the big bucks!
The food is wonderful here. I came with a few friends on our Vegas vacation and was super surprise. The fettuccini with veal is my recommendation as well as their cauliflower soup.

The food was bad to average. The duck was gross and had a weird aftertaste. The lamb Rague was decent but it was a little bitter due to the broccoli it had in it. The yellow tail sashimi again was very average. The service was really bad. So if you want average food with bad service you should eat here... Otherwise go somewhere else. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is very nice, but in Vegas that's pretty much true of most nice places.

Started with variety of bread. Had one with salami n cheese. With 3 dipping sauces- oil, cheese or carbonata. Carbonata was tangy,chock full of eggplant and delish.  Beef tartare was good. Had truffles on top.Truffles tasted bland. I thought they were supposed to be amahzing?!  Oysters, $24 for 6 minuscule oysters that weren't properly cleaned nor did it come with minonette. Could have gotten caviar with it.  But the duck foie gras ravioli was really decadent. Bit salty tho. The veal.chop was juicy and tender but tasted like.chicken. guava panna cotta was really good. The st.germain spritzone was refreshing. great service

Love this restaurant. The view is fantastic. Service has always been very attentive. I always go for the simple old favorite of straight up spaghetti and have never been let down. The sauce is excellent.

You know those few precious moments when you're absolutely falling in love with a dish? Like your eyes roll back and you carefully savor each bite, wishing the experience will never end? It's an ecstasy that only a few restaurants can deliver. This describes my dinner experience at Scarpetta, when I delicately pulled apart my fennel dusted spiced black cod. A bed of tomatoes and roasted fennel added a tangy zest to the fish. My lawd. This must be a dream. It's too good to be true!

BAM! Snap back to reality. As I used my fork and knife to draw another piece of that tender cod to my mouth, I spotted a thin black line. Hmm, that's an interesting lookin' spice. Let me tug at it some more. Lo and behold, it was a piece of hair, and it was definitely not mine. The hair was embedded in the cod's skin! I politely informed my waiter of the situation and he apologized, then asked if I would like to replace the cod with a different dish. I just wanted another cod. I wanted to return to that euphoria I was experiencing before my foodie world came crashing down on me when I discovered that unfortunate piece of keratin. 

Like Forrest Gump says, sh** happens. I understand that, but I'm at Scarpetta. This is a high-caliber restaurant, one of the best in Las Vegas, owned by the famous Chef Scott Conant. It's not something I would expect to happen here. My waiter was professional though, he quickly brought out another cod (since my partner was already done with his dish) and our dessert was on the house. I totally appreciate these gestures. Yet, when my second cod arrived, it did not taste as heavenly as the initial one. I noticed that my second dish came out a lot faster than my first, which meant it was cooked in a shorter amount of time. The meat of my second cod looked a tad raw and it was almost rubbery in texture, not as moist and soft as my first one. There goes my foodie high. Womp womp.

The kitchen staff probably invested less time and attention on my replacement dish. I know there was a slight rush to bring out my cod ASAP since my boyfriend already finished his entree. However, I was still paying for this dish and it was executed poorly compared to the first one. 

This could have easily been a four or five star review. We asked for a table next to the window and the views of The Strip and the Bellagio Fountains were stunning. So romantic and beautiful. My boyfriend and I started our dinner with the Tuna "Susci" with marinated vegetables and preserved truffles. This is essentially tuna wrapped around vegetables. It was almost like a sushi roll, but there was too much going on. We couldn't really tease out the tuna flavor.  

My boyfriend ordered the short rib & bone marrow agnolotti. It's cooked in brown butter, horseradish, and toasted breadcrumbs. He said it was good but not amazingly tasty. He was still quite hungry after finishing his pasta. 

The complimentary Amedei Chocolate cake with toasted almond gelato and salted caramel sauce was decadent. The chocolate was not overly sweet and the almond gelato was creamy.

It wasn't purely the hair, but the fact that my second cod was unrecognizable compared to my first one. The rest of the items are pretty solid. The view is the best thing Scarpetta has to offer. And maybe that black cod...when it is cooked properly.

I was there two weeks ago with some friends and we decided to have Italian before heading out to Marquee that night. Food was okay, not really that great. Ordered a steak ($55 or so ) and it was pretty tiny. Ordered another plate of a pasta and it wasn't that good. The sauce tasted bitter to me.

Scarpetta is on one of Las Vega's best place for restaurants;  the third floor at  Cosmopolitan.  It is nestled next to some excellent restaurants and it more than holds its own.  I have eaten at Scarpetta many times and have never been disappointed.  

The atmosphere is semi dark and very luxurious.  We had a terrific view of the Bellagio fountains from our table.  Since their pasta is so good we ordered three pastas and one main dish.  The three pastas were the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli, the Short Rib Agnolotti  and the classic Spaghetti with tomato and basil.  Each one of these dishes are superb. Each one gets a 10 from me.  We followed the pasta by sharing a pork chop which was also excellent. 

If you are looking for an outstanding Italian restaurant look no further.

The service was awful: although with courteous and knowledgeable staff, we were rushed through the main course. Portion size is decent, but for American standards it might seem too little. Other than that its a great spot.
Awesome scenery and great service. Not to mention the food was spectacular. For a nice dinner night I would highly recommend. Be sure to get reservations

So far my Favorite Italian Restaurant in Calgary, the staff are always friendly, the service was great everytime I went there. I always start with the sambuca prawns, and caprese. Both amazing appetizers, and shareable. I do have a hard time sharing the prawns. I have tried a few entrees and all have been great, the lunch sandwiches are fabulous, killer deserts and gotta end it with a cappuccino or an Expresso, the quality of the food, the authentic Italian flavors, it's definitely my Italian Fix in Calgary, Chefs Rocco and Gennaro always know how to satisfy my taste buds, I highly recommend 500 CUCINA or aka Cinquecento CUCINA to all my friends and everyone, Buon Appetito!

Came here late night after the Dane Cook comedy show on June 2 2018. Awesome service, very attentive staff. 
I love the ambiance and the window views of the city. 
The candle light was nice and the food was amazing! 
We had the appetizer of short rib, a potatoes cake thing with peas that was so good. Also I got the spaghetti which was so delicious with the fat noodles and tangy marinara sauce. The bread they served to our table was also so good and fresh, soft and warm. 
I can't wait to come back to this place!

It was a red-meat night. My husband and I shared a beef tartare served with a quail egg. I was worried about eating the raw meat and was glad we shared it, otherwise I don't know if I could have finished it by myself. It was delicious. We also shared the main meal, prime rib with lardo mashed potatoes and honey glazed carrots. So yum and tender! I highly recommend it. 
We shared the entire meal in order to make it to dessert only to find that the dessert there doesn't cut it. I mean it was okay, just not worth the price. I tried their Nutella & vanilla creme bombolini. It was okay. I hate saying this, cause I'm a nutella fan, but the nutella really brought the dessert down a notch. It didn't taste like a fine dining dessert. The banana bombolini tasted like banana pudding, so that wasn't good either. My husband tried the chocolate cake and he thought the presentation was lacking and the cake was only okay. Their esperesso was very strong, a good way to end the night.
FYI the drinks are delicious and pleasantly strong. I tried the berry smash and my husband had a few billionaires, both were good.
Overall: The food is super delicious, but skip the dessert.

This restaurant was recommended to me by a friend, but I was disappointed with the flavours, as it just didn't compare to the likes of other neighbouring restaurants, such as Brassaii. Had the food been priced more fairly, it would have stood a chance. 

Scarpetta didn't quite live up to its name. The majority of the dishes were bland or just scarring *coughs - Spiced Mushroom Sott' Olio side dish*. The noteworthy dishes (i.e. Creamy Polenta and Black Cod) were prepared well, but not enough to redeem the whole experience. I would not recommend anyone to dine here for this price. 

To read my review on individual dishes I've tried and for amazing visuals, check out my blog post: http://kiwianne.com/scarpetta-overrated-and-overpriced-italian-fare/

Loved our dinner at Scarpetta!  We miss the Los Angeles location so were pleased to find we also love the one in Las Vegas.  The lobster pasta was so delicious and the entire staff was super friendly and attentive.

Scott Conant truly has created an amazing dining experience here in Vegas. The views of the bellagio fountains makes for a great ambience. But it's the food that makes this one of the places to eat in the city. Italian food done right can't be beat. And that's what they do here.

As others have mentioned, the duck & foie gras ravioli as well as the short rib agnolotti are to die for. 

We have been here a few times now and can't recommend it enough.

Since I can't have access to foie gras anymore in California, it was a no brainer I would order the duck & foie gras ravioli in vegas....and an excellent choice I made.  The portions looked small but it does fill you up.  The beef tartare was also pretty amazing!  Great cozy ambiance in the beautiful cosmopolitan hotel.  I would definitely come back.....after my wedding of course.

Restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip are known to be overpriced, underwhelming, and catering to free-spending high rollers. As a local, I often try to avoid these tourist traps. The expensive menus often provide amuse-bouche after amuse-bouche-sized appetizers and minimally larger entrees leaving you wanting more (quantity). So, I was pleasantly surprised to find a restaurant that finally live up to the bill. I've been wanting to try Scarpetta since seeing its dineLa menu back when I lived there for a short while last year. My girlfriend surprised me with a birthday dinner here with an awesome table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. She was specifically interested in their signature tasting menu, which we later found out was not offered on the weekends. However, after speaking with the chef, our waiter was excited to let us know that it was available. 

For $110, each person gets a 7 course meal complete with an amazing bread basket and they even added an 8th course (or side dish). Three of the courses feature their signature dish including the scallops, spaghetti, and duck. Dinner starts off with a bread basket, which our waiter warned us not to devour. Having experienced fine dining before in Vegas, I completely ignored his advice and dug in. The best piece was the meat and cheese-filled stromboli. The bread spread came with marscapone butter, eggplant caponata, and citrus-infused olive oil. Since my girlfriend is gluten-free, I pretty much ate the entire bread basket myself. No regrets.

Next came the first course: a duo of  yellowtail and tuna. These two pieces of fish were just plain amazing. The pinch of sea salt really elevated the flavor of both pieces. Clean and simple. The diver scallops is a classic dish with a nicely seared scallop atop cannellini beans, and mushrooms. This came with a wonderfully fragrant side of the most creamy polenta with truffles I've ever had complement of the chef. The third and fourth courses were the freshly made spaghetti with tomato & basil with a shared plate of the short rib agnolotti. The spaghetti was simply perfect, the pasta version of a wonderful margherita pizza. My favorite dish of the night was the agnolotti. These small pasta morsels were filled with tender short rib and topped with brown butter and horseradish bread crumbs. My girlfriend compared these to chicken biskit crackers if you close your eyes. At this point, I was starting to get full. The fennel dusted black cod and spiced duck breast courses were a blur. I was getting delirious from the food coma I was about to enter. God, why did I eat that entire bread basket. I had to box the duck breast and muster all that I had left to prepare for the dessert. The amedei chocolate cake with toasted almond gelato was the perfect ending to a marathon of a meal. 

The experience was fantastic and this is by far the best value you will get on the Strip for a prix fixe meal. Both the food and service were extraordinary. A must-try restaurant for any special occasion (or if you're just looking for a fantastic treat).

Superb food
Excellent service
On our last night in LV we wanted a good meal before heading to the airport
Since we have not seen the cosmopolitan hotel yet we decided to go there 
Then we checked the restaurant ratings of course on yelp
The restaurant was rated 4 stars as supposed to the lower 3 star ratings of the other restaurants
So we proceeded
We informed the maitre'd we were in a rush and we had to get out at a certain time
They went into action
Sat us...took our order...we had 2 waiting staff and 1 food runner... got our breads and drinks...took our order...made sure our drinks are always filled...food came out perfect...
The staff was so efficient that we did not feel we were being rushed... no feeling of stress at all from us or the staff...pure efficiency
We even had enough time for dessert
Btw dessert was excellent
Keep in mind that this is a very nice restaurant where you have a fancy meal and take your time to eat
We ate well and got out of the restaurant 2 minutes earlier than our deadline
Next time we are in LV, I'll definitely come back to this fine establishment and on top of that I will recommend it to everyone I know
Thank you Scarpetta and their excellent staff !
Highly-highly recommended

Such an average meal...I can't see what all the raving is about......the food was just ok with the exception of the polenta. ..this was the highlight of the meal, but an app shouldn't be the best item of the night.....the bread people were raving about, eh...nothing special except for the mascarpone spread....the spaghetti was just alright. ......yes the noodles were homemade and thicker than the average spaghetti noodle, which I liked......however the sauce , what a let down....boring, bland uneventful......I was able to try pici, it didn't blow my hair back....I didn't bother with dessert because what was the point..........on a side note the tables are way to close to each other, not easy to enjoy a romantic meal when you can hear the details of 3 different conversations.....sorry not a fan

Tasting menu was great.  Highlights were all the appetizers and  pasta dishes.
Duck was ok, fish was good, but skin wasn't perfectly crisp and a little too chewy.  Wine pairing was appropriate.

Overall very nice dinner, very nice setting and view.  Service was good, not perfect.

Scarpetta is one of the best spots to visit here in Vegas. I've been here a few times already and always had an outstanding experience. The view from the restaurant is terrific. When making reservation ask for the table at the window so you can enjoy Bellagio Fountain Show. 

Our night started with Creamy Polenta, Burrata and a complimentary basket of bread. As an entree we decided to go with Black Tagliolini and Branzino. It was so delicious that my friend said: "if I was allergic to one of the ingredients of this dish I would commit a suicide". Can you imagine how great the food was... Yum!

Don't forget to leave some space for dessert. Their Chocolate Cake and Coconut Panna Cotta are simply delicious.

Scarpetta is a must try. See you very soon :).

My girlfriend and I love this place!  This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant!  The last time I went we got the chiefs choice which is pricey but it is so worth it.  You get tons of food and you can get wine with it as well and their wine selection is amazing.  It is your classic Italian restaurant so you know what you are walking into.

They  have amazing service from their waiters/waitresses to their sommelier.  Their sommelier is extremely knowledgeable and very professional.  Everyone makes you feel right at home and the food is amazing as I have already said.  

The atmosphere is very pleasing and they have a good view of the Bellagio fountains and you can definitely see a show.  I recommend this place to anyone and anytime my family comes in or one of my friends wants to take someone on a date I always recommend this place.
Fresh pasta that made 2 people near me say "this is the best pasta I've ever had". I loved the regular spaghetti and the vegetable sides. Intimate environment and great service.

Excellent Restaurant!!!!

I went here for my friend's birthday and it was amazing. It's located inside The Cosmopolitan hotel, and it's a bit of a walk from the lobby, but it's definitely worth the walk. I had the spaghetti, which is what it's famous for and it was incredible. My friends got a mixture of Braised Short Ribs, Pesto Pasta, and Spaghetti. Everything was FANTASTIC. The service was GREAT and I would definitely go back. The only downside is that it closes early....about 11pm. It's definitely not a late night spot. You also need to make an appointment. It was definitely the best meal I had in Vegas. Go check it out!!!!!

Went her in Las Vegas during there happy hour. The food was pretty yum. The food and drying are 7 bucks each.  Regularly this place is pretty prices so happy hour was a great option for us. My fav was the pork belly but there is a different options like duck foie ravioli. If you go enjoy.

My 300th review and what an enjoyable experience.  This review honors the restaurant as well as my fellow yelpers who always seem to make the right call.  

The strongest recommendations were the following and the yelpers were right on:
Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli - pretty amazing
Black Farfalle - bowtie pasta with lobster was delicous - the texture of this pasta felt like someone may have actually tied it in a bow

The spaghetti was good but serves more as a filler and does not stand out next to the other dishes.

I had the sea bass (branzino) for my main dish which was also good but again, on this night, it was all about the pasta.

An incredibly romantic restaurant. With the Bellagio Fountain in the background, the dim lights, the candles, the wine flowing...it's the perfect setting to fall in love. The service was spot on. Attentive and helpful. The sommerlier helped me pick out a unique bottle of Italian red to compliment the meal.
We started with the oysters. (Because romance was blooming). And shared the duck and foie gras ravioli and the lamb trio. The ravioli was amazing. Rich and delicious as anything with foie gras should be. The lamb trio is the reason I knocked off a star. Although the dish overall was good, one of the lamb preparations was dry and tough. The plate of complimentary italian cookies at the end was a wonderful touch. Scarpetta will always be meaningful and I plan to be back with my love.
Came here just for the famous spaghetti. Delicious but definitely pricey at $24. I'd say this is probably a once in a while treat, but when in Vegas!

Had a really good dinner here. Probably should've gotten the pasta as everyone raved about it, but I got the black cod instead. The cod was really delicious though-cooked perfectly and had a nice flavor to it. To start we had the grilled octopus and burrata--all really good. We had the sommelier help us pick a wine and we had a red blend that was amazing.
Wow! The best Italian restaurant in Vegas for sure! Recommend getting at least a half pasta order to at least try the spaghetti with tomato basil dish.

My husband and I went to Scarpetta on our recent anniversary trip.  It was amazing!  We started out with the scallops appetizer and it was great, delicious and cooked perfectly.  My husband had the spaghetti and I had the stracci.  Both dishes were delicious.  We ended the night with a gingerbread pear crisp with cinnamon ice cream.  Everything had was great.  To make the night even better, the service was the best we could ask for.  Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable.  We will definitely be back when we go to Vegas again.

Long awaited dinner at Scarpetta. We make a version of their tomato basil pasta at home, so I wanted to try the real deal! 

Between two people, we ordered the duck / foie gras ravioli and the tomato basil pasta. The ravioli was delectable, and I ate my fair share even though I am not a huge fan of ravioli. The tomato basil pasta was good, but a bit disappointing given I expected to be a ton better than the one we make at home - it ended up being just ok. In fact, I think I might like my version of it better. 

What I loved though was the bread basket! So many different breads and dips to try. Yum! Got me pretty pull before our main pasta dishes came out.

Also, I had made a res on open table, but came early and did "walk in" instead. The hostess was still nice enough to sign me in for open table (without me asking) so that I could get my points. Other places have been known to cancel the reservation. So I thought that was really nice, and left me with a great impression of the restaurant.

Good, real good.  Had the short rib risotto and crab, shrimp, lobster pasta.  The waiter said that the portions would be really small, European sizes, and he recommended to order a couple of things if you were hungry.

Well our group was hungry...

But after ordering the short rib risotto and seafood pasta dish, I was beyond stuffed.  I would have been completely satisfied with ordering just the seafood pasta.

Talk about overselling, but I don't think he meant to do that...who knows!

It's expensive, but Vegas in general is expensive.  If you're looking for a great meal but don't mind spending the $$$ then you should check this place out.  While their menu isn't extremely extensive I think it has a little something for everyone.

Tried the Scarpetta in NYC and it was an easy 5stars. The Vegas version has a great location in the Cosmo, but the food and service didn't quite knock my socks off like the genuine article. Try the fritto misto and spaghetti with tomato and basil for a great taste of Italy, but if you want to experience what Scarpetta can really deliver you have to go to NYC!! Definitely worth a shot if you're rich and hungry for Italian lol..

Leave the superficial snooty attitude at the door because this Scarpetta is everything but that. You'd think you'd be dealing with staff that think they have better things to do than tend to your every whim but you get just the opposite. I was a little disappointed that we didn't get a table looking out to Bellagio's fountains but we got somewhat of a consolation prize and sat along the windowed wine cellar. 

Everyone rants and raves about their bread basket. I can tell you right now none of it is exaggerated. You get a wonderful medley of bread but the one that takes the cake is the stromboli bread. Packed with meat and cheese, you could easily fill up on them. Fight it kids. Fight the feeling! Eat one and just wait for your main entree to come out.

The roasted sea scallop was one of the largest scallops I've ever encountered. Plump, juicy and flavorful. It was served on steamed cauliflower with a splash of creamed cauliflower sauce. Both the scallop and cauliflower complimented each other perfectly. What kind of irked me was the menu described the appetizer as, "Roasted Sea Scallops." When you see the word "scallops" you assume you get more than one. Breaking news. You only get one. It's big nonetheless but remember that you only get one.

Scott Conant's twist on the spaghetti may seem simplistic at first glance but once you taste it you can tell there is a lot more that goes on behind the scenes. Unfortunately, in my opinion, the dish fell short. The noodles were well undercooked. I like my noodles undercooked but with every bite, I could taste the rawness of the noodles in the middle. The cheese and garlic olive oil is already infused in the pasta but it was overly cheesy. I thought it took away from the tomato and basil flavor. What I did enjoy was the bit of spiciness you get. It gave the spaghetti some life. 

Overall the service was nothing short of elegance but the food, with the exception of their bread basket, was painfully average.

*** Review is for Restaurant Week August 2014 Menu ***

Another restaurant that I've wanted to try now marked off the list.  The Restaurant Week menu is somewhat limited in selections, but what it has was very good.

I was seated next to the window overlooking the Bellagio and the fountains which added to the good atmosphere of the restaurant.  I was brought menus and an iced tea.  I had to ask for the Restaurant Week menu and it was brought.  I had already made my choice from the online menu but sometimes things change so I wanted to make sure.

I was brought a nice bread basket with sourdough and three other breads.  Accompanying it was a trio of bread toppers/dippers--mascarpone butter, caponata, and a citrus infused olive oil.  All three were good, but I could have eaten a plate of the caponata!  The mild citrus flavor in the olive oil made that my second choice.

For the starter, I ordered the creamy polenta with fricassee of truffled mushrooms.  The polenta was brought in a white dish and the server then spooned the onion and wild mushroom mixture over the polenta.  The dish was excellent.  I almost took some bread to wipe up any leftover polenta.

For the main course, I got the fennel dusted black cod on a bed of concentrated tomatoes and roasted fennel.  The fish was cooker perfectly and was moist and soft but with a crisp crust.  The crust had a mild anise flavor from the fennel.  The tomatoes beneath, concentrated by baking until some of the water was rendered which gave the tomato a prominent flavor.  The roasted fennel was tasty.

For dessert, there was no choice but that didn't matter.  The bomboloni was a wonderful way to end a good meal.  The bomboloni consisted of two filled with Nutella ganache and one was filled with a vanilla cream.  Alongside was a small scoop of banana ice cream resting on crushed chocolate shortbread pieces.  Excellent!

Service was good for the most part.  Two small things--when your posted opening time is 6 PM, open at 6.  Seating people almost 10 minutes late is not the best form especially if someone has a show they need to get to.  Also, I had two Sweet 'n Low wrappers on the table that neither a runner nor the server cleared even though both were by several times.  That's something you wouldn't expect from a restaurant of this class.  I'm sure Chef Conant would point this out if he were dining there.  I wish I didn't have to ask for the Restaurant Week menu.  It was a sheet of paper.  Bring it with your large books of wine and dinner menus.
Possibly the BEST restaurant in vegas!!!  Also the pasta and dessert entrée was fantastic and we'll worth the wait!!! I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves food!!  A+++++

This place offers a first class dining experience. My fave restaurant in sin city by far!

I come to this restaurant pretty much every time I go to vegas (that is pretty often) and have ordered many things off the menu. However, I keep going back to the duck and foie gras ravioli. OMG it is so freakin good! The paste of duck and fois gras in it is so smooth and silky within the ravioli pasta which is perfectly cooked al dente. Then comes the balsamic marsala sauce on top which is slightly sweet but not overpowering.

Went here for Vday, made a reservation. Beautiful atmosphere, romantic and delightful staff. From greeting to being served at our table, I couldn't have asked for more. The bread they give you to start off with is delicious, make sure you try the eggplant on top! Recommend getting any kind of pasta, it's their speciality (we had parm ravioli and sausage penne). Calamari here is a must for an app! Wine selection is huge, and it's nice to see how knowledgeable the servers are. Staff was polite, professional, and wouldn't let my water get half empty. New fave date night spot!

OMG, this place is great!! Love Love the ambiance, very modern chic, romantic and fancy place...the service was great! We were in Vegas for the Elton John concert and wanted to have pasta for dinner so we tried this place. We have no regrets, waiters were fantastic, first course was delicious (short ribs). I had a glass of sauvignon blanc...went perfectly with my pasta! As we finished our dinner, we asked if we could take a glass of wine to go, (as we were running late to the concert) and the waiter did not hesitate and brought us our drinks! Lovely service, would definitely try this place again.

Nothing like fresh pasta made in house! Came here with girlfriends and had top notch service. We all chose a buddy and split our apps/entrees, and Scarpetta was nice enough to halve our plates for us! 

Definitely recommend the truffled foie gras ravioli! 

The wine list was beautiful but appallingly marked up (300%). So we brought our own vino! ($35 corkage fee)
Simply AMAZING in details and taste! A must for the love of food.

Just wow. My new favorite place to dine in Vegas. Super swanky interior. The lights were dim and the crowd was pretty quiet when we went Friday night. Perfect after nursing a hangover all afternoon.

The basket of bread was thoroughly enjoyed by all at the table. It was accompanie breadd with marinated eggplant tapenade, evoo, and some whipped butter. Some had prosciutto and cheese marbled in them.

To start, the Kumamoto oysters were fresh and light. The cocktail sauce and mingionette were both great. We also had the grilled prawn and diver scallop with foie gras. They portioned it out for all of us so that was really nice. The vegetables in both appetizers were very well done. Everything paired nicely. We also had the uni, crab, tobiko capellini which was just ok. When you hear uni the expectation bar is set pretty high...

For my entree I had the famous spaghetti which I enjoyed. The fresh tomato and basil flavors were well balanced and the pasta wasn't too al dente which I like. My bf had the black cod. I thought it was ok, nothing special.

To end the meal, we had the bomboloni, recommended by our server. I'm glad my party didn't skip on dessert, because it was SO GOOD. The freshly fried Nutella filled donut ball was perfect paired with the light banana gelato. I'm typically not a huge fan of heavy fried desserts...but man oh man...with that gelato it was to die for.

Overall, food and service was excellent. Of course it cost a pretty penny, but what do you expect in Vegas? Definitely recommend Scarpetta if you are looking for some tasty eats.

Upscale Italian on the top floor of the Cosmo.  Only had an appetizer and pasta, so limited view, but think I'd go back for the full experience if I was looking for a high end (expensive) Italian option.  Pricier than the new spot over at the Cromwell, so might consider that first (see my review).

Jimmy the bartender is one of the best I have seen in the business. He knows his stuff, is personable and owns his bar; helpful and pointed in keeping it running with the staff.

Food was excellent, as was the drink.

a great pre-christmas dinner

started with:
tuna susci: caviar, granny smith apple and tuffle crema (just ok)
lardo wrapped prawns with chili oil and rosemary lentils (great)

moved onto:
capellini with ricci di mare (uni), dungeness crab & tobiko
pici pasta with  lobster, tarragon, almond & chili pesto 
tagliatelle with vegetables, true zabaglione & guancial 
all of which were so delicious 

capped off with:
three kinds of cheese served with seasonal compote, spiced nuts & honey comb

shared a bottle of rose 
a wonderful, wonderful night

p.s. our server was amazing.  his name is titus.  you can't beat a name like that.

Outstanding. The food and service were both exceptional. My girlfriend had the Kobe Flat Iron Steak and, I had the Short Rib Agnolotti (SRA). Her steak was great and my SRA was extraordinary. The SRA was crisped with brown butter and the texture/flavor was simply phenomenal. The bread at the start of the meal with the lemon infused olive oil and mascarpone butter was so good it almost ruined the deliciousness that followed.

I wholeheartedly recommend Scarpetta - for its food, service, and even decor. 

Bravo!

Service & quality at an all-time high. This place was an amazing experience. Our server was Titus, he was great! Went here for our anniversary, we had their spaghetti (perfectly al dente!), some other pasta dish (beef ravioli), tuna & avocado (best appetizer), their Berry Blast drink, and their lava cake with ice cream a la mode. 

Definitely an upscale restaurant so don't be surprised if the bill goes well over $100 between 2 but like any place, definitely an experience to just try at least once.
