Atmosphere is dim and fairly quiet with good background music, so it's very relaxing and calming while you enjoy your food and company. Will definitely come back.

My boyfriend and I had our 1st Valentines dinner here last night. Luis was our server and made sure we were well taken care of. Our table was right by the window and over looked the bellagio fountains. The decor was modern. The only complaint I had was the wine list didnt have any Moscato options! But highly recommend this restaurant!

As others have said here, if you're a Vegas tourist who thinks that the Olive Garden is good Italian, and you just want to treat your girlfriend while in Vegas -- this probably isn't the place for you. You're going to feel the portions are small, and you may not appreciate the things that make this restaurant extraordinary.

First, price -- be prepared. WIth a first and second course, without alcohol or dessert, it's easily $40 to $50 per person. I enjoyed a glass of wine and the famous spaghetti, and my meal was $46. The wine was over priced -- Scarpetta should compare its wine pricing per glass to other similar restaurants in Vegas, and I think they would find that they are a bit too high. $15-17 per glass is a bit much.

Second quality -- The bread basket alone was incredible. I swore that I would have only one piece, but I could not resist the hot stramboli with proscuitto and cheese, and the salted butter spread was amazing. The spaghetti also was extraordinary. It is a simple dish with tomato and basil only, but the flavors combined with the thick homemade pasta made the dish memorable. It is one of the few dishes I've had where I felt that the fresh and homemade nature of the pasta really made a difference.

Finally--the view. It is one of the best in Vegas, overlooking Bellagio and the Bellagio fountains. The dark woods, the view, the candle lit room -- a wonderful place for a romantic dinner. If I'd only had a date. :)

The restaurant overlooks the Belagio fountains, and there is a sophisticated and lovely ambiance. I had the pasta, because duh... it's an Italian restaurant known for pasta. It was delicious. A bit pricey, I probably won't come again because I'm not the biggest fan of Vegas in general, and I feel I can get everything I got here somewhere else for cheaper. There's nothing that really stood out as amazing and worth coming back for.

My friends were headed to Bacchanal for dinner and... I'm not really a buffet guy, so I walked over to Cosmo and ate here... at the bar.  I'd heard so much about that damn spaghetti dish that... I was excited to try it.  AWESOME bread basket.  It came with an eggplant thing (very descriptive, I know) that was f'ing delicious.  The spaghetti was good, but not "Best Thing I Ever Ate" good.  Hell... I make better spaghetti at home.  The noodles were a bit too thick for my taste (and undercooked).  Sauce was decent.

Would I go back?  Yeah, though I'd probably try something else from the menu.

Its killing me to give this place 3 stars. I really wanted to love this place. I watch chopped and have mad respect for Scott Conant. Every single foodie I know has recommended his very simple yet delicious spaghetti dish to me. So, we ordered it as an appetizer and BOY were we disappointed. The taste was wonderful but the pasta wasn't cooked right (Ironic I know since he dings people on this very issue). 

We told the server our pasta was a lil too al dente and he quickly corrected me that fresh pasta can't be al dente. I continued to clarify that its a big tough in the center and doesn't taste like its cooked all the way through. I completely understand that pasta should still have a touch bite to it but this was practically raw on the inside. Like I said before I REALLY wanted to love this dish and the server made me feel really stupid for not "getting" how pasta should be cooked. The restaurant took the spaghetti off our bill which was really nice but I wish they'd offer us a redo of the dish. 

Regardless, I haven't given up hope just yet. Every restaurant (even awesome ones) can have an OFF day. I do wish the server was a bit more understanding but what-ya gonna do right? Anyways, hope to try Scarpetta again and LOVE the spaghetti.

Was really impressed with the service and the food we had. Special mention to Chef Betty for the spectacular desserts. 

A must if you are in Vegas.
The pasta was soo good. The portions are small and food is expensive. Worth the experience to try it once. The bread they bring is you delicious. Amazing!

5 stars goes to the truffled mushroom with polenta
3 stars goes to the basil spaghetti
4 stars goes to the ambience
4 stars goes to the service
amazing food kind people Great environment and the owner is very cool. One of the best Italian restaurants in Calgary .

My friend had tried the Scarpetta in LA and had raved about it, so when she came to town we had to try the one at the Cosmopolitan Hotel. She was absolutely right (she usually is ;) and I have been back several times since first trying it with her. 

The restaurant is beautifully done .. very contemporary and chic .. and most every seat boasts a fabulous view of the Bellagio Fountain show. It's a great place for entertaining out-of-town guests for sure. One time we even had the privilege of being seated at the "Chefs" Table (which is in a private room) with a prime view of the Fountain Show and the entire kitchen. 

The food .. what can I say .. everything we've tried there is spectacular! My favorites are the Short Rib Agnolotti, which is simply melt-in-your mouth goodness and the Tagliatelle with Fall vegetables, truffle zabagalione & guanciale, which is just the right amount of truffle and is nice and light. I've also tried that famous Spaghetti .. it's good, very good, but not something that I would order again. Some of my dining partners have tried the Lobster Pasta, the Black Cod and the Duck Breast and the little bites I tried were good, but not necessarily items I would order. 

From the starters, my favorites are the Creamy Polenta, again with Truffle :) and the Braised Short Ribs of Beef. The Calamari and the Scallops are also good, but we keep going back to the Polenta. 

Dessert .. the most important part of the meal .. the second time we were there, we saw something at another table that looked delicious and right up our alley .. turns out it was not on their menu but from the neighboring Scott Conant eatery DOCG Enoteca. It's called the Salted Caramel Budino with Pretzel Toffee.  It is super creamy and  the perfect balance of both sweet and salty at the same time. We shared it the first go-around but now order one each whenever we go .. and that rarely happens. 

The service is impeccable, friendly knowledgeable servers and bussers who go the extra mile and have great personalities. The first time we were there my dining partner mentioned she was heading to DC the following weekend and our server came back with a list of fun things / places for her to do while she was there.

Excellent -- excellent .... what a great birthday dinner experience.  The portions were perfect and the service OUTSTANDING!  had a table near the window so could enjoy the fountains at Bellagio while waiting for the meal.

All the courses were terrific and tasty.  Beef rib pasta was perfect and the dessert really great!

My friends and I were seated with a view of the Bellagio fountains and it was great! Service was good. 

The 4 different types of bread were really good. I had to stop myself or I wouldn't have room to eat my main course. 

I had the duck and foie gras ravioli. The pasta was cooked perfect and the filling was rich but a little too salty for me. The wine reduction added a good balance to the pasta.

But the star is definitely the spaghetti. It had an amazing flavor with a slight bite that goes very well with the perfectly cooked pasta. 

The Amedei chocolate cake was delicious! It was a perfect balance of richness and decadence for a chocolate cake. 

My biggest disappointment was the soda drinks. I asked if they had other soda options besides fountain like Gus and Dry sodas but Scarpetta doesn't. I asked for a Ginger Ale. Without notification and with my assumption that fountain drinks are unlimited refills, I had 4 tiny glasses of mostly ice and maybe 4 oz of soda. My soda bill was $16. I had the waiter removed the extra charges.

Overall, it was a great restaurant with good food, service, and view. I'll try it again but look at other drink options.

Had a delicious tasting menu Sunday night - pre Valentine's.

Best seat in the house next to the window overlooking Bellagio fountains - terrific, attentive service.  

Delicious food - the executive chef, Dan Rossi worked with Alex for 14 years...therefore, good technique, now cooking Italian very nicely.

Vita Shanley's desserts are delicious.  naturally....

Masterful front of house....  plus Antonello's back in town.  

Great team of some of my most favorite professionals in a spectacularly lovely location making great food....  

Any questions?

The consensus among our group about Scarpetta was pretty meh. While some of the food was well done, we expected more given the price, and several of the dishes fell flat in terms of flavor. We were able to get a last-minute reservation late on a Saturday night, but from my experience, Vegas is built to handle so many people that reservations anywhere but the most exclusive restaurants aren't necessary. 

The restaurant looks out the side of the Cosmopolitan, and you get a decent but not amazing view of the side of the Bellagio fountains (the giant Bellagio sign gets in the way somewhat). The vibe is trendy upscale, and the prices reflected that. We couldn't find any wines under $100/bottle (but if a $4400 bottle is what you want, Scarpetta can accommodate you (and yes, that's not a typo)). Consulting the sommelier revealed only 2 such options, one of which was only a red blend. The few wines I recognized were priced about 3x retail, which isn't outrageous, but it's not great either. The cocktails were strong and priced typically for Vegas at ~$16 apiece. Mine was tasty but not anything special. My wife's made her sick later that evening, despite being the only thing she drank that night (she is sensitive to cheap alcohol or alcohol with lots of sugar).

The service was average. We were promptly seated, but when it came time to order drinks our server was nowhere to be found, and he often left the table too quickly to notice that some people were trying to get his attention. This improved as the night went on, and by the end of the meal, I didn't really consider the service to be a problem.  

The appetizers are not made to share, and you should prepare to drop some cash if you want to get anything for the table. $26 for 2 scallops is hefty with a group of 6. We settled on oysters, which were the only reasonable choice we could find. Luckily, a variety of freshly-baked breads (some with meat/broccoli and cheese) are served with a nice array of spreads/dips, and all of them were tasty. The bread will keep coming if you want it, and this could easily serve as your main appetizer.

The lobster pici pasta was creamy and decently flavorful, but the portion was small for the price, which seemed to be a theme for the evening. The only exception was the Tomahawk, which was enormous and impeccably prepared. I wish I had gotten it myself, as the few bites I had were hands-down better than the NY strip I had at a steakhouse the night before. One of my friends found the short rib agnolotti quite lacking, with not much flavor to speak of. My wife had the spaghetti with meatballs, which was rather plain, to be honest. The pasta had a nice texture, but I've had better sauce out of a jar and the meatballs were underseasoned and bland. 

For dessert, we settled on the chocolate cake, which was OK but not mindblowing. It was moderately rich, but I've had richer cakes elsewhere. Additionally, the cake itself was quite small, which I found disappointing. 

Overall, I wouldn't go back to Scarpetta. It was too overpriced for the small portion sizes and unpredictable quality of the food. It would do better at a slightly lower price point or with more impressive menu items. The menu descriptions all sound great, but the execution was lackluster too often for my liking.

wow this place was really good. As much as i love trying restaurants that they dont already have in LA (pretty new), id heard about Scarpetta when I was visiting NY so we decided to check it out. 

I had the Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli which ws delicious! a real winner! They were so flavorful that even John (notorious for his 5 minute meals)  was forced to eat slowwwly.

I also ordered the sea scallops- so juicy!  & the veal was alright, nothing to write home about.

I wish i had known to request the table with the views of the fountain! We were sitting by the wall, but that was ok.

I would definitely come back, this place is one of the better restaurants in lv at its price point.

Went here for an anniversary dinner. The service was great. Requested a table with a window view of the Belagio fountain. The food was amazing. The place itself was dark and pretty intimate, with top 40 music playing in the background. They had a book of available wines that was about 20 pages long, if you're into that stuff. I stayed with my old reliable Jack and coke.

Its a pretty pricey dinner. we had two entrees, two appetizers ($23 scallops which were amazing), and a few drinks by the glass. All of which rang up to about $150. 

Definitely a place I would recommend be prepared for a pricey bill however.

This place was amazing. We had a great view of the Strip and the food was beyond good. I think I ate more bread than I did pasta - they brought us citrus oil, mascarpone butter and bruschetta with freshly baked breads (complimentary) to start. Our meal was delicious, we started with a beet salad and scallops. For mains, my date had the short rib ravioli and I had a creamy vegetable tagliatelle. I love trying new places in Vegas but I'm super tempted to go here next time I visit since it's worth returning to.

The boys and I had a very good, relaxing meal here last Friday night.  Very nice restaurant in Cosmo restaurant row. Place is classy but not the least bit stuffy. Like everyone mentions, the bread selection is great. Mini Stromboli's w/ sides of marscapone, tomato/garlic...really good. Went through several of the pasta dishes for the table to begin. Duck and Foi Gras Ravioli, Risotto w/ short rib and Short Rib and bone marrow angolotti all good to excellent. Nothing better than home made pasta. Polenta w/ truffled mushrooms might have been even better that the pasta dishes...must try! I had the Veal Loin and Pork Belly. The loin was a bit dry, but flavorful..the Pork Belly was spectacular.  Friends had steak and halibut, all were very happy. Wine list is amazing..tons of Italian wines...pricey! Found a good bottle for around $100.  Overall, pretty reasonably priced meal for Vegas.  Good stuff Scott!

I cheated: I sampled a few of the Scarpetta dishes at the media opening of the Cosmo. So I knew their pasta was ace. But I wanted a full plate, and I finally got to indulge when some friends from out of town wanted to chow somewhere classy but fun, cool, not outrageously expensive, etc. 

Their spaghetti w/ tomato sauce accomplishes so much out of so little. Like Rao's, it's all about the ingredients. The pasta itself has such a consistency and texture that you want to chew each mouthful until it's too fine to chew anymore. I could have downed another plate (just not at $25).

Oh: The tuna "roll" appetizer is delish, too.

The pasta was cold and we were rushed out by our server who could't give a damn about us. I guess that's just Vegas, but I was dissapointed considering how excited we were to try this place. The bread basket was killer though.

We had the tasting menu with wine pairing.  A++++++++++!   I highly recommend ordering this if you want to try the different flavors here.  Be come here hungry too!  Don't fill yourself with the bread basket if you're going to order the tasting menu.

Every dish was great, and this Scarpetta location is as great as the Beverly Hills location inside the Montage BH.  

I'll definitely return here again.  This outstanding meal was the highlight of my trip!

For the $7 Happy Hour at the bar area from 5 to 7pm, it's satisfactory.  The food plates are tiny so expect minuscule portions.

We loved our meal at Scarpetta and the view of the Bellagio fountains was a bonus. My husband had a salad and pasta dish which were superb and I had the corn soup and a lobster pasta dish. Dessert was the chocolate cake with almond gelato. Fantastic!  Wonderful meal.

I don't eat Italian food too much so this was definitely a different experience.

It was my brother-in-laws 30th birthday and we came with a party of 16.
The server was knowledgeable on the menu. Recommended a few good dishes. Since we were a party of 16, I understand we probably took a little longer to order as we were all deciding on what to order, but the server did not rush us at all. Everything came out in a timely manner.

They had 3 different types of bread with three different spreads, butter, some eggplant tomato-y dip, and citrus herb olive oil (definitely the best one). Just that alone was yummy. Most of us skipped an appetizer as we weren't too hungry. One guest, however, did order their yellowtail. The few bites I was able to sneak were tasty! It had a citrus flavor to it, and if you know me, then you know I drown everything in lemon.
For the entrees, I ordered their lobster pasta dish. It was very pleasant. With higher end restaurants, dishes tend to be more salty or over seasoned, which I cannot stand, but it wasn't at all. The pasta was thick and cooked perfectly. I was also able to taste the foie gras. I've never had it before and did not like that at all. The guest who ordered it, however, usually loves foie gras and didn't like it either. She said it tasted too bland. She wanted to speak to someone about it, but the waiter hardly checked on us. I also tried the short rib and bone marrow pasta dish. It was delicious. I loved the fried garlic to give it more of a crunch.

For dessert, most of us ordered their Nutella dessert, which by the way, is superb! I grew up on Nutella, and it brought me back to my childhood. It was pretty much sugar donuts filled with warm Nutella with a side of banana ice cream. Yummmmmy. Another couple at the table shared their guava dessert. It was the perfect mixture of fruits, not too sweet either!

Now for the bill splitting. We all individually calculated how much was going on each card, which was extremely time consuming and inconvenient that we had to do it ourselves, since he "couldnt do it".  The bill altogether wasn't too bad, and they didn't charge gratuity for that large of a party, but for this nice of a restaurant, I'd expect atleast a little happy birthday for my brother in law, but oh well. The food was worth the price. I recommend it, but I'd have to try other places before I decide on coming back.

A solid Italian restaurant with exceptional service. My fiancé and I sat along the window and had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains and the Strip. Our waiter was highly attentive and very friendly. Our glasses never went empty, as there was always someone rounding the tables to refill our drinks. 

My fiancé had the spaghetti and I had the pici. Both were very flavorful and the portions were just right. 

Overall a great experience. I definitely recommend this place for romantic dates!

We were very excited to try this restaurant since it was our first time staying at the Cosmo, and it was recommended by the concierge. He even called and booked the reservation for us. We even got all dressed up for the occasion to have a romantic dinner together. 

After being seated, it took 20 minutes for the waiter to even come over. He did not greet us, introduce himself, or even offer recommendations. He just asked us what we wanted then left. 

I ordered the fish and my boyfriend ordered steak. He was pleased with the temperature of his steak, but my fish was completely raw. I had to wait another 15 minutes for my meal to be cooked while my boyfriend finished his. 

When it was all said and done, it was a $200 meal for substandard food and service. I even told the manager how displeased I was and all he said was to contact a different manager and come back and try them again. 

I work for a review site so I am willing to speak with someone on my concerns before posting a negative review online, but it was clear they get enough business and do not care how they treat guests of the hotel. Sad because with so many options in Vegas, I will be sure to let friends and colleagues who visit the Cosmo to definitely go to a different restaurant.

I almost filled myself up with their pepperoni and cheese bread.  Simply amazing.  Since it's complimentary, it's easy to go crazy on them without ordering an entree.  But who would be foolish enough to do that?

The service here is what you would expect of a nice fancy restaurant.  There's never a moment where my water was empty.  The waiters will give you a great recommendation for wines to pair with your meals.  Since you're already at a nice restaurant, you might as well have some wine with your meal.  If you're not an alcoholic, now is the time to start!
Celebrated my 5th anniversary. They set me up with the best table in the house. Food was great. Wine recommendations were amazing

I'm SO happy to write this review. My husband and I had an incredible dinner at Scarpetta to celebrate our one year anniversary, this past September. The food was perfect - we had the creamy polenta with truffle mushrooms (my favorite dish, by far. Ever. In my whole life), spaghetti (classic and wonderful - I've never had fresh pasta before, and I was in heaven!) and I think the other dish we had was a ravioli of some kind (I can't be sure, because I was in a complete state of oblivion from my polenta and spaghetti). Either way, it was ALL fabulous.

Besides the incredible food, the service was fantastic. Our server was so sweet and helpful. The view was amazing. AND, at the end of the night - because I'd told my server about how much I loved head chef/owner Scott Conant (my favorite Food Network guy/Chopped judge!) - he had Scott himself come over to our table to take a picture with us (and he was so great!).

It was the BEST night :) Thank you to Scott Conant and Scarpetta for a wonderful dining experience.

We ate here because we thought the restaurant was the same people that sold the Scarpetta vodka sauce on Amazon. Our waiter didn't think that it was their chef that sold them so we were a bit disappointed but we got the spaghetti and the sauce was very similar! Our waiter was nice and took our picture for us with the view of the Bellagio but he mistook our order and we got spinach instead of broccoli. We still got charged and did not get our broccoli which was a bit sad . However, the truffle spinach was AMAZING and the truffle mushroom polenta was our favorite. The beers were okay and the free bread assortment and spreads were a great plus! Overall, very expensive and some great dishes.

This is an amazing restaurant that provides great food and service.  We were celebrating our friend's wedding and let them know when we booked the reservation.  We assumed we would get a nice booth but the server surprised us and took us to a private dining room that had a clear view to the kitchen and over looked the Bellagio fountains.

Jennie was our waitress and she did a great job as well as the waiter helping her (I think his name was Rod or Rodolfo).  Jennie walked us through the menu and provided recommendations and was conscious of the vegetarians in our group.  Everything we ordered was great and the ambiance just added to the experience.

This restaurant is on the pricey side but a definite must for any special occasion or splurge.

What a disappointment. Food was overpriced for the portion size, not cooked properly (pasta undercooked and lobster over seasoned), and just lacked any creativity. Service was non existent. It took 15 minutes to get a soda and 20 to get bread. 

Try something else in cosmopolitan before this place.

My boyfriend and I came to dine here for our 5 year Anniversary, the food was very good but the service was not what I was expecting given that it is considered a fine dining restaurant. The waiter seemed to busy with his older guests and barley checked on our table. It was our first time going to the restaurant and the waiter did not explain the menu at all, he just dropped off the menus and then came back around later and asked if we were ready to order. When the dessert came I was expecting something written on it saying Happy Anniversary, but unfortunately there was nothing written on our plate. It was pretty disappointing, it was our 5 years and we were hoping to celebrate it at a nice place together. My boyfriend and I are younger than the clientele that was their, so maybe that was why the server did not pay attention to our table, but if that is the case they should really reconsider who they are hiring to work for their restaurant. The hostess and busser were very nice and friendlier than our server.

I am eager to go back to this restaurant and be in "heaven" again. Have you tried its Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli yet? It is beyond delicious! Given CA has banned Foie Gras, it makes the Las Vegas location much more appealing than the Beverly Hills one (although please comment on this post if you are certain that the Beverly Hills location still can serve the same dish!). 

The restaurant is inside Cosmopolitan hotel, so you can certainly dine your way to delish land and continue the party at Marquees club. As a cherry on top, service at the Las Vegas Scarpetta is amazing as well. I highly recommend!

What a great spot for yummy Italian food. Scarpetta has a very romantic feeling and the large windows give you a great view of the fountain at the Bellagio. 

Whenever possible, I order homemade pasta and last night was no exception. I had the Al Ceppo, which has house-made sausage, porcini, and lots salty olives. So good!! My husband had the veal Chop Parmigiano, and it was outstanding! The bone-in chop was tender and crispy with just the right amount of sauce and buratta.  We were too full for dessert, but the selection looked great. 

If you're looking for a romantic date spot, I would highly recommend Scarpetta.

This place was fantastic! Here's the breakdown:
Ambiance- the decor was very modern, there were some very cool light fixtures above the bar and in the bar seating area. My only issue would be that the tables were VERY CLOSE together- it made it difficult to navigate the restaurant to get to the bathroom without getting in the way of the waiters trying to work. 
Service- A+ from start to finish. We did not see an open reservation on OpenTable so we called  and the maitre d' was so wonderful and gracious and was able to fit us in! We got a great table by the window and our waiter was just great. He took us through the menu, made great suggestions and really made us feel taken care of. 
Food- overall very good. For starters my fiance and I split the diver scallops (a small portion but we were not very hungry). The scallop was cooked perfectly, and the marcona almonds really added a delicious flavor and crunch. My only complaint would be the lack of flavor from the golden raisins that the menu said were in the dish. I was hoping for that sweet flavor but I never tasted it. For dinner we got the Pici and the Short Rib Agnolotti. These were both great! The Pici was spicy (which I enjoyed but my fiance thought was a little too much), and the Short Rib Agnolotti was phenomenal- possibly one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had! For dessert we had the coconut panna cotta which was actually quite tasty- not something I would have normally ordered but I was pleasantly surprised -a good mix of flavors and very refreshing!
Overall- I would absolutely go here again and I have already recommended this restaurant to two other friends that are planning upcoming trip to Vegas!

Prime location, delicious food, and great service...our meal at Scarpetta was definitely one of the highlights of our Vegas trip. There were a few missteps on our food adventure, but not nearly discouraging enough to detract from the overall experience. 

We made reservations for 6:30 on Thursday night, which seemed to be the latest time to arrive and get one of the tables overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We got the last one available. The only issue with the view is that there is a giant metal bar running exactly eye level across the window, so you have to pop your head up like a little meercat just to get a glimpse of the fountains. Oh well.

We ordered the tasting menu and told the waiter that we'd like a bottle of white wine, somewhere in the semi-sweet to semi dry range, full-to-medium bodied, in the $50-60 range. The waiter brought us two options to taste, and we went with a delicious riesling. The bread course came with a lovely tray of marscapone cheese whipped butter, lemon infused olive oil, and a delicious fresh tomato spread. We didn't eat too much, because we knew we had seven courses of awesome heading our way:

1) The first course was yellowtail and tuna sushi. The yellowtail was served with thin pink rock salt wafers that complemented the fish perfectly. The tuna was rolled around marinated vegetables and served with preserved mushrooms. Everything was light, fresh, and flavorful. An excellent way to start a meal. A crispy fritto misto came on the side - the tempura fried herbs and lemon were a delicious addition to the standard tempura fare - shrimp...veggies...etc.

2) The second course was a sea scallop served on top of cauliflower, with a cauliflower puree, chili oil, and a salad with capers on top. - The capers were a bit salty for my liking, so I pulled them off, and the cauliflower with the cauliflower puree was a little redundant, but oh. my. goodness. That scallop was the best I've ever had. The crust was perfectly carmelized, and the scallop inside was tender and melted in your mouth. The small trace of heat from the chili oil added an unexpected twist to the dish and really took it to another level. 

3) The chef added in course number three - creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms. My biggest complaint here is that I can never eat anyone else's polenta again. Amazing doesn't even begin to describe it. My friend and I dove into this lake of creamy, buttery, savory goodness with reckless abandon, knowing full well that we were completely spoiling our appetite for the four remaining courses. If nobody had been watching, I would have licked the bowl. We took a little break before moving on in the meal.

4) The pasta course was both a super high and super low note in the meal. After seeing Scott Conant revered as the King of Spaghetti on television time after time, we finally got to see what all the fuss was about. The simple spaghetti dish was amazing. I have never had pasta so perfectly al dente. There was a bite to it that other pastas lack, almost to the point where you feel like it will stick in your teeth, but it doesn't. It was served with a fresh tomato basil sauce that was so perfect, it didn't need any fancy infused oils or architechtural garnishes. It was just pasta perfection. 
HOWEVER, the short ribs angnolotti with brown butter horseradish sauce was just awful. The horseradish sauce blew away every other flavor on the plate, and it wound up tasting like a big plate of mustard. This is the awkward thing about not liking a dish in a tasting course - we were only halfway through the meal and we'd had such good courses previously, that we felt a little awkward sending it back...so we just moved forward with the meal.

5) The next course was a black cod with concentrated tomato sauce and carmelized fennel. Perfect crispy skin, rich, flavorful sauce, and crunchy fresh veggies - definitely a hit.

6) Spiced duck breast with endive, cippolini onions, and a preserved orange - this dish was ingenious. The duck, endive, and onion were perfectly cooked, but it was the addition of the super thin slice of sweet preserved orange that really made the dish. 

7) Dessert - simply outstanding - a chocolate lava cake on a streak of carmel sauce with toasted almond gelato on a bed of chocolate cookie crumbs, with a delicate twirl of chocolate as a garnish. 

The only problem with this meal is that it was so delicious, there was no way you could leave anything on your plate. My friend and I polished off every dish - which left us feeling so full that we barely made it out of the restaurant.

If you decide to attempt this delicious seven course food adventure - open your wallets wide - food, drinks, and tip set us back $350...but it was well worth it.
Six of us and the most exciting dish was for my vegan friend who ordered the risotto. Everything else was just okay.

Very unique place. The food is good and they have a great wine selection with good service. If i have any complaints, it is a bit too expensive and it is noisy. The pasta is the best selection. Prepared aldente just the way I prefer my pasta. I had a lobster and pasta and it was very tasty. The sauce was over the top good. Make a reservation in advance as it is not easy to get into this place.

My favorite Italian spot in Vegas! If you love seafood, try the Black Tagliolini with sea urchin, Dungeness crab & flying fish roe. For dessert, my favorite is the coconut panna cotta in guava soup. It's very light and perfect tart and sweet combination.

Update: Tried their tasting menu for the first time. It didn't disappoint! It was a lot of food though, felt stuffed and couldn't finish the dessert. We had already switched it from a chocolate cake to the panna cotta. The pasta was perfectly al dente, but the portion size was slightly too big for a tasting menu.

Wow!  First time to a Scott Conant restaurant on 12.8.16. Walked in ready for the signature spaghetti and excited for the bread based on the reviews. Other guests wanted the tasting menu, sure!

I'm super glad we went with this. We got to try so many amazing dishes. I admit I couldn't move after dinner, and that doesn't happen often, but it was well worth it!!!  Others got the wine pairing and thought it was awesome. 

1. Start with the bread. Maybe the best bread basket I've had.  The salami and cheese bread was delicious. I could've just had that for my meal. 
2. Duo of yellowtail and tuna. Raw fish is not my favorite but I cleared the plate. This was delish. There was so much flavor. It was light and clean and tasty.  Yellowtail had pocketed red onion.  Tuna had avocado crema, pickled peppers, Granny Smith apples, and crispy quinoa. 
3. Fritto. I do wanted to try this and we got a bonus dish!  It was delicious. There was even lightly fried lemons with the veggies and seafood. 
4. The diver scallops was tender and delish with the mushrooms and blood orange. 
5. The polenta was another off menu bonus. So many people loved this, so happy I got to try it. Mixed with truffles, it was good. 
6. Spaghetti. Tomato & basil. I ate it all. It was as good as I hoped. 
7. Short rib agnolotti. A star. Very tender short rib. Very rich.  Brown butter. Horseradish. Toasted breadcrumbs. 
8. Fennel dusted black cod. I ate it all. Asparagus. Mushroom. Enough said. 
9. Spiced duck breast. I don't eat a lot of duck but this was good. 
10. We got the coconut soufflé instead of the chocolate cake. It was a late change and the soufflé was very liquid. Not sure if this is normal or not. It was good but I prefer it more cakey. Lemongrass gelato was good too. Note they did up charge for this.  $5 when on menu it's $4 more.

My fav were the duo of yellowtail and tuna, spaghetti, fritto, and the bread basket!!!

Service was good. 

Wow. There was a view of the Bellagio fountains throughout dinner. That was amazing too!

I'm full just thinking about this meal. Highly recommend!

This is at the top of my list for foods that u must try while in Las Vegas. I found this place through yelp and I called to make a reservation. From the other reviewers suggestions, I asked for a table with a view of the Bellagio Fountain light show. The food here was excellent. I wished I could have eaten here a few more times before I left Las Vegas. The service here was excellent. I was with 2 friends and I have to say all of the food here was amazing. Even the bread that they brought out was delicious.

I have to say, our experience at Scarpetta was one of the best fine dining experiences that I've had in Vegas yet, and I've been to a good amount of restaurants on the Strip!

I had made a reservation for Sunday night at 6:30pm through Open Table, but had cancelled it because we weren't quite sure where we wanted to eat for sure yet. I saw that there were still a few time slots for around 6pm left on Open Table, so I didn't bother to make another appointment when we decided to just go there. 

We showed up around 6:15pm and asked to be seated in the dining room. The hostess told us that all the tables are booked and that we need a reservation. I kindly told her that I had a reservation, but cancelled it because I saw that there were still many time slots left. She just looked at me and started walking us to a table. (This was kind of strange haha).

The bread that was given to start was amazing. There were 5 different kinds of bread and 3 sauces: citrus olive oil, eggplant tapenade and mascarpone cheese butter. I had to get two orders of the eggplant tapenade...so good.

Our server Roberto was extremely helpful with helping us looking over the menu and to order. 

For our appetizer we ordered the Mediterranean Octopus which was very tender. For our pasta we ordered the famous Tomato and Basil Spaghetti. It was cooked perfectly al dente. I would have to say it was the best spaghetti that I've ever had. I'm pretty much drooling thinking about it right now..

For our entrees I ordered the Fennel Dusted Black Cod and my boyfriend ordered the Filet Mignon. He had ordered medium rare, but they served it to him as medium well. I told him to tell our one of the employees (Julio) to send it back. Julio was very accommodating and made sure that my boyfriend received the second steak cooked perfectly the way he wanted. 

Roberto even included a Coconut Panna Cotta on the house for dessert because of their mistake with the steak. It was so good!!

I just wanted to give a big shout out to Roberto and Julio for making our first time experience at Scarpetta amazing, even if we had to send back my boyfriend's steak. The Tomato Basil Spaghetti was the highlight dish of the night. We will surely return to Scarpetta whenever we are in Vegas again!

Loved the wine list. 
Loved the polenta. 
Loved the duck. 
Loved the service. 
Great restaurant.

Dinner on Saturday evening @ 6pm.

Excellent service from every person we interacted with at the restaurant.  The hostesses were quick to help us and friendly. Our server Garvin did an above average job describing dishes and being attentive without being intrusive. Even the guy filling our water and clearing our plates was amiable and professional!

Ordered the short rib ravioli which was AMAZING. Even better than I had imagined - and I day dream about pasta. We will be back!!

So everyone has said a lot about the bread basket already but I am still thinking about the salami bread with the eggplant spread..it was so good & also very filling!

My friend and I split the farmer's market salad and the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti. The agnolotti was a little oily and had a wasabi aftertaste (we were later told it was horseradish) that was a little weird. The texture of it was good but didn't make up for the flavor. I liked the farmer's market salad - it was crisp and crunchy and the hazelnuts were a really nice touch. Also, I asked for warm water and was given a whole teapot of it, which was great. 

One of the girls didn't like her meal and when we told the server, he took it off our bill, no questions asked. That was really nice of him and even though one of our side dishes never got sent to the table, the amount of food we ordered turned out to be just right. 

Not too pricey, but not sure if I would come back. It was good but not great.

One word: delish!!! Although I feel their customer service is not up to par. Since one is paying big bucks, one should expect great service. On yelp the restaurant indicated it closes at 11pm; when I called the person on the phone (female) stated they'll close at 10:30 if it's slow.... Ahh... This is Vegas

Absolutely incredible. I had the tuna and avocado appetizer and it was perfect- the tuna had a ton of flavor, the avocado was fresh and had a hint of lime and salt. For the main dish I kept it simple and ordered the spaghetti (something I never order in restaurants). The pasta was cooked al dente, the sauce was PERFECT and clung perfectly to the noodles, and the basil tasted like it was just picked.

Also, the view was absolutely amazing. We got a table right next to the window and overlooked our hotel (the Bellagio), the fountains, and part of the strip. The decor and atmosphere of the restaurant was also intimate and gorgeous. My friends and I didn't have to shout to hear each other.

Overall, amazing meal.

Scarpetta never disappoints!  Above and beyond friendly service and amazing food.  We started with the scallops.  They were roasted with just the amount of crust.  Next was were the braised shorts ribs - tender and so much flavor!  The creamy polenta with mushrooms - OMG!  I so want to lick my plate!  I had the Duck and Foie Gras ravioli - rich and smooth and yummy!  My GF had the lobster pasta.  The pasta was perfect with a delicious spicy sauce (I know because I "helped" my friend out when she stepped out!)  For dessert, we shared the coconut panna cotta.  It was a sprint, our spoons flying.  Next time, we will get our own!

By far, our best meal this trip to Vegas!

Views and Service were great.  We had the tasting menu, which was outstanding.  Lots of different tastes and textures - all memorable.

We also had the wine pairing with the tasting menu.  Wine pairing was good, considering the price point ($45 for the pairing), but we would have gladly paid more for a premium wine pairing option.

Outstanding evening.  Don't be in a rush - I wouldn't go here pre-theater.  Dinner took about 2 1/2 hours - we enjoyed every minute.
Excellent service, food, and ambience. One of the best in Vegas. An all around A+ restaurant. Highly recommend!!! Ask to get a window view--well worth the wait.

Dined with two others.  It is DARK.  Not romantic, just dark. Got a headache from everyone around us using their cell phones to see their menus, the food, anything!!  The bread was ok - nothing to rave about.  When my husband requested an additional slice of sourdough to have with his salad, the bread they brought was cold, like fridge cold.  For starters we had oysters, buratta salad and polenta. Hands down polenta wins, exceedingly rich so we split it three ways!   Other apps ok. Main dishes short rib agnolotti, spaghetti with meatballs and the tomato basil spaghetti. Short ribs were ok, meatballs good and the plain spaghetti meh - overwhelming tomato with not even a hint of basil. Deserts Amedei chocolate cake, Nutella & vanilla bomboloni and mascarpone cheesecake. Best course of the night - only the chocolate cake was disappointing. We had lovely wine from a B+ list and espresso to end. 

Our reservation was at 6 and it was made clear to us that we would not be seated until 6 pm. Front desk staff could use a customer service skills session. At about 7 pm, I needed to visit the restroom.  The single stall restroom was horrible. Trash cans overflowing, floor littered with water, paper, etc.  Hard to believe it could get in that condition in an hour?!? We have visited Vegas every year at least once for the last 20+ years. Lots of dinners in those years - this wasn't the worst but certainly not the best.

Been to both the one in Beverly Hills and Las Vegas now.

I feel that the Beverly Hills Scarpetta is better tasting that the one in Las Vegas; however, the service at Las Vegas was better than that which I received in Beverly Hills.

Food: Three stars
Service: Two stars
Decor and ambiance: Four stars

Went to Scarpetta with a group of 9 for the slow period between Christmas and New Year's.  The reservations were easy to come by as it was a Monday night and the place was not too busy.

The food was solid.  Started with the yellowtail appetizer that was simple and refreshing.  The secondi was the short rib agnolotti.  This was by far the best dish of the night.  Plentiful, tasty and the texture was superb.  The primi was the veal chop which was a good size portion but the quality left a little to be desired.

The service was off for a slow night.  They didn't have the scotch that the wife ordered so they default brought Macallan 12 saying that it tasted like the one we had ordered.  Also, my agnolotti came way after the others were served, they had forgotten it, but they comped the dish, so I guess that was ok.  There was just some general confusion here and there about who ordered what.

All in all, it was ok.  Over-priced for what it is.

Calgary's hidden gem is located in the heart of Inglewood along the main strip. The taste of Italy comes out at this cozy and genuine Italian restaurant. 

The Caprese Salad is an awesome starter.... I have never had a Caprese salad with so much fresh flavour with their amazing Buffalo Mozzarella flown in directly from Italy. 
They are known for their terrific pizzas which are raved about from everyone I talk to... Still need to try! 

We had the chefs specialty where the owner Rocoo catered a unique and off the menu dinner to celebrate our anniversary. Definitely won't forget the evening with the perfect wines to complement each course of the meal. 

Hands down the best dinner experience in Calgary with great service, top notch flavours from the chef and a personal touch from the owners. Which shows how much effort and care they put into every experience. 

Try it out. They have live entertainment on the weekends and an outdoor patio in the summer.

THE BEST MEAL IN LAS VEGAS. The beau is a Italian food snob and he is so picky about Italian food since he lived there for six months previously.  The bread basket is wonderful and so full of options. We could have gotten full just eating that. We had the hamachi which was so fresh and melted in your mouth.  The highlight of the meal was the DUCK AND FOIE GRAS RAVIOLI. Yes I just said that, and it was the most beautiful pasta I've had in my life. The pasta was so fresh and light, cooked perfectly. The filling was creamy and decadent. I want to go back just for that.  The service was impeccable as well.

The spaghetti is amazing. I almost ordered another. The veal parmigiana was so delicious. The service was amazing and so was the view looking over the bellagio fountain.

Well I could not wait to get back to have the spaghetti..so delicious!! Thank you so much again!

Excellent service (Luis) 5, ambiance 5 and food 4.  They sat us exactly at the time of reservation.  They gave us an excellent table overlooking the Bellagio fountain. The waiter split our meal - very thoughtful. There were two items that we ordered that really wasn't that great 1- carpaccio looks delicious the flavors didn't blend that well. Strawberry Soufflé had great flavor but the sugar crystals was not good. 

The bread is to die for.  The pasta was amazing. Overall very good!!

This is the best Italian restaurant I've been to so far! During the July 4th holiday, after trying so many restaurants, we were craving for something Italian. Being staying in Cosmo gives us easy access to this place. We're glad we did pay a visit! We had an early dinner so we were able to sit without having a reservation during a holiday long weekend. 

Their PRIME BEEF CARPACCIO* was mind-blowing! The best I've ever had! The beef was sliced so thin and it's so tender! It's cooked just right! When it's put together with the greens and cheese,, that's what you came to Vegas for! We really wanted to get a second order of this but we were too full after finishing all dishes! 

I didn't know broccoli can taste so good until I had GNOCCHETTI SARDI.... The way they did it made it such a good combination of broccoli and pasta! Best pasta ever! Very tasty, creamy but not greasy or tasting too heavy! 

Their STRAWBERRY SOUFFLE was another sweet surprise! We were a bit hesitated about getting this one as we thought it's some gelato on it. But we didn't regret after we got it! It's not too sweet but just the right amount of sweetness. The souffle is so soft and puffy. Love it! Will definitely go back again next time we in Vegas!
Extreemly small portions!! Expensive. Not that good. Dont come here if you are hungry bc you will have to eat 3 bread basketts to satisfy your hunger!!

WOW! What more can you want from a Las Vegas experience. Such a great experience that I actually ate here three times  Amazing service, I mean just stellar, the staff was polite and attentive. 

They accommodated a large party of 12 for us in a private room with just an hour notice. 

Onto the food: 

The mushroom polenta was divine. I had it two nights in a row. Creamy rich yet not too heavy, not overly salted, and a great mushroom to sauce to polenta ratio. Honestly one of the best I've ever side dishes I've ever had.

The pasta... Where can you go wrong here, I tried three of the pastas, squid ink pasta with roe and seaweed was amazing. The combination of the three textures the unctuous earthiness mmmm!
A simple pasta with marinara, handmade of course the sauce was buttery sweet lightly salted, and lastly my absolute favorite... 

The short rib stuffed pasta. I seriously don't have words to describe this. It had a nice crunchy crumble on top, some fancy reduction drizzled evenly over every piece. Just delicious. Bite sized, al dente, at first I thought the portion was small at first sight but wow it was so filling.

On my next visit I went with a friend:

Apps included the Yellow tail crudo with a unique and delicious infused oil I believe. 

The seafood fritto Misto which was good, but I will say it's the only thing I wouldn't get again. Fried lobster, calamari and crab I believe. It was good but too much and with everything else, I didn't want to waste any stomach space. 

The Watermelon burrata salad ... Again speechless, I mean did they grow the watermelon here? It was so fresh, juicy, crisp, the tomatoes were clearly hand picked for us lol. It was just so fresh and refreshing a great palette cleanser, and duh burrata makes everything better. 

Entree: We split a bone in ribeye. They even chopped it up nicely into two portions, more than enough to share. Medium rare cooked to perfection, I got a photo of this one, you can tell it's high quality, rested well, and extremely juicy. 

Paired with a wine, selected by the manager, it was just a great combination. They know their stuff!

No room for dessert.

On my third visit (yes all in one trip) 

I came for the black cod, tuna "susci" and dessert. 

I put this black cod dish up there with Nobu! It was that good. I also felt dumb not realizing it was (sushi) a fun play on words ... (Whoops) another delicious raw appetizer. 

The black cod had a caramelized onion fennel tomato topping. Cooked to perfection, flaky, buttery mmmm. I am bias as this is my favorite fish to eat. 

Onto dessert: I really really wanted the chocolate banana cake but ... I'm allergic to bananas so that was a no go but everyone around me had ordered it and it was highly recommended. 

I went with the Panna cotta, and I'm not typically a huge fan of Panna cotta due to my dislike for the texture, but man they nailed this one as well. Sweet but not toothache sweet. Smooth, dense ish. You gotta try it. Also it has a citrus pineapple caramelized fruit topping I believe. I forgot to get a photo of this one. 

Lastly the decor: 

The place is dark, classy, upscale, but they have a cool bar, and little private bar tables, great for any occasion honestly. The wine room had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains, and the main dining room was so comfortable, I didn't want to get up from the round booth. 

All in all 5 stars, I'd eat here every day if I could. Many thanks to the staff, barterders, management Etc. 

See you next time !!!

I was here for a group dinner and though I am a vegetarian, the chef was able to make a very delicious lentil plate and good pasta dish. I saw the others in the group enjoy their dishes and I have been to Scarpetta in NYC so I knew this Scarpetta wont disappoint me and it surely did not.

Had high hopes. I ate at the bar and service was competent, but cold. I ordered a glass of Pinot noir that was delicious. I also ordered the yellowtail which was bland and overpriced, though the fish was really fresh. For my entree I had the veal ragu with fettuccine. It was ok, but something I could have made better at home. Plus, it was overpriced for what it was. The best part of the meal was the bread basket that contained a Stromboli with a side of marscapone, caponata and olive oil.

Overall, it's fine, but there are better Italian places in Vegas.

Great service, great food. Our server went out of his way and asked the chef to prepare our meal as per our request. That was really nice of the chef. Food was amazing and there is not much to say. Great food great service.
Good service. Thought the food was good but wasn't blown away by our meal. Had the ribeye cut. Didn't see many wine bottles below $170.

Love the food, the service and everything about this place. The servers and staff were great and the wine awesome...  Try to book early to get the window seats which are facing the Bellagio fountains.

Scarpetta is awesome.  The food, the service, the location...I loved all of it.  Yes, it is over-priced, but all Vegas restaurants are over-priced, so in my mind it's all relative.  I go into it from the beginning expecting to pay more, but I also expect the restaurant to hold up its end of the bargain and give me something that doesn't make me regret spending $100 a person.  Scarpetta definitely holds up its end of the bargain here, and now that I've addressed the price issue, I can write about the more interesting things!

We tried the short ribs for appetizer and spaghetti and branzino for entrees.  The short ribs were melt-in-your-mouth juicy good.  I've never had freshly made spaghetti before, and it was amazing...now I can confidently say that I really understand al dente!  The branzino, which I typically find simply prepared in other Italian restaurants, had a very creative and delicious preparation.  It came as two filets (with crispy skin!) on top of a hodge-podge of seafood (baby shrimp and mussels) with some kind of seafood jus that is added at the table (interesting pink color, but very nice seafood flavor).  The mascarpone butter and citrus olive oil that accompanies the bread is delicious!  

I tried a couple of cocktails, and the one that stands out the most to me was the Gallardo.  I was hesitant to try it because it included apple juice (which I don't enjoy), but the waiter assured me it didn't taste too apple-juicy and he was right!  It was flavored mostly by the basil and was so aromatic and fresh...perfect accompaniment to spaghetti!

I think the most amazing part of the meal was the strawberry souffle.  I want to go back to Vegas just to have it again.  I can't even describe it.  Just get it and try different bites with the ice cream, rhubarb and the other sweet sauce it comes with...pure eating pleasure sensations.  We also had the bomboloni, which were very good, but at the end of the day just still  felt like donuts and weren't as special as some of the other items I tried.

As mentioned by many other reviewers here, the view over the Bellagio fountain is pretty sweet, and it is just so lovely right around sunset.  The interior ambiance of the restaurant is classy and fun.

On a side note, I am totally addicted to the show Chopped and love Scott Conant and was so happy his restaurant did not disappoint :)

Picture a classy Italian restaurant with the Bellagio Fountain water show in the background and you've got one heck of an intimate dinner experience. 

I searched high and low for the top restaurants on the Strip and Scarpetta came to mind because of it's location and well known cuisine. With the dimly lit atmosphere and fine modern decor, I had a good hunch this would be the perfect place to share a late night dinner. 

We came without a reservation but was immediately seated in the main dining area. The server immediately placed our menus and brought out our waters. He returned with a bread basket filled with a variety of freshly baked breads and a side of olive oil, eggplant tapenade, and cheese. Each bite was intoxicating and we had to forcibly stop to avoid getting too full. 

I dared to be adventurous and ordered a Billionaire $16 (homage to homie Bobby Axelrod from "Billions") and thoroughly enjoyed this bourbon based cocktail with a touch of pomegranate and absinthe. This is worth coming back to at least sip at the bar to pregame or as a nightcap. My guest ordered an Eagle Rare 10 Year ($18) in addition to our meal. 

We love to share our dishes and decided to exclusively order two seafood plates:

- Mediterranean Octopus ($21) olive oil poached potato, tonatto sauce & salsa verde
- Fennel Dusted Black Cod ($35) asparagus, hedgehog mushroom 

The grilled single tentacle of the octopus was cooked perfectly without the excess chew or toughness. The lightly seasoned potatoes matched well with the texture of the octopus. This is a must order for any seafood fans. We scrambled to see who would get the last bite and I bet you can imagine who got it. 

The server was kind enough to split our black cod order for each of us to enjoy. The acidity of the tomatoes worked nicely to cut the velvety richness of the cod. With a mix of the mushrooms and sauce, the dish became ordinary to extraordinary. 

Dessert was left to another venue but would like another opportunity to make room on a future visit. 

Our server took care of us from start to finish. At the end, we felt slightly rushed because we were one of the last diners but overall, felt acknowledged throughout our meal. 

If you're looking for an upscale meal with finesse, attentive service and a gorgeous view, consider making an OpenTable reservation here. Every bite and moment from the dinner was memorable. For now, my restaurant experience at The Cosmopolitan (STK, Rose Rabbit Lie and now Scarpetta) have been very positive and I can not wait to try the rest of their eateries.

We were starving when our flight landed in Vegas. Luckily, they were flexible on our arrival time with the reservation, but I guess it wasn't totally full anyway even though it was a Friday night. 

The warm  bread basket was a nice way to start: 
- Broccoli strombili: broccoli raab and cheese in bread 
- Salami stromboli: better flavor with the fatty meat
- Ciabatta: doughy 
- Focaccia: good olive oil flavor

These came with mascarpone butter (very subtle), lemon olive oil (nice), and an eggplant caponata, which I liked.

Pastas: 
- Short rib agnolotti: better with some extra cheese. The first few bites were good, but it got pretty monotonous, and I wish they had a smaller portion of this. It was pretty rich
- Tagliatelle: with lots of vegetables. guanciale, and a truffle zabaglione. I wasn't expecting much from this dish, but the textures and the flavors turned out to be really good

Sides: 
- Mushrooms: a pretty good portion, slightly oily, but good flavor 
- Cauliflower: I liked the gremolata on top, and it actually went well with the agnolitti since the pasta was so rich

We tried ordering some cocktails, but most were pretty unremarkable, and they definitely weren't the craft cocktails I was hoping for.  Food came out shockingly quickly, and I actually wish they had slowed it down a bit rather than bringing it all at once, since things got cold. 

The view of the Bellagio fountains at night was beautiful (we got a seat by the window)..  While the food was not bad, it wasn't as great as I expected, and I doubt the Vegas version does the original Scarpetta justice.

I was visiting Vegas with a group of girls and wanted to eat at one of Vegas's top restaurants.  Searching through Yelp, Scarpetta seemed like a good choice.  I knew it was more expensive but from the reviews I was assuming it was worth it.  I definitely do not think it was.

The food was good, but not worth the price tag.  The pastas were the best part so if you do make it to Scarpetta I would suggest sticking to one of the pastas.  The total bill for the 6 of us was around $500.  We ordered a few drinks and a couple bottles of wine and though I don't have anything about the food to complain about I just don't think it was worth $500.  Normally when I have a meal with that price point I am expecting some experimentation with foods or unique pairings.  Scarpetta did not try anything new.  Steaks, typical pastas, decent portions, but nothing new.  

There are so many choices for restaurants in Vegas so I just can't recommend this one.

Actually quite a nice experience here.  We had a light early dinner here in the bar/lounge area.  We were not allowed in the main dining hall due to a friend's attire (he had just got out of Marquee, their pool club).

I don't even fine italian food very often, but color me happy here.  The bread basket was awesome!  They had a salami bread in there... ask for extra :)  The olive tapenade they served it with was also stellar.  I could eat that stuff alone.

Ordered the duck + foie gras ravioli.  It was really good.  Friends ordered the spaghetti due to some rave reviews from my friend who had been here before.  I thought the spaghetti was good, but not $25 good.  The duck+foie gras ravioli was possibly worth the $27 they charged for it.

We sat in the lounge, so maybe didn't get the full dining experience, so charging the full dining room price for lounge food knocked the experience down some. 

Almost a 5 star place imo.

3.5 stars. My review of the NYC location received 5 stars. As of now my wife & I visited 2 different Scarpetta locations both NYC & Las Vegas & while both restaurants were great, Scarpetta in NYC blew me away!!! This time I tried the infamous Scott Conant spaghetti & must say, it was really good. The flavors were alive & the pasta was perfectly al dente. Very good. Still, the NYC location is better. Even the bread basket was slightly off in Las Vegas but still good. I guess the difference in chefs changed things a little. Not to mention service was a little lifeless & cold. Still I'm affectionate about Scarpetta. In NYC that is lol.
Even better the second time around, had the prix fixe menu again. Our waiter Mike was outstanding and really added to the great dining experience.

We had dinner here last night and I agree with most of the reviews on yelp the food and service did not disappoint from start to finish.  We started with some cocktails a White Russian and the berry smash.  For appetizers we had the yellowtail crudo and the scallops oh my..... the yellow tail melted in my mouth and the scallops were perfectly cooked.  We shared the world famous spaghetti and the spiced NY strip the spaghetti was perfectly cooked and let me tell you I'm not a fan of spaghetti but this was really good the sauce kinda tasted more like a vodka sauce.  I would definitely get again but next time with the mini meatballs.  The NY strip was good but I think if we are ever in Vegas again we would try the filet or the brazino.  For desert I had the coconut pan a cotta and my son picked chocolate cake with the toasted almond ice cream.  One word to describe the dessert.....decadent..... oh so good.  One of the better meals we have had in Vegas.  Will definitely be back here the next time we are in Vegas.  And oh our waiter Michael was attentive, professional and patient we couldn't of asked for a better waiter.

This place is wonderful!! Great service, ambiance and delicious food.

I was originally a bit turned off by the poor service of the hostess taking our reservation over the phone, but once we arrived the staff (especially our waiter, Mike) was very friendly and accommodating. We loved the ambiance: dim lighting, candles on the tables and stylish decor. We requested a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains. It was really nice being able to look out from time to time even though there's a big bar on the window right at eye-level that makes it difficult to watch the fountain show without needing it lean over awkwardly.

Food: Overall, we really enjoyed our meal! Though there were a couple items I'd recommend against, we loved most of the dishes we tried. Here's a quick review of each item we ordered:

APPETIZERS

- Beet Salad: I enjoyed this, but it was my least favorite of the apps we ordered and could have used more beets.

- Roasted Sea Scallops: If you like seafood, this dish is a must! SO GOOD. It was my favorite item we ordered, and my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

- Creamy Polenta: Another amazing dish! Creamy, buttery perfection.

ENTREES

- Spaghetti: My boyfriend loved this! He said it was the best spaghetti he's had here in the states. The noodles and sauce reminded him of spaghetti in Venice, Italy. :-)

- Mediterranean Branzino: I was disappointed in this dish. The fish was bland and the overall flavor was nothing special.

DESSERTS

- Amedei Chocolate Cake: Loved this!! The only thing that would have made it better is more gelato. It only comes with a tiny scoop and goes quickly with how chocolaty the cake is. Simple solution: request extra gelato while ordering.

- Zeppole (with nutella center and vanilla sauce): We debated over getting this and splitting the two different desserts or just getting two chocolate cakes (which we knew we'd love). I'm so glad decided to give it a try as it ended up being our favorite!! I'd definitely recommend it to others dining here.

This is the best Italian food I've had in this country in a very long time.  The wild mushroom polenta was creamy, rich, and very flavorful.  My husband and I went with the pasta.  He had the sheep milk ricotta agnoletti and I had the spare rib agnoletti.  Both were savory and melt in your mouth good.  For dessert we had the bombolini, which were quite delicious.  

The service was excellent and I disagree with a previous yelper who said service came with a serious attitude.  Our server was kind, helpful, and not at all pretentious.

The only thing that I would like to see on their very extensive wine list is more mid-range bottle options.  There were hardly any bottles of wine under $100.00.
Incredible food and fantastic staff and owner! If you find yourself in Inglewood, this spot is a must!

Best dining view in the Cosmo.

We went here to enjoy dessert and coffee. We were sat in front across from the bar in a private booth. The dessert was delicious! Chocolate cake with gelato and Carmel sauce. Out of this world. My husband enjoyed dessert as well which looked like doughnuts filled with Nutella. The food was so delicious we wanted to come back, however they close down for 10 days prior to the holiday season. Our waiter was so kind as to give us a tour of the restaurant dining room that overlooked the Bellagio fountains. They also have 2 private rooms. One for events and another that is the chefs table. We got a tour of the kitchen which is impressive and impeccable. The exterior doesn't do the size of the restaurant justice. It's full scale and top notch. Our waiter recommended the pasta for next time, since we already had eaten prior to our visit. Due to their Holiday closing, we took his advice and tried the DOCG next door which was amazing. Next time we find ourselves in Vegas we will definitely eat here and if possible reserve the chefs table.

By FAR my favorite pizza in the city!
My group of girlfriends have been going to 500 Cucina exclusively for the last couple of years.
We used to alternate where we would eat, but after a while it was clear that 500 was everyone's favorite!
Just thinking about their pizza makes me drool.  Fantastic crust - not too thin, not too thick, just the right amount of chewiness yet still light.
The toppings are 5 star and their sauce is light and flavorful.
I always get the Diavolina with spicy jalapenos. I think they are marinated or fire grilled or something but they are soft, fresh, and abundant.
The pasta looks amazing too - the porcini pasta is a huge bowl of fresh noodles, tomato sauce and tons of mushrooms.
On Saturday night they have live music, but I have yet to experience it.
Also there's a lot of free street parking near by, as it's on the west end of Inglewood.

Food was absolutely amazing, honestly mind blowing. But service was horrible. I came here with my two girlfriends for a birthday and we weren't checked on once for the 45 to an hour that we were here. Our server, Giampaolo walked by our table multiple times and never asked how the food was or how we were doing or if we needed anything. I come to a nice restaurant to be treated with respect and not looked down because of my age. I understand we look young and you may think that we won't tip you well but I'm in the bar industry and he would have gotten well taken care of, for sure. I always tip well. He had overheard me talking to my girls about the situation and then tried to not have me pay for the wine to make up for it, without saying something about the horrible service. It's very upsetting when you expect good service and you get belittled.

This place is a great restaurant all around!  Great view, great ambiance, and great service.  We where seated with a great view of the fountain show at Bellagio.  I usually don't like Italian food, too much garlic.  But after this meal I fell in love with it all over again.  The Oysters-West Coast where amazing, the Spaghetti was delicious, and I cant rave enough about the Mediterranean Branzino!  The meal was excellent! We will definitely be back.

Really good Italian food. It may depend on what you order because mine was outstanding and my wife's was simply good but for a non-Italian food lover like myself, I was duly impressed.

The decor was very nice. The tables are a little tight so if you need to navigate through the room, you may have to turn sideways or take an odd path. My wife and I were seated at a two seat table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. She got a beautiful view of the fountains and I got a view of a wall. Other than those two things, The ambience and atmosphere were very nice.

I had the beef tartare appetizer and the lobster pasta and they were both off the hook. The handmade pasta is the real deal. My wife had the oysters appetizer and swordfish. Both were very good but not out of this world. 

The service was nice and accommodating. 

May depend on what you order but, based in my experience, I give it a smiley face!

I ate here the first week of July and had the pork chop.  The pork chop was so fatty and juicy that I ate the whole thing!  The dining area is very cozy and dim with windows that lined the walls.  The waitstaff was friendly and our waiter surprised us with free cookies to congratulate the future bride (not me, someone else!).

In Las Vegas for a long weekend just a few days after the grand opening, i ended up at Scarpetta for a late dinner seating. The concierge at the Cosmopolitan hotel was about as nice and as accommodating as you could hope to have and she hooked me and my smoking hot date up. The place looks amazing and i dont now who they thought we were but we got the million dollar table. It must have been that new Calvin Klein dress i was wearing that made them think i was deserving of a table that overlooked the Bellagio fountains. I even asked my hot date if he tipped for that table, he swore he didn't. Whatever I'm not one to look a gift horse in the mouth i just enjoyed the amazing beautiful view and got ready to eat. 

The service... Impeccable. Charming on the ball waiter with not too much sass but just enough chit chat. The food was prompt and delicious. I had the creamy truffle polenta and  super yummy black macaroni with lobster and Mr handsome across the table from me had the goat which was really good too. I know because even though i dont eat goat cuz i think its gross, he made me taste it and it was.. well, really good. And that's from a goat hater! The wine list is deep but not over complicated, even a wine Jr leauger like myself could find my way around it.

It was a real romantic fairytale night out, exactly what you think fine dinning should be. It was fancy with out being stuck up, tasty with out being weird. Scarpetta LV is a real winner.

Even though the food was good (not on par with the NY location though), I can't give more than one star because the service sucked. 
So it's Restaurant Week in Vegas. I wanted some pasta and Scarpetta's RW menu online looked good. It was our last night there and we had to catch our flight, so we booked the earliest table possible. We walk in and are handed the regular menu, no RW menu. We're sort of hungover and tired and I think maybe i read the dates wrong, so we go ahead and order off the regular menu. No big. 
Then other tables start coming in. They are all given the RW menu enthusiastically. I ask our waiter if it is RW. He says yes, we just started it tonight. I ask why we weren't given the chance to participate--it IS for charity, after all. 
He says, oh...ummm...well...it's by INVITATION ONLY. 
Waiter, you are a LIAR. 
Oh, really?, I say with an eyebrow. 
Yep, sorry, he says, and walks off. 
Just say you f'd up, and comp our dessert or something. Don't treat me like I'm some idiot. 
I wonder what Scott Conant would say.

Had dinner with a group for work.
The best appetizer was the grilled octopus.
I had the lamb, it was terrible.  Dry and about 5 pieces.  Not good at all.
Colleagues said veal chops were good.
Wine sucked.  Their suggestions were crap.
I'd go back for the appetizer, nothing else.
The service was really good and they were very attentive.
Seems very overrated and overpriced.

If you are let looking for the best dining experience come to Scarpetta. The GM Mario made our night with his exquisite staff. Luis was our waiter and took the best care of us from start to finish with his stellar recommendations. The sommelier Kyle served us the best wine and will forever remember this dinner with great friends. Thank you Mario and Scarpetta staff for everything that you do

I'd have to agree with the other reviews on how amazing this place was. service was top notch. food was fantastic. drinks were delish! definitely exceeded my expectations of food, service, and beautiful view of the strip and bellagio fountains. 

Drinks: the bartender knows how to make his drinks. my sister got the berry smash which was made with fresh fruit. very yummy! not too sweet and just the right amount of fruity. I got an old fashion. I've been searching las vegas for the best old fashion and this place wasn't too bad. only thing lacking was a cherry

Food: 
1) braised short ribs with root veggie and risotto- the risotto was a perfect pairing for this dish. it was super delish! if the meat was tender enough to cut with a fork i would say perfect. don't get me wrong it was still tender, but i think this dish would be PERFECT if it were just a tad more tender
2) sushi slices- pass on the raw fish. save room for the other stuff (good and fresh but there is so much other stuff to try)

3) roasted scallop- I'd have to say this was my fave of the night. i have a thing about scallops. they always seem to disappoint. but SW at the Wynn and Scarpetta have won me over with these amazing scallops. YUMMMMMM

4) polenta with truffle mushroom- i love mushrooms and this went perfect with the polenta. it came in two separate pots that you would mix together. super fab. it seems like an odd side dish for the food but GET IT ANYWAY!

Pastas:
5) spaghetti with tomato and basil- i wasn't impressed by this basic spaghetti that a lot of yelpers raved about. but the noodles were really good. home made noodles a little bit chewy and more dense than the standard spaghetti noodle you make at home
6) duck and foie gras ravioli- i'm not a big fan of foie gras but everyone at the table loved this dish. they said it was the best pasta dish we got.
7) stracci- lobster, crab, shrimp, and basil- this was my fav pasta dish. it was bursting with flavor. the shellfish was perfectly delicious. MUST TRY

8) lamb- my goodness this was the best lamb i ever had. if i didn't know any better i wouldn't even have known i was eating lamb. there was almost zero gamey taste that is commonly associated with lamb. YUMMMMMM

dessert:
we had about 4 desserts. but the best i think was the gingerbread pear crisp. get a little side of gelato/ice cream. it was so good. i was stuffed to the brim at this point but i had to have more!

we also had some fish but i would go with the other amazing food rather than the fish dish. would love to come back here. its quite expensive but also quite yummy. my tummy was more than satisfied when i left :)

No Reservations....Packed - Living like a VIP!   We had a group of 7 and NO Reservation around 8 PM - What to Do - After a 10 minute wait, we were ushered into the Private Dining Room!  I must say - FABULOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE!  

As we wait...we see the CHEF himself in the house.... What a Night!

- The drinks were fabulous!

Things I tasted... Heirloom Beet Salad and Crispy Fritto Misto (This is a MUST - Perfectly prepared and delicious)  / Black Fettuccine /  Pici / Coconut Panna Cotta (I recommend ordering 2 or 3 of these for yourself - so Yummy!

We will be back! oh... Can't forget the BREAD!

One of my favourite pasta places in Calgary. The pizza is pretty good to.

Been here a few times and more recently I'm hooked on their Gnocchi Alla Panna. It is just that good. Had it again for lunch the other day.

Their pizza is lovely. Shared the Rochetta a couple weeks ago with a friend and we were not disappointed. Their Triple Pig 1 and 2 from YYC Pizza Week were equally delicious.

We enjoy watching Gennaro cooking and chatting away with all his customers. His stories are endless and his passion for his food always shines. Husband and I shared the 500 Fries and we were seriously fighting for the last crumbs.

It's a beautiful restaurant in Inglewood and we've always had great service and great food. Worth the visit the next time you want pasta - or pizza!
Sheer brilliance. The short rib agnolotti is worth the trip back. Service was impeccable and the wine selection divine.

This review is actually about an experience i had on Valentines day. First of all, i made the reservations over a week in advance, After reading all of the reviews here, I requested to be sat next to the windows to see the fountains. Upon arriving there, they sat us in the 2nd row from the window. I asked about it and they said it was 'first come first serve', even though i had requested it in my reservations.
