Luckily, the couple next to us heard and switched us seats because they had already eaten there before and seen the view. It was really sweet of the couple. We actually had to wait for our menu, even though we had already sat down, which was really weird. It took maybe 10 minutes or so for them to give us menus. 

We ordered the yellowtail appetizer. For entrees, I ended up ordering the short rib agnolotti and my boyfriend ordered the chicken with a side of brussel sprouts.  The yellowtail was so so, the fish was fresh but it didn't really have enough umph. The bread course was AMAZING. They had mascarpone butter, citrus oil and an olive tapenade that was to die for. i wasn't crazy about the agnolotti...I was actually pretty disappointed. There no actual sauce to the pasta, which for me was a misstep. Short rib and marrow are in nature very rich and oily but when i had it for leftovers, the oil was excessive to the point of it being disgusting. The brussel sprouts were the star of the night for me. Side dishes aren't usually that special but i could eat an entire bucket of these things if someone let me. I liked the chicken my boyfriend had but he didn't care for it. We ended the night with the nutella and vanilla bombolis and those were super delicious.

All in all, i think i would go again, but i would definitely order different things. I know he's known for his spaghetti and i totally regret to getting that.

I was actually really excited about this place, but to much avail, this place is mediocre at best.

I really think this place is over-hyped. The food here is marginal and the prices exorbitant than its actually worth. I got the duck and foie gras ravioli, which was ok but not quite flavorful. After trying cucina enoteca in Irvine, CA, I always have to compare every italian place to it and Scarpetta cannot compete. Cucina Enoteca is always a good half price cheaper! 

I also am NOT a fan of their service. My wine was forgotten and only came at the tail end of my dinner. For $18 a glass, this is unacceptable. I know waiters work long hours but it seem like everyone was crabby who worked there.

I'll have to say though, the window view is pretty good as it faces the fountain of the Bellagio.

Scarpetta has a very small happy hour window, I think it was Mon-Fri 5:30-7:00pm and I was determined to try it this week...just made it under the wire. We had the creamy delicious Polenta with mushrooms, warm assorted olives, fresh farm salad, burrata crostini, seafood frito misto, bone marrow ravioli, and wine...it was a fantastic sampler, all was delicious and exactly as described in their menu for just $7 a dish/cocktail.

The environment is cool and classy.  You can get away with casual attire, but a little dressier would fit better.  This is definitely an option for a romantic dinner as well.

The service team was attentive and friendly.  The bread basket is filled with tasty options.

For my meal I ordered the Short Rib & Bone Marrow Agnolotti.  It was very good.  It also has brown butter, horseradish and bread crumbs as part of the meal.  The horseradish is very subtle, so do not get scared away by that.  The bone marrow helps give it deep flavor.  The meal is very good.  The portion is modest, so definitely consider an appetizer, soup or salad to pair with it.

I have no intention to return to Scarpetta after having dined there last night on the pre-fixe menu for Restaurant Week. First I will state what is warranting the one star: a wonderful Chianti and delicious heirloom tomatoes. 

This is what I was served:

Heirloom Tomato Salad - I thought the presentation was lovely and all the flavors were good and spread out. The heirloom tomatoes were very tasty. I was not disappointed with this dish.

Aged Sirloin Beef; Potato Gnocchi, Wild Mushrooms, Parmigiano & Barolo Ragu - I am fairly certain my dish did not have ANY mushrooms in it and I was very disappointed in this fact. Was it because we were dining on the RW menu? I guess mushrooms only go to those paying full price? The sirloin was O.K.. nothing special. I will admit the waiter suggested I get it medium and I opted for medium-well, maybe my mistake here - but the fact the meat had quite a bit of fat on it and gristle was NOT my fault.

Amadei Chocolate Cake Toasted Almond Gelato & Salted Caramel Sauce - The cake was very rich and I was pleased with it, however I felt as though it was something that could be served up at an Applebee's for goodness sake, not a fine dining establishment.

On to the even worse (because the food was actually okay) was the service. Our waiter was horrid. Just absolutely, down-right inattentive and spaced out beyond belief. He was an older gentlemen. Mistakes made:

- Incredibly slow service
- Offering us a wine menu, but not taking our wine order until we gave it to him ourselves
- The wine took forever to arrive and in the mean time he did not return to take our meal orders
- Had tap water poured into our water cups that were filled with the water we PAID FOR
- He did a poor-ass job of describing the meals, as did the others serving us
- Just the most bland service EVER; did not ask us how our food was, did not chat with us at all, just did not care in general

Was it because we were there on the RW Menu? Maybe. And if that is the way an establishment runs a wonderful event for a good cause for a charity than I have absolutely no intention of ever returning to order off the menu. There are better places I can go in Vegas to have fine Italian dining. Scarpetta is not one of them.

First time on a recommendation, plus I have eaten at Mora in Phx which was excellent. Jason was our server and ordered for me. Meal was amazing to say the least and my pork chop was over cooked. There was 2 of us and we split the burrata which is a MUST have. Also had the scallops with Foie Gras as an app. Deeelish. Entrees were the Branzini, Agnolotti and the chop. Disappointed in the chop but had plenty of food even though I sent back the chop and didn't ask to replace it. The highlight was dessert. Tried the cheesecake, donuts and the Budino. OMG the Budino was probably the. Eat dessert we have EVER had. Definite must try and we are foodies who grew up in the restaurant business back East. Ask for Jason to guide you through the menu!  Cheers.

They don't open until 6pm, so we were concerned we wouldn't make our 8pm show at the palms hotel. But the service was very fast. so fast, it made it pretty obvious that our lardo wrapped shrimp was precooked albeit very, very tasty. but a bit dry. the cocktails were delicious...the agnolotti rich and delicious, but the ny steak was the highlight & perfectly cooked. we finished with  the banana souffle and coffee. the coffee was great but the souffle was more of a meringue than a typical dessert souffle. also, a highlight was the attentive service. actually the best we've ever had in vegas! thanks to garvin. we had 6pm reservations and were out by 7:05pm.

I am a fan of Scott Conant from Chopped fame but I have to say the Las Vegas outpost of his iconic NYC restaurant just did not live up to the hype.  I went with a group of guys and we ordered the tasting menu.  They were nice enough to allow us to order it on a Friday night since it is usually not offered on that night of the week.  We tasted 8 dishes for $110 pp.  The quantity of food was great - really full at the end of the meal - but most of the dishes were just ok.

The real highlight for me was the creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms.  Wow, that was delicious.  Probably the creamiest polenta I've ever had and it paired so nicely with the earthiness of the truffles and mushrooms.   The chocolate cake served for the dessert course was also terrific, served with toasted almond gelato.  Too bad I was so full by that time I could only have a couple of bites.  Nothing else was particularly memorable.  

Disappointing for me was the restaurant's signature spaghetti - a seemingly simple preparation of pasta, fresh tomatoes and basil.  It arrived very simply plated -  a perfect cylinder mold of spaghetti covered by a clear plastic cloche that I suppose is meant to preserve the freshness of the preparation or perhaps to concentrate the aroma.  The cloches are removed with a flourish releasing nice smells of tomato and basil.  The pasta was a bit overcooked and the sauce, while wonderfully creamy (how do they do that?) was just too sweet, as if Chef Conant and Chef Boyardee had a bastard love-child.

Another disappointment was the black cod.  In the past I have found this fish to be among the most delicious owing to its high fat content and buttery texture and flavor.  Scarpetta's rendition of this fish, pan-roasted with concentrated tomatoes and roasted fennel, was so overcooked that it was unrecognizable as black cod.  Just a piece of fish.

Other dishes were a bit more successful including the raw preparation of yellowtail and tuna, the diver scallops, the short rib/bone marrow agnolotti and the duck breast.

The wine list is voluminous and expensive.  The cocktail menu offers some nice selections.

There is certainly a lot of eye candy to be enjoyed at this swank place in the Cosmo.  However, one annoying thing was the lighting.  Over every table there is a large fixture containing multiple yellow/gold colored lights.  This lighting casts the food in a weird color and makes taking pictures of the food impossible.  All the food looks bad in the pictures I took - I suppose that's no surprise that the pictures were a disappointment too.

Decor is amazing. They have a beautiful view of the strip and the interior is quite cozy with the low light setting.

The food in general was pretty good. The scallop and spaghetti were both so yummy! The noodle was slightly too al dente for me, but the sauce was so amazing. The Duck Foie Gras Ravioli had a strong foie gras taste to it. I couldn't really taste the duck. My least favorite of the night had to be the veal dish. The meat was dry and very lackluster.

The most amazing thing was the bread basket. It comes with a variety of dips and breads. There is one warm bread with salami embedded in the inside. I wish I have a whole basket of that!

Anywho, I would definitely come back for the bread and to try the spaghetti again. :)

I had a really great experience here. We went here for our birthday dinner and had amazing service from start to finish. Jason was our server and did an outstanding job making our birthday dinner special. We had the best seat in the house with a direct view of the strip. We took advantage of the opportunity by taking lots of pictures, obvi. We started out with some kushi oysters. I love oysters so it was a must, very fresh and sweet. The lobster pici was absolutely delicious, tasty, complex, flavorful, and very unique. For dessert we had the bomboloni with Nutella and the chocolate soufflé. We also got a cute little sampler of tea cookies and biscotti for our joint birthday. Overall, would definitely come back again for the food and service.

I have a select group of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. It is a small list of places I would go every visit, and even though I like to try new places, my special list always beckons...

The time has come to add a new place to this Elite list...welcome Scarpetta.

Reservation made for Christmas dinner 2015 (made it 3 days in advance), located on level 3 of the Cosmopolitan and we requested a window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Upon being greeted by the lovely set of hostesses (who were very classy mind you), our request was honored, and our table was AMAZING.

We had some awesome servers helping us, our main waiter was Garvin (I hope I spelled it right). He was extremely nice, great attitude, plenty of "just right" conversation, funny, personable, and I could not have enough praise for his knowledge of the menu, Las Vegas cuisine, and his general awareness of what it means to be a good host for a restaurant. He gets 5 stars alone!

The ambiance is dark, seductive, and enchanting. The place is mostly "quiet" and intimate, with dim lighting, gorgeous wood flooring and well-appointed décor. 

We ordered a couple drinks. I had a variation of the Moscow Mule  and it was superb. My gf (who always takes forever to pick a wine) had two she was interested in, and our waiter brought both for her tasting. She finally chose a Pinot Noir, and really enjoyed it. 

Our appetizers were:

- Warm Beet Salad...AMAZING IN EVERY WAY! The temp was perfect. The beets were soft and tasty, the shaved parsnip was bitter and palate pleasing.

- Tuna and Avocado. This was divine. Tuna, Avo, micro greens...just perfect.

The bread basket (free):

- Yes, I will rave about the free bread. I don't normally even eat bread but it was Xmas Dinner so sue me! Haha...the stuffed "Stromboli Bread" oh my god. good. The sourdough, the ciabatta, the olive oil and rosemary squares...holy hell on a stick Batman...!! The bread was delicious and it came with an eggplant tapenade, marscapone butter, and a light olive oil...oh man...wow.

The Pasta:

- I got the Short Rib Agnolotti.  The flavor depth of the wagyu short rib, the bone marrow broth, the dark rich sauce and the fresh mini-ravioli pasta...was amazing. It didn't look like a huge portion, but looks were deceiving...it was a lot of food. This is now a TOP 5 dish favorite in Las Vegas. 

- My lady got a Gluten-Free variation on the Spaghetti & Sauce. It was the same tomato and basil fresh sauce, with gf noodles and they added just enough garlic, olive oil and shaved cheese to it. This was simply an amazing spaghetti and sauce. I mean...wow again.  Simple, flavorful, and filling. 

On the side:

- We added Brussels sprouts to our mains and they were great. Toasted macrona almonds with just a bit of smokiness. Lemon oil, garlic, oh man these sprouts were luscious. I am going to try to make these at home. This side alone was so worth it (seriously). Try them.

***  ***  ***  ***

All of the food came out in good order to not clutter the table. The servers and staff always knew when to clear a plate or fill something. They were ever-present but not annoying. Honestly, the service was perfect. This was a great Christmas dinner, and one to remember for so many reasons...they even brought out a light dessert course for us since it was my birthday the week prior (with a lemon bar, a berry jelly candy, a chocolate, and little cookie).

If ever I write 1,000 words for a Yelp! review let it be Scarpetta. People, you cannot go wrong here. With drinks, appetizer, salad, and two entrees, we were around $150, throw in a well deserved great tip, and it was a delightful dinner, perfectly executed for under $200 in an amazing seat to see the Bellagio show and enjoy a quiet and intimate atmosphere. 

I'm coming back soon, I promise!

The reviews are all true.  4 of us had dinner there this past weekend and we can honestly say everything was amazing.  From the bread and appetizers through to dessert, we were passing our plates and sharing as every selection was beyond delicious.  The highlights were the spaghetti and the polenta.  We will definitely be back on our next visit to Vegas.

Overall the place is doing it right with the ambiance and service. Our servers were spectacular; they took the time to converse with us since it wasn't busy yet and it was very pleasant to get to know them. Can't remember their names but they have tattoos hidden under your uniforms (we were chatting about tattoos and they showed us theirs haha).The hostess on the other hand had some attitude problem when we asked to be seated some where else that happen to be right next to where waiters would enter in and out of. I'm still wondering why she sat us there when more than half of the room was empty...

Anyways, on to the good stuff that matters. THE FOOD. 

I had the Spiced Rubbed NY Steak. It tasted fine; however, after sitting for 10 minutes, the steak started to taste really dry. The spices on the steak were great though...I'm just sad that halfway through my steak it started to taste dry. Maybe it was old steak. ::shrugs:: I've had steak at Delmonico and it was significantly better over there. For a renowned restaurant, I was expecting more. 

My boyfriend had the Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli. This dish was amazing! I'm a huge fan of liver but this dish was out of this world. Mind you, I'm not big on italian food. The cream that it was submersed in was light and wasn't thick like many other italian places I've dined at. This is a must if you're ever a first timer here!

This was my first time here. The ambiance was nice, but the room was a little dim. I had the duck foie gras ravioli--it was quite tasty. And I liked the bread. The service was alright. Not once did the waiter come back and ask how we liked our dinner. The place was quite busy-so make reservations.

We chose this place due to the high recommendation here on yelp and I'd think to thank everyone for not letting me down!  The service was top notch and the food was extraordinary.  You must order the pasta....it's so fresh!

service is the worst I've experienced in Vegas, food was not bad but loses it's flavor with bad service, Scott Conant the owner needs to read these reviews and start screening staff. I for sure will never step foot into this sad excuse for a restaurant ever again. A week later I was in Beverly Hills with the same group of friends and we saw Scarpetta, we avoided the restaurant and ate elsewhere, proving how lousy service means loss of business.

I would highly recommend Scarpetta to anyone traveling to Vegas. This was one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to. They have one of the best views of the fountains and the strip. I had the short rib agnolotti and the chocolate cake for dessert. The pasta was like little pillows of heaven. In addition, Neal, Mario and the rest of the staff were amazing. Five stars!

I picked this place for a special occasion. 
We were seated in the corner next to the windows with a view of Bellagio's water park. We were greeted by Mike, very professional and easy to talk to. The cocktail and wine list had a lot of variety and good choices. The menu was the same, variety and delicious choices. Mike made a couple of great recommendations, I went with his advice and was not disappointed. We both loved everything that was served. I would definitely come here again and would request Mike. 
Thank you again

Great ambience, lighting and music. Good service. Weird Caprese, felt cheap with little cherry tomatoes and the cheese was ultra soft like raw egg whites. Prawns were good; I enjoyed the sambuca sauce.

Great restaurant!! Everything I've eaten here has been delicious. I've been here a few times and have had pasta, steak, Kobe rib cap steak everything has been awesome. I die for their creamy polenta and their Stromboli bread. Every time I come to the Cosmo I have to eat here!

Oh my WOW. So very good. We came here with friends that have been to Scott's restaurants in New York and LA and loved them both. And our food was amazing! First off the bread they give is amazing. You get various traditional Italian breads including stromboli. The olive oil butter was fantastic with it. We then got the endive and apple salad and polenta. The salad was fresh and delicious but the polenta was heaven!! Even the mushrooms (I only tried the juice from them) was great. I could eat that polenta everyday. As for dinner, we tried various things but most of us tried the spaghetti. It was funny because my friends recommended it and I almost laughed with them recommending the most basic dish on the amazing menu but I listen. Glad I did- I now have dreams about the spaghetti. I actually asked to go back the next day and get it again but we didn't have time. I have now scoured the internet to get the recipe. Very very highly recommended. We also tried the Pici and Agnolotti. Both were to die for. The agnolotti was actually a huge hit at our table. It is heavy and rich but just melts in your mouth. 

This place was great and the service was very good. Honestly not a bad thing to say about it. I live in So. Cal and am planning a trip to go back to his LA restaurant as soon as I can.

3.5 stars- food was really good but over priced. I had a plate with chicken in it, the short rib pasta, and Palenta. If I was chief Ramsy I would say that the mushrooms on the Palenta were too hard. 

Basically you are paying for location on the strip.  

Service was ok (a little on the slow side). Waiter was really nice.
Among my favourite Italian mini chains. The spaghetti is out of control good. Cool atmosphere.

Expensive but worth it. A very short menu that was fun to share items off of with others in our party so we could all try different things. Great food with a unique flair. Their bread choices were very unique including a bread with meat in it.  They need more servers. Our bar and food service was slow. They only had one bartender working, while she was great, no one could keep up alone with the volume of a full restaurant. We liked the location with its view. Also they presented the food to you when it came very well. We will go back.

Great service!! Me and my lady shared spaghetti (tomato and basil), broccoli (seasoned with garlic) and braised short rib appetizer!! Good proportions, and yummy bread with three different types of spread. I could eat five bowls!!
I can not say more great things about Scarpetta.  The food and service are perfect.  Yes, its pricey but you get what you pay for!

Had a phenomenal dinner here. I got the black pasta and my boyfriend got the beef ravioli and both were great. If you go you should definitely make a reservation because they get booked. Of course we were able to sit in a spacious lounge area and eat dinner without an issue. Service was quick and attentive. Overall delicious food and a good time!

Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. 
Such an amazing pastas, great fish entrées and an awesome view to Bellagio mountains. This restaurant 'hiding' in a small hall at the 3rd floor at the Cosmopolitan and when you go inside it's a huge restaurant.

When I was browsing through Yelp to choose a nice restaurant before going to see the Banda MS concert, I decided to tryout Scarpetta. I wanted to compare it to the other Italian restaurants in town. Scarpetta has a magnificent view, the customer service was excellent, and my Veal Chop Parmesan was not cooked thoroughly. We started our evening with some fresh oysters which were complemented well with a bottle of white wine. My guest had a chicken breast, and she said it was good. I brought my concern with Julian, my server and he did apologize on behalf of the restaurant's inconvenience. Julian brought my guest and I complementary dessert which we both enjoyed. Overall I think Scarpetta was excellent but I think the food at Nora's is far better tasting ( well at least the Veal). Scarpetta by far has the best view compared to the other Italian restaurants I've tried out in town. Would I come again? Probably. Did I get for what I pay for? Yes. Is, is the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas? It has potential!

The reason this review is not five stars is because our great experience was tainted by the negligence and poor service given by the sommelier. 

After ordering our bottle with him we were offered a taste of champagne, but after out first course came and went he hadnt returned with our bottle so we complain to the server. She comes by with a glass of champagne as a peace offering while she tracks the somm down. Our main course is half eaten and he walks over with the bottle half open and apologizes for forgetting us. He didn't ask us if we still wanted it, especially considering that dinner was 15 mins from being done, he just opened it.

We get the bill and the bottle's not on it so we thought that was a nice gesture for makes us having to wait all dinner. He comes back and says he forgot to put the bottle on the bill and rang our cards with the corrected bill... I'm like wtf is wrong w you. He drops the check with someone else's card and bill. We have to send it back. 

I know it's just two ladies so our bill was only $200 but still... Wtf is wrong with you. Nice service should come no matter how high roller your table is. He was terrible. The hotels getting an email about it too.

Excellent dining experience!!! Our waiter was very knowledgable and attentive to our requests and needs! 
We had FETTUCCINE  with lamb ragu, broccoli rabe & pecorino to start with .... It was very good
 Main course: PRIME FILET OF BEEF with potato-lardo purée, rainbow chard & barolo sauce and SPICED DUCK BREAST with eggplant gratin, pine nuts & duck jus!
 Both were very tasty and balanced in flavors!
For dessert we had  NUTELLA & VANILLA BOMBOLONI (nutella ganache, banana gelato & chocolate shortbread)....... Interesting ........ Didn't impress me much as I was looking for more uniqueness !!!! It  reminded me of donut fi

For drinks we had:
IL DOLCE LIMONE  and San Remo!!!

If you are looking for a romantic dinner with you loved one, this is a very good choice!!!!

I am forced to drop the star rating from 4 to a 3 because of the lack of consistency, which is a factor at high end restaurants.  Their spaghetti over this past weekend was terrible.

In fact, I actually returned the first batch. It was watery and the noodles were overcooked and broken. The second batch was only slightly better but definitely not the same in flavor, texture and consistency that I experienced in Miami and again in Vegas last fall.

It's still excellent service and probably the prettiest and fanciest restaurant at the Cosmo. They will always hold that title.

My great friend was moving the Australia so I decided to take her to a nice dinner as her 'going away gift'. I figured it was more practical than something she would have to pack, lol. 

We both order some drinks, which were quite strong; I was pleased! We decided to split the endive and apple salad. It was so flavorful and the heirloom beets melted in my mouth. It was the perfect size as I was looking forward to my main course: truffle ravioli (I do not recall the real name of the dish!).  I love truffles and it was like eating something little angels made. I was so happy! We were too full for dessert but the waiter still brought us some petits fours (complements of the chef). The food was simply amazing, every bite was so delectable! 

We also had a view of the Bellagio fountains show and that was very beautiful!

I cannot wait to frequent Scarpetta again (:

I ate here recently and was very impressed
To start, we shared the braised beef short ribs
What impressed me was that they already brought the dish out seperated into 2 even portions so we did not have to share from 1 bigger plate in the middle
This type of service and attention to detail is always appreciated
Although the meat was tender and the risotto was very nice and different, I wouldn't order this dish again
The portion of meat is very small and it tastes as if just braised in a tomato/stew-type sauce
I was more impressed with the risotto than the meat

However, the entrees were just delicious!
I have the Black Farfalle with lobster ($35 - their most expensive pasta)
This dish is perfect
The pasta seems to be cooked in a lobster broth and tastes of lobster, which was just amazing
Also, they don't overpower it with sauce
There is a dusting of basil breadcrumbs, which are delicious and the pasta and lobster are tossed in a basil, chopped tomato, garlic butter concoction
This is a perfect pasta dish - lobster is tender and meaty, pasta is cooked perfectly, the basil and tomato and garlic go so well
The garlic is even thinly shaved (this reminded me of Goodfellas - if you've ever seen the movie, perhaps you remember how one of the characters would shave the garlic with a razor so thinnly that they said the garlic melted in the oil)

My boyfriend had the black cod, which he thoroughly enjoyed
The fish was cooked perfectly, with a great crispy skin

Unfortunately we didn't have dessert (too full) but I would definitely return and try another pasta creation!

Before I went there I had read a few yelp reviews and I have to say that I expected something more. Not that it's a bad place, just nothing to write home about.

The interior is very classy and elegant - dark wood, candles and comfortable white couches. The light is soft and dimmed, so it's a perfect spot for romantic, candlelit dinners. As in the majority of such sophisticated Italian restaurants the menu is very short and well-considered. There is no banality there, the flavors are mixed in surprising, interesting ways - you can see that the chef wanted to do something different. They also have a lot of vegetarian and gluten free dishes, which is not so common. The waiter was very professional and knew exactly when the food should be served or taken from the table. He also recommended great drinks and desserts.

The bread they serve as a apetizer is fresh, soft and savoury - delicious. For a main course I decided to try short rib agnolotti with brown butter, horseradish & toasted breadcrumbs. It tasted good, but was a bit on a small side and left me still hungry. My friends' portions were a bit bigger and they were satisfied with the flavors. The really good part were the desserts, we ordered mascarpone cheescake and banana souffle. They were perfect, not as heavy or as sweet as I though. The Berry Smash was also great! I had a few and I have to say there is waaaaaay more alcohol there than in Poland, where I live. It's easy to get tipsy.

So why only an "ok" grade? The prices are pretty high and the food is just ok. The concept itself may be interesting but the result is no so great as to overpay. There is probably a lot of Italian restaurants which are just as good or maybe even better.

Let me start by saying that I've eaten at some pretty incredible places in Vegas, spent a lot more money than I did here, but I absolutely enjoyed myself at Scarpetta just as much at a fraction of the cost. Everything was spot-on for our visit. Despite having made last-minute reservations, we requested and received a booth where all four of us could see the fountains. The appetizers were amazing: we tried the pea soup, polenta, scallops, and short ribs. For entrees, two of us had the duck and foie gras ravioli, which I will be dreaming about for a long time; the aged sirloin; and the spaghetti. One of us had dessert (yeah, that would be me), a coconut panna cotta in a guava soup. Perfect. My only complaint: the wine prices. They are, in a word, astronomical. I expect to pay double retail prices usually, maybe a bit more in Vegas, but Scarpetta is at least quadruple. So my husband chose beer, and I went with two glasses of wine and called it a day, rather than having to sell myself on the Strip for a bottle.

I went here with my boyfriend for the small plate happy hour. The menu was limited, but good. We got the creamy polenta and the foie gras ravioli. The polenta was okay and the ravioli was honestly the best ravioli I had ever eaten. The environment was cool and intimate. We sat in a very secluded booth, which there are about 8 in a row like that. There was a table there too that overlooked the bellagio fountains which would've been neat to sit at with a bigger party. Our drinks were okay and I don't even remember what they were, but there were just three to choose from. 

Overall a cool environment to experience and get some good food and okay drinks for a decent price. And you get to walk through the cosmopolitan which is neat. Would recommend.

The food here was high quality, though slightly small in portion for price, but the service timing was tremendously off for a high quality place which was the biggest setback.  

We waited well over 20 mins for our starter drinks, though randomly one person at our table got a glass of wine, while the rest of us sat waiting, and the timing on everything else with the service was excessively off. Our drinks went unfilled for extended periods of time (not the water) and other things that highlighted a real lack of attention on the server, whether over extended or just lacking, not normal for this standard of restaurant. It is tightly sat with lots of big party tables so perhaps the reach is too much, but food quality wise, it is excellent. It's a bit aggravating to me that the server wasn't around to address drinks and other items we shouldn't had to be looking for him for but was blazing fast to get the bill to us and closed in 30 seconds. 

The one upside was that the service was not aloofly arrogant which can be standard with some places like this in Vegas. 

Random note - I would not recommend the octopus for a group to share.

Amazing.

Fantastic service, food, and ambiance.

Can't wait to return.

Delicious, with a nice ambiance. 

The service is attentive. They seem to have a sixth sense about your needs, and take care of things immediately.

The sommelier gave us a very good wine suggestion based on my very limited description of what I would like. Their wall of wine is quite overwhelming, I was very glad for his assistance.  

The prices are a bit steeper; but you go to a place like this for the pleasure of the taste buds; and good taste bud pleasers, need to be rightfully rewarded. 

Everyone at my table, avid lovers of delicious food, loved their meal. 

I, a tasteaholic, will definietly be back for some more.

P.S. I do not care how full you feel, you need to try one of their desserts. It is 100% worth the potential explosion of the stomach.

What a stellar place! Before we begin, the address of 500 Cucina is actually 1003 9th Avenue SE, NOT the address listed on Yelp.

We were a bit lost in the beginning given the incorrect, but luckily, we called the restaurant and someone actually walked out to find us!  Amazing.  Great start to the evening already.

We came on a Monday night at 6:30PM.  It was a bit quiet at first, but the crowds started flow in around 7:00PM. 

Ok on to the food itself.  We ordered three dishes in total. 

First, we had fries with truffle oil to kick off the evening.  These were delicious and we polished these off so quickly that we were tempted to get a second order.

Next, we share one of the pizzas and one of the pasta.  For the pasta, we were recommended the seafood linguine.  I'm not usually a big fan of seafood pasta, but this one was pretty delish.  As for the pizza though, this was amazing. We had the "cowgirl" which came with a healthy serving of smoked porschetta and arugula.  The dough was just right, loved every piece of it.

Will be back again with a bigger group (so that we can try all of the other pizzas).

Thank you Yelp for this great find.

Fantastic food and service. My fave of the trip! We were a group of 8 and they were extremely accommodating of our budget. The waiter never treated us like we were anything less than VIP. We had a amuse Bouche, foie gras/scallop stater and  surf and turf. Nothing was short of amazing

Beautiful ambiance, impeccable service, picture perfect views but underwhelming dishes. Was expecting  palatable flavors of love, however we weren't thoroughly impressed.  They have all the right ingredients, for one exceptional restaurant, maybe the kitchen was off on this particular evening.
Carpaccio.  Need I say more ???    Amazing.  Service is great.  Spaghetti is ALWAYS perfect.

Best. Pastas. Ever.  We showed up at around 5:30p for an early dinner with our son, who just turned 21 (in Vegas!) and were happy to find out they had a social hour until 7:00.  Do not miss on that menu - short rib bone marrow agnolotti and the duck and foie ravioli - literally "last meal" worthy.  Also, the pork belly was amazing.  The $7.00/glass Sangiovese was surprisingly great (we ususally don't opt for happy hour wines).  We also ordered The Spaghetti with added meatballs from the regular dinner menu.  It was the best spaghetti we have ever had.  Dessert was the incredible mascarpone cheesecake with a perfect double espresso.  We luxuriated in one of the curved booths close to the entrance which was private but let you observe the comings and goings of the restaurant.  The decor, music, ambiance, etc. is first rate.  Last, but not least, the service was superb.  Friendly, efficient and professional.  This was a true 5/5 dining experience and we will definitely be back

We recently ate at Scarpetta in the private dining room for a family event. While we didn't have a normal menu, our event menu was built off of regular menu items. 

The meal itself was pretty good. The best thing out of the appetizers was the short rib and polenta. 

Best pasta was the duck fois gras ravioli. And the best part of the desert was the cheesecake (oh my god it's the best I've ever had). 

It was pretty good stuff all around.

A few years may have passed, but Scarpetta is just as outstanding as ever.

I dropped by on a Friday night, immediately after a show at The Chelsea had let out.  Thousands of people were descending on Cosmo's P3 restaurant zone all at once, and I had to select a dinner spot as quickly as possible, or else no open seats would be left.  Scarpetta was the ideal choice, since I could squeeze in at the bar.

The place was a madhouse, but I didn't mind.  Service at the bar was just as spot-on as in the dining room.  I was also luckily enough to be seated next to some very friendly and sociable solo diners who *love* talking about food.

I started off with a glass of Riesling, which I sipped while nibbling on some freshly baked bread.  Scarpetta serves one of the finest breadbaskets in Vegas, with abundant olive oil, eggplant tapanade, and whipped mascarpone cheese for spreading.

For my app, I tried the braised beef short rib with farro risotto and a slice of lardo.  Ladies and gentlemen -- you will never taste short rib as tender and delicate as this.  Absolutely perfect.

For my entree, I tried the spaghetti, which is apparently a specialty of the house -- and I can totally see why.  Thick, plump noodles with a smooth and flavorful sauce will totally upend any preconceived notions of what spaghetti should taste like.  You think spaghetti is simple or boring?  Not after Scott Conant has his way with it.  

There are so many fabulous restaurants in the Cosmo that picking a single favorite is close to impossible...but Scarpetta is definitely high on the list!

While perusing menus for a special dinner in Vegas, I quickly narrowed it to Scarpetta because of their robust vegetarian offerings (both on the regular menu and then an additional veggie menu) and price point. It is less than some of the fanciest restaurants on The Strip and I can now confirm that the food is equally as good.

Ambiance- We chose Scarpetta without even realizing until later that it was located in our hotel (The Cosmopolitan). For as loud as the hotel can be right outside the restaurant, the inside was quiet, calm and classy. The hostess mentioned that we were sitting at her favorite table and we could see why. Our two top overlooked the Bellagio fountain and the strip. It was great. The tables were far enough apart that we didn't feel too close to other diners.

Food- I read a lot about Scott Conant's famous spaghetti 'baseball,' so we had to try it. Our waiter managed our expectations by explaining that the simplicity of the sauce, herbs and fresh made pasta made it delicious. We split all our dishes and this one was easy to share, as they gave us each our own tiny little ball of pasta. It's not a stretch to say that it is in fact, the best spaghetti I have ever tasted. The consistency was perfect and flavors well-balanced. I can assure you I would never spend over $20 on spaghetti anywhere else, but I'd probably do it again at Scarpetta.

I had my eye on a few meat or fish dishes, but honestly the veggie menu easily tempted this carnivore away. I started with the tuna susci (sushi) and it was some of the best I've had. Each piece almost melted in my mouth and the flavors melded nicely together. I was truly sad when it ended.

My girlfriend had the polenta and we both agreed that it was the creamiest we've ever tasted, without being overly rich. And add truffles to anything and each bite turns into heaven. 

We accompanied our spaghetti with another pasta dish off the vegetarian menu, the agnolotti. This was easily my girlfriend's favorite, as each dumpling was filled with (and covered by) the right amount of cheese, cream and truffle. Our meal ended with three warm and perfectly textured zeppole (tiny donuts) and vanilla almond dipping sauce.

The wine pairs were delicious and pours were generous. Our server was down to earth, perfectly attentive (but not overly) and mindful of our needs (both relative to food and time so we could make our show). 

It is unusual for me to return to restaurants in Vegas, as there are so many good ones, but Scarpetta will be my exception. The combination of excellent food, service and price make this one of my new favorite dining haunts.

Well rounded menu
Service felt rushed with little explanation of dishes. 
Good presentation (plates)
Auxiliary staff could use some polishing however.

We've been to (and loved) Scarpetta in NY.  The bread basket there was astounding and so memorable we wanted to come here for that, even 6 years after our visit to the NY location.  We enjoyed our meal here very much (and it's not a bad value for the strip) but the bread basket was definitely less amazing than I remembered.  They still have the meat stromboli, as well as some very good sourdough and the rosemary focaccia, which used to be my favorite but now seems to be made with whole wheat dough and is no longer quite as good.  

We shared two pasta dishes, the duck and foie gras ravioli and the (beef) short rib agnolotti ($26).  The short rib agnolotti was absolutely fantastic.  The duck and foie gras ravioli (which is what I had before) was ok, but there's not much foie flavor and this time the sauce had a spicy kick to it that I did not care for.  Though the waiter warned us that the pasta portions were light (in between appetizer and entree size, he said), I actually found them quite filling. I think we got about 12 raviolis, which is a very decent portion.

The restaurant has a lovely view of the strip + Bellagio fountains.  Try to get a table near the window.
Great service, good food.  Our waiter Luis did an excellent job of keeping our drinks fresh.  Great venue for a reception dinner

I had a wonderful dinner with girlfriends here.  We enjoyed the tasting menu that was full of extra bonuses from the chef.  Everything was so tasty and well presented.  The waitstaff were knowledgable and helpful.  My favorite was the simple spaghetti course that was so flavorful and left me searching for the recipe online after dinner.

It's good food, no doubt about that. But browse the menu before dining so you're not surprised by some of the prices. Variety of complimentary breads and butters/jams/oils. Pasta is made fresh, so be patient for your meal. I was disappointed at first with them only having one vegetarian option (spaghetti) but it was great so I'm glad it worked out. I'm sure if I told them my food choice concern, they would have offered to make substitutions but I just didn't want to go through the drama that night.

Great atmosphere, had a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  Service was top notch as is with most higher end restaurants in LV

Duck & foie gras ravioli - very good 
Polenta with mushrooms - really exceptional.  Smooth and real depth of flavours in the sauce.
Spaghetti - just so much depth and flaour in such a simple dish of pasta, tomato & basil.
Lamb - well prepared, 

Wine Selection - great selection $100+

I came here on a Sunday at 6.  Totally dead which is sad because the food and service were so good.  Maybe it picked up after I left?

The bread was excellent and I usually don't like bread at Italian restaurants.  They had a focaccia, ciabiata, standard loaf, and crazy one with meat in it.  As a vegetarian I had the first 3.  In addition there were 3 dips - an amazing butter, a eggplant option, and citrus infused EVOO.

I began with the white artichoke soup.  Great presentation.  Mushrooms and croutons with a nice foam and greens, then came the creamy artichoke soup.  Cleaned the bowl.

Then the famed spaghetti.  The $24 spaghetti that apparently is amazing.  I had to find out for myself.  I hadn't ordered spaghetti from an Italian restaurant in a decade (in high school I'd order it on dates to save money).  It was honestly - ok.  I found mine to be too al dente, but perhaps this is personal taste and preference.  Still good pasta - but don't feel like you have to get the spaghetti.

The service was great.  The waiter was quick, knowledgable, and professional.  The manager came over and chatted with me for 15 minutes which was great.

They sat me at the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains - can't complain about that.

Go here.  So you can say you ate at Scott's place and because it's delicious.

Came here with my wife for a getaway from LA.

Food 5/5
Ambiance 5/5
Service 5/5

My friends and family thought its weird that I like this particular restaurant so much, but I really do!

There is nothing like overlooking the fountains of Bellagio and having a romantic meal with the woman I love. Made me feel like a millionaire (although I'm not ... yet).

Will definitely be back!

One of the best food I had in a long time. I did not know what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious, very refined, well balanced, and the service was outstanding. I had the creme of polenta, the brazzino and the caramel with chocolate mousse. These were outstanding, very well prepared, well balanced, not to much of one or another flavor. The service was great well attentioned. The reception as usual need major upgrade. She made us wait although we had a reservation and the place was not busy, and looked at us with an attitude when I asked how much longer we will have to wait. But beside that it is an outstanding food for the price. Ii can definitely compete with the well known 3 stars restaurants of las Vegas. I highly recommend it.

Food and ambiance was perfect! The service was immaculate. We had 5 people taking care of us. About the food- it was absolutely delicious! I tried salmon, which was perfectly seasoned and moist, mushrooms- perfect choice of variety in yummy sauce, and the plate of octopus, which was my favourite! Definitely recommend it if you are a foodie and want to spend a romantic dinner with someone special or your friends.

I loved loved loved Scarpetta back in NYC. Their bread basket is second to none. Their truffle mushroom polenta I still dream of til this day. Their panna cotta taught me what the gold standard should be. Imagine the excitement I had in bringing my in laws to the Vegas location. 

Our dining experience certainly did not disappoint. It was definitely all of my family's fav on this trip! 

Short rib agnolotti, spaghetti and meatballs, uni black tagliolini, duck and foie gras ravioli, and Branzino - every dish was beyond delicious! Our table couldn't get enough. 

My personal fav is still and will always be their mushroom and polenta. I don't understand why they don't just offer a full entree portion! I can eat a whole bucket worth - so so so so good. 

Desserts - I had three baskets worth of Stromboli swimming in my stomach by this point (along with their polenta and whole plate of duck, foie gras ravioli) but I just couldn't refuse their dessert menu. Coconut soufflé (so airy!), cheesecake (decadent!), donuts (bursting with heavenly Nutella and banana cream), and chocolate cake (brownie like exterior - very rich and perfect for all chocolate lovers) - no options can go wrong. 

Overall - all around 5 stars! Foods, services, ambiance! Would be back every time we visit Vegas!

Very nice Italian restaurant. 

The reception at this restaurant was warm and friendly. Our waitress was prompt and helped us pick out stuff from the menu. 

The ambience was nice. The food was fantastic. Best lasagne was probably the best I've ever eaten. Everything else we ordered was great too. It seemed to be real Italian food cooked by Italian chefs. 

I will be going back to this restaurant during my short stay in Calgary.

Authentically Italian food with a modern twist in an understated, elegant and comfortable dining room. The restaurant was happening on a Saturday night but there's enough space between tables that we still had a feeling of intimacy. Everything was perfectly cooked in perfect combinations of ingredients. We had two starters: braised short ribs and brussel sprouts. We shared a pasta chocked full of lots of different vegetables. It had a very earthy flavor and flavors only achieved from patiently creating a reduction. The two entrees of lamb and black cod again featured flavors from painstaking attention and time in the kitchen. Our waiter, although busy, was attentive, friendly and professional. Very nice meal and I love being a little overstuffed(that's why no dessert).

After reading all of the great reviews, I am really excited to go to this restaurant.  We made a reservation because, online it said that they were recommended, but there were not many people in the place. We got the suggested appetizer of the Tuna Susci and it was delicious! The waiter even had the kitchen split it onto two plates so my boyfriend and I could share.  It was delicious with white truffles in the middle and very well seasoned. My boyfriend ordered the black squid pasta with seafood because the reviews raved about it--it really wasn't that great.  It actually smelled and tasted a little overly fishy, but he was a good sport and ate it all.  I order the duck breast, and the duck was cooked perfectly.  The only suggestion I have is that the duck was cut VERY thick and there was not enough of the delicious orange glaze.  It was good, but not over the top amazing.  We were pretty full but ordered the strawberry shortcake for dessert---OMG AMAZING!  It definitely made up for the mediocre dinner. The service was really great, the dinner was blah, and the dessert was really good.  I would recommend this place, BUT I would not come here again.  There are too many other great restaurants in Las Vegas, this definitely has the atmosphere but I do not think our dinner was worth 150$.
One of the best in terms of quality and service.  Excellent food and awesome wine list.

Sat at the bar- waiter recommended the octopus salad off the regular menu as a light option. It was tasty- had beans similar to fava and a tasty hummus like paste under the octopus, which was likely pan seared. There were also some half sliced baby tomatoes and Brussels sprouts which were seasoned well. It was also happy hour, so I ordered the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti- it was completely delicious!!! It's very rich, close to being a little over oiled, but tastes amazing! They highly recommended the duck ravioli also, said its better but a little heavier. Will definitely order next time. The portion is half what the full dinner portion is, and I found it perfect. Most people could order 2 items off happy hour, which are $7 a piece, and feel satisfied as a meal- order 3 if you're really hungry. They had some cool specialty cocktails on HH all for $7 also, with two beers and their choice of a red and white wine. The best happy hour I've seen at Cosmo! Atmosphere is quaint and romantic. Excited to go back to try more options!

We tried this place because we watch the Chopped on Food network all the time and wanted to try chef Scott's food. 
I think I definitely have had better fine dines than my experience here. Very beautiful and intimate place as being a luxury in LV is kinda basics. Anyways, we tried their pasta dish with short rib, which the short rib was missing on that plate. I don't know where it was incorporated. If I was a chopped judge I would have taken points off for not really tasting this main ingredient in that dish. The horseradish was definitely the main kick in that dish. We also tried the Bronzini fish dish which was pretty good and made to perfection. We tried our friends dish who got the foi gras ravioli and that was the highlight of the table. For desert we got the little round donuts which were pretty good. I have to mention that the bread service was definitely one of a kind with some bread baked with some kinda salami.

Absolutely amazing!   Customized everything we requested, very friendly staff, and the vegetarian options were incredible.  I had the creamy polenta as a dinner option and was blown away.  David had the fois gras duck ravioli and was so happy!  Will definitely come back

Great food, Scarpetta manages to offer a level of refinement above its peers in every dish starting from the bread.  I just had oxtail agnolotti from Faith & Flower in LA, Scarpetta's short rib agnolotti blows it out of the water.  Cannot believe there is such discrepency in same star rating, of course everyone has their taste.  Service is sufficient, but I am here to eat, not to be pampered.

we weren't looking for a very high end place to dine... just something average so i guess this place is OK? i still had higher hope then what i actually get... but the $$$ is reasonable so i have no complain.

we tried the duck and foie gras ravioli that everyone is talking about... it's OK... also the black cod... which was OK too... the bread was pretty good w/ the three different kinds of dips they have... desert was what i liked the most... the napoleon and panna cotta were both amazing... 

service was NOT good at all though. our waiter wasn't attentive at all and many times that we had to wave him to order, get more water, or even asked for bread.  and no, the restaurant wasn't busy!

oh well, at least i tried.

We have eaten at Scarpetta in New York and Miami many times and it was simply fantastic. They let us down this time. Pasta wasn't cooked very well. The short rib agnolotti that we had in NYC might have been the best thing we have ever eaten. Here it was just ok. Filling was coming out of pasta and it was very chewy. Hopefully they get it fixed.

Scarpetta finally contacted me and invited us back. There was confusion, my email was forwarded to the wrong person. We don't live in the area so the next time we were in town we made a reservation to return. Mark the manager apologized profusely when we arrived, he also checked on us several times. Our waiter was Roberto, he was flawless. It was night and day with the waiters. Our first waiter really left a bad taste. Roberto not only explained different foods and made recommendations but, gently encouraged us after we made our choice to a different item. He was right. He couldn't have been more spot on. He was very attentive. Ivan was his assistant and was very attentive as well. The food was a beautiful experience. We had the polenta, a must have, carpaccio, melt in your mouth. My husband originally wanted the rack of lamb, but Roberto encouraged him to try the lamb ragu instead. The pasta was freshly made and he thoroughly enjoyed it. I had a steak filet. After wanting another cut, Roberto encouraged me to try the filet. Spot on. I love Gallagher's, but, this was better. Don't tell anybody. The desserts were fabulous, the cheesecake was so yummy. Why not 5 stars? Because of the previous experience. Next time we come we will book with Roberto, he made the difference. If you make a reservation ask for Roberto for an epic meal.

The only reason why I'm giving it two stars is because the server or busser who ever was refilling my drink actually did what he was supposed to. 
For an expensive, high class dinner.. we expected for them to at least make my cousin's husband birthday to be specially. Yaknow, the whole dessert with candle thing. We ordered so many dessert for crying out loud, they didn't really need to give us a free one. At least a candle ? THAT'S STRIKE ONE. 
The second one is.. I got the duck liver pasta.. I expected to get checked on while eating dinner. Yeah, there were a lot of us.. but we also had TWO SERVERS!!! Didn't get asked at any point what so ever how I liked my food (it had no flavor by the way) so I had no choice, because of my hunger, but to bare that food rather than ask for a different one because there was no one to request it from. THAT'S STRIKE TWO
Then the server, didn't tell us the last minute that they could only split checks in the beginning until we needed our checks in the end. In the freaking end!! THAT'S STRIKE THREE 

OVERALL, mediocre food, service was okay, for an expensive price. You're pretty much paying for the name and location of they restaurant.. i suggest skip it and go to a neighboring restaurant instead.

Idk.. maybe it's different for everyone :( but I'm just not a big fan :( I'm a foodie. I love food adventure and food full of flavor. & I just didn't get that.. on the up side, Nutella dessert was great but nothing special

Favorite spot in Vegas so far. The quality of food & service is great for the price. We ordered the lobster pasta, scallops, brussels sprouts and tuna crudo. We liked everything with the lobster pasta being the best dish. My mom and I had an awesome experience there for Christmas Eve dinner. Would come back again.
Wonderful presentation and food!! If you want great service ask to be seated in jonathan's tables and tip appropriately for the service. Fine dining for foodies for sure.

I went all out Vegas and ended up with a bill that ran me over $90 for just myself. But the black truffle fettuccine and orange soufflé were worth it. The bread basket was the perfect way to kick off Starch Madness and our table ran out of the butter halfway through.
My entree was, for $75, definitely worth every penny. Shaved black truffle on top of truffle infused pasta? And so much parmesan. Everyone was sticking their forks in my bowl! For dessert, we got the orange soufflé which was beyond decadent. I normally can't stand figs but the gelato was surprisingly incredible. Sinking my fork into the ramekin while the Bellagio fountain show went on in front of us was pure bliss.
This is pure Vegas extravagance and I am all for it.

Had a late dinner on 12/3 (10pm).  We were greeted and seated right away.  The restaurant is tucked away, but had a great view of the Bellagio fountain show.  Service was great.  Their wine is is fair.  They had a couple of choices for 1/2 bottle pinot noir at a decent price.
Oysters- The kumamotos (sp?) were pretty good.  They came with a vinaigrette added already
Creamy Polenta- Very good.  
Short ribs Agnolotti- The best dish of the night.  Loved the hint of horseradish amid the butter sauce
Spagetti-  A tad on the bland side.  But liked the home made pasta.
Creme Brûlée-    Not your typical creme brulee.  This was a deconstructed version and was "interesting".  Probably wouldn't get it again.  

All in all, a good meal.

This is a nice restaurant with a nice menu and ok service BUT if you expect a great restaurant, you will be disappointed.  The prices are high for the quality of the food and the wine prices are exceptionally high.  In fairness, I have been generally disappointed with the restaurants in LV.  Getting close to NYC prices but unfortunately not close enough to NYC quality.

Yes, their food is delicious...but I'm here to tell you about their service.  OMG!  They were awesome!  Came here for Father's Day dinner and everything was on point.  They were so awesome and my parents loved the presentation for all the dishes.  They brought all the entrees each covered by a cloche.  Then they did one of those tata deals, we found that so fun...it's the little things that make an experience grand.   They figured that out, thank you!

Even though I live in NYC, I've never dined at Scarpetta in NYC.  Very much enjoyed Scarpetta in Las Vegas in the Cosmopolitan Hotel.  Service was very friendly and attentive.  I was dining solo, and was seated at the best table in the restaurant with a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains that are splendid.  The stromboli in the bread basket is delicious!  Loved the duck and foie gras ravioli with marsala.  Very generous portion.  The main course of duck with endive was very good (very soft), but I've had better duck dishes (Le Cirque and Robuchon in LV).  The zeppoles were a bit overdone (too dark) and there was too much nutella filling.

Dined here a week ago with one of my friends and enjoyed the meal.

We each decided to order a couple of courses.  I went with the yellowtail app and 2 pastas, my friend went with the yellowtail, a pasta, and the duck.  We both thoroughly enjoyed the yellowtail.  For the pastas I had the black tagliolini and the duck & foie gras ravioli.  Both were excellent, although the foie ravioli was a little too rich for how much they gave you.  My friend liked the spaghetti but he did say it was a bit over sauced for his likings.  He did rave about the duck.

Overall I would come back.  The pastas all looked great and would do something similar of trying a couple of them.

Dear God. Perfection. Not a misstep in a two-hour dinner. 

Bread basket.
Polenta.
Mushrooms.
Pini (I think that's what it was called? Crazy pasta with lobster and chili pesto)
Cod.

The service was smooth and personable without being phony. The view of Bellagio was phenomenal. Scott Conant, you are my hero.

AMAZING!!! One of my all time favorite dinners and I go out to eat a lot. The portions are on the smaller side but hey when you're in Vegas you don't need a big stuffing meal, need to save some room for drinks :)

We ordered the short rib appetizers' with polenta (VERY small portion). They were beyond anything else I've tried. Everything just melted in my mouth. For dinner I ordered the mushroom raviolis I think it was called foie gras ravioli. Again this plate was just outstanding nothing like anything I've ever had before. The grated cheese literally foamed on the plate. I can't stop talking about this meal and recommending this restaurant to others. 

Another plus was the window seating which had beautiful views of the Vegas strip. The place is dimly lit so adds a romantic feel.

Excellent service doesn't describe how great the serving staff and Owner was. Top marks for the staff knowledge of how the food was prepared.  The food was the best New York Italian food, and the best dining in Las Vegas. The deserts were exploding with flavor. A must eat place. - Doug Morneau

After going to DOCG in Las Vegas, we really wanted to try Scarpetta here in Toronto.
It is a part of the richyrich Thomson Hotel, and was lucky to find parking on the street instead of the pricey lots nearby and valet.

Reserved through Open Table.
The service was pretty quick and attentive. It wasnt too busy, it was Saturday of the Labour Day weekend, but steady.

I had the scallops (which were really good!), while my girlfriend had the creamy polenta (which she thought was outstanding).
We both had pastas for dinner, i had the braised short rib and bone marrow agnolotti (which i could eat all night! the cheesey brown butter sauce was great!) and my girlfriend had the cavatelli (which was awesome too! i stole a few bites!)

definitely glad we made it to Scarpetta in Toronto.
is on the list for Vegas!

After reading all the great yelp reviews we picked this place for my wife's birthday. Here is your ex-elite yelp renegade review.  I hope it is good enough for you.

Our waiter helped with the wine list and led us in the right direction.  Huge win, you shouldn't have to study beforehand to be able to order wine.

The bread is in fact good. But remember when you review a restaurant that knowing the bread is good is not actionable info.  Actually by knowing this I ordered a strong drink knowing the bread could save me, so good tip.

The appetizers we had were rich, interesting that all of them looked rich. Polenta was good.  Crab corn chowder was great because it came as a plate of just crab - where's the chowder? They pour it on right in front of you, that's where. Fun and effective, lots of nice flavors all stood out. The appetizers were big.

So then we tried the spaghetti because of the yelp reviews. It's tomato basil sauce on spaghetti. Everyone who raves about it is questionable. Have you ever had spaghetti with tomato basil sauce before? It is like that but over twenty dollars. Ours was super salty which I didn't like. This dish would be chopped for sure.

We had two fish dishes both were pretty good but the fennel black cod was the best, cooked just through.

Dessert was 5 huge doughnut balls and really surprised me. Simple and delicious. They were perfectly done. Not a thing wrong. Super satisfying. Service had ramped back up for dessert.

The setting is sweet. Windows overlooking the bellagio fountains. Cool looking wine cellar. Plan your visit to be there through sunset as the strip lights come on.  It had a comfortable relaxed atmosphere but still classy.  We had a lot of fun.  I'd go again.

I come every single Vegas trip. Betty, the head pastry chef is INCREDIBLE. not only does she make the meanest desserts of all time, she is also incredibly generous. The entire staff there is! They sure know how to make you feel pampered. All the other appetizer, pasta, and meat dishes were on point and phenomenal. 

That spaghetti... And Betty..... Keep me coming back for more....!!!! Lol. Till next time!

We've walked by so many times and wanted to try this place out because of Chef Conant. In fact, last year, I asked my parents-in-law if they wanted to have dinner here but after looking at the prices, they decided against it, so we didn't.

A few weeks ago, I went back to Vegas with my husband so we decided to check this place out, finally. We didn't have reservations so we weren't sure what was going to happen, but we got a corner seat for two. There's a dining room with views of the water show that we can kind of see from our seats. 

My husband wasn't that hungry because we made the mistake of eating at a buffet earlier, so we didn't get an appetizer. I did get some red wine and so didn't my husband. They served us bread to start and it wasn't just any bread bowl, it was freshly baked bread and they were all delicious! I could have just eaten the bread and be happy about it. 

So we finally ordered and I got the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti, it was topped with panko bread crumbs for a nice change of texture. I loved it. It was also very filling! I was really uncomfortable afterwards because of the buffet earlier. My husband got the gnocchis with foam, it didn't have flavor to the foam, just for presentation, I guess. 

We didn't have room for dessert, but we'll come back and have it some time soon. It lost a star because we were seated in the corner there because we didn't have reservations, or so we were told. People who walked in and said they didn't have reservations were able to be seated in the dining room. Please be consistent about it. You can tell us "the dining room is currently full, you can wait for it to open up or we can seat you now in the corner, which would you prefer?" Instead, they just made the assumption and seated us. Took away from the experience a bit, I'll be honest.

I posted the photos on my instagram and Chef Scott Conant liked it!!! Then I posted a photo of him liking my photo and he LIKED THAT! yay!!! Very cool! He seems like a cool guy and to top it off, a really great restaurant.

Loved my experience at Scarpettas- Make sure to make a reservation! It can be a bit crowded since there are not too many tables. We ordered the foie gras and duck raviolis. It's amazing how light the raviolis are- my only regret was not ordering more pasta! I thought ordering the spaghetti as an entree would be "too much pasta" at Scarpetta's there is no such thing. My boyfriend got the fillet which was of course delicious while I got the New York steak- it's massive! No side needed especially if you order an appetizer. The Primi Piatti are also large enough to serve as a main entree. Asked server her recommendation for the dessert she discussed what the most popular were and which her favorite was... the Bomboloni. Basically, donut holes infused with nutella or vanilla served with a banana gelato. DELICIOUS. The added bonus is definitely the view of the strip and the Bellagio fountaints. Cannot wait to go back! 

Thank you Scarpetta for the amazing service and delicious food! Scott Conant- nicely done.

There is a Scarpetta in NYC but as of last week I have only been to the Las Vegas location. Marc Maron interviewed Scott Conent (who I have seen on TV a number of times) and talked about the spaghetti dish and how he could not believe how good it was. Well it is VERY good. My mom hadn't been feeling great prior to our trip so I think  she didn't really absorb how good the meal was. I had a special appetizer that had Octopus and lentils which was really good. We had a table near the window and were able to see the Bellagio Fountains. Mom had scallops-she said they were good. The spaghetti was really out of this world. Every time one has fresh pasta I think you are reminded that no matter how skilled a cook someone is if it is dry in a box-it is dry in a box. This clearly had been made day of and the tomato sauce, was flavorful and the pasta wasn't drowning in it.

We had the ricotta cheesecake which was a small round serving (different than other places) with some fruit sauce.

I have been wanting to dine here for years and finally got the opportunity this time around even though there's one here in Beverly Hills.  This location is a bit tricky to locate as it is tucked in a corner near Jose Andreas' place and next to D.O.C.G Enoteca.  The atmosphere is romantically dark and narrow but once past the bar, the floor to ceiling glass provides a spectacular view of the Bellagio Fountains.  If you are on a date, request to be seated next to the windows as all tables against the glass are two tops.

Service and Food were outstanding.  Although the spaghetti seemed to be the rave on Yelp and on tv, I thought it was good but not the best I've had.  My personal favorite was the truffle mushroom polenta!!  Highly recommend this dish.  The Apple glazed pork chop is also worth mentioning and it was slightly better than Wolfgang Puck's.  The roast chicken gets high marks especially the sauce that accompanied (chicken liver, onion and shallots)!  We ended the meal on desserts of Nutella & Vanilla custard filled bombolinis and the coconut soufflé.  Nothing was left on our plates.  It was the best meal during our Vegas weekend.

Great views of the Bellagio fountains - and very good food.   We came here once before - and enjoyed our experience then too.

The spaghetti is excellent (I got that last time too).  I add on the meatballs this time, and wasn't really impressed (so sorry - but they reminded me of the meatballs that come in spaghettio cans....sorry).    

Wine selection was good, but pricey.   Would recommend this place for a splurge!   View and atmosphere is worth it.

My boyfriend and I chose this restaurant as our splurge meal for the weekened becuase of the reviews it had online. The ambiance is quiet and romantic and most tables have a view of the Bellagio fountains. The bread has cheese and peperoni in it, like a litte stromboli. The grapefruit gimlet was good, not the best drink I had on this trip but dinner was amazing. I asked my waiter which of three pastas he reccomended and I was suprised when he reccomened the least expensive one. It was the ricotta and truffle pasta. It was very simple but everything worked perfectly together. Best passta dish I have ever had. My boyfriend the lamb loin which was perfectly cooked. We shared the panna cotta. I belive it was coconut and passion fruit. I would definitely reccomend the panna cotta and the pasta. The wait staff was friendly and just the right amount of attentive. Definitely my favorite restaurant at the cosmo!

Everything was squisito! Exquisite!! Scarpetta is doing Italian right. The atmosphere, food and service were all impeccable. 

LOCATION: It's located at The Cosmopolitan (where all the great restaurants seem to be). 

ATMOSPHERE: The ambiance is romantic, lighting was dim and sexy, view of the bellagio fountains were breathtaking. Upscale and Trendy. Great for celebrations or a date night. 

DRINKS & FOOD: We started with a bottle of champagne for the table while we enjoyed the variety of complimentary breads (the bacon and cheese was my fave). We were a group of 4, and shared all plates. For an appetizer we ordered the tuna crudo and yellowtail crudo. They plated it for us and the presentation was beautiful. The fish was melt in your mouth delicious and seasoned perfectly with just enough kick to wake up your taste buds. We ordered 2 plates of the spaghetti, split into 4 portions, the short rib/bone marrow agnolotti and the pici. All pasta dishes were cooked perfectly al dente. Accompanied by a bottle of Justin's Isosceles, which never disappoints. The spaghetti was simple but delicious - spaghetti noodles with tomato and basil. The short rib agnolotti is a mixture of short rib and bone marrow inside a flat agnolotti noodle (think mini cylinder raviolis). It's rich and savory. The pici pasta with lobster, tarragon, almond and chili pesto was by far everyone's favorite. It's a must order. We finished the night with some Nocello, an Italian black walnut liqueur. I'm not into dessert drinks but I will definitely be buying a bottle of this for home. 

SERVICE: Service was outstanding. Our waiter made some great recommendations, our drinks were always full. And Noah, the sommelier? was very warm, welcoming and fun. He really made our night special. 

Value: I'd say this is more of a 4-$$$$ restaurant, but well worth the $140 per person.

Gorgeous restaurant, great service, beautiful food...and be prepared to shell out some cash! 

During our Vegas trip, hubs and I were looking for some great Italian and being that we were staying next door in Aria, we figured Scarpetta at the Cosmopolitan would be a great fit. A 9:30 pm reservation and we were off!

As mentioned, this is a pretty romantico restaurant with dim lighting, slick tables and modern touches. Service was helpful but not intrusive - a definite plus! 

And how about the dishes...

Heirloom tomato salad: 4/5: A very delicious combination of incredibly fresh stracciatella cheese, great tomatoes a bit of salsa verde and eggplant. The portion was small but it was bursting with flavor.

Spaghetti: 4/5: Yeah, seems boring but our server mentioned how great the fresh pasta, scratch made sauce and basil was, so I went for it. I'm glad I did because the pasta was perfectly al dente and the flavors were completely on point without being overwhelmingly tomato-y. Again, portions are very small here - even for the pasta. Perhaps a 1-1.5 cups of pasta for $24...that's pretty steep...albeit delicious. 

Would I go back to Scarpetta? Absolutely. It's creative and delicious Italian fare in a gorgeous restaurant. Give it a try...and bring your credit card :)

Was here with a large group (bachelorette party) and we got the tasting menu with wine pairing.

Excellent food in general. Favorites were short rib agnolotti, scallops, and yellowtail, as well as the duck (though it was at the end and we were so full already we hardly ate any)
 Was underwhelmed only by the spaghetti dish (why am I filling up on something I could have cooked at home?). The rest of the dishes were superb, down to the port and lava cake-esque dessert.

Fantastic restaurant. The first thing to come out was their complimentary bread, which featured a few different varieties along with Marscapone butter, eggplant, and citrus infused olive oil.  I ordered the Black Tagliolini with Dungeness crab and masago, which was very flavorful, but the real kicker was the texture and quality of the pasta.  Perfectly Cooked.

I also ordered the espresso old fashioned to drink which was very good.  Definitely a great meal in vegas, and the view is pretty special too.

You know when you watch those shows like "Best thing I ever ate" or "Enter cities name-Best" and you see the food on the show.. get all hyped for the food.. and its a major let down?!... Well this is not one of those places!!! This is a life changing experience in all things Italian..i.e. Pasta!!! 

Entering this restaurant your first impressions are, this place is fancy and nice.. beautiful layout.. ask for a window seat to look over the Las Vegas Strip.

My Wife and I when seated, were greeted with a delicious assortment of breads and focaccia to die for. 

We started our meal with the polenta with mushrooms and truffles it was creamy and decadent! 8/10 delicious! 

Next for our main dishes-

I ordered the fabled $25 dollar simple basic Tomato basil pasta dish... it arrived in a decanter and unveiled in front of you.. it is molded into a tight little ball and then unravels into a full dish.. I take my first bite and Wowwwwwwww!!!!!! Mind blowing!! Delicious is to weak of a word for this pasta!! Im italian and this is multiple levels in flavor ubove anything i have experience with such simple ingredients!! It is creamy almost like a vodka sauce.. but after watching how its made.. its the blending of butter and parmigiana cheese i would pay twice the price for this dish! 10000/10

My Wife ordered the ravioli with duck and foie gras with a balsamic drizzle... also fantastic!! 

This is one of the best food experiences I ever had and I have traveled the world tasting food!! Bravo Scarpetta!!

Another excellent choice at The Cosmopolitan in Vegas. We sampled several pastas and appetizers. The short rib agnolotti, pesto penne and the ravioli a were all great choices. The Halibut and Petit Filet of beef were the best entrees. The chocolate cake with almond ice cream was the most popular dessert.

I loved this place. It has a very sleek and modern feel.  If you can sit by the window with a  view of the Bellagio fountains, it's an added bonus.  The market salad was amazing and unlike anything I've ever had before. The house made tomato, basil and mozzarella past was also amazing.  Honestly, the real star may have actually been the bread basket though. There were four kinds, and they were all delicious.  We also had the veal, but compared to the other things we ordered, it was the least exciting part of the meal.

I was in Toronto for meetings and two of my foodie coworkers and I had planned on visiting Scarpetta.  Unfortunately, my original dinner companions were feeling under the weather but by sheer coincidence, my brother and his girlfriend happened to be in town.  They gladly joined me.

I really like Scott Conant's no-nonsense style on the Food Network and of course knew of his NYC restaurant's stellar reputation.  I was looking forward to this.

When we got to the Thompson Hotel, where the restaurant is located, we were impressed by how beautiful the space is, very open and inviting.  We sat and ordered a drink.

Even though I did look at the starter menu, I knew I was going to have the polenta; I had heard so much about it!  For the mains, both my brother and I were indecisive so we asked the waiter what his favorite was.  He very confidently told us that as incredibly simple as it sounds, the spaghetti with tomato and basil had made Conant's reputation.
