I then asked about the branzino and he said that it was a great choice too.  When he saw we still couldn't make up our mind, he suggested we share both dishes and we immediately agreed.

The polenta came and it was so incredibly creamy and delicious that it didn't really need the mushroom reduction, however good it was.  It was sensational.  I am still craving it a few months later.

When the mains arrived, we were expecting to see two plates that we would have to try to split evenly.  But no!  The chef had actually created 2 plates for each dish so that we could enjoy the dishes the way they were meant to be.  Very nice touch!

The branzino was expertly cooked and impeccably fresh.  The delicate flavors of the sides were a perfect accompaniment.  The spaghetti however was the star.  It was perfect.  There is no other word.  The few ingredients all shined through and made this very simple dish something almost otherworldly.  The third dish, ordered by my brother's girlfriend, was the duck and foie gras ravioli and she enjoyed it immensely.

She then ordered the coconut panna cotta, which is served in a guava "soup".  I consider myself something of a minor authority in panna cotta as it is my favorite dessert to make and the texture of this one was exquisite.  The guava and coconut flavors were delicate and went together very well.

What a meal this was.  I can't wait to go back!

This is a great classic Italian. The fresh bread that they serve is awesome! Assorted flavors baked in and all addicting. I had the lardons to start. Good if a little charred. I went with the classic spaghetti and meatballs. Good simple but fresh flavors. Also tried some of the different raviolis which were all good. Definitely on the pricy side but excellent view and staff to go along with the food.

It was good!
Went with 4 girlfriends last night, and all were pleased.
The ambiance was nice and the service was GREAT! It was really what set the experience apart from lesser fine-dining options, as opposed to the food.

The duck/foie gras ravioli was definitely the star at our table.
Two people ordered the spaghetti, which I tried. It was definitely tasty, but not hype-worthy. 
Other dishes hit the table- the scallop and short rib appetizers are small, and the short rib wasn't amazing. I didn't try a scallop.
I had the Jidori chicken (because I never order chicken and saw another review that insisted). Very good!

Recommended generally.

No words can describe how happy this experience made me. 

I was in Vegas for a slightly belated celebration of my birthday, and a timely celebration of my friend's. Scarpetta fell on the night we celebrated my birthday, and I am so glad! 

The restaurant looks great and the service is perfect. The waiters are all extremely knowledgeable and can answer pretty much anything. 

But who cares about that? The food... it was ridiculous! To begin with they bring out some bread, as with most restaurants, but Scarpetta bread is next level! There were some regular rolls which were bomb. But there was this one type, no clue what it was called...but it had some kind of meat inside! I thought the waiter mentioned that to us, but I figured I was hallucinating. Nope! It was phenomenal. The bread also came with butter and other accoutrement. All delicious!

So I could have left happy at this point. But my food slayed me. I think I may have actually died, said what up to a couple of angels, and then rejoined my table after frolicking on a cloud or two. I ordered the Black Fettuccine (pasta dyed with squid ink, adorned with king crab, squid, shrimp, and breadcrumbs while bathing in lobster broth). Need I say more? It tasted better than it sounds. It was more than worth the $42 it cost. 

I also tried my friends' flank steak (amazing) and black cod (also amazing). But lets be real...I won.

As a dessert we shared:

Bombolone - Basically an italian doughnut. There were five. Two filled with nutella and three filled with something white that by some ungodly magic was BETTER than nutella! Never thought I'd say that. It also came with banana gelato which just pushed my taste buds past their limits of joy.

Amadei Chocolate Cake: The richest most delicious chocolate cake you'll ever have. The inside was filled with molten chocolate goodness. It also came with toasted almond gelato. Also heavenly.

I implore you to try this restaurant when in Vegas.

Food wise over all, the executive chef clearly has an eye for rich flavours that spoil ---- but just gets a little carried away. Ambiance wise overall, you get an upscale New York feel, with 20% awkward service. 

There are pros and cons to Scarpetta - but overall a solid 3 star. 



The space is nice. It's just the right amount of trendy ambiance to be a great lunch spot or for a business meeting after hours. 
The service is good - my personal experience was a little awkward, but i can see the staff have solid training, management is seen, and it's obvious they have good service expectations of the staff in general.

Alternatively, this wouldn't be your top choice if you're looking for some 'warmth'. It's a little more sterile in that sense.

Food is where i was a little disappointed. I had Scallops, Octopus and the short rib Agnolotti. The amount of effort that goes into the appetizers is commendable. For the less than $20 price point, it's actually worth it when you factor in all the components.....but that's the problem. There are so many different components to the appetizers that it becomes really confused ---- and often rather salty. In terms of the pasta, if you're going to be a solid Italian restaurant, you need to get that right - sadly my experience showed technical flaws and inconsistencies.

After a long day of competing a bunch of us were SUPER hungry and wanted carbs.  We were in the Inglewood area so one suggested 500 Cucina where authentic Italian food with a twist is served and a reservation for 8 at 6:45pm on Saturday night was made. As we were gathering people, we realized there were more than 8 so when some of us arrived, it wasn't busy and they were kind enough to move us to a table to accommodate all 12 of us.  The table was right in front of the door so it wasn't the best on a cold night.

One of the first things I noticed was the live music which was really nice - and apparently they have live music every Saturday at 7!  We were handed menus and poured waters, and couple of us ordered some drinks so I was able to taste a sip of Pimms and lemonade which was really good and refreshing.   We all had decided what we wanted and the majority of us ordered pizza while some ordered pasta.  Mandy and I shared an order of meatballs and Diavolina pizza, only half with jalapenos. While we waited for our food, we were chatting away and as time went on, we were still chatting away and food was nowhere to be seen - I think we all started to wonder where food was because we were all extremely hungry until finally a part of our tables food came and we were getting excited but then....more food never came out - 4 out of 12 got their food and started eating because of our hangriness while the rest of us observed in jealousy. Our conversation started to become "I'm sooooooooooo hungryyyyy".  The 4 who got their food were midway through their meals when a waitress came up to the other end of the table and says that she has bad news "Okay....so unfortunately there's no food.......... *giggle* no, it will be a few more minutes - somehow the orders got split up in the kitchen" I think we all had this unimpressed blank stare at her.  Yes, we know she was trying to be funny but don't do that to a group of famished people -_-!!!! Any who, it was much longer than a 'few more' minutes and we were not impressed at all.  The others had finished their food by the time the rest of our meals came out and even bringing the food out, it was a mess - they gave the wrong orders to people but at that point, we were too hungry to care. 

Mandy and I had instant regrets with sharing because we wanted our own pizza by the time it came. Our order of meatballs came with 5, they were a good size and super moist with tomato sauce on top. The pizza was good, the diavolina came with tomato sauce, two types of spicy meats, black olives, jalapeno peppers and mozzarella. The crust was fluffy, soft and a little crunchy - they put whole jalapeno peppers on top so it can get pretty spicy, the salty meat, olives and the mozzarella cheese was a good combination with a kick of spice (I took the jalapenos off).  The pizza was good, we devoured it quite fast though - I didn't get a chance to ask others what they thought because there was a moment of silence when the rest of the food came out - all we wanted to do was eat.

Ohhhhhhhhhhhh 500 Cucina, I really, really, reeeally wanted to like you.  Although the live music was nice, food was decent, the service just didn't meet our expectations.  The food didn't come at the same time and it took way too long to arrive for our famished bodies and to top it off, at the end they had to ask whoever ordered drinks, how many they had because our first waitress's shift must have ended.  I don't think this is the first time this has happened either...

*SIGH* :(

I stumbled upon this place and boy am I glad I did. 
fresh food, fresh fish, seafood to die for and I can't believe the prices. You'd expect fine dining prices.... but not true and in Inglewood sooo close. Service was great too they really know their stuff. 
I will be back.
Decent food. The spaghetti was pretty good but I wouldn't consider it a meal. Hubby got the veal which he said was pretty good. Probably not a restaurant we'd visit again.

I was apprehensive to go somewhere so expensive for a friends birthday and honestly the menu didn't thrill me. 

First off the restaurant and service, ambiance the view - excellent. If this food appeals to you and you have the budget I would highly rec for a special occasion. I have to say tho I DO think that it is overpriced for many menu items but its fine dining at the Cosmo so what do you expect. 

As a group we ordered 3 pasta dishes, 1 soup and a desert. I tried the crab and corn soup - delicious as was the chocolate cake I ate. however the show stoppers were the duck and bone marrow pasta dishes - DEVINE. I would go back and order only those and eat them all and not share a bite.

Lovely restaurant with a view of the Bellagio fountains and a romantic atmosphere.  

You're given a bread bowl at the beginning of the meal with a nice array of breads with olive oil, butter, and an eggplant dipping sauce. The bread was amazing. 

We started with the black tagliolini, a pasta with squid ink, crab, and fish roe.  It was a unique dish with a delicate flavor.  The roe provided little bursts of sweetness which complimented the crab nicely. 

I had the Branzino, which was perfectly executed.  It was served with a saffron broth poured over it at the table.  Another beautiful dish with delicate flavors.  I do wish that some ellement of it had a bit more "pop."  Overall a very nice meal.

We came here to celebrate my partner's birthday, recommended by two gourmet friends. I made the reservation through the app Open Table and we got a place close to the window where we could see the Bellagio Water Show. It was awesome!!. We ordered Duck and Foie Ravioli, Creamy Polenta, Tuna Carpaccio and Al Ceppo, the most exquisite flavor,  I couldn't say which was the best!!, also an excellent selection of Wines,  a friendly Staff and a fine atmosphere that made an unforgettable night.

It was amazing!!!  One of the best meals I have ever had.  The service was great and very classy.  The Roasted Scallops were definitely the best Scallops I have ever had.  I also the loved our Pasta and Filet, the dessert was also great.  I had Coconut Panna Cotta with Pineapple and Guava Soup, which is now my favorite dessert!  I would go back for sure!!!

Our second trip to Scarpetta, and I can't deny anymore - I am in love.  How could you not love a restaurant that never says no?  Just get a bite to eat in the bar?  No problem  More bread?  No problem  Split plates, take a look at the dining room, what's in this cocktail, table by the window...all no problem.  The food and cocktails are all executed perfectly.  Next time I'm in maybe I'll pop the question.

Love this place!  Went her for my girlfriend's birthday and was delicious!  I had their Aged Sirloin of Beef Rare as possible for $36 and the Spaghetti Tomatoes with Basil is to die for here.  Service and atmosphere was perfect.

Can't want to go here again. =D

Emailed in advance and requested a table with a good view of the Bellagio fountains. And they duly obliged. Really good table and view. 

Had the 6-course tasting menu with matching wines. Some amazing food, especially the signature pasta dish with cheeks.

Only negative was the temperature. The air con was set to super cold and it was a bit much at times.

I went to this restaurant just to try the Spaghetti with tomatoes & basil as seen on the Food Network.  Unbelievable!  Also, can't forget the braised beef short ribs with polenta & truffled mushrooms.  So many choices in Vegas but this is one to check out.  Wine prices are a bit on the high side.

With hundreds of restaurants lining the strip, choosing one for dinner is no easy task. Scarpetta is one I will recommend over and over again. Everything from the wine to the ambiance to the food was fantastic, absolutely zero complaints from our group of 4. They have a great location in the Cosmopolitan overlooking the Bellagio fountains, request a seat by the windows for a great view. Their pastas are all homemade and delicious and I highly recommend making room for a couple of those if you can, but whatever you choose you really can't go wrong!

scarpetta is located on the 3rd floor of the cosmopolitan hotel.  you can either take the escalator or the elevators up.  if you do take the escalator to the 2nd floor, the escalator to the 3rd floor is around the corner not immediately next to it.  

they have a bar area if you can't get a reservation.  

they dim the lights.  the setting is nice and elegant.  the wine cellar is a whole wall of the restaurant.  we sat next to the wine cellar wall.  if you sit next to the window, you can get a view of the bellagio water fountain. 

the complimentary bread basket was extraordinary.  it consisted of ciabiatta, foccacia, homemade stromboli w/salami + smoked mozarella,  the stromboli was warm and reminded me of pizza. =)  it came with condiments of citrus infused olive oil, eggplant tapenade, and a mascapone butter.  

usually when the wine list is that extensive, we ask the waiter for recommendations.  he asks questions like would you like red or white...light, mildly bold, or bold.  we chose bold...which was the chianti...and sure enough it was very bold in flavor.  it comes in a glass flask.  this is to let the wine breathe before serving.  then they pour the flask into your glass.  they make sure that the wine arrives at the optimal temperature.  

our first appetizer arrived...the braised short ribs comes on a bed of risotto with shavings of parmesan cheese on top.  since they knew we were sharing, they split the portion so that we had our own pretty half of braised short ribs.  if they hadn't done that we may have fought over it.  deep flavors, tender ribs, and perfectly cooked risotto tickled our palates.  we enjoyed it so much that we asked the waiter for another menu to try more appetizers. 

we ordered the tuna scusi (which was recommended by the waiter) and the sea scallops.  the waiter came back to inform us that our entrees were already fired up...if we would want the rest of the appetizer to arrive before the entrees...or if it was okay that the entrees arrived and then to have the newly ordered appetizers..  we told him that whatever was done first was fine.  but that shows that they take enough care in serving their food to notify us.

the sea scallops were equally savory.  it was seared to perfection with several different types of mushrooms.  there was also a sunchoke sauce on the plate that tasted like a deep cream of mushroom sauce (but its different...but the closest flavor that i can think of..).

the tuna scusi was not as impressive, not because it was not a good appetizer.  it was like sushi...vegetables inside with thinly sliced tuna instead of seaweed wrapping the vegetables.  it wasn't bad but it just didn't have the wow factor of the previous two appetizers. 

now on to the entrees...

first we had the duck and foie gras ravioli.  adorable little triangular pillows of ravioli drizzled with a brown sauce.  do not be deceived with the small ravioli, these packed a punch of flavor.  hubby said that this dish worth coming for.  course he also laughed saying that there was a scarpetta location in beverly hills.  pasta bliss!

we also had the spaghetti with tomato and basil.  i read about this spaghetti so i had to try it for myself.  why was this spaghetti better than most spaghetti??  well, my answer came when i took the first bite, the spaghetti tasted like chinese hand pulled noodles!!! 

no one else has said that...but the spaghetti really did taste like chinese hand pulled noodles.  if you are familiar with it, you would know that the noodle is chewy and must be cooked al dente (example: like jia jiang mein).  it's chinese hand pulled noodle with an italian flavoring.  now you know. *wink*

there was no room for dessert.  the waiter commented that we did well since we devoured everything...two bread baskets w/condiments, three appetizers, and two entrees.  each dish had great presentation.  we stared at each plate for a couple seconds since it was "too pretty to eat"...before taking the first bite. 

oh, this meal was worth it.  the bill arrived and was less than we expected also.

food -- 5 stars
presentation -- 5 stars
service -- 5 stars

This would be a 4.5 restaurant in my book.  I would definitely come back or recommend this eatery for anyone who cares about the ambience.  Beautiful restaurant, great views of the Bellagio Fountain, service is on point and the food is above average.  However, next time I would order from the menu, the holiday fixed menu did not meet the expectations.

The spaghetti here is to die for! Perfectly cooked al Dente noodles. Fresh pasta. Made with olive oil infused with herbs, Parmesan, fresh tomatoes. I would come back just to have this spaghetti again. 

I loved the creamy polenta with truffle too!  

I'm going to book mark the other scarpetta location(s) too.

I don't know what all the hype is for. We had the spaghetti and short rib pasta and it was so very below average, I cannot tell you. The sauce on the spaghetti had no flavor and there was hardly any short rib in the agnolotti.  I can't believe this place has so many good reviews.  There are so many other good places to eat in Vegas, this is not it.
This is a great addition to Inglewood with friendly and knowledgeable service. Great arancini, crisp veggie filled insalata mista, and fresh made pasta with delightful sauces and ingredients.

I really wanted to like this place ... and I loved the way it looked and felt. But between the service that night and the food, I was really disappointed. 
There was 9 of us and we ordered apps to share, and most of them missed the mark. We had : frito misto, octopus, short rib, polenta, and the tuna rolls. The calamari had veggies and a UFO- unidentifiable fried object - polenta posing as calamari. That wasn't cute. The octopus was great, but it was swimming in this bland broth of garbanzos and tomato. Yuk. The polenta was good, if u like cream of wheat for dinner, and the short rib app was just bad. Cold and bland and slimy. 
Then came the mains -- I got the cod. Undercooked friggin cod. I can't have undercooked now. It. Was. Vile. I sent it back.
There was a problem with service that night, and the octopus came after the mains, and our potato and Brussels sprouts never came. As an apology the restaurant comped my dish (and another angelotti that was doing the backstroke in oil) and sent out 6 desserts on the House. 
I added a star because they made an expensive accommodation for their shortcoming tonight, and that def redeemed their service. The waiter was also very apologetic, and service is paramount to me, esp. in a high end restaurant.
I loved the bread basket and the mascarpone butter...so much that it ended up being my dinner...since the food just wasn't good that night. So kudos on the service portion of the meal, but I will not return to this restaurant.
Good for Las Vegas but not exceptional overall for italian food in general.

This is my first ever check-in on Yelp! 
I had a great dining experience at Scarpetta. The food was beyond delicious. The service was terrific and the view was breathtaking. We sat right next to the window so we got to watch the Bellagio water ballet as we munched on our perfectly cooked pasta and veal medallions. 

We ordered the braised short ribs with farro and the tuna rolls as our starters. The tuna rolls were not impressive but the quality of the tuna was great. The braised short ribs with farro was so good I could've eaten bowls and bowls of it. The beef was flavorful and tender and the farro was cooked to perfection. I wish we ordered another plate of the short ribs because I loved it. I ordered the famous spaghetti and it was one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. The pasta was so fresh, soft and chewy. It was simple but done perfectly. My friends ordered the tortellini with duck and foie gras, veal medallions and fresh pasta sheets with lobster, garlic and pistachios. Everything was delicious. For dessert, we ordered the napoleon with creme brulee and blood orange sorbet. 

Our server was attentive and not pushy. He also had a great sense of humor.  

It was a great experience over and I would recommend you stop by this place when you're in Vegas.

Okay, this was my 3rd time dining here and it gets better everytime.
Firstly 
When in Vegas, I choose to live like a king
I overtip
for the exception of Tacos El Gordo my family and I choose to fine dine
Being a sports better I chose January 10th thru January 15 
NFL divisional Playoffs and of course the college football nation championship game
and all the NBA and college basketball in between.

This trip we decided Scarpetta at the Cosmo, Prime at the Bellagio and Gordon Ramsays Steak at Paris.

we order the coli flour soup without the rabbit for my 6 year old 
2 orders of the scallops with Foie Gras for all of us to share 
Let me say the bread baskets and especially the eggplant dish they bring with it is absolutely amazing.
so back to the scallops and Foie Gras, perfectly cooked and delicious the poached pears went with the Foie Gras better than anything I have ever tasted.

Next our side dishes
fingerling potatoes were magnificent perfectly seasoned and cooked just right
the Brussels sprouts in creamed Pancietta and fuji apples was to die for, How do you make Brussels Sprouts taste so good?

Our main courses
Lobster Pici for my daughter, she mainly picked at the lobster 
I had the Foie Gras Ravioli 
my wife had the newest item called  TAGLIATELLE 
that could have been the best of the best
pork cheeks in a delicious pasta with an alfredo like cream sauce over it.

As I said, we eat at some of the finest restaurants in vegas, and for the 3rd trip in a row, we find ourselves still discussing Scarpetta 
the least expensive of the wonderful places we ate at is the one we cant wait to get back to.
Mr. Scott Conant, You sir are a PASTA GOD
Our Bill at Prime was 420.00 + tip
Our Bill at Gordon Ramsays was 360.00 + tip
Our Bill at Scarpetta 230.00 + tip and this is where we were satisfied more than any other place.

Food: 3.5 Stars
Service: 4.5 Stars 
Atmosphere: 5 Stars 


Scarpetta used to be my favorite Italian restaurant in town, but from my recent visit, it seems like it isn't the case no more. I believe it has a lot to do with Scott Conant is no longer involved with this place. 

We came in as party of nine and was lucky to get a private room/chefs table with the view of kitchen and fountain view. 

The service was decent and fast. I appreciate our server's Mike who provided honest opinions/suggestions. Mike was actually our server a few years back when we had our dinner party here as well. 

As soon as we got our bread basket, I realize the quality isn't there. I used to talk about their bread baskets to my friends since I love bread so much. Loved the variety and the warm and fresh bread. It's not the warm and fresh bread anymore. It's cold and a-okay bread. The eggplant dressing for the bread isn't the same either. The flavor was way off. 

Thankfully, most of the appetizers and entrees that we ordered were still decent. Although my friend felt like there's less lobster in Pici now. The texture of the pasta are still great thankfully.

Another let down was the dessert, I used to love their dessert. The banana soufflé and coconut panna cotta in guava soup were so good. The hotel took over the dessert department. Beside the cheesecake that our server recommended, all other dessert that we got were not impressive. 

Hopefully Scarpetta will improve and get back to the quality that they used to have.

Surprised my boyfriend with dinner here this past Saturday for his birthday. We made reservations for 7:30 and requested a table by the window. We were 5 minutes late because we had to stop by the ATM which, by the way, is located right at the foot of the escalator by security. We were greeted by the hostesses and manager who were all friendly. The dining room itself was a lot smaller than I had expected. They were able to accommodate our request and we were seated at a beautiful 2 top with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains. Water glasses were immediately filled and a bread basket magically appeared with 3 accompaniments: citrus infused olive oil, eggplant spread and my fav, mascarpone cheese... way better than boring butter! Like everyone has already mentioned the bread basket was delish! We also got a bottle of red wine for a great price, $75. We shared everything and for some of the dishes they were actually able to split it in 2 so it would be easier to share! This was my first time tasting fresh pasta and you can most certainly taste a difference. There's a specific bite and texture that can't be compared to that dry stuff at the grocery... 

-Raw Yellow tail: 4 very fresh pieces!!! Love the salt sprinkled on it. And the pieces were actually pretty thick and not some skimpy thin little things.
-Creamy Polenta with truffled mushrooms: Perfect balance of creamy and sweet. I liked it because it was more like a soup for me haha
-Braised Short ribs with Risotto: tender chunks of beef. Tasted like this Korean short rib dish that I love. 
-Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli: My favorite dish of the night. It was so decadent and delicious. If you don't like the taste of strong cheese, you will not like this dish. The sweet Marsala sauce paired perfect with it.
-Spaghetti: I'm sure some people have a problem spending $25 on a small plate of spaghetti but it definitely is something everyone should taste at least once. Light, fresh sauce with perfectly aldente pasta... It is because of this dish alone my boyfriend had been wanting to come to Scarpetta. He has made this recipe a couple times for me and I'm sorry to say but my boyfriend's spaghetti tastes exactly the same.. if not better. But then again my opinion may be biased HAHA
-NY Strip Steak: It was a mistake ordering this because we were so full. We had to force ourselves to finish this dish HAHA At $55 though I didn't think the steak was THAT amazing.. It actually had some unwanted gristle on it. But I'm sure it would have tasted a lot better had we not been SO full. 

I really wanted to get dessert for him and they were going to do something special for us but we were already so late for our show and not to mention so beyond STUFFED.. We had to run out of there... literally, we ran out of there! 

Service was amazing all night from our server all the way down to the lady who came around with parmesan cheese and chili flakes. But special shout-out to Paul K...the friendly food runner/expo who was so polite and quite knowledgeable about all of the food. 

THANKS SCARPETTA! 
SCOTT CONANT, YOU ARE HOT 
;ppp

It took until the last night, when perhaps I was thinking a little clearer, to realize that not only there was a Scarpetta's in LV, but it was in my own hotel! Scarpetta's is one of my favorites in NYC, and who knew it was SO close to me! My friend and I were looking for a romantic, filling date before our red eye home, and I insisted that we go here!

When walking in, we actually first walked in to the restaurant next door, as the signage is a bit confusing. We finally figured it out and found the right place. When walking in it is dark, romantic, elegant and seduces you with the high class, romantic but somewhat edgy vibe, the aromas are tempting, and the music hits the right parts of your soul. We were immediately drawn to the fancy special occasion room, which was set up to look like a palace, and the incredible timing of the Bellagio fountains was displaying in the background. As we kept saying all vacation, "What is Vegas?!" never was more true. We had the option to sit in the formal dining room, or the seats at the bar, and for some reason found the seats at the bar to be more cozy. The dining room had the same elegant, romantic but dark charm to it, while the bar was a little lighter and more lively. However, in the dining room you can get seats that overlook the city and the fountain (not real life).

Now the menu is the same, or mostly similar to the NYC location, so I already knew what to get. The classic pasta with red sauce (what they are famous for)! My friend got the pork belly, and we split the Brussell's. There really is no comparison for their food. Little words exist to describe the perfection of the flavors, aromas, textures, and presentation. All that you need to know, is that this should be a mandatory part of everyone's trip.

Very delicious! They got us a last minute reservation on a Saturday night. The fettuccine with veggies was outstanding. The Pici dish was also very good. The service was great, constantly refilling our waters and giving us more bread. It is very expensive, but worth it for a night out in Vegas.

Simply amazing!  Awesome good, fantastic service and great ambiance!  Can't get any better than this!  Went for Mother's Day/mom's birthday and they did not disappoint!  We were on a time crunch because the restaurant opens at 6pm and we were trying to catch Celine at 7:30.  We made reservations and got there and was promptly seated at 6.  We told our server, Johnny, of our situation and he just rocked it.  We already reviewed the menu before going in but it was Johnny and the staff that really made the magic happen.  Below are some of the dishes we had (sorry, they're not the fancy names but I don't remember them so I'm going to just make them up and you can try to figure it out).  All noodles are made in house and perfectly cooked.  Noodle plates were about $25-35 each.

1.  Black noodles.  ONE OF MY FAVS.  Sooooooo good!!!  They piled the roe on it and it was aaammmaziinng.  It was like having wonderful surprise bursts in every bite.  A MUST.

2.  Green noodles with lobster called PICI.  Another fav!!  Has a spice kick to it.  Not stingy with lobster and huge chunky pieces.  A MUST ORDER.

3.  Spaghetti.  Ok.  We got it because it was recommended by yelp reviewers, but wish we got another noodle dish like the spare rib one.  I would skip this one.  The other dishes are far more creative!

4.  Octopus starter.  Amazing!  So tender and did not feel like I was eating octopus.  Tasted and had the consistency of a more expensive sea animal.  

5.  Applewood smoked pork chop.  PERFECTLY cooked and you can taste the delicious smokiness.  My brother said it was the best pork chop he's eaten.  Soooo good!!

6.  Side of mushrooms.  Delicious!  Great side!

7.  Scallops.  Our eyes rolled to the back of our heads when we tasted this.  Soooo good!!!  And so tender!  

8.  Black cod.  Just melts in your mouth.  

9.  Mandarin soufflé.  So soft and the cream and ice cream with it was so subtle!  Perfect non heavy dessert to finish it off.  They even put a candle on it for my mom's birthday and wrote happy birthday!

10.  Bread basket (comes with meal).  Dude.  This might be the best bread basket I've ever had.  No joke.  Warm and delicious, it was dangerous because we didn't want to fill up on it but we kept eating.

Guys, if you want to impress your date, recommend a reservation at 6 exactly and get there like 5:45 to get a window seat with a view.  The window seats were all 2 table tops and filled up quick.  We got a booth because we were 5 people.  For groups of like 10, I saw a nice private room with a window view.  

Food was amazing, service was impeccable, cannot stress how amazing this place is.  Will definitely come back again to try other dishes!

Absolutely stunning atmosphere.  Thanks to other reviews, I requested a table by the window and I'm so glad I did.  We sat at a beautiful table overlooking the bellagio fountains.  Service was above and beyond.  We enjoyed a bottle of wine and some apps before dinner.  The lemon pasta was wonderful as was the duck.  
Thank you for a very enjoyable evening.  
We would surely come back here.
Great spot!  Food is great! Staff is excellent.  Very close to the Scarpetta in NYC.

3 1/2 stars

Came here for our 1 year wedding anniversary, and booked weeks in advance. We were greeted at the door and congratulated by the host, which was very nice. 

We were then escorted to the worst table in the house: a wobbly 4 top table in between 4 large parties of business men, where we couldn't hear each other talk. We were also given nasty looks when we asked for a booth away from the crowd seating. 

The food overall was 4 stars. The spaghetti and lobster picci were cooked al dente and were enjoyable, with perfect portions. The added meatballs were $8 for tiny bits over over cooked, tougher beef- we recommended skipping those. 

Drinks were average price for white table cloth dining, and were made very stiff. No disappointment here. 

Dessert options looked great, and we opted for the bomboloni's after seeing other Yelp reviews. They were just "ok". Even fried doughnuts with barely any filling inside, which ended up making us both sick later that evening. 

Overall we give this place 3.5-4 stars. Worth a try if you want fine dining Italian food when in Vegas, but nothing exciting and certainly not a "must visit" venue. We tried it, and don't feel the need to return.

So yummy!  Got the burrata,short rib pasta and my husband ordered the huge rib eye special. I could've eaten about 3 of my meals! My hubby called it quits and our waiter told him good effort. Overall a great experience. Wish they had gelato for desserts!

Wow...... just wow. I can't believe after all these years of coming to Vegas, I missed a place as sexually pretentious yummy as Scarpetta. 

Cosmopolitan Hotel is known as the place to see and be seen, and Scarpetta fits the bill as a place to eat sexy, while looking sexy. Like all key restaurants in the Cosmo, I don't consider anyone of them above a 4-star rating, so giving them 4-stars, means that it's among the best that this hotel offers. 

You absolutely MUST try their tomato basil spaghetti. Cooked to al dente perfection, I was simply amazed that I was able to find anywhere. If you're a foie gras fan, this is one of the few places in town that does it beyond right, including their foie gras ravioli. Their branzino is perfection.

But beyond these dishes, I wasn't overly impressed. Everything else seemed decent, but nothing amazing to the point of worthy mention.

Dessert was excellent though, so you definitely don't want to miss that if you have a sweet tooth. I highly recommend the panna cotta. 

Atmosphere is where I deduct a star. It's a bit too pretentious and dark for me. It's almost like I took a step back in time to a freak-sex club in the 70s. Think Studio 54 that reincarnated as an Italian restaurant, and you've found Scarpetta. It has an annoying level of pretentiousness, so the only way I'd come back is if I return with a group of people.

Came on a Wednesday evening, May 9, 2012.

Catching up on writing reviews, and I wish I could have forgotten about this terrible experience already.

Our party of 4 approached the hostess and politely asked for a table.  She looks up... no smile.  We're told the wait is about 15 minutes, and we reply it's not a problem, asking if it's ok to sit at one of the many empty seats/booths across the bar near the entrance.  She pauses before answering that it's ok (and only later do I sense that her response was a bit cold).

However, I'm still in high spirits from having arrived in Vegas that evening for extended weekend of friends and partying.  As we're led into the dining room, I marvel at the coziness.  The room is quite small, with what seemed like 3 rows of tables, with the window seats overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  It's more intimate than I expected, and I immediately filed the memory as a good place to bring a date.

We're led to a circular, chic booth that had, in hindsight, almost a diner-like feel to it... but it was an upscale setting, and was something I actually enjoyed so we could eat family style.

We had chosen to dine here because Arvin T had heard they had an amazing spaghetti.  But let's continue chronologically.  The bread basket came out, and it was amazing.  The stromboli was tasty, though I'm no expert, and we ended up asking them for a second basket.  The waiter was slow in bringing that second basket out, and I definitely felt like we committed a taboo... but that didn't stop us from reminding him to bring that out for us.

I'd go down a play-by-play for each of the items on the menu, but, to be honest, it wasn't very impressive.  I really hoped the food was so good that I could look past the mediocre service, which bordered on indifferent.  But, alas, it cannot be said.

I would still recommend this place to bring your date for a nice, intimate dinner.  The dim yellow lighting exuded a warmth that I only wished was completed by quality service I had come to expect from the Cosmo...  If service isn't important to you, esp in relation to money spent, then I would still suggest giving this place a go sometime.

However, I think of Vegas as a place to escape - a sanctuary away from the hustles of life.  Scarpetta let me down, and it was only the first punch in the stomach by Cosmo that night.

Had a fantastic dinner at Scarpetta on a Thursday night.  I'd had reservations here on 4 previous occasions and had to cancel for one reason or another every time.  Finally I was getting to try this joint.  We were seated immediately upon arrival.  The restaurant is larger than I was expecting, and if it wasn't full, it was very close.  Lively atmosphere, almost loud, but not quite.  I wouldn't say it would be good for a romantic evening, but it was great for a night out with friends.

Our server immediately approached us and presented us with an impressive wine list.  It may not be the best I've seen on the Strip, but it was well above average.  The prices are typical for a restaurant located in a higher end hotel on the Strip, so you might have some sticker shock.  We went with a barolo which was fantastic.  Service was great throughout the evening, no complaints at all.

In addition to the wine list, we were brought the bread basket.  This has various types of bread, but the one that stood out had bacon and cheese.  It tastes as good as it sounds.  I might try to steal some the next time I eat there to make a sandwich with it the next day, it was great.

To start, our table of 4 split 2 pastas:  the short rib agnolotti and the ricotta cavatelli with wild boar ragu and arugula.  The waiter advised that they were small dishes, so we went with 2 orders of the agnolotti.  Very glad we did, the amount we received was a perfect starter, but splitting the dishes among 4 would have been a stretch.  Both pastas were cooked to a perfect al dente.  Some of the best pasta I've had.  The short rib was very tender and flavorful, and the pasta to filling ratio was great.  Likewise, the wild boar ragu was incredible.  Rich and very deep flavors were seasoned perfectly.  I would be able to just eat a ton of this with a spoon, it was fantastic.  I'd even eat it cold.  

To eat, I went with the special of the evening:  veal osso bucco with risotto.  The veal shank was large and fork tender.  Full disclosure, a buddy of mine ordered this dish as well and his was NOT fork tender.  I saw him use a knife on more than one occasion throughout the meal.  Mine, however, was fantastic.  The meat was moist and melted in your mouth.  It's not the best osso bucco I've had, that honor still goes to the mighty Ferraro's, but it was an A dish for me.  The risotto was cooked well, but had a bit too much citrus for me.  But, I liked the dish enough to keep Scarpetta at 5 stars.

This place isn't cheap, but you can find a LOT higher prices on the Strip and the food you get won't be worth the additional cost.  I had a great deal of anticipation for eating at Scarpetta, and I was not let down.  I've found a new Italian place for my rotation next time I'm in town.

On the food alone, Scarpetta is probably a four star restaurant. But with the spectacular space it occupies (Cosmopolitan Hotel, overlooking the Bellagio fountains), it gets the five star nod from me. 

The perfect ambience is hard to ignore. Unbelievably swanky, Scarpetta just oozes Vegas. Dimly lit, white linens, dark wood and interesting light fixtures mix to create a very upscale atmosphere. 

Food wise, I enjoyed two appetizers: the pea soup and sea scallops. The soup excelled where other dishes didn't in that the pea flavor wasn't showed up by the cream. For the other appetizer that made up my one 'entree', I found my scallops to be cooked near-perfectly, but one of them suffered from too much char, rather than a nice caramelization. There was also a too-gratuitous use of garnishes, from radish, to micro greens, to apples and more. Less would've been more when the scallops are served with truffles white asparagus. 

The dishes our friends had all received the same comment: heavy. While its summer and seeing the words 'summer truffles' on multiple dishes is never a bad thing, all those dishes all felt so heavy with butter and/or cream. 

I would be remiss if I didn't cap this review with a mention of the bread. Served with dishes containing citrus-infused olive oil, cold eggplant spread and a mascarpone butter, the bread itself was out of this world good (though also heavy, as it's laced with a thin slice of salami and cheese). 

I can't say that my Scarpetta experience didn't live up to the hype. However, like much of Vegas, there was a sliver of feeling that the food itself didn't quite live up to the glitz and glamor of the restaurant itself.

I've been to Scarpetta in Beverly Hills and enjoyed the food there so I was delighted to see another location at the Cosmopolitan. I couldn't find any other review mentioning take out/to go orders and on Yelp, they're listed as not offering take out. The kids in our group really wanted pasta though so I thought I'd call to see if perhaps the information on Yelp was incorrect. They do in fact accept take out orders. The lady who answered my call informed me that she could take my order over the phone or I could come in and order at the bar. 

Ordering was easy and I found the staff to be welcoming and knowledgeable. Scarpetta is known for their spaghetti; however, the regular spaghetti sauce does have dairy and the noodles have egg. They removed the cheese and subbed in gluten free noodles to accommodate the kids' allergies. I myself had the duck and foie gras ravioli. All of our orders were delicious and definitely comprised of quality ingredients. It took about a 10 minute wait to make our order.

I'm glad that they offer take out because they were the only restaurant in Cosmopolitan that readily noted that they offered gluten free options. From my past experience with Scarpetta, I know the restaurant itself isn't meant for kids. Therefore I appreciate that we could still enjoy great food in our hotel room and avoid potentially disrupting fellow patrons' dining experiences. Only caveat is that the serving sizes are on the smaller side - arguably not really a surprise for fine dining. The thirteen year old inhaled his serving of spaghetti and the two year old easily finished half of hers in one sitting.

Better the second time, basic service - very slow, and not happy, but got the job done.

- complimentary bread - pretty good free bread. the best part was the eggplant tapenade and side of butter.
- Beet goat cheese - super cream goat cheese and perfect roasted beets. incredible.
- avocado and tuna sashimi - most fibrous and mushy, low quality flavorless tuna. 
- uni pasta - sweet and salty, chewy and delicious
- brussels - halved roasted brussels, too mushy tasted overcooked. Had better at cut and andreas
- mushrooms - yum
- shortrib agnolotti - im not a pine nut person and could really taste the nuts and not so much of the beef. meh just ok to me.
- pici - thick spaghetti with lobster, spicy, pretty good. my second favorite, would not get again.
- chocolate cake 2.5 stars - sub par mediocre chocolate cake
- marscapone cheesecake 3 stars - very standard circular shaped cheesecake with fruit mixed in it hink, i prefer cheesecake factory.

Had high hopes for Scarpetta since it is so highly rated on Yelp. We made our reservations many weeks in advance and had a nice window seat with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. That was awesome.

Service was overall decent. The bread basket was awesome. I'm not a huge fan of pastries usually but I finished all the bread in the basket. It was that good.

Creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms - This was amazing! We ordered 1 portion to share and they preemptively split the order for us. Cool.

Truffled burrata with roasted tomatoes and salsa verde sauce - This was their daily special and it was super delicious. This is a must order! 

Foie gras and duck ravioli - This was way too rich. We ate a couple of mouthful and had to get it to go :(

Uni pasta - Again, way too rich. We had a split order and couldnt even finish half the portion! :( 

I'm not sure why but both the pasta entrees were just too rich for us and that totally killed the experience :( I wish the waiter warned us more in advance :(

I was really looking forward to trying out this upscale Italian restaurant, but unfortunately I was disappointed with my meal. My group and I had read reviews prior and wanted to try the duck and foie gras ravioli after seeing so many pictures and positive opinions. Since 4 out of 5 of us ordered the ravioli, I assumed they cooked it in a big batch and maybe missed the seasoning step because each person though it tasted so bland. Thankfully our server took each dish off our bill, because nobody ate more than a few bites. I did get to try the spaghetti and that was really good. I'm kicking myself for not getting something different, but maybe I'll give this place another chance.

Scarpetta is one of Scott Conant's restaurants. He basically does everything right with this one. The food and service were amazing and the view of the Bellagio fountains wasn't half bad either. The homemade pasta's were top notch. I had the spaghetti. It was simple yet done perfectly. To me, that's the ultimate test of a kitchen and they passed with flying colors. There are so many restaurants to try in Vegas, and I'm still going to go back to this place next time I'm there.

This place is awesome! Friendly staffs, amazing foods, nice view to the Bellagio water shows and huge selection of wines! This place is perfect for a date, business meeting or just stopping in with the family!

Tasty food, fabulous service

I had the spaghetti, which is pretty bomb for being just spaghetti. I also tried someone else's steak and it was amazing... I need to return to get my very own.

Dessert - yum!!

Food is good... portions are medium to small.  

I went with 5 other girls and we had an amazing time.  Service was good, better than average... not great.

One of my friends had a meal that was undercooked but they were gracious and took it back.  

We really liked the view of the bellagio fountains but not every table has a great view.  

Its worth a try, but I won't be a regular here and it probably won't be a place that I suggest to go to.  The food is decent and good, but I've been so many other great restaurants with excellent food at a lower price point.

Overall, good food but overpriced.

Came here for my anniversary dinner. Was seated automatically at the most amazing window view table and the rest could only be described as the best dining experience of my life. We told our server, Roberto, to just pick stuff out for us and there was no disappointment at all. Spaced perfectly and everything was cooked to perfection-- the spaghetti is to die for! A special shout out to Kelli and Dom for coming by the table to check on us and making sure everything went perfect. I'll always recommend everyone to this restaurant and I'll be a patron for life. Bravo team, bravo!

Amazing, delicious, and the ambience is spot on. Located on the upper floors of The Cosmopolitan, one is struck with a blend of old world and modern elegance.

We were lucky enough to dine in one of their private rooms, with a view of the Bellagio fountains. The prix fix menu for our party was melt in your mouth delectable; and I don't think there was one item that any of us didn't wish we had more of (or more room in our bellies for).

The waitstaff were attentive and made the rest of the experience delightful. I can't wait to return!

Hands does my favorite restaurant of this year's Vegas trip! The atmosphere was dark, moody and romantic and they quickly sat us next to a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Watching the fountains go off every 15 minutes gave the meal that additional magic. We started with the basil spaghetti, our waiter split it into two portions so we each could sample it. It was amazing, the fresh pasta, tomato sauce and basil gave it a delicate taste and not over powering. Definitely a must get. My husband had the short rib ravioli and thought it was delicious and very flavorful. I got the salmon and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The greens were a bit bitter and burnt but that was the only negative we experienced. We finished with a salted caramel custard that was incredible. All the staff worked well together to be very attentive to us throughout dinner too. I'm pretty sure this will become a Vegas staple in our yearly trips!

Good food at high prices.  That's ok by me.

Have to give a big thumbs up to our server.  Not enough of a thumbs up to remember his name, unfortunately.  Looks like the Asian guy in the last Rambo movie.  Think he's on The Mentalist or one of those types of shows.  He gave it to his straight ie. this dish is no good and try this.  Always appreciated as long as you know what you're talking about.

Duck and foie gras ravioli - Despite being a foodie I am not big on the foie.  But this was a nice, rich, delicate dish.  A bit overpowering on the foie if you ask me but maybe I'm sensitive to that flavor.
Scallops - friends thought it was great.  I don't like scallops.
Steak tartare - pretty darn good.  Believe it was a Kobe beef tartare.  Nice beefy flavor (durrrr) though the accompaniments could have been better.  No toast points, no creamy sauce, no capers, eggs, etc.  Seemed a tad plain.
Spiced duck breast - waiter warned me against this as he thought it has too much cumin.  The cumin smell was indeed higher than even Master Yoda's midiclorian count but it's fate was not clouded by cumin taste.  The taste was strong with this one and more powerful than the waiter could ever imagine.  If anything, the cumin scent gave the dish focus, made it stronger.  (yes I like Star Wars)

Big thumbs up to the bread basket.  There was one with salami or some sort of cured meat with it.  Yummy.  Not sure the marscapone butter was any better than normal butter but it was goody goody.

If you have a bigger party be sure to make a reservation and ask for a table that overlooks the bellagio fountains. The background for dinner was pretty amazing. The view was beautiful. 

Came here for a friend's birthday dinner (happy birthday Aileen) last night and had a pretty good experience. The waiter and staff were pretty friendly but they could have filled the water cups more often. 

Scarpetta offers a complimentary bread basket with a couple different types of bread. One is even filled with cheese and meat!!  It comes with sides of marscapone butter, eggplant and olive oil. They weren't skimpy with seconds so I really liked that. 

I ordered the black tagliolini that comes with Uni, crab and roe. The presentation was beautiful. The roe on top really contrasted the black pasta. I thought it was pretty delicious and the portion size is deceivingly bigger than you think it is. I was super full half way through although I did load up on bread. I did see couple of Uni chunks in my pasta but the flavor wasn't that strong. I would have preferred if the Uni really popped. Overall I liked my pasta. It was warm, very creamy and very decadent. Lots of crab meat as well. I also tried their side of mushroom which was delicious and buttery. 

I thought their spaghetti was just a ok. The waiter said it's very simple but very popular. It had good flavor. The sauce was creamy and on the sweet side but I would definitely try more exotic things on the menu. The short rib agnolotti was super good. It was on the sweeter side with a brown butter sauce but I thought it was delicious!  The portion is less filling so order something else if you have a hungry appetite.

As for the drinks.. They were good and pretty strong but comes but a decent price tag. Most at $16.

I'm not sure if I want to give 2 stars or 3. It might not be fair as this place isn't equal to some of my 2 star reviews (it's probably better than most), but for the high price-tag....I think it's justified. The best part of my experience was my $20-a-glass wine. The $$ amount is to be expected in any nice place in Vegas, and I was happy that the wine was at least very good for the price (as they aren't always). Service was so slow, it took almost twenty minutes between being greeted and for the waiter to come back for drinks, and then the same wait from drinks to food and food to the check. We were on a tight schedule being on a work trip, so this was a little inconvenient. It wasn't even busy yet, either. For my food I split the Tagliatelle which I felt lacked in truffle flavor and their signature spaghetti dish which I felt lacked in overall flavor and should not be their signature dish. In general the food was not bad in any way, I just thought it was very expensive for what it was and for the lack of great service. Generally not a bad experience and I might be willing to give it another shot when back in town.

The happy hour is awesome 5:30-7pm. $7 apps and drinks at the bar! I love the duck and foir gras ravioli and the short rib agnolotti! The Limone martini is delicious. For Dinner the pici is absolutely amazing! I loved my experience at the bar and at our table. The staff is great. I can't wait to go back!

My girlfriend and I spent our Thanksgiving holiday in Vegas with our respective families.  The original plan for Thanksgiving dinner was to go to Caesars' Bacchanal Buffet, but since we were staying at the Cosmopolitan, the logistics of getting the family together there scrapped that Plan A.  Plan B was to go to the Cosmo's Wicked Spoon Buffet, but the three-hour plus wait resulted in us scrapping that one, too.  As a result, we made our way to Scarpetta since everyone likes Italian (right?) and they could accommodate our party of eight without reservations at 6:30 pm on Thanksgiving Day for dinner.  By this point, we were just happy that we found someplace...anyplace...for dinner.  

We were seated in a nice, small, private room looking out over the Bellagio's fountains to the north.  Matthew, our server, was exceedingly professional and knowledgeable about the menu, offering spot on food and drink recommendations.  We started off with drinks while we looked over the menu.  I had the Billionaire ($16) made with Elijah Craig, pomegranate syrup, Pernod Absinthe, and lemon juice.  Frankly, the cocktail was well made and pleasing, however, for the price, I wasn't impressed with the choice of Elijah Craig as the base spirit unless it was for their 18 or 20 year old stuff.  Of course, since they didn't specify, I assumed it was for the standard 12 year old bourbon.  For starters, the table shared an order of Crispy Fritto Misto consisting of seafood, vegetables, artichokes, herbs & lemon ($18) and an order of Creamy Polenta topped with a fricassee of truffled mushrooms ($17).  All elements of the fritto misto were fried to perfection, crispy, without a hint of sogginess, leaving the mix of shrimp, calamari and octopus tender.  I like polenta.  The polenta was creamy as advertised and as good a polenta as I've ever had.  That said, it was $17 for polenta...a bit pricey.  Chef Scott Conant and his Scarpetta are known for its fresh made pastas, so for my main course, I had the Pici, a thick, spaghetti-like pasta, with lobster, preserved tangerine & bottarga ($36). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=EmJ-zvY2Ihq8gwDluU6IPQ#qPDstnGpczl7IsR5MB4p5g  I'd never had pici before and it was a hearty, filling pasta.  It was tossed with restraint with what I'm assuming was only olive oil, the preserved tangerine, bottarga (a dried, pressed fish roe), and tender chunks of lobster claw meat.  The pasta dish was outstanding as the flavor profile and aromatics of each ingredient were present and in perfect balance.  While it was one seriously pricey bowl of pasta, it tasted like it was worth every bite as it hit my tongue.  The gf and I split a side of roasted mushrooms consisting of trumpet royale, beech, and shitake mushrooms, topped with pecorino and trucioleto vinegar ($11) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=EmJ-zvY2Ihq8gwDluU6IPQ#EmJ-zvY2Ihq8gwDluU6IPQ  It was a nice plate of fungus and excellent complement to my pasta. 

Scarpetta may not have been our first choice for Thanksgiving dinner, but it was definitely a good choice.  The food was well-executed and delivered amazing flavor.  Service was attentive without any hint of intrusiveness.  The only downside was that it was quite expensive and some items seemed overpriced for what was received.  Still, Scarpetta is a fine restaurant and perfect for a special occasion...even Thanksgiving dinner.

Last night, myself and three other people had dinner here. To preface this, I knew we were going to drop a wad... I excepted excellence, I got mediocre at best. First, wine is very expensive; $75 for the least expensive bottle. Second, the food was luke warm. Third, the restaurant was empty yet we were sat in the center of the room pushed up against a pole.
Honestly... I was really excited about this place, and it was a complete let down. I guess this place has a nice view.... I wouldn't know because I was sat at the worst table in the restaurant, even tho it was empty. Out of the 4 entrees we ordered, one was excellent, and the other 3 were forgettable. For the money I spent, I was hoping for something I could tell people about. I won't mentioning this place to anyone.

My wife, friends and I decided to try Scarpetta for the first time. We were expecting a 5 star experience.  Bottom line: We were DISAPPOINTED.

We arrived early and I approached the Hostess area to let them know the 5 of us would have a drink at the bar prior to dinning. I did request a specific type of booth that would accommodate the us facing the Bellagio. She barely spoke to me and had an attitude as if we were lucky to dine in her establishment. She did accommodate us but her attitude had us very DISAPPOINTED. 

The wine list is extensive and has some great varieties. We ordered a bottle for the 5 of us. I noticed other patrons had some special chips at the other end of the bar. None for us? Not from the bartender. After waiting 10-15 minutes I had to walk over to the other side of the bar and get them myself. I then (Jokingly) told the bartender how good the chips were and he said, "Yes-aren't they!" Very DISAPPOINTED.

The dinning room is beautiful and we had a wonderful server, Titus. He was knowledgeable and professional. He was a bright spot during the evening. Our group had the endive & apple salad and braised short ribs for starters. They were very good and we highly recommend both.

For our mains we had the spaghetti with tomato and basil (somewhat DISAPPOINTED) halibut (wonderful) and the rib eye (very DISAPPOINTED). Our friend ordered the rib eye medium and it came out very rare. He returned it for more fire and it came our perfectly. The problem was that we ate our mains without him and he then consumed his as we watched him. Very DISAPPOINTED.

I ordered the chocolate souffle for dessert. It tasted very ordinary and seemed as though it may have been frozen.  I know you can't compare any souffle to Eiffel Tower Restaurant but I'm surprised they served a tasteless dessert here. Very DISAPPOINTED.

There are so many fantastic restaurants in Vegas. There were some bright spots but we will not return. We were DISAPPOINTED.

If you go here at night, make sure you get a good view of the Bellagio fountains because that's half the experience of going here. The other half is the delicious ham and cheese bread they give you. I probably could have just eaten that for a meal.

Anyway, food came out a little slow. The duck and foie gras ravioli was indeed salty as another reviewer mentioned. I did enjoy the short rib agnolotti though. Not sure if I've ever tasted anything like it before.

3 1/2 stars?  Dined with a group of 8 last night.  The atmosphere is cool and chic.  We enjoyed the breads and spreads.  The menu changes seasonally so any online searches may get you different or incorrect results.  

The oysters to start were delicious and we shared bites of the braised short ribs of beef.  I had the stracci which is lobster, king crab, and shrimp over thin pasta.  It was good but a lot of pasta to eat.  I had the side of honey glazed carrots with roasted Sicilian pistachios which was very good.  Shared a bite of the brussel sprouts, but  not a fan so can't judge.

The cocktails and wine are extremely over-priced.  Markups on some bottles of wine were at least 300% and up.  I recommend a glass of your favorite to accentuate your email but this is no place to get your drink on.  Save your drinking $$ for after dinner out on the town.

The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Took care of us promptly and with enthusiasm.

Not sure I would return. There are many restaurants still to explore in Vegas, don't limit yourself!

The BF and I had trouble deciding where to go for our anniversary and he had put me to the task of finding a place with a scallop appetizer and a solid light white fish entree and Scarpetta won out in our short lists of places that fit the bill. 

I love the 50's low lights and bold dark wood grain used in the restaurant. We were seated by the windows to witness a rainy and moody sky (which I happen to like). People said this is a nice view...but there is a large partition on the windows and it happens to be at eye level.  I cant see the water, only the top of the spray of the Bellagio show. It defeated the purpose a little bit....

STARTERS

We started off with the raved about bread basket. There was a stromboli in there rolled with cheeses and salami that was delicious. If I could order that at the lounge I would. There was also sourdough slice, a bread roll, 2 herbed foccacia squares. They give a trio of butter, a eggplant caponata and citrus infused oil. Caponata was lovely and all the bread was warm, soft and nicely crusty.

ROASTED SEA SCALLOPS- which they split onto two presentations for each of us to have one. It was a very fresh scallop, nicely seared. There was a light spice that came through as you chewed it, capers and bottarga on top gave some briny flavor, micro green some bitterness and salmoriglio made for a nice creamy sauce to it. It was served on top of a steak of cauliflower that was nicely roasted. 

DUCK AND FOIE GRAS RAVIOLI with marsala reduction - was one I was very curious about since many rave about this and the spaghetti. I've had the spaghetti before in LA (and did not weep) and now that I actually know the Scarpetta recipe and have replicated it, I wanted to know if something else was rave worthy. This was tasty, but it was just a bit TOO rich for such a big plate of it.  Some may love a whole heap, but I'm glad it was split as a appetizer...and still there was too many for us. We're freegetarians ( semi vegetarians) and don't really have many rich foods since switching over to the dark side..

ENTREE

MEDITERRANEAN BRANZINO - Came with 2 nice sized filets with nicely crisp skin and beautifully flaky meat. If came with a bed of braised leeks, celery root, shrimps, clams and mussels and had a seafood broth reduction as a sauce so it was very clean, sea flavors going on here.

BLACK COD - fish was nice and buttery, with a herbaceous,somewhat anise tasting, tomato glaze and micro chives. It had caramelized fennel & roasted tomato to go with. I've always had black cod aka butterfish in a Asian preparation so this was interesting to try something different. 

The BF preferred the Branzino and so did I.

DESSERT 

ZEPPOLE - with nutella center, vanilla sauce & candied hazelnuts was divine. These were rich pillows of heaven. I love zeppoles and beignets of all kinds and this is among the best I've had. Will come back. Just for these. 

BROWN BUTTER HAZELNUT CAKE - the name makes it sound like it would be more brown buttery cakey thing, but it truly was more about the lemon curd, meringue. I'm slowly growing to like lemon desserts and this was good enough to make me believe in it. It had olive oil gelato & candied hazelnuts to go which gave a light savory aspect to it. This was a great choice to balance out the zeppole since those were just dense and this was bright. 

Service was decent. There was a mixup with the kitchen and our appetizers went to the wrong table at first, back to the kitchen and eventually to us. Service cleared plates and refilled drinks quite frequently and checked on us. A little weird note but in the area we were seated the chef was coming around and talking to tables and even serving one of the tables around us. I guess good that there are regulars but found little awkward as well. 

It was a solid choice for dinner and went home happy. I see they have a vegetarian menu and have a nice lounge area so I would consider coming back for a snack there and those zeppoles...I don't know if I would do a "all out" dinner here again though.

The night after our dinner here we went to a establishment off strip and the flavor and quality was on par with better prices, vibe and surpasses in service. 

Overall, Scott Conants place is solid for the Strip and I'm glad it is here, but it was surprisingly not the star of our weekend.
Awesome location, try to get a window seat.. Nice view of Bellagio and Cesar's. Food was great, service was better. Would definitely come back.

Very good location,(Can see well Bellagio water show from window side) And good staff, Good service. Wine also good.
But a meal is not for me, not well bread. Most food feel taste oily,
Take wife or girl friend and just eat appetizer and drink wine, Thats it.
I will never come back here.

I'm such a celebrity chef ho.  But don't let that influence the credibility you assign this review because I'm a discerning celebrity chef ho who tells it like it is.  

This. was. perfection.

I travel a lot for my jobby job and whenever it takes me to new places I always do a quick search to see if any of my celebrity chef crushes have a spot to crash.  Enter Scarpetta.  Everybody knows Scott can cook.  The man is impressive.  And the "this is the worst thing I have ever put in my mouth" bravado just adds to his charm (for me anyway).   So when you are slanging that kind of bravado your restaurant better back it up, right?  

It. does.

From the meated butter (yes I said that), to the incredible breads, spicy lobster pasta, to the perfectly cooked duck, to the happy anniversary sweets, there was not one element that was not first rate.  The food was exceptional.  The interior design was exceptional.  The service was exceptional, and the view overlooking the Bellagio fountains.

Exceptional.

I think I might have had too high of hopes.  It would really be a 3 1/2 star rating.  It took awhile to get a cocktail but I understood that we were a bigger party.  The cheeses we got for an appetizer were really good.  I ordered veal even though I know this is more a pasta place but we were getting the spaghetti to share.  The veal was ok but didn't seem worth the cost.  The spaghetti was tasty but I didn't understand the stellar reviews on it.  The service got better and overall I enjoyed the dinner - but just seemed a bit overrated.

One of my favorite Italian places! The short rib agnolotti is so scrumptious. The little bread crumbs they add on top adds the perfect texture. The sauce is mouth watering. I also really enjoy their spaghetti. It looks small but is so filling. They have a beet salad that is a great appetizer before the filling entrees they have. One time I went their twice in a row for dinner, it's THAT good

The host seated our party so we got the full view of the bellagio fountains. 

The foie gras ravioli was my favorite. The flavor was rich with the right amount of sauce. I wished the portion was bigger. Wished California didn't ban foie gras as well.

The duck was good as well. Crispy skin and super soft on the inside

We came with a party of 5 for dinner. Our view was amazing. We were seated right next to the window. We could see the Bellagio water fountains every time it went off. If I were to base my rating just on the ambiance and view of the restaurant, I'd give it a 5. 

Unfortunately, the food wasn't impressive for the price. I had the pici and shared the creamy polenta. The pici had a really good chili pesto sauce. The pasta and lobster was perfectly cooked. But I expected the dish to wow me and it didn't. My favorite dish was the polenta. It was delicious. 

Our server was friendly. I think it's worth a try, especially if you can get a view of the fountains. I think there are other restaurants in Vegas that are great and better priced. I'm not sure I'd come back.

Skip the primi, dive into the secondi.  Scarpetta excels at pasta.

While it is true, a recent trip to Italy has forever altered my perception of Italian food (the reason for the loss of a star), Scarpetta delivers with an Italian chic décor, light spirited service, contemporary plating, and Italian cooking sensibility.

Straight to the pastas.  Plated as a secondi (second course before the main), portions are smaller.  Do like the Italians, save your bread to mop up the left over sauce once you finish the pasta.  Trust me, do it, you'll understand.

The tagliatelle with a truffle zabaglione and guanciale, a take on carbonara is excellent.  All the flavor of carbonara are there, just lighter. The pasta is toothsome and near perfect.

Duck and foie ravioli.  Thin sheets of translucent pasta around packets of duck and melting foie.  Glazed with a sweet marsala and duck stock reduction.  The sauce is enriched with dribbles of foie fat as the little packets are broken open.

Finally, the spaghetti with tomato and basil is a take on amatriciana.  Simple, fresh pure of tomato, hint of fresh basil.  Clean flavor.

Although I'm happy with two or three pastas, most think I've gone foodie crazy so if you must, the  mains.  The spiced duck breast with endive, preserved orange, and cipollini onions is excellent.  Perfectly rendered, the skin of the rare duck is crisp with no cloying underlying raw fat.  It's earthy, ducky flavor cut by the sauce of preserved orange and duck jus creates a very well balanced dish.  Not to be outdone, the fennel spiced black cod.  Hints of licorice taint the delicate flavor of the cod, the acidity of tomatoes and the briny, salty flavor of olives elevate it.  Unfortunately, I couldn't find the mantecato of baccala the menu promised.  All good, the dish worked.

Great wine list.  Heavy emphasis on Italy.  

Is Scarpetta truly Italian?  No.  (You should still tip your server; I miss Italy).  It does however, deliver a great experience.

I'd like to preface this review by saying I haven't had very many fine dining experiences. That being said, this is by far one of the best in terms of food quality and service. Yes, it is indeed pricey, but that should be expected with any fine dining experience no matter where you are.

I can only comment on the dishes I tried, so here they are:
+ Complimentary bread & spread - All of the bread was great. For our spread, we had olive oil, egg plant, and marscapone cheese. I've always preferred butter instead of olive oil, but this one was quite tasty. The olive oil had an almost herbal/spice taste to it. The egg plant is prepared with a tomato sauce or something, so it paired really well with the stromboli bread.
+ Roasted Sea Scallop appetizer - Delicious, practically melts in your mouth. The portion is rather small as you only get two.
+ Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli - Very rich to the point where it was almost a struggle to finish the plate, but it was so scrumptious, I couldn't stop eating.
+ Spaghetti - Probably one of the best I've ever had. Pasta perfectly al dente with just tomato and basil, but the sauce had a creaminess to it that made it divine.
+ Black Cod - Another great dish, but overshadowed by all of the other fantastic plates. It was seasoned well. The accompanying cherry tomatoes tasted so bright. If I ever go to Scarpetta again, though, I'd probably forego this dish and try something else.

Lastly, to expand on the service aspect, our waiter was very personable, cracking a few jokes throughout the night. He was helpful with making suggestions on the menu and explaining everything. Our water glasses never really went low. Oh, and the view of the Bellagio fountain was gorgeous. Only downside is the window divider thing was right at eye level, so we had to look above or below it to see. Definitely a wonderful restaurant for a date night, though.

Love it. Simply elegant food that is cooked to perfection. We were lucky to get good seats next to the window that overlooks the Bellagio fountain that made the meal extra special. The servers were numerous. We had a different person for almost every type of service; one guy who pours the water, another who seats you, another who takes your order, another who brings out the dish. It was very fun to get pampered. 

We split the spaghetti and ordered mushrooms and brocollini as sides. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the tomato sauce is creamy with great flavors. Really a satisfying meal despite it's simplicity. The sides are as amazing as the main dish if not more! Again, we didn't order anything too exciting but the flavors are spot on. 

Will definitely come again and look forward to having the same dishes all over again.

We were seated at a table by the window with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The atmosphere is the best thing about this place. While the Cosmo pushes the boundary of being too gaudy, even for Vegas, Scarpetta is sleek and elegant in a refined way. The dining room doesn't feel crowded, and while it's quiet enough that you'll sometimes hear other conversations, the noise isn't intrusive.

In addition to wine, I ordered a Pisco Flower off of their cocktail menu. It was well made, but nothing to write home about.

The complimentary bread was outstanding, as were the accompaniments. They brought us olive oil, an olive tapenade, and a creamy mascarpone spread.

We ordered the brussell sprouts, broccoli rabe, and burata as appetizers. The burata was good, as were the pickled beets that came with it. The brussell sprouts cam with apple slices and a cream sauce. It was fine, but would have benefited from more caramelization on the sprouts. The broccoli rabe was just disappointing. Indistinguishable from the version you might get  at a diner or buffet on the side of the highway.

I ordered the fettuccine as my entree. It was delicious, one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. Someone pointed out that it tasted like pizza. This brought it down a bit after seeing that it was true. It tasted like a sausage and roasted pepper pizza, but this wasn't a bad thing. My friend had the famed duck foie gras ravioli, and it fell short. The foie gras filling was rich, but airy and light. It felt incomplete without a heavier component to pair with it. Perhaps my bite missed one of the small dabs of sauce that was strewn about. I didn't try the agnolotti or the spaghetti that were also ordered, but they looked very good.

Our server brought our friend a nice little dessert sampler for his birthday at the end. Service was great throughout, but it felt a bit odd when they began clearing plates before everyone was finished eating.

Overall, had a great time here and would come back.

The restaurant itself was very nice, we got a table right by the window where it had a great view. The menu was very simple. we ordered the braised short rib as an appetizer, the meat was very tender and had lost of flavor. we ordered the duck ravioli and it wasnt as good as people on yelp said it to be. the sauce was a very sweet but bitter sauce and overall wasnt that good. We also had the roasted chicken which was good, but had that same sauce that made it taste funny. We ordered the spaghetti just to try it, and it was very plain, no meatballs, and the noodles were a little harder than what they shouldve been. for dessert, we had the coconut panna cotta that had caramelized pineapples and a guava soup with ice cream which was so good!

Their cheese bread is amazing!! It might be on a secret menu cause our server was confused, but the lord heard my prayers and cheese bread with salami was delivert! AMEN, spaghetti was coo too!! K bye thankssss

Beautiful restaurant, delicious food. We had a table of 6 and tried the Pre Fix menu.
Our table was in a perfect spot to watch the fountains - the restaurant was so accommodating- service was impeccable- several dishes were brought out compliments of the chef. Delicious!!
We had a wonderful evening!
I can't wait to visit Scarpetta's again.

This place has ruined me. I'm never going to be able to eat dried pasta again, only the fresh stuff for this girl. But seriously, they MUST have Italian grandmas cranking out homemade pasta by the pound. Easily the best Italian food I've had. Definitely an upscale place.
