I've had several food items (spaghetti, foie gras and duck ravioli, ribeye, multiple glasses of wine, raw yellowtail, pici, short ribs, and the dessert doughnuts) and every single thing is delicious. Service is perfect, I was never in want of anything. Servers are knowledgeable and passionate about what they're serving. Also wonderful wine recommendations. Something that I din't expect is getting the best steak I've had in this city here. Their ribeye is without a doubt the finest piece of red meat I've had in my life. If STK is too busy (it is), but you still want a great steak, come on over to Scarpetta. You will not be disappointed. Another great thing to mention is the view. Wanna wow your lady with a great view of the Bellagio fountains? Make a reservation and request it.

This restaurant is a gem!  After eating at Chef Conant's other restaurant, D.O.C.G., earlier in the year, we decided to try Scarpetta.  We were NOT disappointed.  I called two weeks ahead to request a signed cookbook.  The manager confirmed he got me a book and confirmed our reservation.  We were greeted with a warm smile and prosecco in honor of our anniversary.  My husband and I did the tasting menu with wine pairings and the staff went out of their way to serve us exquisitely prepared food, as well as a few additional dishes in honor of our special evening.  The pasta was fresh, the product was amazing and the wine pairings complimented all of the dishes perfectly.  Our favorites were the spaghetti and the foie gras ravioli - TO DIE FOR.

We had a fabulous meal at Scarpetta last night!  We split the Heirloom Beet Buratta Salad and Creamy Polenta with Mushroom appetizers.  Both were amazing but the Polenta was the best I'd ever had. The bread basket was also unbelievable.  For entrees, we each had the Spaghetti, which was simple yet somehow unbelievably tasty.  We also shared the filet, which was perfectly seasoned and prepared.  Lastly, we had the Banana Souffle which was out of this world.  In all, the food was among the best Italian dinners that I've had.

Why 4 stars?  The wine menu, while long, has no affordable choices.  We struggled to find a bottle of red under $100, which I think is ridiculous when there are so many amazing affordable wines at cheaper price points.

Well the view alone makes this a spectacular dining experience. Ask to sit near the window when making reservations so you have a nice view of the Bellagio fountains at night. We started off with the creamy polenta with mushrooms and oh sweet god was it delicious. Every single bite was amazing. We then ordered the duck foie gras ravioli and the spaghetti with marinara sauce. I know spaghetti sounds like such a simple thing to order but our waiter was raving about it. He was right- it was done to perfection. I will have to try the Scarpetta in NYC and see how it compares
Amazing service , food and attentive servers ! It's a trendy quiet place. Great place to enjoy dinner with a view of the Bellagio across the street. Dessert----so beautifully made.

Sexy Italian restaurant with a French spin (they had foie gras). Beautiful indirect views of the bellagio fountains. Delicious pasta. Great wine list. What more could you want? A must try especially if you're staying at the Cosmo.

Easily one of the best meals we have had on the strip.  From start to finish, from the service to the food to the view, there was nothing anyone at our table could say negatively about Scarpetta.

I had the Black Cod which is apparently becoming very chic now.  It was so light and buttery that I only wish I could have had more.  It almost melts in your mouth.  

Going as a group was beneficial because we were able to try several of the pasta dishes and share.  I'm not sure the pastas are enough as an individual entree but probably too much for an individual appetizer...if that makes sense.  They are perfect for sharing.  We went with the short rip agnolotti, traditional spaghetti, and duck foie gras ravioli.  All were awesome, even the spaghetti which was a surprise to those at the table doubting a typical or plain type of pasta was worth a try.

I would also highly recommend the lamb, at least 3 people at our table got it so I was lucky enough to have a bite or two.  It was perfectly cook on every plate and was so tender it was definitely a star of the menu.

From the moment you walked into my life,
Everything felt so right.
From the moment I looked into your eyes,
I knew I had to make you mine...at SCARPETTA! - Jason Chen (solo player original)

The service here is out of this world. Everyone greets you so warmly, not just your own waiter. The view of the strip is spectacular as well. The different types of bread and dipping thingies that they give u complimentary to start the meal was pretty amazing. The duck and foie gras ravioli was really special, really filling (in a good way) and the taste of the filling wasn't overpowered by the sauce reduction. No room for dessert unfortunately although the menu looks pretty simple. Great meal and not at all expensive. If i lived in vegas, i'd come back many times. Try it!

Food: 5 stars --- Service: 5 stars --- Atmosphere: 4.5 stars --- Price(value): 5 stars

Food:
Foie Gras duck ravioli:  a mediocre sized dish, with oily ravioli stuffed with slim slivers of duck breast and foie gras. maybe foie gras is not meant to be cooked, but it was not a 5 star experience. despite my description it was good, but not great. I would expect more for what i am paying. 

BBQ ribs and bone marrow pasta: another ok meal, with the small chunks of meat in them. 

Seared scallop: VERY delicious. this was a wonderful appetizer, it set the par at which i was expecting the rest of the food to be at, unfortunately nothing did. Very juicy, and the bacon wrapping it was just the right amount of crispy.

Service:
I Hated the service, we had some snobby waiter that was quite rude. no help with description of food, not even a smile. I just didn't like him. Our waters were refilled once. this is a fine dining restaurant, I expect my water to be filled each time i reach half way. For Las Vegas standards this place FAILED miserably. I sit at the far end of restaurant in Bachi burger and my water gets filled constantly. any restaurant, fine dining or not, the people serve with a smile. the food runners were nice enough though. the service did not meet the standards one would expect at a restaurant like this.

The restaurant:
we had a pretty nice view of the Bellagio water works. we were one table away from the window, but it was still nice. the decor was nice too, i liked the way set up, the tables seemed to be stacked higher and higher as they went away from the window. chandeliers were very fancy. the decor met vegas standards. 

all in all probably not going back, not worth the money.
You feel like they put attention to every detail, and not only the food. Just wish they had at least a bottle of red wine below $80 !

From the outside, it just looks like a regular restaurant with a bar in the front. But as you make your way, the places says fancy all around. I went here with a bachelorette group and it was a nice flashy restaurant to celebrate such an occasion.

The service was great, however, it did take some time for the server to get to us. They were hospitable and made sure everything was set in order for you. Their selection looked great. The dish I chose was $45 (Prime Beef whatever lol I'm not sure what the dish was called). It was tasty but small. I will admit, I like to enjoy my food but I do want some quantity in it as well. For that $45, I would be able to get a bigger piece of beef elsewhere, however, it wouldn't have been cooked by the famous chef and that restaurant. Sadly, I do not ever no who that is. HAHA! Nonetheless, the beef was amazing and tasted great. The side potatoes and mushrooms added flavor to the beef and mixed well.

When it comes to the drinks, I advise you just get it elsewhere. Small martinis or little drinks were $15+ and when it came to wine, just be careful with your wallet! Some bottles are worth over $1500! And that's wine that was bottled in 2002-2005! Just go to the nearest store and enjoy that Stella Rosa!
Cool place with great food but terrible service.

Jason was absolutely phenomenal! Accompanied by the wonderful Adriana, this team works well together & was very attentive to our group. He is very charismatic & charming. Not only was he a great server, but his personable personality had us laughing & enjoying our time even more. Scarpetta accompanied us with a table next to the window to view the Bellagio water show & helped us celebrate our girlfriends 30th birthday. Thanks for your food recommendations & stellar service!

My dining experience here was out of this world. The interior of the restaurant was absolutely beautiful, with modern & elegant tables & lighting.  We started off with the wagyu beef tartare and the creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms. The polenta was unbelievably creamy and luxurious!  Then my friends and I ordered the tagliatelle, duck & foie gras ravioli, short rib agnolotti, and colorado lamb loin done medium rare. Everything was delicious, especially the lamb. The best part of the night was surprisingly the stromboli that was part of the bread basket at the beginning of the meal - buttery, fluffy slices of bread that was stuffed with salami & cheese. I am going back just for that bread!

First of all, this place has some great views of the Bellagio fountains- if you can get a good seat. The service is very good and give great recommendations. The lighting is very dim so be prepared to look closely at your menu.
As for the food, the portion sizes for the apps were good for 2 or more to share if you wanted to go that way. Beef carpaccio was excellent and the polenta is a must get, might not want to share that one. The octopus was ok but not fantastic with lots of beans.
Another must get dish is the spaghetti, simple yet stunning. You can add meatballs if you wish but this is just some good old fashioned spaghetti with freshly made pasta. 
For dessert the best thing to share is the budino, but the soufflé was also really great.
The price is a little high so value might be in question but there is no doubt the food quality is off the charts. 

4.5 stars

Bread basket. It has stromboli. Perhaps not the stromboli you order up at a pizza spot, but it is layers of delicious dough and meat. And, this treat was truly the highlight of my meal. If it weren't for that and the beautiful surrounds, the meal would have been a tad disappointing. 

Since inhaling about 10 of their yellow tail tuna at Taste of the Nation, I have been eagerly awaiting a trip. Of course, we had an order of yellow tail, and I must say the preparation was better at Taste of the Nation. Not sure how serving it up poolside away from their kitchen could produce a superior product, but the seasoning wasn't singing quite the same tune. Nonetheless, it is still a good dish. 

We decided to order the spaghetti because we were told it was featured on Best Thing I Ever Ate. The dish was good, but the tomato basil sauce wasn't unexpected. The flavors were delicious, but in a middle of the road way, not a fine dining way. I have had similar sauces at much lesser restaurants that delivered the same gustatory satisfaction for a much lower price point.

If you are going to dine here, I personally think you should skip the spaghetti despite its hype. For my visit, the food overall hovered around a 3, but the space is absolutely gorgeous especially if you get a seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Make that happen, and you've got a very promising spot for a date.

Great short rib pasta, very snobby service. Skip the crispy fritto appetizer - it's a joke. It actually probably was the worst part of our meal. Why is this on the menu? $18 for fried salty breading, really? But good job on the pasta!

I'm a huge Scott Conant fan thanks to Chopped, so while in Vegas, I had to try his restaurant.  We couldn't get in until 10pm, but it was so worth the visit.   I enjoyed the Crispy Fritto Misto to start, followed by the Apple Glazed Kurobuta Pork Chop.  That pork chop was BY FAR the best chop I've ever had.  
Ever!

Like seriously!

It was charred perfectly with plenty of juice from the chop.  I really didn't even need the apricot mustard.  Honestly, I could have had the chop alone.  Well that and the Il Dolce Lemone.  
For dessert, I indulged in the Strawberry Souffle with vanilla gelato.  

Everything was impeccable.  Even the the Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli that  I tasted from my cousin's dish!  It was well worth the splurge and would go again.  For sure!

Mediocre, to say the least.. 

So we decided to try Scarpetta this past week for my significant other's bday, and went into the experience with relatively high expectations, both being big fans of Scott Conant. I'd read up a bit on this resto before making our resos, and they were mostly mixed, but thought what a better way to celebrate a birthday than at a resto with a notable executive chef known for his refined Italian cooking.. 

To start, we ordered the creamy polenta with a fricassee of truffled mushrooms, the duck & foie gras ravioli, and the porterhouse steak (special) with a side of mushrooms & grilled potatoes. 

The ambiance in this resto was cool although a bit vacant and definitely had the air of a restaurant superimposed in a hotel. Not the cool vibe of a funky, independent resto on the Ossington strip. It was quiet inside, granted, it was a Monday night and neither of us expected it to be super happening by any means, so it would be interesting to see how this place shapes up on a weekend evening... Our server was definitely lovely and super personable, and very attentive throughout our meal. 

As for the wine list, it is very extensive for Italian wines (being an Italian resto and all) ;) although I do have to say I wish there was a larger selection of international wines at more reasonable price points (I have had many a bad reaction to Italian wines so I tend to stay away; a sensitivity to the tannins used in Italians so it can really be hit or miss). Although going into an Italian restaurant I don't expect the focus to be on International wines, but for purely selfish reasons I would have liked to have seen more on that note :)  

The Polenta came and went quickly.. It was truly delicious and has kept me wanting more..  Good thing I found the recipe online ;) (Yes, I am making this tonight lol). This course truly set the tone for the rest of the meal... next course was the duck & foie gras ravioli. We shared this between the two of us, and the nice personal touch was dividing the portion into two, for individual servings for us both.. The filling of the ravioli was divine to say the least, but on the note of the fresh pasta, I'd give it a 5/10. Quite gummy and just not the most enjoyable texture by any means.. I've had much, much better fresh pasta on many occasions.. 

Next came the Porterhouse steak topped with truffle butter, with the side of potatoes & mushrooms. The steak was well beyond medium rare (we'd asked for a touch above medium rare at medium-rare-medium), but came out well done.  The cut wasn't the greatest and was quite fatty (Morton's is a thousand times better on the note of its Porterhouse; hence, it being a true steakhouse). We also found it to be really bland and flavourless, even with the truffle butter (this seemed to be the only thing to add any flavour to the meat, and it was just not enjoyable by any means.. we went as far as contemplating sending it back, but the kitchen was closing and we just didn't want to be that couple... As for the sides, there were maybe 2-3 small bits of mushroom on the plate, and a very small handful (say midget?) of potatoes which were so well done they were hollow on the inside (almost like they were deep fried??). At a pricetag of $68 for this dish, I truly would've anticipated far better. Scott Scott... tsk tsk... so disappointed in this item which should've been the highlight of our meal.. :( ! Really disappointing to say the least, especially after having dug out the receipt just today and looked at the total for this one item.. 

From what I have read, Scarpetta does not live up to Conant's reputation and I'd have to agree on this note. I wouldn't recommend Scarpetta by any means (there are much better places in T.O. to check out) but if going, I would highly recommend Conant's signature polenta dish; all other items we sampled left much to the imagination... Mediocre, to say the least, and with a pricetag of $200 for dinner, I would have expected more..

Wow! Wonderful service; wonderful food; wonderful wine! We loved this restaurant! With no reservation on a Tuesday evening, we had an excellent dinner. Prime Fillet of Beef and Duck Foie Gras Ravioli. The manager greeted us and suggested the perfect bottle of wine. We will certainly tell our friends and family to check this restaurant out when visiting Vegas.

I had dinner here a few weeks ago on a Thursday night with my BF and another couple and we loved our experience at Scarpetta.  Everything from the service to the food was well executed.  The decor is dark, hip and elegant.  This is a very cool restaurant in a very cool hotel.  

On to the food:  
We could not get enough of their signature bread, the stromboli, and our waiter happily obliged by bringing us more upon request.  I haven't tasted anything like it anywhere else.  

For starters, we shared the Yellowtail, the Braised Short Ribs and the Crispy Fritto Misto.  The Yellowtail sashimi was good but it didn't knock my socks off.  It just didn't have as much flavour as I would have liked.  However, the short ribs and the Fritto Misto were standouts.  The Fritto Misto is seafood and vegetable dish, battered in a light batter and fried until crispy.  Delish!

For our entrees, I had the black cod and my boyfriend had the tenderloin of beef.  Both were presented beautifully and were perfectly spiced and cooked.  My friend ordered the spiced duck breast and said she enjoyed it.  All of the portions were quite generous in size.  

Our waiter was great.  For dessert, he recommended the Caramel Budino over the Bacio Chocolate Bar.  Since I am a sucker for Bacio, I had to order it anyway while by BF ordered the Caramel Budino.  All I can say is that the Budino was by far superior to the other dessert (and most other desserts I have had).  Our waiter knew what he was talking about.  

I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Long over-due review. Came here for dinner during my bachelorette party in the month of June 2014.  When we arrived we had a bit of a wait.. even with reservations. When we did get seated the view from our table was beautiful, we could see the water show that Bellagio does. Our waiter, can't remember his name was really attentive, asked us how we are doing, if there was anything else that he could get,  the staff kept our waters full AWESOME!! 
Food here is pretty good. We all had different dishes amongst the 12 girls in the group.. That's how we eat LOL. Sharing is caring. Over all great place, great atmosphere, nice people, modern interior, beautiful views.

I had such high hopes for Scarpetta. We came on a Sunday night at 6:40PM, a bit late for our reservation but we were seated promptly.

The bread came quickly, and was amazing. There was sourdough, a type with meat in it, ciabatta, and some other small roll. It came with olive oil, tomato, and cheese mixed with butter as toppings, which were really delicious.

The creamy polenta with truffled mushrooms was also quite amazing, especially on the bread.

For some reason though, when our entrees came, everything just went downhill.
The duck and foie gras ravioli just tasted weird and a bit too salty. The short rib agnolotti wasn't very tender or flavorful. The vegetable spaghetti was a bit better and the broccoli was pretty good. Overall though, a bit disappointed. Perhaps it was just an off night.

Went with a large party of 12. The views of the Bellagio fountain were awesome till someone got shot outside and they shut it down.
The food was really great and the service was good.
I had the Beef Ragout Pasta and it was superb!
Best pasta ever! I love coming to this place. Too bad they closed the one in LA.  They will go out of their way to accommodate you!!

Very tasty w/ Italian roots

I won't say that Scarpetta is exclusively Italian cuisine, but all the basics are there for quality dining with some very nice views of the fountains outside. Service is top notch with emphasis on your experience being 100%. 

Food quality was exceptional for the money, bar-none. A wide variety of flavor choices for most folks, and some more common choices for the simpler people. Nothing was overspiced as I had become accustomed to at high-end Italian places, which was nice.

Seafood was nice w/ great accompanying vegetables (marinated cherry tomatoes are amazing). Breads w/ prosciutto were impeccable as an appetizer, and the wine selection was pretty damned good (it helps that their wine cooler-thingy is a clear wall).

 I would definitely return when back in Vegas. It also helps that you see some fairly well-known entertainers eat here, which is a decent sign of quality.

Spanish Baby Octopus.
Grilled White Corn Soup w/ Blue Crab.
Heirloom Tomato Salad.
Pici Pasta.
Black Fettuccini.

Deliciouso!
:)

I was being lazy and didn't want to hunt around for a place and decided that it's was better to go with the devil I knew.  Remembering to stay away from the salmon. I gave the lamb loin a try. I found it to be incredibly flavorful and tender, yet not gamey.  If you enjoy lamb, this dish is a must.  My date who ordered the chicken was totally envious.  I tried his and would have felt the same way.  It wasn't that the chicken was bad, it just wasn't spectacular like the lamb. I also highly recommend the coconut panna cotta.  Although guava "soup" might sound a bit odd, it's what makes the dish so delicious.
Absolutely amazing!! The ambiance is perfect, dark, sensual, mysterious and exciting. High end. Definitely recommend the pre fix courses!

Scarpetta won't let you down. I went with 2 friends who really know and love food (one of them is a really talented professional chef with years of experience) and we all agreed it was fantastic.

We had the spaghetti, the duck and foie gras ravioli, and the black farfalle to start. And it was all good. The ravioli were off the charts and the other two were good, not amazing but tasty. For some reason when the farfalle came out all the sauce had shifted to the bottom of the dish so at first bite i was like WTF, and then i got to the bottom where all the sauce and lobster were hanging out - mmmmmmmmm. nom nom nom. 

The entrees were amazing. I had the cod, and i tasted the sirloin steak - which was excellent. The deserts were amazing too. We had the panna cotta, the chocolate cake and the nutella filled donut holes and they were fucking rad. 

This is a really pretty restaurant too inside, its beautifully designed and it has a view of the bellagio fountain which is cool. Its a place to take the misses for sure. 

We had 3 appetizers, 3 entrees, 3 deserts and wine and including tip the bill came out to 120 per person. A very reasonable price for such good food and service.
Great pasta. They provide us different bread for free and brought us hot tea. Very nice atmosphere, quiet and romantic. Would come back.
One of the most prestigious dinning experiences in Las Vegas. Apart from the unbelievably amazing food, the service and the view are unparalleled. A must when visiting the Strip.

So after the Rock n Roll Las Vegas 1/2 Marathon I decided it was time to carb up! Wait, do you do that before you run? My beautiful girlfriend flew into town to join me and Scarpetta was the perfect place to take her for dinner seeing we were staying at the Cosmo and it wasn't too far of a walk for my trashed legs!  I had requested to be seated by the windows overlooking the Bellagio Fountains and the table couldn't have been more romantic. We requested the Sommelier and he promptly came to our table and my gal and him found the perfect wine for us. I'm more of a vodka expert. For an appetizer we ordered some oysters, not sure where they were from, but they were smaller than normal yet very flavorful. My girlfriend and I split a couple entrees, the duck and foie gras ravioli and the Colorado lamb trio. The duck and foie gras ravioli was amazing! I know it's not cool to do that to ducks, but I was bit by a duck when I was young and I'm cool with it. Not too mention it was absolutely delicious! The Colorado lamb trio was another memorable entree with what I believe was a lollipop, cutlet and steak. I must say this was a very romantic meal with excellent service and mouth watering food. Scarpetta will always have a special place in our hearts! Thanks

Finally got the chance to go to Scarpetta! 

We made reservations for 2 and had a nice night. The restaurant is decorated nicely and has nice views of the Bellagio fountain--ask for a table by the window!

I ordered the tuna & avocado to start (soooo fresh and yummy) and my boyfriend got the octopus, which was pretty good too.

For our entrées, the oh-so famous spaghetti and lamb trio. Both of which were delicious! 

All in all, giving four stars because for all the hype and the $$$, it wasn't super spectacular, just pretty good. I'll be back, though!

The view if you can sit near a window is spectacular - so fun to watch the Bellagio Fountains. The food is incredible, just a bit pricey. If you're willing to spend more, it's totally worth it though. We loved the polenta, spaghetti (really is the best I've ever had), and beef filet.

Scarpetta was good - definitely a restaurant you do have to try when you're out in Vegas. I was there with my husband a couple of months ago - he ordered the NY steak and I got the spaghetti with meatballs. Both were good, especially the steak. Even though the NY isn't the best cut, it was still tender, juicy and flavorful. I was a bit disappointed in my meal because it wasn't traditional; the meatballs were tiny (bite-sized). That's pretty much the only thing I'd change. Other than that, the food and service were great.

5 amazing stars for the duck and foie gras ravioli.  It made my eyes roll into the back of my head, it was so good.

I also tried the spaghetti which was eh in my book.  I mean, it was good.  But Ted Allen told me it was worth $24 and he was LYING.  (Or paid off by Scott Conant, I'm not sure which...)

This place is dim (low lighting) and I can't remember much about the decor.  Hey, it's Vegas, I was on vacation and probably (okay, obviously) was pretty tipsy.  It's a perfect match for being inside the Cosmopolitan.

When I'm back in Las Vegas, I'm not sure that I'll need to come back here, but the memory of the ravioli will last a lifetime.

How do I describe the love? Love, Love, LOVE! I have previously dined at Scarpetta in New York, and was ecstatic to check ou the new space at The Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas. 

Our server, was hands down one of the best in the business. Full of passion and enthusiasm for his food, we were truly excited for our dishes. Being that we had a party of 5, he removed our menu's from our hands and told us that the chef would be preparing something fantastic for us. We ended up with small plates of 4 courses: starting with appetizers, pasta (duck fois gras ravioli, linguini with black truffle, their famed spagetti); a branzino and meat affair for the 3rd course (Sicilian spiced duck breast, and seared scallops...plus many more items (I believe it was 5 plates for each course) for party to share, which was fantastic! 

Hands down, best Italian meal that I've had in years. I will be back very soon. Ciao!

The most amazing food I've ever eaten! We tried a variety of menu items, including the entrees, but nothing was as delicious as the pasta dishes. Superb service. Stunning view of the Bellagio fountains! We will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas!

This restaurant was fantastic. I made a reservation to Scarpetta for my boyfriend's birthday. I requested a table by the window and a surprise birthday dessert. They did not disappoint. I had the best table in the restaurant and they brought out our dessert with a candle and a message. My boyfriend was surprised and absolutely loved the place. The food was delicious!!! It came up out very hot and fresh. The drinks were amazing too. Our waiter was super attentive and very courteous and friendly. Scarpetta made our romantic dinner absolutely perfect.

My second visit in the past couple of years, and the food is simply amazing...amazballs as Usher would say.  Everything is perfection.  My girlfriend is a vegetarian and they separated the bread into two baskets so the bread with the meat was not touching the other bread - that's service, right?

My only complaint would be the noise level, or the size of the two-top at whic we were seated.  I like a hum in a restaurant, but we were too far from each other to speak in our indoor voices and be heard.  If we were closer together it wouldn't have been an issue.  Pretty minor issue, really...last time I was here I sat on the window and didn't notice the noise, this time I was pretty much in the middle of the room between the bar and the window, so that could be it as well.  Perhaps next time we could request a window seat.

Scarpetta is always the restaurant which makes my taste buds sing.  My Mom's Italian and the food here is as good as it gets (don't tell her please). About ten years ago was the first time of many I dined at Scarpetta- being a N.Y. native.  Currently my status is a LV resident, hence I'm a 'follower' now:)  
The interior is nice, but it has a spectacular view of those fountains nearby;)
Please don't eat all the delicious bread, make sure you have room for some of the classic dishes here. 
As you enter into Scarpetta there is a lovely lounge area, which will not disappoint if you failed in making a reservation. 
Desserts, of course all are exceptional! Without divulging a thing about these delicious endings think: Italian. Has anyone ever not liked Italian desserts...precisely;)

Bone marrow agnolotti was amazing. The other four pastas I tried were below average. Spaghetti was boring, I dislike foie gras. The caramel dessert was awesome. Tiramisu was great. The other two desserts were average. Service was good. Kinda pricey
Very good food and service.  Wine selection is extensive but could use more quality selection in lower price range.  It seemed like most bottles on the list were over 100 bucks

I really wanted to like this place and some items were fantastic, but overall...There's just so many other better places.  The octopus was incredible and might be the only reason I would go back - and I don't really love octopus to begin with.  The tomatoes that come with the breadbasket was also really killer. 

Our server was great, got along well with the group, and recommended an excellent bottle of wine for the table.  The rest of the service was a little odd.  We had 5 or 6 of the wrong plates come to the table throughout the meal, including 3 birthday desserts before we had even ordered our food!  Not sure what was happening there. 

We tried the Buratta Salad (always good, no matter what), Tuna Carpaccio (good, but compared to the other raw fish I've had here was unremarkable), Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli (the best entree I had), Short Rib Agnolotti (a little tough), Black Togliolini (incredibly fishy, uni was tough, the crab was overpowered by the rest of the dish, the amount of tobiko was aggressive and given how strongly flavored the sauce or pasta was, it wasn't needed), Spaghetti (real heavy on the basil), Al Ceppo (braised lamb - just fine), NY Steak (well prepared and cooked perfectly, still just a steak though).  We ordered desserts, but I was pretty over eating by the time it all came.

Overall, this place was just a little too hit-or-miss for me.

After a fantastic visit to the NY location four or five years ago, I was excited to eat at Scarpetta again. Unfortunately our experience at the Vegas location was a huge disappointment. The food was still delicious, but it was completely eclipsed by the terrible service we received, and we left with a bad taste in our mouths despite that scrumptious pomodoro. Our surly server wore a perpetual scowl, avoided our eyes when we tried to flag him down, and seemed eager to flee the table as soon as he unceremoniously dumped our food down, without waiting to see if we needed anything else. You would think he didn't WANT us to order more cocktails or courses. Getting a basket of that delicious bread proved extremely difficult, let alone a second one. Worst of all, towards the end of our meal, three of us had finished our entrees, but two of us were still eating our shared pasta, when the servers started clearing plates, including said hard-won bread basket. They literally cleared every plate from a six-top except the one we were eating from. WHAT?! No. Unacceptable. Rule no. 1. Do not clear until everyone has finished eating! I cringed for the waiter but I was also very disappointed and shocked to experience this kind of service at a high end, expensive restaurant. Needless to say we felt rushed out and couldn't savor the last bites of our meal because everyone else at the now empty table was sitting there twiddling their thumbs. Going to a nice restaurant isn't just about the food - it's about the service, atmosphere, and overall experience. This is true everywhere but especially in Vegas. Scarpetta failed miserably on this front.

I am a Las Vegas local and on a tuesday night during the "Magic" convention, it was my girlfriends birthday. I was unable to get a reservation for her birthday. I went and spoke with the manager, Kelly, who said she would do whatever she could to help me out. When we arrived at the restaurant she said she would see what she could do. We grabbed a drink at the bar and 10 minutes later we were told our table was ready. I was expecting the small corner in the table, but was pleasantly surprised when we were seated at probably the best table in the restaurant. The last table right next to the window which gave us an incredible view of the Bellagio fountains. Titus our waiter was excellent! The food was incredible as always! The night turned out amazing all because of Kelly. Great manager!!!

We came here on a Wednesday evening for a company meeting. Our menu consisted of a full course meal: 
Primi - Served Family Style
1. Creamy Polenta - Fricassee of truffled mushrooms
2. Heirloom Tomato Salad - Burrata, marinated eggplant 
Pasta - Served Family Style 
1. Spaghetti - Tomato and Basil 
Piatti - Individual 
1. Fennel Dusted Black Cod - Concentrated tomatoes, mantecato, black olive oil 
2. Organic Jidori Chicken - Mustard spatzle carrots, fegato sauce
Dolce - Served Family Style
1. Amedei Chocolate Cake - Toasted almond gelato, salted caramel sauce

- Hard to find! Literally, it's like a crevice on the third floor of the Cosmo! WTF, weird entrance. 
- Nice staff. Presentable dining area for larger groups. Fast at wine refills. 
- I loved the spaghetti! Although simple, the noodles tasted great! The flavoring was fresh and rich. 
- Their polenta was unremarkable. Cornmeal boiled in porridge. I prefer simple mashed potatoes. 
- Fresh tomato salad! Loved the ripe tomatoes. But awkward to eat as family-style. 
- The chicken was soft and tender. Not too salty. I'm glad I got this over the Cod. Although the cod was flavored nicely, I didn't like picking some of the bones out of it. 
- Dessert was amazing. Not too sweet, but the correct balance to end of the meal.
- Overall, nice plating and nice night.

We went here for dinner and our table had a nice view of the Bellagio Fountain. It's beautiful here. Our server was fantastic. He knew I was trying to save room for dessert. We were given a bread basket that included stromboli. Yum!

Creamy Polenta:
This had mushrooms and truffle oil. The consistency, aroma and taste were superb. I can finish a bowl of this and still want more. 5/5

Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli:
The pasta is shaped like a duck's tongue. It has balsamic reduction on top. If you like foie gras, you'd enjoy this. 4.5/5

Short Rib and Bone Marrow Agnolotti:
This and the spaghetti are my favorites on their menu. It's meaty, rich and tasty. It has crunchy bread crumbs so you get that texture. 5/5

Spaghetti:
Spaghetti should be real simple. Noodles, olive oil, fresh tomatoes, basil and cheese. Anything extra is plain overdoing it. Cooked perfectly al dente. I get an extra order to-go for lunch the next day - the noodles get softer but soaks up all the flavor. 5/5

Nutella and Vanilla Bomboloni:
Italian doughnuts filled with either Nutella or vanilla. Comes with a side of banana gelato. The filling is a little thick - it's not just straight up Nutella. 

Amadei Chocolate Cake:
Dense chocolate cake with a side of salted caramel gelato. 4/5

Proseco, delicious food, good company and a spectacular view...life is beautiful!

First, I met Mike Tyson when I dined here! And we danced in the middle of the restaurant. So an extra star for that!

Scarpetta is a beautiful restaurant. Beautiful Earth tones and a intoxicating view of the Bellagio fountains.

Scarpetta is one of those fancy restaurants with menu items that no one really knows how to pronounce; needless to say, I just ordered and hoped for the best. And the results we're favorable!

I could mention what I ate/ordered, but this place doesn't offer a fixed menu. It's seasonal and changes because your quality freshness. Everything that was order was amazing. There's a bread basket... I could have kept eating that and been a happy camper. There were several variations, my favorite was the stramboli (not the American version - I asked the server what it was because it was slap yo' mama good!), it's a combination of fresh bread and meat. It was a joygasm to the mouth! The bread basket is served with a fancy whipped butter, a roasted eggplant dip, and olive oil. 

I order the yellow tail app (which they always have) and it did not disappoint. Fresh and tasty! I ordered a pasta dish (no idea what, who, where, why, yaddda, yadda, insert fancy words and culture here) and it was flavorful and light. The portion size was perfect. Not too much or too little. Seriously, I don't think you take doggy bags from places like that.

We ordered several desserts and they were all great and small enough to not get stuff and big enough to share.
 
They have an extensive wine list and it covers an entire length of a wall. It's a pretty sight.

The service was impeccable. Spot on. Courteous. Attentive.

Overall, Scarpetta was de to the lish. If I could afford it, I would definitely go back in a minute! I yearn for you Stramboli. Definitely not your traditional Italian, but a great modern twist.

I stumbled upon this restaurant while I was waiting for seats to open up from other near restaurant in Cosmopolitan.

From the outside, the ambiance seemed pretty romantic and we thought we'd give it a try since we've been to the other restaurant.

As we were guided through the narrow hallway, we came up on this bigger and even more romantic side of the restaurant. There were big windows for the beautiful view and big and small tables for big groups or small.

Service was fantastic. It seemed that every workers had different role. Hostess seated us, manager-looking person greeted us and guided us through the menu, server brought bread and explained the ingredients in detail, and another server served us delicious food. Every one of them were so professional.

To match with everything above, the plates we ordered were exceptional. Sadly I live in LA and will have to wait for another trip to Vegas to try those again. We had Spiced Duck Breast and Tagliatelle. Duck was cooked just right. It was little crispy on the outside and so soft on the inside, it melted in my mouth. Tagliatelle pasta was so creamy and rich. I usually don't chew much when eating but this time, I made sure I didnt swallow the food too fast ;).

I would strongly recommend this place to everyone. I'm so glad I stumbled upon this place. This place really did worth every dollar I paid for.

Scarpetta was not worth it. I spent about 260.00 for two people including a 45 dollar tip. We didn't have wine. The scallop was pretty good, the foie gras ravioli was ok, we had a steak dish that I can't remember because it was that forgetful. finished it off with gelato, which I could have cared less about. The service was great, the decor was nice but boring. In general I was extremely underwhelmed. If my bill would have been about 50 dollars cheaper I would say this is a good place to take a friend or business partner, but not a date or someone who you'd want to share a meaningful or memorable evening with. However, since Scarpetta was not 50 dollars cheaper, my conclusion is... go somewhere else. There are much better places.

Our server started us out with an array of different breads, accompanied by mascarpone butter, an eggplant tomato caponata & citrus olive oil. I often tend to judge a meal as soon as the bread (or chips... etc) arrives to the table. First impressions are crucial! If you ever dine at Scarpetta, dig for the warm stromboli loaf in your bread basket first! It pairs really wonderfully with the caponata, but also stands strong on its own. You definitely want to eat this bread while its hot- because its stuffed with layers of salami & mozzarella. YUM!

My first course was Braised Short Ribs of Beef over a farro risotto. The beef was immensely tender & alive with flavor. It had a very thin slice of parmesan resting on top of it, just barely melted. Nice touch! I loved how hearty the risotto was- this is nothing my Mom would have ever prepared for me...but somehow the risotto tasted home-y. I didn't even have time to identify all the vegetables that were in this dish, because I was far too busy stuffing my face. Between bites of the short ribs, I had a few pieces of raw yellowtail. Incredibly fresh, with such great flavor. Unknown to me at the time, it was adorn with almost microscopic red onions (GROSS)...but I ate each piece very willingly- despite my hatred for onions.

For my main course I had the Aged Sirloin of Beef. It was served with wild mushrooms, potato gnocchi & barolo ragu. Everything on the plate was exceedingly juicy & robust, without being overwhelming. The gnocchi was a great equalizer to the sirloin and the ragu. This dish was really unforgettable, hats off to Scott Conant.

Dessert was very simple! Coconut Panna Cotta served with coconut sorbetto, pineapples & guava soup, ofcourse this is my pick- being a true Hawaiian & all. I could have done without the crushed pineapples, I felt like they interfered with the guava coconut vibe I had going. I had mentally prepared myself for the guava soup to be too sweet, but fortunately, I was incorrect. In addition to that, I was thrilled with how smooth the panna cotta was. Each bite was like silk!

In short, I LOVED Scarpetta. 4 stars!

Amongst the Cosmo's array of excellent restaurants, Scarpetta is definitely one of my favorites.

Hubby & I had reservations for 9:30 pm but we were running a little behind (story of our lives). We ended up getting there at 10:30 pm, and the hostesses were still so sweet despite our late arrival! We even got awesome seating with a view of the Bellagio water fountains, per Hubby's request of course. It's overall such a romantic venue with dim lights and soft lounge music.

You start off with complimentary bread, and it's honestly the best bread I've ever had. The basket has an assortment of different breads and condiments. The winner was the Stromboli- soft Italian bread filled with delicious cheese and salami. Ugh, orgasmic!

We also began with Raw Yellowtail which was topped with a ginger oil and pickled red onion. For a steep $18, it was rather disappointing. We each only got 2 bite-sized pieces of fish. Very tasteful fish, but still a let down.

My entrée made up for our appetizer. I ordered the Short Rib Agnolotti- fresh pasta filled with tender beef. It was a mouth-watering combination of sweet brown butter and toasted breadcrumbs. So delicious!

Hubby ordered the waiter's recommended Pici, a pasta colored green by chili pesto. He thought it was a bit salty, and our sides were on the salty side as well. We shared an order of mushrooms & corn, which were both bursting with flavor. It was so much food, we left with some to-go boxes.

Since you can never be too full for dessert, we ordered the Strawberry Soufflé with berries and vanilla gelato. We almost ordered a second one, a strong indication of how yummy it was. It tasted exactly how I'd imagine clouds would- Sweet, light, & fluffy. What was even sweeter was the "Happy Birthday" message written on the plate next to a candle. You just can't beat thoughtful service like this. :')
As good an experience as you can have in a restaurant.  All of the food was incredible, especially the octopus and the spaghetti.

I have been to Scarpetta twice and both times were very different. The first time was amazing and my favorite item on the menu was the Goat. So I was very excited to return to have this again.

Second visit, no Goat. BOO!! What the hell, that was so good- bring it back. The food was still great and service was excellent of course. This was my order.

Apps: RAW YELLOW TAIL, and HEIRLOOM BEET SALAD- Both were really good.

Paste: SPAGHETTI Tomato Basil- OMG to die for, homemade pasta people!! 

Pesce: MEDITERRANEAN BRANZINO- You can never go wrong with this fish.

Contorni: BROCCOLI RABE

Dolce: NUTELLA & VANILLA CREME BOMBOLONI and MASCARPONE CHEESECAKE anything with Nutella and Mascarpone is good.

This restaurant has a great ambiance, great service and great food. Definitely give it a try.

Enjoyed a 20 person set menu dinner. Scallops, beet salad (goat cheese YUM) and ravioli were delightful.  Filet did not compare to previous night's red meat but was still fine.  Should have sat on the other side of the table so that I could have enjoyed a strip view during the 3+ hr meal.

One of those places where you will stare at the menu over and over and still not be quite sure what you are ordering, yet at the very same time, still have it be one of the best meals you will ever consume. 

The ambiance to begin with, is just gorgeous. You almost can't help but to feel up the soft, velvety walls as you watch the Bellagio fountains go off. Service, as expected is excellent. 

And of course the food, wow. From the delicious variety of bread to the spaghetti, as well as the steak were to die for. 

What most impressed me, were their portions. It seems as if they know exactly how much a person requires to eat to feel satisfied. For a pasta dish like the spaghetti, you think you are getting a small amount, but take that fork and start eating, and you'll realize that there are endless amount of noodles within that little bowl.

Now, I know that there is a Scarpetta here in LA, but on this lucky night we actually got to eat food prepared by the famous chef Scott Conant himself. I don't know if that makes a big difference or not but after finding out he was our chef, it definitely justified the perfection of our meals.

Easily made reservations via OpenTable earlier in the day for a prime time on Friday night.

When my date and I arrived, we were quickly seated and they checked our coats for us. They have a very respectable wine selection and presentation of their stock. The acoustics were very good; even sitting at an table near the middle, we were able to converse with regular voices. Service was quick and very polite. I ordered the roasted duck and was very pleased with the dish. My date ordered the cod filet and wasn't so thrilled, but loved the squash soup appetizer.

For dessert we shared the chocolate cake with almond gelato and it was amazing.

I will definitely return to this hotel and restaurant in the future.

My friend and I just randomly searched for an italian restaurant and then found this. The service is great. The waiter was very patient. He gave many useful recommendations for us.  Tuna &avocado: I think it is tuna sashimi and avocado with a lite lemon juice. It tastes healthy and delicious. Filet steak: I ordered for medium. OMG, it is perfect. My friend ordered black tagliolini and scallop. She loves both of them so much.

I mostly frequent the Scarpetta in Miami, but while in Vegas last month we stayed at the Cosmopolitan and decided to give this location a whirl.  We are big fans of the spaghetti in Miami and wanted to see if it would be the same.

Who would have thought that an unassuming spaghetti dish would be so amazing?  It doesn't even have any meat in it and it is so good!  I get my own because I don't like to share it.  If you want to try other things, it's great to split because it is very rich....cheese and cream, and butter...oh my!   The bread is delish, especially the stromboli, love the accoutrements, olive oil, mascarpone butter, eggplant spread. The heirloom tomato salad is always a good stand by as well.  We had the scallop appetizer this time, and it was very good.  We never really have room for dessert, and had to catch a show, so we passed. Maybe next time we will try the panna cotta.

All in all, I still love the Miami location better. The service is pretty consistent with both locations, just a different slightly more relaxed vibe in Miami.  Besides, who can beat a view of the ocean and the sleek, modern, nautical decor of Scarpetta Miami.
The BEST bread basket. The BEST pasta. The BEST dirty martini. There is nothing to complain about here. I went here twice. It is that amazing.

Ambiance: Dim lighting. Romantic. Service: Awesome. Very knowledgeable, nice and attentive server. Bread: 5 different kinds with 3 spread/dipping options. Really enjoyed it. Appetizer: Short Rib Risotto- Good. Nothing more nothing less. Entrees: Agnolotti was okay. The "brown butter" in the description got me hoping for The Old Spaghetti Factory's Brown Butter Mizithra dish, but it was nothing like it. Rich, but not salty. And I like salty/savory. Best part was the crispy/crunchy texture in some bites. Hubs got the tried and true spaghetti. He liked it a lot. Noodles cooked truly al dente. Again, not as savory as I like, but... satisfied with the quality. I like super bold and flavorful dishes. This is definitely a restaurant for those with a more "refined" palate. Drinks: A greenish martini with a basil leaf in it, I forget the name- refreshing. Two dirty gin martinis- strong and actually dirty. Two Macalllan 12s. Total bill before tip: $180. Probably won't come back with all the options Vegas has to offer, but 4 stars because there's no denying it IS a nice restaurant if that's your type of thing. :)

I cannot give less than 5 stars to this place!,.. Everything there was just great!!... The service was excellent!... And the wine was very good!!. We followed the recommendations from our waitress and tried 3 different wines, every wine was better than the one before... I still don't know which one I liked better.. The food was delicious!!.. As an appetizer we had the prawns with sambuca, and they were fresh and very tasty... The gnocchi and the pasta were excellent!!.. And the beef was delicious!!.. I would definitely go back there!...

If you are looking for a fancy meal to splurge on, look no further. We were looking for a $$ place but this is more of a $$$ in my opinion. However, it was WELL worth the money!

I called and got reservations day of at 6 pm, when they open. I had asked for seating near the windows as I had read that there was quite the view. They said they cannot guarantee this but we ended up with an AMAZING view of the Bellagio fountains and most of the strip at sunset.... the view alone was at least 4 stars!

But then.... the food.... OMG. The bread basket they brought us was an appetizer in itself. The stromboli with broccolini was my favorite! (Vegetarians, you can ask for the stromboli without meat to be in your bread basket.) In addition, the other bread was awesome and it came with citrus olive oil, marscapone butter and some sort of eggplant antipasto. We ordered a side of the broccolini to share and two entrees: the halibut (this was a special) and the spaghetti.

Why, you might ask, would you pay over $20 for a small plate of spaghetti? Because this unassuming dish was bursting with flavor and freshness. The pasta was homemade and perfectly al dente, the sauce was just chunky enough and the fresh ribbons of basil were the perfect garnish. My husband said he didn't miss the meat and it was just perfect- however you can add meatballs for extra money. The Halibut was also perfectly done: crisp on the outside and white and flaky on the inside. It was served with potenta and grilled artichokes. An excellent dish if they have it on special when you go!

You thought it couldn't get better? Well you are wrong. The service was ON POINT. Our waiter(s) were checking in on us the perfect amount of times, our water glasses were always full, and we were asked if we wanted another drink two sips before we finished the first. It is obvious that customer service is high quality here- from the wait staff to the host to the kitchen staff.

HIGHLY recommend if you are looking for a place to treat yourself to a wonderful dinner!

I've been to Scarpetta LV 3 times so far. Great bread basket, "more Stromboli please!" Recommend the Spaghetti. Which is strange because I never order Spaghetti when dining out, this ones special though. Black Tagliolini was delicious and some pasta filled with short ribs, I forget the name of it but it's different and probably isn't like anything you've had before. Order and share the Dry Aged Sirloin to accompany your pasta. It's a perfect fit, especially with the Spaghetti.

Dessert? Skip it. Had em all and not one I would order again, and by this point you'll have spent enough money.  Thought about giving Scarpetta 3 stars, not because of food but because of price, e.g. "the handmade in house pasta" spaghetti is $24. But I had to take into consideration of the convenience of being located on the strip and that location with it's great fountain views cost money.

I loved this restaurant, we were a party of 5 and we each ordered something different: spaghetti with tomato & basil, polenta, fetuccini with lamb & rapini, filet mignon, and the lamb, it was all great and we all left very happy and satisfied.

Although the entrees were great, I could not get enough of their fabulous bread (specifically the stuffed bread) which I used for my own scarpetta, my plate was wiped clean. I will definitely visit the location in LA where I live, can't wait to go back.

The BEST dining experience ever! Scott Conant's sophisticated yet soulful dishes were nothing short of decadent. Started off with the short ribs; then the duck and foie gras ravioli (our favorite--so good!); I had the spiced duck breast, and my hubby had the halibut. Halibut was delicious! My duck had a little too much star anise in the rub. Ended with the napoleon, so yummy, I cleaned the plate. We sat right next to a window and had a great view of the Bellagio water show. Had a wonderful time!

And the service was impeccable! The staff was very professional and friendly. According to our receipt our waiter was Asato. Great guy. Next time I hope to catch Chef Scott there!

Like other reviewers, I'm not a big fan of Scott Conant, a judge on the TV food show Chopped. Not sure if that's his real life persona or his made for TV Simon Cowell-like persona that makes for good ratings. I broke down and went to Scarpetta, totally prepared to hate the place. As much as I wanted to hate it, I loved it. It's always interesting to read the reviews and see the swings, with one reviewer hating it and the next loving it. It's usually the total experience that somehow helps make the food more or less memorable. It was totally memorable for me, from being with my wife to the Bellagio fountains to attentive service to the food being timely served, perfectly prepared and beautifully presented. The bread basket was all artisan selections, a meal in itself. The creamy polenta and truffled mushrooms were heavenly. The spaghetti was as good as spaghetti gets....there's only so much you can do with it and I thought the sauce was outstanding. The black cod melted in your mouth and was a work of art. The coconut panna cotta was the most interesting, striking and palate pleasing dessert I've ever had.

This place was ridiculous! Came during my stay in Vegas for Infocomm with some Law Firm associates. All from NYC, so we were on the hunt for a good Italian place in Vegas, and we found it!

Great bread basket. Great apps. Great entrees. Great wines. Great desserts. Great ambiance. Great lighting. Great views. 

Loved it!

I was very excited to dine here  for my first night in Las Vegas. When we arrived, the hostess was quite snarky when we requested to move one table over from her suggested table. Although the service was friendly, not once were our waters refilled nor was the table cleaned before the arrival of our dessert which you come to expect when dining at a place like this. 

For our appetizer, we split the spaghetti. Decent but from my own personal dining experiences, the spaghetti did not warrant the hype. For our entrees, the bf and I dined on the duck  and short rib ravioli. We seriously could have passed on these two dishes.  They were forgettable and only made us reminisce about similar versions of these dishes that we had in the past which were not only better but cheaper. For dessert we ordered the strawberry soufflé. By the time the dish arrived  the gelato on top had already melted adding to the mush of butter and bread within the ramekin. 

All in all the best part of the meal was the complimentary bread. While I will not return, I can see aspects of Scarpetta that some foodies may enjoy.

Great Service
Great Food
Great Time
Fresh pasta, Great Sauces, Awesome selections.

Ah Scarpetta. Restaurant of my all-time favorite judge on Chopped-Scott Conant, every episode I ever watched featuring Scott added a grain of sand on top of the ever growing mountain that was my dream of dining at Scarpetta. By the time I finally walked through those doors it was an Mount Kilimanjaro sized monstrosity of a dream. I was so giddy I took a picture with the frickin sign. I mean this was it! I was going to eat pasta the way it HAS to be sauced up and cooked, I was about to have a symphony of flavors dancing their way onto my modest palette opening my eyes to a culinary world that which I have never experienced in my 24 years. I was about to be blown away. 

We're seated by the window with a nice view of the Bellagio water show. Oh things were going as I expected at this point. 

Our server was nice, in a very proper, sophisticated, would not smile more than a 3/4 grin, and maintained an impressive monotone demeanor kind of way that which you expect at such a dining establishment. Everything is going according to plan. 

We order the short rib risotto appetizer to share and I decide to get the roasted chicken as my entree while my partner in crime got the so raved upon spaghetti. As we waited for our entree the bread basket came out. There was a variety of different breads some stuffed with salami and cheese, and others with spinach and garlic all served with olive oil, cheese spread, and olive tapenade. 

Holy crap. I ate this bread and thought oh my god this is it, this is what I've been missing. The flavor was bright and salty, the outside was crusty and chewy but the inside was tender and soft. Dip that into the olive oil and you're in heaven. I'm literally on cloud 9 at this point....

Out comes the short rib risotto that they kindly split into two plates. 

First impression: Are we minions? I mean I know it's "gourmet", and I know we split it. But I kid you not when I tell you my portion was probably 2 tablespoons. IT'S OKAY THOUGH we're at SCARPETTA. I took a bite. The piece of short rib was juicy, soft, and boldly flavored. I liked it. The risotto was pretty good-the vegetables still had a nice crunch and it was a nice little bed for the short rib to sit on. Not blow my mind amazing, but good! Pretty good!

Okay the entrees! We get our hot plates and gracefully decide to not mention the fact that both of our dishes combined could probably hide behind an IPhone 6 Plus. We couldn't risk ruining the moment. But after taking a bite of my Japanese raised chicken that had eaten nothing but the finest grains before being swiftly beheaded, and brined in an anise spiced mixture for days before arriving at my disposal....I realized something. It didn't taste good. In fact it didn't taste like anything. I could hear Scott ripping a contestant to shreds for making chicken thats dry and needs a sauce, vegetables that have no love, and an overall dish with nothing bringing it all together. How could this be the cooking of the man whose every critique I felt I could so passionately agree? 

After I had a bite of the spaghetti was when the depression truly set in. Not only was I excited to try this dish because of Scott's particular distaste for a mediocre bowl of pasta, but Ted Allen also picked the dish as the best thing he ever ate on Food Network's show as well. This dish had so much going for it. 

Verdict? So painstakingly ordinary. The sauce had nothing really special about it-it was a bland, under seasoned tomato sauce, and for being homemade the pasta didn't really have that chewy bite you'd expect. Oh let me also add that it was a 9 bite portion (we counted). 

Needless to say we decided to skip dessert, and I the girl who pranced in Scarpetta walked out like a little girl whose mom lost her bunny rabbit because she wanted her to "play" outside. Oh wait...that was me too. 

Scarpetta, you disappointed me-and for that I nominate Scott to the chopping block. I think I'll stick with Alex Guarnaschelli's opinions for now.

If you want a lot of pompous attitude, and pay a lot for average food this is the place for you.  Don't order the braised beef rib.  You will leave hungry and who puts cheese on their ribs.  That's a shame.  Don't expect to eat healthy either.  The cocktails were very good though, so I would recommend the bar.  The restaurant also has an amazing view.

Dark, moody and intimate...my kind of place. This restaurant just oozes class and sophistication. A definite welcome from the debauchery taking place right outside. (No joke...I went to the restroom by the entrance and some girl had tossed her cookies alllll over the floor.) I mention this because I felt like the Cosmopolitan was starting to lose its appeal for me. It's definitely a different crowd from what it opened to a couple of years ago.  But Scarpetta has really turned it around for me.

I'd been wanting to go to Scarpetta in LA for awhile so I was SUPER excited when we came upon this location after finding a long wait at Jaleo. Since it was a Saturday night, we decided to push our luck and ended up with a booth tucked away in the lounge/bar. Perfect. 

The service was amazing from the get-go. Started off with the delicious Gallardo with Hendricks for me, and a proper margarita for my man. We were starving so we inhaled our bread basket of rosemary foccacia and stromboli with marscapone butter and eggplant cabonata. That right there? Best bread basket EVER. Moved on to the most amazing, melts in your mouth short ribs over a bed of farro and veggies. Originally, the farro was for me and the short ribs for my bf but I had to take a bite when I saw his eyes roll over. Then onto our entrees of spaghetti and Colorado lamb. I have to admit, that spaghetti was super overhyped for me. I really liked it, but I expected too much for a simple plate of well executed pasta with tomato sauce. Don't get me wrong...it was delicious, but I'd choose differently next time. The lamb was, however, declared the best lamb he'd ever had.

We were stuffed by then but we couldn't resist dessert. I chose the browned butter cake with figs and poached pears because I just wanted the pears, heh. Our awesome server brought me a taste of aperol to pair with it - what a perfect way to end our meal.

When we were discussing our fave meals from the weekend, we both agreed this was by far the best. In fact, I'll go as far as saying it was one of my best meals in Vegas ever. Thanks for an amazing time, Scarpetta.

Fantastic!  
Dinner at Scarpetta was the last of 3 amazing Valentine gifts.  I wanted to come here because I'm a fan of Scott Contant, and I was not disappointed. 

Our meal was absolutely fantastic, the service was top notch and the atmosphere was perfect.

We started with a light and delicate glass of Wine to go with Creamy Polenta and a Fricassee of Truffled Mushrooms, I had the Short Rib Agnolotti and Dave had the Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli, both were amazing and you know it had to be for me to eat Foie Gras :-)  We ended the meal perfectly with Pana Cotta and Bomboloni. 

I highly recommend you come here when celebrating your next special moment, or, if your just in the mood for a perfect evening with the one you love.

Happy B-Day to ME!!!

Okay we decide to do vegas for my bday and I've been wanting to try out this place.  My good work friend of mine recommended it...shout out to Frank M. for the recommendation.

So I completely forget it's in vegas cause i'm a guy and have the attention span of a 2 year old.  But the wifey thinks of everything and yes I know I'm lucky and yes I tell her frequently.

We ordered:
Bread Basket - Wow!  GREAT START!  

Creamy Polenta - Magical buttery love potion.  Add to anything to make it better.  You can put this on cardboard and enjoy.

Roasted Sea Scallops - Cooked to utter perfection.  Texture was great.  Had a hint of fish to it but I loved it.

Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli - Although I have an extreme love of Foie Gras, this dish was just okay for me.  The texture and temperature of the Ravioli didn't mesh well with the Foie and it just clashed.  I had high hopes for this one.

Spaghetti - This was supposed to be my highlight.  I even went online and made this dish based on raves I've heard about it.  I have to say I wasn't impressed.  The spaghetti noodles were too thick and didn't have that homemade taste or texture to it.  It was served too cold for my taste as well.  Maybe the size of our group affected my experience here.  VERY SAD MOMENT when it hit my palette.  I probably should have asked them to redo it but the vodka had already soaked in and my enthusiasm was curbed.

Black Cod - Just a fish on a dish.  Flavors were okay but this didn't do much for me at all.

My worst fears had materialized.  The moment when you start so fast in the direction of brilliance just to be let down along the way.  I wouldn't say it was a complete let down as the dishes were all pretty well put together, however, that's all it was.  Great shit thrown on a plate...I didn't feel inspired...I wasn't brought anywhere...I was just at a restaurant in Vegas eating with my hot wife and a group of great friends.  It would have made the night perfection if the experience matched the bill.

*Thanks wifey for the extremely thought-filled dinner plan - You're loved*

I was very very excited to come here while on a girls weekend to Vegas. Both my friend and I thought this would be one of our highlights!

Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the hype in our visit. My friend has a few food allergies. Their gluten-free menu was a great help, but we had asked for her to be contacted by the restaurant beforehand to verify that she would be able to eat there. She didn't need anything crazy, just a confirmation that very simple things could be accommodated. Things that have been easily done by Red Robin and other chains. Easy stuff. They called her an hour before our reservation and spoke for about 30 minutes.She was assured that the waiter would be notified of her needs and that her requests could easily be honored. Great!

We get there and are seated right away (despite being a little late due to traffic) but our waiter knew nothing about the conversation that had taken place just 30 minutes before. He went to talk to the hostess and everyone played dumb all around. Despite her requests being quite simple and her efforts to be an easy customer, we were made to feel like a great big hassle to everyone. 

We split the raw yellowtail app and they messed up hers but quickly fixed it. It was so delicious though incredibly tiny even if we hadn't split the portion! There was a long delay for our entrees and the chef sent out a free salad during the wait. They also messed that up but fixed it. My friend had the black cod and I had the short rib angolotti. The cod was again a very small portion. The angolotti was a generous portion, especially given the richness. It was very good but we felt it overpriced for portion and quality, even for Vegas.

I had asked for my remaining angolotti (about 2/3 of my serving, so a large amount) to be boxed up to take with me and not 5 seconds after the waiter had acknowledged my request, he stacked a bunch of plates on top of my plate and walked off, thus ruining my leftovers. I watched him to make sure he wouldn't unstack the plates and scrape off my food into a box. Luckily he did not. My annoyance was high and we had a show to attend so I decided to not make a fuss and just let it go.

My friend and I have eaten out many times at many different types of places with a variety of price points. This was the worst in terms of service at this type of restaurant. The food was ok. Maybe it was an off night, who knows. I wouldn't waste my time or money here again when we come back to Vegas.

We went in after a show ONLY to try the duck and foie gras ravioli. We intended to sit at the bar because we thought there would be a wait at 9 on a Friday night, but they were able to seat us. The house bread basket was amazing. Three different types of bread with a paired dipping sauce. Along with the ravioli we ordered the scallops. Both were delicious. We had just tried the foie gras ravioli at Craft Steakhouse, and I think I prefer the filling there. But, the pasta here is so fresh and amazing. The scallops were on point as well! I would love to come back and try a full dinner here. The service was amazing as well, the server did not care that we were only there to try one dish.

Great view and there is such an attention to detail to their food items.  I was already in awe after the bread basket (it was definitely not an ordinary bread basket).  I enjoyed the Caesar salad and the foie gras and. Duck ravioli combo (tasty...devilishly rich)...the salted caramel budino provided a nice sweetness to balance out the savory meal.

Food was INCREDIBLE. We ordered the Lardon Wrapped Prawns and  it came on a bed of lentils that blew my mind. My husband had the pork chop which was definitely the best we've ever had. I ordered the short rib agnolotti which was beautifully prepared. The service was cold and rushed which absolutely ruined our overall experience. Although it seemed to probably resemble how it really is in Italy. Get in, get out, and good day. I would have really valued a "spiel" of the menu and the restaurant and maybe some suggestions. Not just "are you ready to order?" There are too many restaurants in Vegas to enjoy for me to ever return to this location.

My boyfriend and I are avid Chopped fans and Scott Conant is our favorite judge so it was only right to come here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday :) 

To start off the meal they brought out some bread with different dipping sauces/spreads... before even ordering we scarfed down the whole basket. It was seriously the best bread ever. Even after we finished our entire meal we wanted more! 

We ordered the braised short ribs of beef with vegetable and farro risotto as an appetizer and for our entrees we ordered the spaghetti and short rib agnolotti. The spaghetti was fresh and the sauce had a good basil kick to it. But our favorite of the night had to be the short rib agnolotti! The horseradish sauce was amazing and worked so perfectly with the agnolotti--it was like eating juicy prime rib in the form of pasta!

This is seriously one of my favorite restaurants in all of Las Vegas Nevada you need to call and make a reservation ask for a seat by the window it is delicious I'm talking about the food and the view you can watch the Bellagio fountain shoot off from sitting inside your cozy swank seat and when you're all done then go walk on over to the chandelier bar and get a cocktail or walk over to secret and get a beer and a slice of pizza....Instead of dessert ....

Not your typical Italian. I'd call it fancy Italian versus traditional/family Italian. It was good. I had the noodles that are made from squid. Good but next time I will probably go in a different direction. It was good to try something new.

Amazing pasta!!! I had the PICI and it was delicious! Our waiter Luis was super nice, attentive, and talkative. I'm giving them a 4 since I can't give them a 4.5 because one of host at the front was very unwelcoming when checking in for reservations we had.

This cute, Italian restaurant is located at the Cosmopolitan. We came here for a friend's birthday dinner and had a great service. 

We got free bread (take full advantage) and it was delicious! They have a good options for their main entrees. Since I am a vegetarian, I was going to stick with the usual and get a salad. The waiter then told me they have a separate vegetarian menu which made even more happier. 

You can see the fountains at Bellagio from this restaurant.

My family and I dined here in Nov and ordered an array of dishes. I forgot our waiter's name but he was a tall slender gentleman w. a beautiful smile. His service was very memorable. He was knowledgeable w. the menu and I ordered one of his recommendations;

Creamy polenta: CREAMY and RICH!

Sicilian-spiced duck breast with preserved orange, root vegetables and caramelized endive. I was pleasantly surprised. 

Duck & Foie gras ravioli- RICH RICH RICH and flavorful. 

Mediterranean Orata- Very light and flavorful. The fish skin was crispy and the meat was moist.

The dinner was good but it was the desserts that made it great!

The Strawberry Souffle and it was DELISH!! -I wish I could remember the name of the other desserts because they were all really out of this world too. 

The dinner was ok but hats off to the pastry chef and our fantastic waiter!

Great price point if you're looking for something fancy that won't break the wallet. Plus, it's in the beautiful Cosmopolitan, with all its glitz and glamour :) The restaurant itself is on the top floor with all the other eateries, including STK, Jaleo, Secret Pizza, etc.

As for the food, we had mixed reviews at our table. I had the duck and foie gras ravioli which was a nice light dish. Had a hint of sourness that I'm assuming was from the marsala reduction? I actually enjoyed my friend's short rib agnolotti much better. It had great flavors, the pasta was perfect, where the entire meal would have a nice texture to it and then suddenly melt into short rib goodness. The tagliatelle was OK, not a particular favorite.

Overall, the ambiance was excellent. A bit on the dimmer side with their vintage lights. They had many private booths, creating an intimate setting.

My husband and I felt like some of the famous spagetti that we so enjoyed at the Beverly Hills(Montage) Scarpetta. What a bummer. Our service was extremely slow and just lacking in every way. It was still early by Vegas standards (730) so I don't really get the lack of attentiveness. We ordered wine which did not come until AFTER our first course. Finally our spagetti comes....oh, so SALTY...it tasted nothing like the last time. Our server must have known something was amiss as he never once asked how we were enjoying our meal. We also waited a good 45 minutes to be offered dessert---or the check by this time. We finally had to wave someone down to get the bill since we were DONE with this place.

Such a shame. We have had many great food adventures in Vegas, this evening was not one of them. If you really want to have some spagetti that will change your life then come out out to California and enjoy the Scarpetta at the Montage.

With so many cooking competition shows out there, I've always been curious how good some of these renowned chefs and judges really are.  Certain guys clearly have the cred to back it up, but there are others I'm not as familiar with.  Chopped's Scott Conant was one of the latter, but I can now say, without a hint of doubt, that...

SCOTT CONANT IS BAD ASS.

Although it may not have been the original Scarpetta in NY, my meal at this location was still pretty fantastic.  I'd even say they rank as one of my all around favorite restaurants, along with The Spence in Atlanta and State Bird Provisions in San Francisco.  Honestly, everything we had was terrific.  It's also easy now to see why Scott Conant is so tough on contestants who dare to cook pasta on the show - Scarpetta's ranks as the best I've had thus far!

-- BREAD BASKET...Complimentary
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=dPyovDlWT4wM9GCaxo59yw#hYFt6DlCGHA332ECJChzLQ)
Not normally something I would bother mentioning because bread is bread.  That is, unless it's got salami baked into it.  Well played Scott Conant, well played.

-- ROASTED DIVER SCALLOPS with Morels, Sugar Snap, Watermelon Radish and Pea Froth...$23
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=dPyovDlWT4wM9GCaxo59yw#V_vEStj9d5Uur3sAloUvZA)
My friend and I split an order and our server was kind enough to have it plated separately for us.  The scallop had a near perfect sear (could have been harder) and the center couldn't have been cooked any better - soft and tender.  The pea froth complemented the scallop's sweetness quite well.

-- DUCK FOIE GRAS RAVIOLI with a Marsala Reduction...$27
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=dPyovDlWT4wM9GCaxo59yw#rJ2lg-UKLTLOss3CPgcrYQ)
Simply fantastic.  I was already dead set on ordering this, but it was nice to find out it was one of their signature dishes.  The ravioli was amazing - silky and tender with just the right bite.  Although the foie gras filling was awesome on its own, the marsala reduction made it that much better!

-- SHORT RIB AGNOLOTTI with Brown Butter, Horseradish, and Toasted Breadcrumbs...$26
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=dPyovDlWT4wM9GCaxo59yw#x9WaFDf-qarVghjn7g-iYA)
My friend ordered this one and it gave the ravioli a serious run for its money.  The pasta was just as good in this dish and the short rib added a nice bit of savoriness.  The breadcrumbs didn't do a ton for me, but it still tasted great.

-- STRAWBERRY SOUFFLÉ with a Rhubarb Compote and Vanilla Gelato...$11
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=dPyovDlWT4wM9GCaxo59yw#UUgJpj3_-6a9_rBmpTbrSA)
Not to gush like a little girl, but damn this was good!  I thought the compote and gelato would be too much sweetness, but the dish had just the right amount of sweetness and the soufflé had a perfect consistency.  I honestly don't know what else to say other than that YOU MUST GET THIS.
