While the meal itself was amazing, I thought some of the hostesses could really use an attitude check.  For some reason, they seem to think they're better than everyone else and do very little to hide it.  It seems other Yelpers have left with the same impression, but at least our waiter Christian and the rest of the wait staff more than made up for it.

Beyond the food and service though, Scarpetta might be worth a trip just to take in the view!  The dining room area (not the bar section) has giant bay windows that face the Bellagio fountains and the strip (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/scarpetta-las-vegas?select=dPyovDlWT4wM9GCaxo59yw#3OL0vvlkTy4YgBuGuBi7cw).  Unfortunate I was only there with a friend instead of a girlfriend though (sorry bud).  Scarpetta, I'll definitely be seeing you again during my next trip to Vegas.  And considering how often I seem to be there, it'll probably be a lot sooner than later!

Yelp Fail. 

This was my girlfriend's first time in Las Vegas, so I wanted to bring her to an upscale place and have her try some food from supposedly exclusive restaurants in vegas. Based on the yelp reviews, and time availability, I chose Scarpetta. It was a major disappointment, and I felt so bad bringing her to this establishment. This was the first restaurant experience she had in Vegas and it was horrendous. 

Let me say that this review is based on three dishes that we had at Scarpetta. 

1. Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli (main course)
2. Short Rib Agnolotti (main course)
3. Roasted Diver Scallops (appetizer)

Ambiance:

The seating and view were great. We were the table almost next to the window where the Belagio water show was going on. There was a great view of the show. The lighting was also dim. It is definitely a nice place to bring a date.

Price:

Despite the $$$, the prices are not too outrageous for Las Vegas. The main course dishes were 25 and 26 dollars while the roasted scallops were 23 dollars. 

Service:

Service was horrible. We were there for over an hour. Our waiter checked up on us twice, once to bring more water and the second time to see if our food was ready. We waited for about 15-20 minutes to get our scallop appetizer. No apologies or more complementary bread. The wait for the food seemed the norm, as the tables next to us finished their food and were just making small talk while waiting for over 20 minutes. After we finished our scallops, we proceeded to wait another almost 30 minutes for our main course. Again, no apologies or further check ups. I ran out of water while waiting for our main course, during the appetizer, and did not get a refill until I had to ask for one (after the main course came). When we wanted to tell the waiter about the problems with our main courses, he and other waiters could not be found for about 20 minutes. We just sat there looking at each other and our plates (almost untouched). Simply horrible.

Food:

Scallops - these were actually very good. They were simple scallops that were fresh and cooked well. I would definitely get this again.

Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli - came out cold, tough, and very very very salty. We have had foie gras before, and this was well beyond what it was supposed to taste like. It left a bitter and salty taste in the mouth that could only be drowned out by eating the complimentary bread with their house tomato sauce. My girlfriend did not want to waste food so she tried to put the ravioli in her mouth followed by water as a chaser. She soon became sick and had to go to the bathroom. She only finished about 1/3 of the plate before I told her to stop. 

Short Rib Agnolotti - gross. The noodles were tough and cold. The sauce made the bread crumbs stick to the noodles and caused the noodles to stick together like one giant pasta. I had trouble eating one bite of it. After finally taking a bit, the food was bland and left an unpleasant aftertaste. It was one of the worst dishes I have had in a long time. I am usually not too picky with pasta, but this Agnolotti was inedible. The noodles were rubbery hard and the sauce was cold and crusted onto the noodles. The appearance did not help. The food looked like someone threw up on the plate. The sauce was black or very dark brown (could not tell because of the dim lighting), but the appearance made the food even less appetizing. 

Conclusion of the meal:

After about 20 minutes of the food being on the plate, almost completely untouched, the waiter came by to ask "how was everything tasting." I told the waiter that the food was inedible and that it was probably the worst thing I've had in recent memory. The waiter's face was priceless. He did not seem shocked at all, rather, he just appeared to be apologetic. The waiter took the food off our table and asked if we wanted anything else. At this point, the restaurant was about to close and we did not want to wait another 30 minutes to get some inedible food. I told him to just give me the check so we can get out of there. They took the two dishes off our bill and our almost 2 hour meal came out to a whopping $23 (for the scallops). What a waste of time and appetite.

This trend of inedible food was not isolated to only our table table. While waiting for our food, the table behind us asked for the check and had two dishes that were inedible and left untouched as well. I did hear that the fish was decent from the table behind us, but that was the extent of praise Scarpetta's food received. 

Overall:

I felt the need to write a long rant about this place. This dinner was supposed to be a happy and memorable event for my girlfriend because it was her very first dinner in vegas. Instead, it was only memorable because of how bad the restaurant service and food were. Considering there are a ton of great great places in vegas, I would highly advise anyone to pass on Scarpetta.

Exceptional service and a fab decor. The food.....yummy but I'm not rushing back. With all the amazing restaurants here there are others I'd rather go back to. The spaghetti with marinara sauce is what the chef is known for....now that I'd have a second helping of. All the rest was really good but not memorable since I can't even recall exactly what it was.

Snobby LA foodie here: this place is romantic, but like almost anything in Vegas, it's more about the experience than the quality. 
Food was nice, standard Italian. I know plenty of mom and pop places that outdo this restaurant by a mile, but they don't have the view of the the fountains at Bellagio :) (if you make a reservation, ask for a table by the window- it really is beautiful).
Also, the prices are adequate! And my lemon drop was very strong. Hooray, alcohol! 
Forgettable Italian food, but if you're trying to get in someone's pants (let's face it- who in Vegas isn't?), this is a sexy, dinner-was-fine place to go!

I was tempted to give Scarpetta 3 stars but I really liked our server, the ambiance, the appetizer and table offerings.  I thought my pasta dish was just good.  Vegas is always pricy and I understand that but I guess I had hoped for a tiny bit better entree.  All in all a nice experience.

We had a very pleasant experience at Scarpetta on Monday night. 

The food was 5 star all the way in our minds, however our Service was a bit hit and miss. 

Luckily the support staff was really fantastic. The menu itself can be a bit intimidating so I looked to our server for advice, he briefly listed ingredients to me, not taste which is very important for me. 

Also one big thing we DID NOT LIKE, by any means, was not only being served from our right but from behind. During the course of service the staff kept reaching from behind in our booth which was not just annoying, but actually uncomfortable. We felt like school kids who were practically told to sit still. It was very odd.... 

The hits 
were the short rib app, and the gazpacho soup 

the foie gras and duck ravioli, which isn't as gamey as is sounds surprisingly and spaghetti was tremendous! :)

While looking for a place to have dinner, I only needed to read 5 words to convince me to try this place out.  Those five magical words were "duck and fois gras ravioli."  Umm...yes please!  So with little hesitation we called in for a reservation and I excitedly awaited dinner time.

Once we arrived at Scarpetta, we noticed that the decor was nice but not stuffy.  The people in the dining area seemed to be enjoying themselves and the view overlooking the Bellagio fountain just added to the overall ambiance of the restaurant.  The ambiance and decor definitely work well to add to the dining experience at this restaurant.

The service was also another thing that was nice and attentive but not overly intrusive.  They were very quick to take our drink orders and were quick to come back once they noticed we were ready to order.  They also did a great job of explaining all the complimentary breads and butters as well as fielding any other question we had.  

Now for the important part, the food.  Here's a quick break down of what we had:

Complimentary Bread:

Ordinarily I wouldn't even mention this.  I mean, there are some restaurants that give you some phenomenally good bread but here is the thing that puts Scarpetta above and beyond those other places.  The stromboli!  Holy moly this thing is good.  Bread baked around cheese and pepperoni (I think it was pepperoni) was just so good.  I honestly could have had this for dinner and I would've have been completely happy.

Appetizers:

Tuna Susci -   Assorted marinated veggies and preserved truffles wrapped in tuna.  I suppose this was the chef's interpretation of a sushi roll but I have to say that it just fell flat.  I mean with truffle and tuna in the mix I am still scratching my head as to how this couldn't be good, but it just wasn't.  It was bland and under-seasoned.  My recommendation, don't get it.

Beet Salad - Pretty much what you expect of a beet salad.  A great assortment of different beets with pumpkin seeds and stracciatella cheese with a balsamic dressing, it was refreshing and delicious.

Braised Short Ribs of Beef - This was by far my favorite appetizer.  The short rib was succulent and delicious.  Bedded on root veggies and risotto, this in a larger portion would make an amazing entree, let alone an outstanding appetizer.

Entree:

Indulge me for just a second while I draw a perverted metaphor.  If dinner were a porno, the bread was the nasty making out, the appetizers the foreplay, then the duck and fois gras ravioli would be the money shot.  Goodness sakes alive this is one delicious pasta.  A nice big plate of perfectly cooked ravioli with a drizzle of marsala reduction; these decadent little bites were heaven in tiny little pockets of pasta.  If you like duck and fois gras, this is a must!

Overall, I had a great meal here.  I thought the prices were reasonable for Vegas fine dining, the ambiance great, the service spot on, and the food was just phenomenal.  Honestly, if I hadn't gotten the tuna susci appetizer, this would have been just about the perfect meal, but even the susci couldn't dissuade me from giving Scarpetta a well deserved 5 stars.  Bravo!

Dined here with 4 other girls for my sis-in-law's bachelorette dinner this past weekend.

First and foremost our sever, Ricardo, was such a delight! He was just a super nice guy!

Bread basket was spot on. The eggplant spread is delicious and the salami & cheese bread was so salty and savoy and addicting!! Water glasses were continuously being refilled and service was top notch.

We ordered the tomahawk steak, 2 orders of the pici pasta w lobster, and the short rib agnolotti. All dishes were good but overall not as memorable as the bread. The flavor of the pici was nice and there was a lot of lobster meat which is plus but the pasta was a little too chewy for the group. The short rib was yummy, very rich. The tomahawk was a little too fatty for some of the girls in the group (Ricardo had warned us of fat marbling due to it being a ribeye). The real stars of the meal were the accompaniments of the tomahawk - the roasted on the vine tomatoes and the cheesy risotto balls! Both were excellent!!!

A cookie plate was delivered complimentary for the Bride-to-be. However we should have ordered a dessert because they all looked really good.

Decor is lovely and view of the Bellagio fountains is the primary reason i choose this restaurant.

Before eating at Scarpetta, my husband and I only knew of Scott Conant as the guy who judges Chopped, hosts that awful 24 hour Restaurant battle show, hates onions, and any dish where you mix fish with cheese.  He also likes to wear extremely tight unbuttoned shirts that makes him look like a distant cousin to the Czech brothers that Dan Aykroyd  and Steve Martin used to play on SNL in the 70s.  But for restaurant week 2011 we stopped by here, lured by the promise of $25 spaghetti so perfectly delicious, that it makes Jesus weep.  

Sadly, the spaghetti did not make anyone weep and did not live up to the hype.  In fact, my wonderful husband actually said that my marinara sauce that I routinely rip off from Mario Batali and Anne Burrell, is much better.  I personally was not a fan of the thick noodles, but I thought the sauce on Scott Conant's version was better than mine.  To each their own, really.  But yes I am slightly marking down my rating for the over-hyped food.

Other than that, most of the other dishes were just pretty good, but the  bread basket with the eggplant dip and the truffled mushroom polenta were absolutely spectacular.  Honestly, you could come here and only order the polenta and mooch off the bread basket, and you will have a pretty hearty and filling meal for a decent price.  

So I'm happy that Scott Conant's restaurant in Las Vegas was better than I thought it would be, but his Jesus spaghetti is just ok.

.
Still may favorite restaurant on the Las Vegas Strip... Updated the photos to do the food better justice.  Everything is good, you can't go wrong.

Yet another really superb Las Vegas dining experience.  Scott Conant did not disappoint.  We came here shortly after the restaurant/hotel opened and even then, everything was done remarkably well.  Between our table we sampled a variety of menu items and we really enjoyed the meal.  I particularly loved the shortrib pasta and the striped bass.  The desserts here are also not to be missed-- specifically the chocolate cake with salted caramel gelato.  Need I say more?
Having the spaghetti tomato basil here now and it just feels like I'm eating the Mona Lisa

Never underestimate the power of spaghetti! Clean flavor not overshadowed by anything unwelcome.  Full body tomato basil sauce and impeccably crafted pasta so delicious you'll never look at spaghetti the same again. The rib cap was described as "the best thing I've ever eaten" by my husband. So, if you are unsure of what to order, the rib cap is a must. My sister has a severe gluten allergy and struggles to find any restaurant that not only understands the risk of cross contamination but offers an entire menu of gluten free options. She was she able to order gluten free pasta and said it was incredibly delicious. No easy feat when making any dish, let alone pasta ,for such an allergy. Not only is scarpetta accommodating and inviting but the dishes are made with unbelievable skill by chefs who are truly passionate about their craft. Bravo!

Scarpetta features a very good ambiance with a fantastic view of the  Bellagio Fountains. To get a great view, make sure you ask to be seated by the window upon reservation. Ambience is dark, sexy and romantic, but different tables set different moods. They also have a booth section that is very secluded from the rest. 

Starting with the notable wine list, I decided to pair my dinner with a glass of Malbec.
Shortly after, our server brought us the bread basket. The bread basket consisted of foccacia, strombolli with warm meat and cheese, bread with herb, basic rolls and sourdough. Delicious!  They were served with mascarpone butter spread, citrus olive oil and eggplant spread.

Our server told us that they were best known for their spaghetti. Hmmm, must try that next time. For appetizer, we started with the raw yellowtail. 
For our entrees, we ordered the duck foie gras ravioli  and prime NY steak.
The yellowtail was very tender and refreshing. Used of rock salt gave it a unique after taste. I only wish there was more of it since it only came with 4 pieces. 
The duck and foie gras ravioli was alright.   I absolutely wanted to love this dish due to the presence of foie gras, but I could barely taste the foie gras. The marsala reduction was a delightful contrast to the ravioli. 
The steak was cooked to perfection. Medium rare, the way I like it. However, I can't say that it was the best I've ever had. Not even on my top three list.  It was served with seasonal vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, roasted potatoes, wild mushrooms and parmigiano. We were told the  mushrooms were shitake , trumpet royale, beech, and pecorino mushroom. 

Since we were sharing everything, they were very accommodating by splitting everything for us.  The food timing was excellent! I wish I had more room for dessert but I was too full by the end of my meal.
Overall, i enjoyed my dining experience at Scarpetta.

A wonderful surprise at the Cosmo! We highly recommend asking the staff to course out th entire meal (serve one dish at a time). A single appetizer can be split into two portions so you can order a bunch of different plates and really take your time. 

The scallops with foie gras as well as the bone marrow and short rib pasta were our favorites. The pana cotta and mini doughnuts were awesome for dessert. 

Get a table by the window. The view of the Bellagio and the strip is stunning.

Came here when visiting the Cosmopolitan and we were not disappointed. There were four of us and we all shared our entrees and desserts.

Dishes:
Fois Gras and Duck pasta- ok but nothing special
Short Rib Pasta- good but again, nothing special
Spaghetti with tomato and basil- AMAZING, truly a signature dish, I wish I could have had 3 of these!
Octopus app- tasty but I've had better (mainly B&B also in Vegas)

Desserts:
Panna Cotta- I don't even love Coconut but this was AWESOME! fresh fruit yum
Strawberry shortcake- deconstructed and so so very delicious 
Nutella & Vanilla Bomboloni - AWESOME, highly recommended

The Spaghetti and desserts were the highlight of our meal. For Vegas, it wasn't a terribly expensive meal so we would go back for sure!
Great food and amazing service. The scallop appetizer was amazing and the spaghetti is the best I've had.

We were majorly craving some good Italian food and decided to try this place, per the great reviews on Yelp. We got a bunch of different dishes and shared everything. The best thing on their menu was their spaghetti. While their portions are tiny, they are rich in flavor.The spaghetti did not have an overwhelming tomato paste, it was very creamy and had the right amount of sauce for the pasta. I got their filet as my main entree. The steak was cooked to my liking - just melted in my mouth.

The ambiance of the restaurant is very romantic.We had a great table right near the window where we could see the Bellagio fountains and the whole strip was right underneath us. The wait staff were great, my drink was refilled instantly, didn't even have to ask! I will be back here soon for sure!

A beautiful place to have a romantic dinner. With no reservation, my boyfriend and I were able to sit down right away in a little cubby seating. It was adorable. 

For drinks, I started off with a Lemon Drop and he got a white wine. The apps are so good, beef tartare is our favorite, as well as the oysters. 

I came to this restaurant twice and got the spaghetti both times. I know, why would I get spaghetti in a place like this? Well, my first time here, I saw a yelp photo that quoted the spaghetti with meatballs as "simply amazing." AND YES IT IS!! I love it so much, it really is just simply amazing. 

So in short, I will be back again and again. It seems like I'm always in Vegas... yum (to eat, not to party of course.)

It's a fancy Italian style restaurant at the Cosmo. Of course, the service is phenomenal and the food was pretty good as well. The bread was delicious, especially the one with the salami in it. All the fixings that come with the bread was really good too. 

We got the Creamy Polenta, which was kind of like a mashed corn (i think), but it kinda had a mashed potato texture. The truffle mushrooms made it really delicious. We also got the Veal loin, which was really good. It was tender and not at all gamey tasting. It was very well seasoned and tasted delicious, especially since it was my first time having veal. I got the Stracci, which was pasta with lobster, crab, and shrimp on top. If you're a seafood lover, then you'll love this.

Scarpetta, located on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan, has roughly the same menu as its New York counterpart, including the famous Spaghetti with butter - er, basil - and you can expect the same eyebrow-raising prices.  But it's delicious and, besides, you're in Vegas so you clearly already hate money.  The atmosphere was relaxed, upscale and quiet, which may or may not be what you're looking for in a Vegas dinner.

The service is a bit of a different story.  On the one hand, there were periods when we couldn't get anyone's attention for minutes at a time.  On the other hand, our server was overattentive whenever he was at our table.  For instance, when we were ordering, after we placed our order he would offer commentary on each dish.  This might just be a pet peeve of mine, but if I've already decided on a dish, I don't need you to tell me that it "appears small on the plate, but the filling and the reduction are actually quite rich, so I think you'll be satisfied."  Just say "OK" or nothing at all.

To start I ordered the yellowtail, which was incredible and I only wish there was more of it.  The sea salt was a really nice touch and I'm probably now going to be tempted to salt all of my sashimi going forward.

For my main, I had the duck and foie gras ravioli, which was similarly delicious (and enough food, I thought). According to our server, most people order three courses, but my group felt like two was enough.

We live in Las Vegas, and eat on the strip at least once a week.  We love all the Cosmo restaurants, and decided to try Scarpetta, as we had out of town guests, and we had been wanting to try.  We knew we would not be disappointed - boy were we wrong!   I really was on the edge on how to rate this restaurant, 2 or 3 stars, as the while the food was good, the service was awful.  The server was very friendly, however, and this is why I opted for 3.

First the positive.  The food was excellent.  All 6 of us in the party loved our food.  The desserts also were fabulous.   No complaint at all there.

The problem was the service.  The server was very friendly, but too many issues.  First, we got our cocktails, and after a few minutes, he took our order.  We did not order first courses, however our order was out virtually instantly.  We hadn't even half finished our drinks.  We had planned to order a couple of bottles of wine with dinner, however we never got the chance, and more importantly, our server never asked.

Worse yet, he came by a bit after we got our food,and while walking asked if everything was okay.  We said that it was, and before we could even asked for more drinks, he was gone.  2 of the 6 drinks at the table were totally empty, and he never asked, and still worse, he NEVER CAME BACK.  Our drinks sat empty for 75% of the dinner, and even when he ordered dessert, he did not ask if we wanted coffee or anything else to drink!!!!  It was almost unbelievable.

It's not like he was that busy, as I had a clear view of the waiter station, and he spent quite a bit of time just standing there, watching the dining room.  Obviously not our table, however.

Unless I start to hear some very positive reviews from friends, we will not be back.

As bad as DOCG was is as good as Scarpetta was. I learned my lesson....don't be cheap. It is worth the extra money to eat here for sure. I went here with a friend as our first meal on her first trip to Vegas. When you enter, the restaurant looks tiny... like a long hallway, and then when you get to the end it opens into a large restaurant with a big window overlooking the Bellagio fountains .... so cool. I was worried that I would need to order a lot to get full and spend a ton of money.... not the case. We both ended up ordering the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti and not only was it delicious but it was super filling. It was savory, had varying texture, and spiced perfectly... I loved every bite. That, in addition to their amazing bread basket (including 4 types of bread with some stuffed with cheese/meat/veg and 3 dips a whipped soft cheese spread, citrus olive oil, and eggplant), filled us up...awesome! We finished with the waiter recommended doughnut dessert.... I had one complaint about that dessert, either I missed it or they didn't tell us that one side of the plate was all nutella filled donuts and the other side was all vanilla... I thought the vanilla and nutella would be mixed...so when I was eating from one side and my friend was eating from the other side we were both confused where the other flavor was.... Anyway, the nutella donut with the banana gelato was awesome, the vanilla...not so much. That was a pretty minor problem. Our service was great and we each paid about 30$...not bad at all. Will be back for sure.

My husband and I had a mixed experience here: I really liked it, but he didn't. We came without reservations on a Saturday night, and the place was pretty empty. We were seated immediately and had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. The tables felt a bit close together, and it was very easy to hear conversations at other tables and difficult to block them out. It was also extremely dark; so dark that the man next to me had to use the flashlight on his iPhone to see and pay his bill haha

For food, we clearly had the bread basket, which was a little large for two people but tasty. We probably left about two-thirds of it untouched for fear of getting full before our main courses. I ordered the duck and foie gras ravioli, which was excellent. It was tasty and fun and inventive, and I've never really had anything like it. The filling was salty (in a good way) and paired very well with the marsala reduction, which was a bit sweet. My husband ordered the veal chop parmigiano, which he was pretty underwhelmed by. He grew up in Germany eating tons of veal, and he said that the quality just wasn't there for the price. For dessert, we split the nutella and vanilla bombolinis, which are basically donuts, and boy, were they yummy! 

Service was pretty mediocre. While our server was perfectly friendly, he seemed really stressed. He had to run around to stay on top of things, and he sort of dropped/slammed our stuff onto the table and took off in a hurry.

Yum yum yum. Beautiful restaurant in the Cosmo hotel with amazing views of the Bellagio fountain. The food was absolutely spectacular and I was so happy that they have a separate (though brief) vegetarian menu. They also have really great cocktails as well. Service is on point and quick. As others have noted, their mascarpone butter to spread on your bread is simply amazing. 

Bottom line, this has to be on your Las Vegas food trek. I can't wait to return!

There's something about expensive dinner dates that stresses me out. What do you order that makes you #1 not seem like a greedy user or #2 not offend your date by ordering whatever is the absolute cheapest - like just a side of potatoes?

Well that was my dilemma prior to being taken here by Beau S. on 2/1/14 as his other suggestions for dinner secretly made me extremely uneasy, even though I wasn't footing the bill. While still not even remotely cheap, I breathed a sigh of relief knowing that I could order something under the 9 zillion dollar range on their menu. 

The restaurant is pretty but what stuck out to me is that there must be a thousand waiters standing around waiting to swoop in on any possible need you may have. 

Based on the amount of pictures on Yelp, I had the duck ravioli ($27) and I really enjoyed it. (I presume) to prove to me that he does in fact eat vegetables since we last dated, Beau ordered Brussels sprouts and spaghetti. He said the sprouts were terrible and he ended up not eating them. His spaghetti looked as if it came from a can. I declined his multiple offers to try some because it looked so bad and let him have some of mine. 

I'm not sure what the hype is over the bread basket. I had a good piece of French bread but it wasn't orgasmic like the other reviewers go on about.

Dinner lasted 36 whole minutes. We decided to have dessert elsewhere. The food was okay, the atmosphere was fine, but honestly, if I didn't have such a great dinner date, I probably would have forgotten I ate here. Who I was with was really the only draw about this place.

Been wanting to try Scarpetta for awhile now! Decided to come here for dinner w my gf on a Wednesday night and it was not too busy. We shared everything and they split it all for us which was nice. The polenta with truffled mushrooms was Amazing I could have done without sharing this dish! The duck foie gras ravioli was rich and savory. The only dish was did not care for was the oratta which was a fish dish with a tomato based sauce. The fish was too fishy tasting for my liking and just overall lacked in flavor. The coconut panna cotta we got for dessert was delicious and I am still thinking about it! Definitely need to come back and try the spaghetti!

-hostess could be friendlier...maybe b/c we changed the appt. time once?
-found a long twisted hair in the bread basket.  we didn't make a big deal nor did they...gross
-$35 cod wasn't really present.  smaller than a poker card and very salty/fishy
-food overall was just ok but definitely not worth the money.
-bill took a long time to come around 
-best: our waiter was cool

Delicious fine Italian dining in Las Vegas at The Cosmopolitan hotel. Fresh baked bread is so yummy with the option  of vegetarian bread that is a must try! Their dipping spreads with the lemon infused olive oil and eggplant spread is so tasty! Definitely a must if you're in Vegas and want to splurge on a fancy and delicious dinner! Their pasta dishes are delicious as well. I ordered the tagliatelle with truffle sauce and guanciale - except I didn't have the guanciale because I'm vegetarian. :)

Simply the best Pasta on the strip. I've had the privilege of trying pasta at many of the excellent restaurants on the strip and this is simply the best. The risotto is perfection so order it it's on the special menu.

HUGE FAN of 500 Cucina! We stumbled upon this place while searching for highly rated Italian restaurants in Calgary, needless to say we were very pleased with the results.

First, our service was exceptional! The server was an expert on the menu and gave us perfect recommendations on drinks and food. While they did not get our order correct initially, they were completely accepting of this fact and offered to correct the mistake immediately. The food was delicious and portions were plentiful!

Vibe here was fun- music selection was late 90's/early 2000's, certainly good for dates or even large groups. If I ever found myself back in the Calgary area, I would be back without a doubt.

There are so many options to think about at The Cosmopolitan when it comes to dining.  If you are thinking about a romantic dinner overlooking the Bellagio fountains, this the restaurant to choose.

Additionally when you go before Christmas the hotels all tend to put their restaurants on a rotation since it is slow season.  Scarpetta had been closed for 10 days until the night we went.  When I had made my reservations i mentioned it was my gal's birthday and would like a seat near the window.

We got there for our reservation and a table with 3 people showed up after us.  They were given a window seat.  We were given a table 3 rows away from the window and next to the waiter station.  We had a limited view of the Bellagio Fountains. The place is pretty dressy casual and there were a couple who had old jeans on sitting by the window.

We were limited on time as we were trying to catch a show at the Bellagio.  The one thing to note is that our waiter was attentive to that point and never pushed us on dessert, but did apologize a couple times for the slowness of the kitchen during the meal.

We ordered our drinks as well as our meal in one fell swoop. As we were in a rush at the night was young, we ordered the yellowtail and tuna susci with caviar for appetizers and  had the duck and foie gras ravioli and diver scallops with foie gras for main courses.  Everything came out slow and we were rushed!  We had two drinks before appetizers finally came and I knew something was wrong and didnt want to ruin the evening.

They brought out the yellowtail but then a full tin of Russian caviar with toast points...etc.  Fortunately we love caviar.  Unfortunately this was not going to be a simple $150 meal!!!  I did not want to and maybe should have said something but we had had a few drinks and I did nit want to ruin the special evening planned any more.  

The Duck and Foie gras ravioli was good but not as great as it sounds.  it was just too tempting to resist. I love duck and I love foie gras but I guess it didn't work well together for me.  The scallops were good too.  Now that California has lifted its ban on foie gras I can now more easily pass when I see it on menus.  The yellowtail appetizer was just okay as well.

Now the caviar was awesome but it is something I would rather have at a nice cocktail party and not on my own dime.  I am still wondering how that was put on my ticket because it was nowhere on any menus I saw.  My $19 dish turned into a $225 dish and my bill came to over $500 for two!  Ugh!!!

Yes it was a special night, but very costly!

Brought a date here.... This is the right place to invite a girlfriend for dinner. The place was a little dim, Bellagio fountains view, candle lights...ohh my. Very romantic atmosphere. 
Our order was a short rib and bone marrow agnolotti and spaghetti with tomato and basil for my girlfriend. We took wine as well for our romantic evening. We took chocolate cake and cocktails for dessert. Cocktails were fantastic. I loved them, my girlfriend as well. 
Yes, we really enjoyed our evening.
The only reason I gave 4 stars is service . The waiter was slow, it took forever to 
get our meal and dessert was served by another server. 
I'll return to this place definitely and hope that their service will be improved by that time.

The food was ok but the food portion is very small.  An entree is about $35-$60 and a glass of wine is about $20.  Our waiter was rude when we asked to split the bill.  It's a fair request but his attitude and his response was short and rude.  I personally wouldn't consider going back to the restaurant nor recommend any friends to come here.
I highly recommend this place.  Great food, excellent views, and one of the best wine lists I've ever seen.  Our waiter Johnathan was exceptional and the food was some of the best I have ever had.

A meal at Scarpetta is a bit like a Chanel bag: you do know it is a tad overpriced for what you get but you keep on wanting more.

My girlfriends and I really like Scarpetta and ever since we went about 5 years ago, we try to go there at least once a year. We always rave about the dishes: this is really really good Italian. The duck and foie gras ravioli is definitely one of my faves but really all dishes I have tried from their menu have always been big hits.

The view on the Bellagio is obviously amazing and the service has always been good. The servers typically have good recommendations, not only for the food but they are happy to recommend cocktails and wines.

A good tip to save on some money is to go during happy hour (they call it social hour): they serve smaller portions of their dishes at a really good price.

I think it is a bit overpriced but when in Vegas... I always go back!

UHHHH MAZZZZINGGGG!!! is it bad to say that the bread basket excites me so much? Everything was delicious! The veal and the duck were to die for but the presentation was really great to top it off... Did I mention the bread basket?

We hosted our wedding reception dinner here after we got married in the Wedding Suite on the 36th floor. We had a four course meal with the scallops, braised short ribs, yellowtail, foie gras ravioli, spaghetti, Mediterranean Orata, black cod, NY steak, and a bunch of desserts. Our custom wedding cake with vanilla and chocolate marble cake with peanut buttercream was the most amazing cake I have ever had in my life (our guests said the same thing). It was well worth the price, as our guests kept raving about the food and how it was the best meal they ever had. We look forward to returning on our one-year anniversary!

I booked our table on opentable.com and was thrilled to see we were sat at the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We found the waitstaff to be friendly and knowledgable. My husband and I both ordered the tasting menu, with my husband enjoying the wines to go with his. The waiters did a wonderful job explaining each dish and spacing out the time between each course. We loved every course, but the one we cannot stop thinking about is the pasta with tomato sauce and basil. I know it sounds simple, but believe me it is simply delicious. I recommend having the tasting menu, but if you do not want to splurge then order the pasta, you won't be sorry.

Okay, so how good can basic tomato sauce spaghetti be? Well, that's what I ordered after being seated with my guest by the windows with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. It was good. Actually, I'm craving it right now on the cab ride back home. The noodles are made in house and they were hearty with some chew. It wasn't the slippery Barilla spaghetti kind that you get everywhere else, even at many upscale Italian restaurants. The sauce was seasoned perfectly and you can taste the olive oil and tomatoes. More importantly, everything came out piping hot. The bread basket was filled with sourdough, cheese bread, and bread that was filled with Italian sausage and spinach. For dessert we got the chocolate soufflé, which was an it too runny for my taste. I'd opt for the tiramisu next time. 

The waiter was attentive and funny too.

Good: EVERYTHING!
Bad: NOTHING!

Swear this is the best food I have eaten in a VERY LONG TIME! 

The dinner breads were great and had a good variety. The pepperoni stromboli bread could've been a meal alone.

For appetizers we had the Braised Short Ribs, Raw Yellowtail, and Beet Salad. The short ribs were tender, flavorful, cooked perfectly, and had a good portion size. The yellowtail was fresh and so tasty with the pickeled red onion, LOVED IT! As for the beet salad, the best I have ever eaten. (Period).

Entrees included the signature spaghetti (I will perfect this at home!), Duck & Foie Gras ravioli, and the 24 oz Ribey. The spaghetti was perfect, amazing, simple, delicious, and awesome. Our ribeye was cooked and seasoned so well, I was glad to get the last piece! The Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli...heaven in your mouth with blessings from on high...I have never been so pleased and I spent the longest time enjoying this dish.

For Dessert, we had the Crispy Sweet Risotto Crepes. These were surprisingly good and the sorbet was AWESOME! Perfect way to end the meal.

I have been thinking about the Duck Foie Gras ravioli DAILY for the past 4 weeks, you have to try them.

This place was so yummy. And what a view! We got the tuna appetizer to start and it was so good. I got some sort of steak and I remember it being perfectly cooked. And the dessert was absolutely divine. I have eaten at some fine places, and this place was very, very good. Better than I expected!

I would rate this restaurant higher if I could. The service is on point and the food is exceptional. The filet is the best I have ever had. And the signature spaghetti is even better the next day! Probably my favorite restaurant, perfect dining experience.  Beware.. You will crave it weeks to come.

Tomato basil pasta was out of this world! The bread basket had a vegetarian Stromboli that tasted amazing. My husband couldn't get enough of the eggplant caponata that comes with the bread!! The service was very  good!

This is easily one of the best restaurants I've eaten at. I visit every time I am in Las Vegas. From the complimentary bread to the desserts, this place excels on all levels. Make sure you request a seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains. I have been served by Roberto twice. He is fantastic!

Outstanding! Asato was our server. He was so helpful and nice. The pasta was out of this world. When I told him I wanted tiramisu for dessert...he went to a neighboring restaurant and got it...no that is service.

This restaurant, located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel & Casino is probably one of the nicest restaurants on the Vegas strip. It is quiet, fancy, and the wait staff is very professional. It is, a bit pricey, however. I think spaghetti with marinara sauce is something like $25. It is, however, probably the best spaghetti you'll eat! I had the broccoli rob ($11) and the potatoes ($11) and let me tell you...they were absolutely delicious! I can't describe the flavor because it was so perfect. While $22 for broccoli and potatoes seems a bit pricey, I think it was worth every penny. My mom had gluten free pasta in a marinara sauce and my dad had some sort of ravioli. They both said their meals were delicious as well.

We have eaten at scarpetta in Vegas 2 times and once at the Miami location.  After eating at the Vegas location the first time, we were so impressed and loved the food so much we chose it for the location of our rehearsal dinner.   

We had our wedding rehearsal dinner for 32 people at scarpetta in the Vino room on 6/15.  I'm so happy we did.  Everything was absolute perfection.  I have to give a shout out to the staff at Scarpetta especially Kelly Racine for all of her help.  She was fantastic throughout this process.   

We had a menu that consisted of the following

Braised Short ribs (Very good)
Creamy Pollenta (to die for)
Heirloom tomato salad

spaghetti (in no way over rated)
Short Rib Agnolotti (spectacular in every way)

Black Cod (did not have this for my entree, but it got good reviews)
Sirloin with gnocchi & wild mushrooms (delish!)

we also had two different desserts served to our table that were outstanding. 

The waitstaff was fantastic, very polite and moved around the room seamlessly.   I can not wait to return for another meal.   And if you're looking for a place to have a small wedding reception or rehearsal dinner, I highly recommend adding Scarpetta to your list of restaurants to check out.

Started off the year with a new restaurant! Decided to come here as a late birthday dinner. 

The Ambience is quite nice. I loved the lighting and the overall layout was quite lovely. Sitting next to the windows give you an incredible view of the Bellagio fountains. 

We started out with the steak tartar which was served with some parmesean chips. Delicious app that i woukd order again. Also tried that short rib on top of risotto. Really enjoyed this as well, but 180 degrees on flavor profile from tartar. So it depends what you want you want! 

The duck foie gras raviloi was 100% what you would expect. Delicate ravioli, generous filling, and a whole plate. I would eat this over and over. Also ordered the Uni pasta. This was such an interesting meal. If you enjoy seafood like i do, this will leave you wanting more. Essentially tasted like ocean. And i loved it. 

Coconut soufle was amazing. Pour over sauce and side of toasted coconut. 

I suppose my only real complaint was the wine. Typical vegas fashion the wine list was okay. And i found some bottles to be so over priced. $42 for a pour of 85' dows... Thats silly.  $98 dollars for a 15-25 bottle of poggio tesoro. I am a firm believer of bringing your own wine and just paying corkage in Vegas. Wine lists in vegas casinos are so awful nowadays. 

Id eat here again and just always bring my own wine. 2 bottle max, $35 corkage. Bubbles, extra bottle and youre set.

Absolutely delicious! Went for my husbands birthday after New Years with a special request- seating with a view of the Bellagio Fountains, which they accommodated  The bread is amazing, yes, but don't fill up. While the dishes are moderate in size, very filling. Had the scallop appetizer: scallops melt in your mouth, perfectly cooked. Did not care for barley risotto on the short rib appetizer. The pici spaghetti was amazing, had a nice spicy kick to it and the spaghetti was cooked perfectly al dente. My husband had the filet, which just melted in your mouth, perfect! Overall great experience and we'll be returning for Valentine's Day :)

I had been dying to try Scarpetta for about a year and we finally got around to it this weekend. You walk up to the bar area which is a skinny hallway that eventually opens up into a beautiful large room. We lucked out and got a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains. It was a really great view and so fun to watch. Our server greeted us right away and he had great suggestions and a good sense of humor, always a plus.  

We started with the complimentary bread basket and it was super fantastic, possibly my favorite bread basket on the strip! There is a delicious stromboli bread filled with warm meat and cheese. There is also an herb bread, a nice piece of crusty bread, and a little cloud like square pillow of bread. There are also 3 spreads, an eggplant, a mascarpone buttery spread, and a citrus olive oil. I am not a fan of eggplant in general so I didn't try that one but I couldn't decide which of the other 2 I liked more. So yummy!

I started with the Heirloom beet salad. There was an array of different colored beets, 2 little wedges of la tur cheese, a few micro-greens, and some hazelnuts sprinkled throughout the plate. Everyone together was great, I just wish there was a bit more acid to break up the savoriness of the dish. I could only stomach half of it before it just became too rich, luckily my husband was happy to eat the other half. 

I moved on to my entree, the short rib agnolotti. The pasta was so delicate and light. The horseradish brown butter had a little kick to it and overpowered the dish just a little. Again, I found this dish very savory and wasn't able to eat the entire plate. Again, my husband saved the day. 

My husband ordered the turbot, it was delicate and so delicious with a light and airy crust. The little parsnips hidden under the fish were my favorite part of the dish, so well done. We also got a side of the broccoli Rabe, which was good but nothing special. 

Our waiter talked us into dessert and we were so happy he did. We ordered the Nutella and vanilla creme Bombolini and can't recommend it enough. We received six little fried donuts filled with Nutella or vanilla creme with a yummy caramelized banana on the side. Everything worked so well together. It wasn't overly sweet, just a nice end to the meal. 

Overall, we had a great meal with a great view! I would definitely go back, if only for the bread basket.

SCARPETTA....OH HOW I TRY TO AVOID YOU!  Yes that was deserving of all cap's. 

So let me just take you back...oh say 5-6 years ago. I was living in NYC and somehow ended up at an "italian restaurant" with no sign (or a very small one) and had the best spaghetti...EVER. I was whisked away into the night without ever knowing the name of the restaurant/where it was (forgot, ugh).

Fast forward like oh... to a year ago when I had the pleasure of dining at Scarpetta here in Miami where I now live and A HA! I somehow had the same spaghetti that I had all those years ago. Immediately I'm like "holy ___(insert adj here)____" this is the best spaghetti...EVER and that was when my love/hate relationship with Scarpetta all began.

Love - in the sense that the food is heavenly and even after eating PASTA (carb overload), I yet still seem to be able to squeeze just a little bit extra onto my plate (whether it be dessert or what have you). It's not the type of pasta where you just peel over and die after because you just stuffed your stomach to maximum capacity. The flavors, heavenly. It's hard for me to justify paying for pasta. I feel like it's the absolute easiest dish to cook in the world (equivalent to a damn bowl of cereal) but at Scarpetta honestly, I would pay more. I stick with the regular spaghetti (trust me on this one).

Hate - in the sense that let's face it people...you're eating a plate full of carbs! Yes my body screams at me as I take every bite of the spaghetti...but it is like drug without the negative consequences (like oh say loosing your kids, family, job, and basically whole life). With this pasta, you just loose a few hours of your life while you are chained to a stair master all day to work it off. Believe me, if you haven't already figured this out by my review so far, let me break it down for you, it's worth it.

I suggested to my girlfriends that we all go to Scarpetta...
- they're all like "well you're the elite girl so we have to go where you want to eat" (and this is coming from girls who only eat like salads) and I'm like ok this is our food cheat weekend, remember? (girls vacation) and they're like "mmmhm" and so then I'm all like "SURPRISE! It's pasta time" Well of course one of the girls was like "ohhh hell no" and stuck with her healthy fish (arctic char) but my other girlfriend caved and had the spaghetti with me (muy bien). The friend who had the arctic char (it was her first time eating it but went with it because of the suggestion from our waiter) really enjoyed it. She said it was absolutely delicious. The spaghetti? I don't even need to say...you already KNOW.

We had wine and mimosa's and blahblahblah it was amazing.

ALSO, I am not sure if this will still be available but there was a tasting course menu which looked TO DIE FOR. However, the entire table needs to ALL order it (duh) so if you have a group of people possibly looking for a course-tasting meal, DEFINITELY CALL AHEAD and get their menu for it. The spaghetti is ON IT along with scallops and a bunch of other things all for a very reasonable price (compared to other course tasting meals like say at ohh... Le Cirque). 

Definitely try out Scarpetta. From start to finish, everything was perfect.

Great service, but the food was far below our expectations. 

The bread basket was great, my personal favorite was the salami infused slices. As far as the meals go, my date ordered the The Creamy Polenta as her appetizer and she seemed to enjoy it. 

I opted for the Short Rib Agnolotti as my main dish and the pasta was LOADED with raw minced horseradish which flat out overpowered the whole dish with almost every bite. And I LOVE spicy food, but it would took my breath away with almost every bite, so it was far too much for my liking. You would have to absolutely LOVE horseradish to even enjoy this dish. 

My date ordered The Risotto with vegetables from the Vegetarian menu which was just mixed diced vegetables. The dish came out at room temperature and did not taste good at all, so the order was sent back.

I will not be returning to Scarpetta, nor will I ever recommend it to anyone I know.

I came here with my dad, expecting a wonderful meal and that's what we received. We asked our waiter if he had any recommendations and he gave us some good choices to choose from. We ended up ordering the polenta with mushrooms as an appetizer. The polenta was creamy and the truffled mushrooms added great flavor and some texture. Then we ordered our main dishes. My dad ordered the black cod and he said he loved the dish. I ordered the veal shank and thought it was a great dish. It was cooked medium and tasted delicious. I wish there was more sauce on the veal rather than just the juices, but it was great. We also split the short rib pasta, which was decent. The pasta was fresh and made in house, which is always good. And the short rib was tasty, but after a few bites, the pasta kind of seemed redundant and too hefty. Following the main course, we ordered two desserts. We ordered the mini donuts with Nutella which were sweet and a bit of a mess. Then we had the gluten free, dairy free, chocolate ice cream parfait. It was extremely delicate, yet delicious. Overall, our experience was great and our waiter truly helped us choose some great dishes. I would come here again, next time I'm in Las Vegas.

I debated giving this place one star due to the terrible customer service we received throughout the entire meal, but the quality of the food made me up my rating to two stars.

Everything we ate was really good, but the service was terrible.  We could never get the waiters attention for anything we needed.  Maybe it was because we were part of a big group, and the gratuity was included, but we had to flag someone down to order, we received the wrong dishes and drinks, charged us for a dessert for a birthday.  Who does that?

Please skip this location and only go to the one in Miami, which is mind-blowing. 

Complimentary bread: best part of the meal, especially the eggplant spread

Octopus appetizer: fairly tasty, but the beans were too salty and thus inedible. The Miami version is perfection in a way that will make you year up, but this Vegas version just passed. 

Polenta: bland. But get this in Miami and you'll wonder why you can't eat it for every meal

Scallops: very good, cooked to perfection.

Duck and foie gras ravioli: So salty I could barely finish it. And I add salt to everything. The reduction was reduced too much, making the entire plate inedible but I was hungry.

I came to Scarpetta hoping to have my mind blown and that's exactly what happened. I made a reservation several weeks in advance because I wasn't honestly sure how hard it was to get in lol. I'd heard that some of the seating has a view of the Bellagio fountain so I was hoping that's where we would be seated. As soon as we arrived the hostess led us back and we were seated along the window with the beautiful view I'd hoped for. We ordered drinks and received the best bread basket I will probably ever have in my lifetime. It had a variety of different types of bread and served along side it was a citrus olive oil, whipped mascarpone butter and an eggplant tapenade. Next we had the beef tartare which was outstanding. I ordered the duck and foie gras ravioli and my boyfriend ordered the short rib agnolotti. They were both rich but had such depth of flavor. The pasta was tender and perfectly cooked. I could go on and on. We finished with espresso and the bomboloni which was so good. Normally I don't like banana flavored things but the gelato was delicious. The bomboloni were sorta like Italian beignets, light,  fluffy, and slightly crisp on the outside. The service throughout the meal was wonderful, the ambiance was relaxing and the food was perfect. Overall it was the type of meal I will remember for a really long time.

Being a huge fan of Scott Conant on Chopped, my wife and I made a point to visit Scarpetta as soon as we landed on Thursday night.  On the plane I joked that we better not get any sticky pasta, and luckily we didn't. 

The decor of the restaurant has a great feel and it's in a great location at the Cosmopolitan.

While the meal was fine, there was just no wow factor.  The black pasta with lobster was good, as was the veal chop, but it wasn't great.  

I am glad we tried Scarpetta, but there are too many great restaurants in Vegas to visit this place any time soon.

I'm not sure why this place doesn't have a higher rating. I think it's when people get things that aren't the pasta, which is the star and should really be the only thing on the menu.

The pasta is fantastic. We skipped all the starters and just shared 3 pastas because we couldn't decide: The duck & foie ravioli (amazing), seafood pici (super thick chewy noodles, delicious seafoody sauce and lobster, with a kick of spice) and short rib angolotti, which was the best thing we had. All the pastas were cooked properly al dente. We also had a side of broccoli rabe, which was garlicky and spicy.

Service was excellent. Interestingly, the interior was fancier than I expected. The interior pictures I saw on yelp and the website looked more young/hip - this is the bar area. The dining room is more formal.

Overall, loved this place.

Ehhh. It was ok, not omg good and not bad. The octopus was good  but not omg melts in ur mouth. I would get it if u really want octopus but I would skip it if you don't want appetizer. 

We got the yellowtail app too, it was good, again nothing you must have. 

Polenta was good, it was creamy and truffley, it's rich. I fee like I was eating buttery grits.

Pasta we got:

Pici- it was very interesting, tasted almost like black licorice. I wouldn't get it again.

Spaghetti with red sauce and basil- was super plain needed more basil and some fresh parmesan or something.... I wouldn't get Again really such a simple blah dish. Not sure why everyone is in awe of this dish

 Tagliolini- if you want to taste the garbage of the ocean get this dish, it was so terrible. It had so much potential but it tasted like you were eating the ocean and not in a good way. I told them it was terrible and they took it off. 

Short rib pasta- it was the best one, it was worth getting again, I wish the presentation was nicer, it looked like it was just thrown on there, kind of scant and random on the plate. 

This place is expensive but you're in Vegas so you can't be surprised everything is expensive. I don't think I would recommend this place based on food only. 

It's very stuffy in here, tables r very close to each other. 

Service was ok not amazing not terrible. I wasn't sure if our server was annoyed half the time or he just had a RBFace. The busser was nice.
This was a amazing experience, the heirloom tomato salad, agnolotti of Marrow, spaghetti was to die for! Service was impeccable, very stylish dining room, loved the leather place mats.

Scarpetta is an excellent restaurant, but it is also extremely overpriced. The portion sizes are very small and the prices are ridiculous.

I started my meal off with the roasted diver scallops. These are served with sunchokes, pinenuts, gremolata and mushrooms. Awesome appetizer...fresh and delicious.

For my main course, I ordered perigord black truffle tagliatelle. This truffle was definitely amazing, I was just disappointed in the quantity. They put literally three small shavings in my dish of plain pasta (no vegetables...nothing) and this cost $65. I understand that 1 oz of these truffles is $60-100, but at the same time they could have at least put 5 or 6 shavings. I thought this was a total rip-off. I mean this is black truffle, NOT even white truffle! I have been to other high-end restaurants where I pay the same price and they will literally shave a whole truffle into my pasta. Next time, I will boil my own plain pasta at home and order these truffles online. The cost will be the same but at least I will be getting what I pay for...VALUE!!

For dessert, I ended my meal with the amedei chocolate cake served with gelato and salted caramel sauce. Rich and luscious dessert to finish off the night.        
                      
I recommend checking out Scarpetta for dinner, just avoid ordering the black and white truffles and be sure to bring a full wallet!

I am super disappointed on my expectations of this restaurant. First the service sucks!!! The guy who was taken care of us maybe talked to is no more than 5 minutes total. The food was good, bit nothing to really brag about. The restaurant was very pretty and we did have a great view of the Bellagio fountains. I would skip this place and go somewhere else.

Food was beautiful. Service was impeccable. Our server Garvin was very personable and quite attentive without being intrusive. The same can be said for his teammates (food runners, bussers, etc.). The only negative thing at all that I have to say is that no Negroni on earth should cost $15, but that's Vegas for ya, I suppose!

Pro tip: ask for a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains, if possible.

My wife and I took a group of friends here for dinner and the experience was unbelievable. The entire staff went above and beyond to ensure we had only the best time. The wine list was great and our sommelier made excellent choices. Our waiter and his colleagues made us feel at home. The food was tremendous, course after course we were impressed. We were seated at the chefs table which gave us a great view into the kitchen and unparalleled views of the strip. I would highly recommend to anyone, you will not be disappointed.
Great view and the restaurant is very cool..I loved wagu beef tartare and Mediterranean branzino fish was perfect

Scarpetta's food was awesome. We were there for a buddy's 30th birthday party, and didnt want to involve ourselves in much other than enjoying our time. 

We asked the server to bring food for our group and let him know we trusted his recommendation, and it worked out perfectly as he knew the right mix of pastas to bring out to us so we could recharge our batteries for the night. 

We had a reservation and were in and out of the restaurant within an hour and a half- exactly what we needed with a 10:30pm dinner. Overall, this place comes highly recommended!

Great looking place, great sevice.  Food expensive and very small portions. 

If you're into this kind of place it's worth a try if you see something you like on the menu.  The food was ok, not awesome for the price.

Just not my way of paying through the nose and leaving hungry only to look at pizza slices served a few doors down.

We had a top notch dinner at Scarpetta while enjoying the wonderful view of the Bellagio water show. The fresh, warm bread basket with a delicious assortment was only a teaser of the wonderful meal to come. The service was excellent,  great detail.  Our wine choice-a Meursault  went very well with our meal.
For our appetizers:
TUNA 'SUSCI'
marinated vegetables & preserved truffles -never had fresher tuna, 
CREAMY POLENTA
fricassee of truffled mushrooms- just perfect, creamy and the fricassee was richly flavorful. 
Entrees:
MEDITERRANEAN BRANZINO
shrimp, clams, mussels & celery root - crispy and sophisticated yet simply delicious
SHORT RIB AGNOLOTTI
brown butter horseradish & toasted breadcrumbs- perfect 
Dessert:
STRAWBERRY SOUFFLE
rhubarb compote & vanilla gelato-so light and satisfying, absolutely no sharing of this dessert. 
My only disappointment was a side of the fingerling potatoes. They weren't bad but didn't live up to the level of the other dishes we had. 
We are pleased to learn that they have a Scarpetta in NYC. This restaurant warrants many more visits.

I wanted to give this place more stars. Interested to see how this place was since well the show Chopped haha. 

Run down of us: came here for a bachelorette party dinner, don't be fooled us girls love to eat.

The atmosphere was nice and the drinks were good. It is kinda dressy so be prepared. The service was ok, and our particular server wasn't that attentive but I guess it was a busy night. 

On to the food we tried several dishes: 

1. braised short ribs

2. tagliatelle

3. duck and foie gras ravioli

4. short rib agnolotti

They were all decent, the pasta was good and the sauces were fine. I think my favorite was the duck and foie gras ravioli but it was super rich so I didn't eat much of it. I wanted to try more things but I was so full. Overall, it was a decent place and a good choice for a group dinner, but not sure if I would go there again.

My wife and I went there to celebrate our anniversary. Our table faced the Bellagio and were entertained by their fountains all night long. The service was extraordinary. We started with the polenta. Woooowwww! Amazing texture and flavor. Our second dish was short rib agnolotti. Spectacular horseradish sauce and the breadcrumbs add a very interesting and fun texture. For the main dish my wife ordered another agnolotti. This time it was the sheep milk with shaved summer truffles and Parmesan emulsion. This dish is nothing short of brilliant. I had a newly added dish. It was the Kobe Rib Cap. This was served beautifully med rare over homemade gnocchi, variety of mushrooms and with a Barolo reduction. This was probably the best bite I've ever had!!! We will definitely come back soon! Great experience.

Hands down the best italian food I have ever had. We came in completely underdressed with kids but everyone was so kind to us. We ordered 7 dishes or so and they all were perfection. My favorite was the truffle risotto. If anyone asks me where to eat Italian in Vegas, I am definitely sending them here!

Please do order the Sphagetti!  Absolutely one of the best ones I have ever tried. The ambiance was very classy I liked it. 

However, the cheese bread is amazing!! Definitely want to come back and try the other items on the menu!

Scarpetta serves the best bread basket I have ever seen. And I don't say that lightly.

I would've been happy with either the fluffy dinner rolls, the buttery, toasted focaccia, or the simple, crusty Italian bread on their own. And any one of the citrus-infused olive oil, the eggplant caponata or the marscopone butter accompaniments would have been not only generous, but irresistibly delicious.

Surprisingly, Scarpetta lays every one of these items in front of you in a sumptuous, complimentary carby feast, along with the absolute kicker: STROMBOLI. That's meaty, cheesey bread, people; it's a meal in itself, and a damn good one. 

I knew I shouldn't, but I couldn't help but stuff my face with the free delights. And although I was already full when they arrived, I forced myself to choke down the simple, perfect spaghetti, as well as a beautifully rare aged sirloin in a Barolo reduction.

I might not have any friends and/or social skills, and later that evening, I may or may not have lost my pants* downstairs playing craps...but eating this flawless meal means I'm a winner anyway.
__________

*I think The Bellagio is now in possession of my shirt. Now I've got nothing.

Scarpetta is good, really good.  We came here with a group of 4 dudes. In addition to the two usual characters, Mr. Booth and Mr. Bloewen, there was also Mr. Buxton.  While in Vegas for the weekend, we thought we would try out Scarpetta for our "fancy dancy meal".  Two of us ordered the famous Spaghetti, Mr, Buxton ordered the Foie Gras Ravioli, and Mr. Bloewen ordered the Linguini.  

The Spaghetti had a lot of hype, but I can clearly say it was the best Spaghetti that I have ever had.  Was it worth ~$28?  Probably not.  The Foie Gras Ravioli, on the other hand, was something unique, and as Larry David would say, Prettay Prettay Prettay Prettay Good.  As Mr. Buxton was eating it, he just kept saying, "Wow. This is unreal."  He had to constantly put his fork down as he was enjoying the dish so much.

I was also lucky enough to try the Linguini dish.  It was also very very good.  Great flavors and cooked to perfection.  The only problem was the Mr. Bloewen had a bit too much to drink prior to dinner, and was not able to finish the meal (basically committing a crime). The rest of us got too full to help him out, but it should be no knock to the dish.

We also enjoyed a couple $16 dirty martinis (clearly overpriced), and had an overall great dinner.

Why 4 stars and not 5, you ask?
Well, I felt as though service was a bit snooty, and the spaghetti was good, but clearly overpriced.  I was not sure why our waiter was looking down at us, and not very friendly.  If it was not for that, Scarpetta would have clearly gotten 5 stars, as it did meet my high expectations.  Next time my wife and I want a nice night out, Scarpetta would be a good choice.

Really, yelp needs to allow for 1/2 stars, because Scarpetta is definitely a solid 5 stars, but Hubby wanted to knock off a 1/2 star for overly spicy Lobster Pici.

Easily one of the best meals we've had in Vegas.  Came here with another couple, and we each ordered a different dish.  Had polenta w/ truffled mushrooms, and salad w/ burrata and roasted beets to start.  We wanted to lick the polenta bowl when we finished, it was that good.  The beets were tasty, too, but the Polenta.... Molto Bene!!

Lobster Pici -- fantastic, but the chili pesto was a bit overpowering (Hubby burst into a sweat within the first bite).
Short Rib & Bone Marrow agnolotti -- Rich, luscious, and not exactly heart healthy, but oh my god good.
Raviolini w/ ricotta and truffle -- not on the online menu.  Super tasty, and you'll want to have extra bread on your table to sop up every last drop of the sauce (hence the name, Scarpetta!).
Veal tortellini -- one of the special dishes offered that night, easily the best pasta we had.  With shaved baby carrots on top, each bite was perfectly savory w/ a touch of sweetness.

For dessert, we ordered the Amedei chocolate cake and pumpkin soufflé.  About 15 minutes later, our waiter ("hot as hell" Luis) appeared sheepishly at our table to apologize profusely that the soufflé were not meeting the expectations of the kitchen so they were in the process of starting a new batch.  Which would take an hour.  :( While our friends were disappointed, we did give serious props to the kitchen for not serving sub-par food.  So we ordered the Bomboloni instead.  Which were "the bomb!"  One of the best parts of the meal, though, was the little surprise Luis presented us with at the end of our meal... to again apologize for the soufflé flop, he went next door to D.O.C.G. and got us a dish of the salted caramel budino.  Seriously, that was a little bit of heaven in a bowl (another 'wanna lick the bowl' moment).  Luis and the rest of the staff were fantastic, and we felt like they bent over backwards to make sure we had a fantastic experience.

Oh yeah... and we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains while we ate.  We waddled out of there fat 'n' happy, and found the pricing to be quite reasonable.  Especially for Vegas.  

We will be back to Scarpetta, without a doubt.

We choose Scarpetta for our 25th Anniversary dinner which we booked in early January with hopes of sitting by a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains but wound up to our disappointment sitting further back with a view of the building instead. But that was our only complaint. The food although not inexpensive was excellent. The fusion of flavors left you wanting more. We shared the burrata with beets, then the Short Rib with bone marrow Agnolotti. Both excellent and topped the night with a very creamy and light soufflé. They really know how to make espresso just like you get in Italy. Great service and delicious food made for a wonderful night.

I ate here last night and boyfriend and I decided on the tasting menu! It was about 6 different courses, each with amazing flavor. The bread basket and dippings that come with were so good I had to restrain myself from gobbling it all up too quickly. The cocktails were way better than expected too. I had the Scarpetta Cosmo since we were at the Cosmo. :)

I think our favorite course might have been the ravioli and spaghetti? No, wait, definitely the creamy polenta. GET THE POLENTA. And the starter of tuna and yellowtail was phenomenal. There was also cod served and duck breast, which were both perfectly cooked and seasoned, but I was getting so full at that point that I gave up midway through the duck. The ending dessert was a rich dark chocolate cake with gelato. They switched out the flavor of gelato for my boyfriend due to a nut allergy and were really accommodating. And they gave us some kind of pineapple cream in lava soup? That tasted like it came straight from Hawaii and the man doesn't even like bits of fruit in his food but helped me eat all of this one.

Everything was perfect! We left more full than we expected off of a tasting menu! Service was great and very informative.

Was looking for a place to celebrate my wife and I's 1 year wedding anniversary and found this place through Yelp.  We thought it would be a good try because it's really hard to get a good reservation.  We ended up getting fit for a late dinner at 930pm.  

Nice romantic place that's dimly lit and if you're lucky you can get a seat next to the window which shows overlooks the bellagio water show.  

Service was excellent and the waiter gave us some good recommendations.  The waiter was so great that he even replaced my wife's drink that she didn't like.  We ended up getting the pici, duck and started with the truffled mushrooms.  All the dishes were great and very tasty.  Portion was just right where we got full enough to not get a food coma.  

One thing that would've given them the 5th star though would've been if they did something nice for our anniversary like a small cake, etc.  no biggie though.  Definitely recommend coming here for couples!!

Didn't know what to expect but we were quite pleasantly surprised!  The food was quite good but the entree portions were a little on the small size.  When my husband's fish arrived, I had to chuckle at how small the portion actually was.  The farmers market salad was quite generous and very fresh.  The creamy polenta and mushrooms were stellar.  The chocolate cake was luscious and worth the calories.

Our server did a good job however the sommelier was not up to par.  He did admit it was his first day on the job but when we looked through the wine list, he made no recommendations and never returned to see what we would like to order.  We did choose a wine on our own and placed the order with the waitress.

The ambiance is definitely NYC like.  In fact, we felt as if we were actually in NYC with the mood lighting and attractive decor.

I have already recommended this restaurant to my daughter and she has made a reservation for this coming weekend!

the house spaghetti was so so bad. i would have paid $6 for it. it was plain and i can't believe that is their house specialty.

the foie gras ravioli was good. 

service was not so great.

We had such a gorgeous view of the bellagio fountains from where we sat. Initially we had to wait a little for our server but the service was great. The bread basket really is quite awesome. Love the duck and foie grois raviol and the squid pasta is a must. We didn't get to eat dessert because we were stuffed. Had dinner with my sister and this place was more like a couples place to eat...dark and romantic!

We had an outstanding experience dining here. We sat at a window seat with a nice view of the Bellagio fountain show. 

The service was impeccable--we had to servers waiting on us. The food was delicious..everything from the bread basket to the main courses.The wine selection was broad. 

Definitely a place I want to return to next time I am back in Vegas.

a bachelorette party visit to scarpetta was by happenchance.  ok, i was wearing sky high heels and since there is no golf cart service to shuffle the ladies around...i canceled the she/morton rezzies for new ones at scarpetta which the group agreed to after checking out all the lovely shoes at the cosmopolitan!  

plus who doesn't want to dine in style with housemade pasta?

i think the folks here were trained at the school of Le Bernadin since they were on pointe with service.  you aren't supposed to notice how many interactions you actually have but they scored big.  i notice but i'm a foodie fanatic.

LOVED that they gave white napkins for white dresses and black napkins for dark dresses.  the ladies can attest to the lint nightmare.  

boo!: ask for a view! i failed to so we didn't have the bellagio view. (for next time).

bread:
insert triple toe curl for the bread selection and i'm not a gluten freak.  i would make out with the pastry chef just for the bread alone.

appetizers and entrees:
- the bride to be was in bliss with her veal duo.
- i loved my foie gras pasta - it was not salty like other yelpers have mentioned. and i'm sodium sensitive.
- every gal pretty much loved their dish from short rib to lobster pasta.
- the only mini ding was that the calamari was way too spicy for my liking.

wine list is lovely and affordable for vegas.  

we would have stayed longer for more foodie adventures but our  group had more stops to make that night.  scarpetta is a solid date night spot or whenever you want to be pampered.

tip: the lighting is kind on the eyes.  no botox required.
Ambiance is nice food is really good! They have s large selection of wines too! Portion sizes are really small.

ONE WORD: SPAGHETTI. No, FOUR WORDS: Tomato and Basil Spaghetti. 

Man, the spaghetti was out of this world. Never have I eaten spaghetti as good as Scarpetta's. Sure, it was just a simple dish but based on the flavor, the texture, and it's overall simplicity, it just exponentially made it better than any pasta dishes that I've ever had. And I'm definitely not exaggerating. But then again, I've never been to Italy.

Seriously though, if you come here, at least get this dish. You will not regret it. I promise. Oh, and the bread basket is excellent as well. Fight your friends and grab the piece of bread with the cured meats on it... it's fantastic.

This place is located at the Cosmopolitan with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain. I was hesitant coming here at first because I'm not really into fancy Italian place.  

While waiting for our table to be ready, we had a couple drinks at the bar. They had a happy hour menu, and the drinks were solid and cheap. 

The waiter gave us a basket of bread and tomato paste and two kinds of olive oil to start us with. There was a variety of bread. My favorite was the roll with salami in it. They were all very fresh and delicious. It was even better when I ate them with my pasta. We ordered the Mediterranean Octopus ($21) for appetizer. They were very thoughtful and divided the portion in half on a separate plate. For the entree, we ordered the Spaghetti ($25) and Pici ($36). I wasn't expecting much for the pasta because I thought, "I mean, how good could it be? It's just pasta." Oh boy, was I wrong! The Spaghetti was a simple dish, but the sauce was creamy and fresh. The Pici was hands down, the best pasta I've ever had! It was worth every penny. The pesto was so delicious and went really well with the lobster. The lobster was soft and tender. Both of the dishes were not overpowering with cheese or sauce, which I really liked. I think they also make their own noodles. They were very chewy - in a good way!

On top of the wonderful view and food, the waiter was really friendly and funny. He was very down-to-earth and honest about his recommendations. Scarletta was such a pleasant experience - I think the best restaurant I've been in Vegas! Cannot wait to come back here again.

calamari.. MUST HAVE THE calamari
took one star off cuz one of my firneds order was mad late

Taste: 3.5
Creativity/Authenticity: 4
Atmosphere: 4
Service: 4
Bang for your buck: 3
