Now im a huge fan of Chef Scott conant and have had the honor the meet him at his beverly hills scarpetta location, so going to the LV location i would figure it would be the same excellent. First the service here is impeccable, the staff is on point and very knowledgeable of the menu. The atmosphere is amazing, very romantic for dates and great views on the Bellagio fountains. Now to the food... got the beef tar tar, squid and baby octopus and heir loom tomato salad to start; all were delicious, the beef tar tar was amazing with the egg yoke Mmmmm getting hungry writing this review. The heir loom tomato salad with baratta cheese oh my goodness, the flavors accentuate each other complimenting one another without overpowering one another. The squid and baby octopus was so flavorful, cooked to perfection; not chewy very tender. Now to the main course which is a big part of why my rating was so low, got the duck foie gras ravioli and the Fettuccine with lamb ragu and broccoli rab. I don't know what went wrong but my ravioli with the foie gras was so over whelming that it was hard to finish the plate, needs something to balance out the flavors. the pasta itself had no flavor (probably not salted) now to the fettuccine with lamb, which was well just fettuccine with lamb nothing special, not much flavor either and nothing special. Maybe its the location the waiter said scott doesn't come here often so maybe he needs to swing by and check up on this place but overall not impressed and ill stick to eating at the one in beverly hills
Came for an early dinner before a show. Shared the tuna + avocado, braised short rib, and the cod. All the dishes were tasty. Cocktails were also on point. Almost as good as the LA location

I recently visited the restaurant with my business clients and while my experience was 5 star, theirs was 3 so I am giving this restaurant a 4 star rating. My dishes were all great (personal favorite is the dessert: Panna cotta which was out of this world) but they ordered 2 pasta dishes and their pastas were all overcooked and displeased about it. I agree that if you go to a higher-end Italian restaurant you expect the pasta to be done right. The view of the fountains of the Bellagio was spectacular however. Overall, I recommend it.

AMAZING PASTA.  My mom says it's not as good as Italy but it is pretty dang close, and that's good enough for me.

PARKING: It's located in the Cosmo, third floor I believe at the corner near the restrooms, it's kind of small random entrance.  Free parking at all LV hotels and a quick walk from any of the hotels on the strip.

ATMOSPHERE: Dark, with a great view of the Bellagio water fountains.  Ask for a window seat if you're with a group of 2, if you have a bigger group you can still get pretty close but not right up to the window.  There were actually a lot of big groups that we saw and they have several private rooms for big parties like birthdays or celebrations, which I thought was cool.

FOOD: Had to get the spaghetti with tomato and basil.  It doesn't look like a lot in the pictures but when you  unravel the pasta, it's plenty for one person especially if you're going to be getting any appetizers or dessert.

BREAD BASKET - They give you all kinds of bread, sourdough, focaccia, stromboli (i think thats what its called with salami and cheese) and for those allergic to dairy, the foccacia is dairy free!!

CREAMY POLENTA - Sooo good, and I don't even like polenta!! It's creamy like mashed potatoes and so flavorful (prob a lot of butter) with the mushrooms it was perfect.

TUNA 'SUSCI' - Also VERY good, and very fresh! A tun roll but the tuna was wrapped around the outside, I dont remember what was inside but it was tasty.  

SPAGHETTI - So amazing.  They hand make it everyday and you can tell.  It was al dente and CHEWY, fresh!! And the sauce was delicious, light but flavorful and something that seemed so simple but blew me away.  Also for those allergic to dairy they can make it without butter and milk and my sister said it tasted just as good.  I tried a piece and it was good, but definitely not as flavorful as mine.  

AMEDEI CHOCOLATE CAKE - Your basic rich, chocolate cake with a slight runny inside.  It was a great way to end the night but by the end of it I was  completely stuffed.

Overall, a great place to try if you're looking for a fancy place in Vegas.  The pasta is like $26 and the atmosphere, although not the best I've ever had, is good and romantic for a date or a fancy dinner with the family.  Just make sure you get a good window seat!

A great place with great food! Live music on the weekend which added to a fun evening, my only complaint would be the volume of the music. Oyster mushrooms are so so so good!  Currently one of my favourite nights out!

What can I say...excellent food and service!  We were treated like royalty from start to finish!  We were a party of seven and fun but not an easy crowd!  They handled us with ease and professionalism.  We are locals and usually get excellent service because we are but they went above and beyond!

Everything was hot and delicious!  From the lamb down to the lobster fettuccine!

OK folks, I'll make this brief. Go here.  Now. Seriously, if you're a foodie and are looking for primo Italian look no further. Bone marrow and short rib pasta? Bread basket from heaven? Best spaghetti ever? Yes yes and yes.

Wonderful experience! Mark was able to provide such an incredible guide for us. We both started with a cocktail - he got the mule and I took the servers recommendation with the basil refresher. We both decided to eat vegetarian and the tomato basil spaghetti did not disappoint. I ordered the buratta salad. We shared the broccoli rabe. Everything was INCREDIBLE! We shared a bottle of Chianti, explained in depth by Mark, and was able to fully enjoy all bites of our food. We finished off with a Mango Marscapone cheesecake. Well done to the staff and management. This place was such a treat!

Absolutely amazing! A must try! Great food! 

My boyfriend and I had previously tried this restaurant. We had such a great experience the first time, so when he asked me "where do you want to go for your birthday dinner?" I quickly responded.... "SCARPETTA!" 
When we went for my birthday, it was such a lovely experience.  Our waiter was just amazing! He was so personable, and really made the overall experience pleasant! A great celebration!

For our food, we started with the roasted diver scallops, which just melted in your mouth, we then had the spaghetti, which is undeniably a must try item, the pasta is cooked to perfection and the taste is just simply amazing, after the spaghetti we then had the prime NY strip of beef, the meat was cooked perfectly!  And to top it all off, I had to order the mascarpone cheesecake.... after all- it was my birthday! This cheesecake was absolutely delicious, and topped with a magical mango pineapple compote and passion fruit! SO YUMMY!

This is a restaurant that you must try!  

-Ask for a table by the window when making your reservation, there is a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountain to enjoy!

(Sorry for the delay in my review/post- my birthday celebration dinner was back in April, and I have recommended this place to many people that I have met and know, and  I figured I finally need to put my great opinion out there to share!)

DATE/TIME: Tuesday, February 26, 2012 / 8:30pm

PRICE: $30-$75/person
VALUE: Definitely worth the price, considering all the ingredients and the delicious flavor.
AMBIANCE: Love the interior. Dim lights, great spot for an intimate dinner.
CHANCE OF RETURNING: 80%

___________________________________

:::: THE FOOD ::::

* DUCK & FOIE GRAS RAVIOLI w/MARSALA REDUCTION
         - [4/5 - Extremely delicious and very rich. So rich, in fact, that while I loved the flavors.. I regretted ordering this dish all to myself. Next time, I'll be sure to order more than one entree that I can share with my dining companion(s).]
* STRACCI 
         - [4.5/5 - I hate to admit this, since the friend  who ordered this was obnoxiously picking on my order all night and insisting she had "won" as soon as she had the first bite of her dish... but her dish really was luscious. Creamy layers of flat pasta with lobster, crab, and shrimp. I planned to order it the next time I went to Scarpetta, but discovered today that it was unfortunately no longer on the menu.]

___________________________________

We also ordered an appetizer to share and a few desserts, and everything really was good. I remember all of us wiping our plates clean.

"Scarpetta" was aptly named. ;-)
We went there for my husband's birthday last year and the food was pretty good! We had their house made pasta and wagyu steak. Delicious food but not out of this world. So slightly underwhelmed.

Very good restaurant. The view is incredible and the food is equally as good as the Scarpetta in Miami. 

While eating you can enjoy the Bellagio water show. I ate fabulous pasta. However, we didn't have time to try some desserts.

Amazing food. Everything was delicious. Three stars because a friend that was with us has a garlic and shallot allergy and the chef refused to cook her anything. First time this has happened to us in such an upscale dining establishment. Truly  disappointing.

I had a great meal with excellent service. 

Food:
Bread basket was great!
We shared the polenta with mushrooms - so GOOD!
Cavatelli with wild boar ragú - hubby liked 
Short rib angliotti - really tasty 
Chocolate cake hubby said it's one of the best he's had - perfect temperature
Panettone - very good. 

Service was on point. We never needed anything. 

We'd definitely return. I'd like to try the regular tomato basil dish. 

The best part was meeting the owner, Scott Conant! Boy was I star-struck. He was very kind gracious to allow me to interrupt his meal. He offered to have his picture taken.

Not worth the price.
The food was fine but we had a much better meal (food and service) at Todd English at 1/2 the price and twice the wine.

I have NEVER had a restaurant cater to my needs the way this one did. I'm vegan and  I was with a large group of people. When I told the waiter, he informed the chef, who, in turn, made these vegan dishes that were great.

In addition, the people were very nice here.

Love this place!!!

This review is for their Happy Hour only.

We arrived on a weekday around 6pm and the bar was pretty crowded but we were able to find a spot at the bar. All the cocktails and small plates they offer at Happy Hour were only $7, which was a steal. The shortrib agnolotti was absolutely delicious. Based on this dish I really want to come in for dinner some time soon. Perfectly seasoned and the texture was heavenly.  

The cocktails were great, too. Strong l, but not too strong and really great flavors. The bartender was really personable and we ended up having a really great Happy Hour. I'll be back soon for dinner.

We went there for my fathers 70th birthday celebration. It was beyond delicious! We had the creamy polenta for an appetizer and it was to die for! We could not get enough! Then we had the spaghetti with basil and it was the best spaghetti I have ever tasted in my life. The sauce was beyond. The service was amazing, as was the lighting and the ambiance. This is a must go to restaurant for all who are looking for an amazing supper.

I enjoyed everything I ordered!  From the Short Rib & Bone Marrow Agnolotti, which was flavorful and satisfying, to the delicious simplicity of the spaghetti. The staff was on point and very gracious. 

My dining experience was enjoyable, from the food to the staff, I would definitely come back again.

I was very excited to try Scarpetta because I had read great reviews for the New York and Beverly HIlls locations. At best the food was uninteresting.

The first course was cold, the second course was barely warm (the pasta was dry as if it had been sitting around) and the third course was just warm but tasted awful. It was described to me as being a slow roasted baby goat.. sounded delicious. When it came, it was dry, tough and overly gamey. I usually love gamey meat, lamb, duck,etc... I sent it back, which I've only ever done twice before. The assistant manager came by to tell me that the goats they've been getting in are smaller than they should be and don't have enough fat on them. So why is this goat still on the menu?

I've eaten at some really great places  (Hatfield's, Eleven Madison, Lucques, Bouchon, ...) and am more than willing to spend money on a great meal. This is NOT in that category of restaurant. It's really lame to be charging those prices for such mediocre (at best) food.

My husband I ate at Scarpetta on a Friday night and were seated right away.  The service was great, the food was good and the atmosphere was great.  By far my favorite was the short rib pasta.  It had such great flavor and the pasta was perfect.

Best meal we had in Vegas, hands down and, if you check my other dining reviews from this trip, most all of them were 4 stars, mostly 5's.  My wife was really wanting to try Scott Conant's iconic and so simple spaghetti after seeing it on The Best Thing I Ever Ate once on Food Network.  We had done the Steakhouse thing already and were ready for some Italian anyway.  We are SOOOO glad we came to Scarpetta.  Every bit of the meal was fabulous from the stiff cocktails to the impeccable service and the just unbelievably tasty food.  Honey's spaghetti was all she could hope for and my Branzino was a masterpiece, perfectly seared, with the most delicious fish stock based sauce that was poured over it table side. My brother had a seared duck dish and my niece some pumpkin-based filled pasta dish.  Throw in that we had a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains blasting every 15 minutes and just, wow!

To a person, we all agreed Scarpetta exceeded our expectations!!!

My husband and I recently celebrated our anniversary at Scarpetta and were seated by the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Very romantic. 

As much as I tried to save room for the main meal, the bread basket with an assortment of carbs along with mascarpone butter, roasted eggplant spread, and lemon infused olive oil was too hard to resist.  I even asked for a refill of the rosemary focaccia, it was that good. 

We ordered the following:
APPETIZER: 
*Roasted sea scallops- 2 perfectly cooked giant scallops that melt in your mouth. 

PASTA: 
*Duck and Fois Gras Ravioli in a marsala reduction
*Spaghetti with tomato and basil
Both dishes were fabulous and I highly recommend both.  I would easily order either dish upon my return visit. 

MEAT:
*Pancetta-wrapped veal loin- with sweetbreads and vegetables
*Halibut with vegetable puree
Again, both were delicious but if I were to come again, I would definitely order the Halibut over the veal loin.

DESSERT:
*Napoleon- creme brulee, macadamia tuilles, blood orange sorbet
*Chocolate cake with toasted almond gelato and salted caramel sauce
Both were decadent, but I personally preferred the chocolate cake more mainly because the salted caramel sauce was divine.  If I could order just a bowl of salted caramel sauce, I would in a heartbeat. 

When you dine here, you will not be disappointed.  The servers are attentive and friendly.  The food is excellently prepared. I can't wait to come back and try other items.

I really liked this place. Great view of the Bellagio fountains. I had a short ribs appetizer that was next level good, the entree was a pasta that was excellent and for dessert I had pastries stuffed with Nutella. Read that last sentence again. Even the bread is awesome.

"This was a great meal"


If you want food that is prepared to very high standards and is of utmost quality this is one great place to dine in Vegas. I had the beet salad, the pasta with tomatoes sauce (a must try), the branzino and the panna cotta. The beet salad was fresh and paired very well with the cheese they had in it. Scott Conant, the chef, is on TV always complaining about how everyone cooks their pasta and guess what? He has legs to stand on! His (well his chef's) was absolutely perfect!
The branzino was very good but not as memorable as the other dishes.

Since the the other dishes were so good, I decided that I could not leave without desert. I had the panna cotta which in my opinion is a must have while in Vegas. Even if you have dinner near by and want to stop in for a coffee and desert, have the panna cotta. Its out of this world and if I was not so full I would have had two!!

I had dinner at Scarpetta on Monday night.  I specifically wanted to check out the new Thompson Hotel including the Roof Top Lounge.  

This hotel and Scott Conant certainly have a lot of hype and the hype was, in my opinion, overrated.  The food was very good.  However, the service was eager but not at all smooth or in the league of the prices, menu, hype or the Thompson Hotel intention.  Staff were young and really were trying to be smooth, cool and hip but no where near any of those adjectives.  The sommelier had limited knowledge and was trying to impress but lacked depth or proper training.  

We ordered the Heirloom Salad with stracciatella and marinated eggplant first to share.  It was very good.  Balanced salt, beautiful presentation and the stracciatella was amazing.  We then had them split two pasta dishes to get a sample of each - Duck and Foie Gras Ravioli and the Pheasant Tortelli.  Very small portions but the flavours and textures were great.  They split each pasta and served them to each of us in a separate white porcelain covered dish.  Good creative touch.  

For dessert we ordered three cheeses and the Amadei Chocolate Cake.  The Chocolate Cake was amazing.  Likely the highlight of the evening.  We also paired it with a dessert sherry that complimented the chocolate and cheeses nicely.

Overall the room is good but not amazing.  They are trying to be hip and cool but the lighting and rough incongruent design elements make it a bit hard for my fussy eyes to handle.  The window LED lights were annoying and needed a glass shield to avoid a tan on the back of your head.  They might work for outside sidewalk walkers but not for a diner sitting at the window.  If the service was in line with the food and hype it would have gotten a 4 out of 5 rating.  Would not do a repeat anytime soon other than a cocktail in the roof top lounge in the summer.  The infinity pool was quite cool.
